title: Keep Town's ONLY bookshop open- a cornerstone of community!
description:
Hi, I’m Jess, and I run Cat Yard Bookshop, a tiny, independent bookshop operating right out of my garage here in Skowhegan, Maine.
Skowhegan hasn’t had a bookstore in over a decade, and I wanted to change that. I started small: shelves I built myself, secondhand books, a space where people could stop by, talk about what they’re reading, and find affordable books to take home. It’s become more than a shop; it’s a cozy gathering place for readers, artists, and neighbors who’ve missed having a spot like this in town.
Now that the weather’s turning cold, I’m raising funds to keep the shop going through the winter — to cover heat, lighting, insulation, and some basic improvements that will make the space safer and more welcoming. My dream is to expand just enough to host more community events — like our Radical Readers Book Club, craft hours, and story nights — and to eventually create a wheelchair-accessible entrance so everyone in town can feel at home here.
Every dollar helps keep the lights on, the space warm, and the books within reach for our community. Even if you can’t donate, sharing this campaign means a lot.
Let’s keep Skowhegan’s little garage bookshop alive — together.
❤️
Jess & the Cat Yard Bookshop
labels: Eyewear, Smile, Glasses, Vision Care, Happiness

title: Support Champions Liquor's Relocation Effort
description:
Help Us Keep Champions in Business and Proudly Display Our Israeli Flag
Champions Liquor has proudly served this community for many years, becoming not just a business, but a place of unity and support. As part of our values, we have always stood firmly with Israel and displayed the Israeli flag in our front window as a symbol of solidarity and pride.
Unfortunately, our landlord at University Towers has informed us that our lease, which expires on January 1, 2026, will not be renewed. The reasons given are deeply troubling and discriminatory. Management has cited complaints, including one from a parent who expressed fear for her daughter’s safety solely because our business displays the Israeli flag. Additionally, they claim our flag violates lease terms, despite it being a peaceful expression of our identity and beliefs. We believe this to be an act of anti-Semitism and discrimination against our values and our community.
We are determined to continue our mission, to keep Champions in business, and to ensure that our Israeli flag continues to fly proudly. To accomplish this, we are seeking to raise $750,000 through our GoFundMe campaign. These funds will allow us to purchase, remodel, and relocate Champions to a new location, on the same block, where we can continue serving our loyal customers without fear of discrimination.
We are calling upon the good-hearted Israeli and Jewish community, as well as all those who stand against hatred and prejudice, to help us in this fight. With your support, we can overcome these challenges, preserve our business, and ensure that the values we stand for remain strong.
Together, we can stand against anti-Semitism and keep Champions thriving. Long live Israel, and may the truth and justice prevail.

title: Support Mark in Launching Executive Recovery Coaching
description:
For 25 years, I've led teams and built global brands. On the outside, I was performing at the highest level. Inside, I was battling addiction I could not admit to anyone. That contradiction, thriving in business while secretly struggling, is the reality for many executives today.
After years of sobriety, I am launching a confidential coaching practice and proprietary framework, literature and potential podcast designed specifically for executives who feel trapped in that double life.
This is not theory. It is lived experience paired with leadership insight. My mission is to help leaders protect their sobriety, strengthen their performance, and find freedom without fear of exposure.
Of course, I wanted to keep this idea close to my chest until it was fully baked, but what I have learned is that my old “lone wolf” ways do not get me very far. Growth happens when I share openly and vulnerable regardless of my pride. Leaning on trusted people is the path forward, and that is why I am inviting you into this part of the journey now.
Why I Need Your Help
Launching this practice requires resources I cannot create on my own. In the past, I might have tried to white-knuckle it solo, but I've realized asking for help is strength, not weakness. Your support will give me the foundation to bring my vision to life and make it available to the people who need it most.
I am asking friends and colleagues who believe in this mission to consider contributions of $100 or more. These gifts provide the foundation for launching this practice and making it sustainable.
Suggested Giving Levels
$100 – Building Blocks
Supports website and branding so the coaching service looks professional and trustworthy to clients.
$250 – Outreach
Funds marketing outreach to connect with executives who are silently struggling and ensures they know this help exists.
$500 – Lifeline
Provides seed funding that allows me to dedicate time fully to developing this coaching practice and making it sustainable.
$1,000 – Legacy
Fuels the full launch of this work and establishes a strong foundation for long-term impact.
Closing
I have lived the double life of success on the outside and struggle on the inside. I know the shame, the fear, and the silence that keep so many leaders trapped. Sobriety gave me my life back, and now I want to use that experience to help others do the same.
Thank you for your support.
Mark

title: Help Our Family Homestead Rebuild
description:
Hi, friends.
We’re a small generational family-run homestead that’s always believed in hard work, community, and growing with care. We are Perma-culturists and believe in making your environment work for you.
We are dedicated to growing fresh greens, flavorful herbs, and raising happy, healthy poultry. Farming isn’t just our livelihood—it’s how we stay connected to the land and give back to our community.
This past summer was incredibly difficult. After years of hard work, we were finally starting to find our rhythm—until spiteful neighbors reported us to the Commonwealth of PA: Department of Manure Management and Animal Welfare. Although we were cleared after an investigation and found "Not Guilty", the damage was done. We lost critical time during peak farmers market season and, with it, a large portion of our income.
Now, we’re asking for your help to raise $10,000 to get back on our feet. Your support will help us:
Obtain Seeds and Bulbs for the following season
Buy Soil, mushroom fertilizer and blood meal
Replant our greens and herbs
Care for and maintain our tiny poultry operation
Buy equipment for our homesteading needs
Cover any fees to return to the farmer's market full time
We’re determined to rebuild and keep doing what we love—but we can’t do it alone. Every donation, share, or kind word brings us one step closer to a fresh start. There are lessons to be learned from each obstacle that is placed in your life. My lesson is to never let negativity win.
Thank you for believing in small farms, honest food, and families like ours. ❤️
With gratitude,
Our Family
labels: Bird, Chicken, Comb, Phasianidae, Fowl

title: Help Riverside Eye Specialists Survive and Thrive
description:
Dr. Ray Glendrange here on behalf of Riverside Eye Specialists, the ophthalmology practice that has served the eyecare needs of our Riverside community for over 120 years. Unfortunately, despite our best efforts, our very existence has been driven to the brink, leaving me to ponder early retirement. Though we’ve lobbied and crusaded for substantial Health Insurance reform, the big behemoth insurance companies and those management companies they employ (partners in crime) continue to get away with murder (literally as well as metaphorically). What’s worse is they used our good name to recruit most of the remaining good plans into their rolls, further stripping us of our ability to offer our patients ethical state-of-the-art care.
Therefore, at the risk of shooting ourselves in the foot, we decided to cut ties with the worst of the bad actors while putting the others on notice that if they want to continue to have us as their provider, they must start flying right IMMEDIATELY. We’ve removed our practice from the panels of those whose top priority is to make money at the expense of appropriate patient care & small practices’ viability. There is no long game for these money-grubbing insurers and their management companies; they fleece the golden goose while they can, massaging their profits to attract even bigger mergers that award HUGE paydays for their execs & investors. I was offered such a deal by one attempting to lure us into their fold. But we’ll NOT sell out to legitimize these egregious practices.
Fortunately, there is light for us at the end of this nightmarish tunnel. We’re now contractually slated to be an inaugural exclusive specialty provider for a new big insurance management company that’s going live the 1st of 2026. Their backing will be huge and not subject to private support, and they’ll directly compete with existing companies, forcing them by comparison to shape up or lose out. We’ve also signed contracts with the VA for seamless scheduling of our brave Veterans (for which, as a Navy Veteran with 2 sons serving as active-duty Naval Officers, I’m VERY proud) along with a great new IEHP contract among many others. So, we expect 2026 will be a banner year for Riverside Eye Specialists!
That said, with the end of our Managed Care contract as of today and the anticipated fallout from our negotiations with these bad-acting insurance companies, we anticipate our dire situation will get worse before it gets better. At the risk of upsetting my friends, patients & colleagues, I’ve decided dire circumstances require dire action; I’ve decided to pass the hat, asking for Go Fund Me donations to not only keep the doors open, but to keep key staff from being poached by bigger practices by paying them competitive wages. Though I’ll be viewed by many as shameless and even just wrong, at this point there’s not much I’d NOT consider doing to save this practice from extinction. It goes without saying NONE of any $ we collect would be used for my use. Having drained all our retirement savings along with selling our Riverside home, the gains used to bolster the practice, we’ve gotten very comfortable living the austere life in our 1-bedroom apartment near the practice. We’re not looking for any large donations; please donate only if you support our cause and have the means to do so. And please understand, we'll not keep score; nobody should feel obligated to donate, we'll not treat ANY patient differently (as I'd like to think we've always demonstrated), and of course we'll continue our code of strict confidentiality for all patients and their records. Thank you for your patience and consideration.
labels: Eyewear, Vision Care, Glasses, Smile, Sunglasses

title: Help Rebuild Jura Floral Studio After Fire
description:
Last week, Sept. 17th, 2025, a devastating fire ripped through 481 Van Brunt St., in Red Hook, Brooklyn. The historic building housed hundreds of artists and small businesses. One of these was Jura, a modern floral studio focusing on artistic and thoughtful design rooted in the emphasis of local materials and sustainable practices.
My friend, Migle, is the owner and founder of Jura and if you happen to know her you know how hard she’s worked to build this business from the ground up. She pours her heart into every project and event, big or small, and brings beauty and meaning to her clients’ most important moments. From gallery shows to small dinner parties, weddings, galas, and beyond.
Following the fire, her studio is looking to relocate and build out a new space, any little boost of support will help her to continue sharing her incredible florals with the community.
www.jura.nyc

title: Support Eco-Librium Farm's Sustainable Vision
description:
Food and farming is such a fascinating field(no pun intended) because there is so much potential to create, to build, to support, and to work with the natural world for a thriving zone of abundance that can provide food, shelter, and so much more to humans and wildlife.
Eco-Librium Farm (ELF) is the culmination and just the beginning of my life’s work growing food and building sustainable ecosystems.  I started gardening with my mother around the time I could walk and my started my first job for a homesteading family at 16 years old. In college I tried to study broadly and looked for something different, but was always drawn back to study agriculture and ecology.
I believe that what is truly good for humans is also what is good for the planet.  From that comes a simple ideology.  Healthy People, Healthy Places.  Food should be good for you, taste great, and be good for the earth.
Eco-Librium is a small farm in Waynesboro VA nestled in the roots of the Appalachian mountains.  I started ELF in 2022 after 13+ years of agricultural experience in 4 different states and 2 separate countries (USA and Ireland).  I wanted the freedom to practice my vision for holistically sustainable agriculture that benefits all living things and honors our interconnectedness with the natural world.
The whole farm is a  total of 3 acres including my home with just under ¼ acre of good soil for vegetable crops, ½ to ¾ of an acre for blueberries and raspberries, and 2+ acres of forested hillside.  The land offers unique challenges and opportunities.  The many different growing zones–shaded dry understory, shaded wet ravine, forest edge, flat rich soil, and open rocky hillside–means there is limited possibility for scaling one crop, but it provides the opportunity for a richly integrated farm ecosystem that utilizes each area to its full potential.
Eco-Librium is dedicated to No-Till farming.  But a small compact utility tractor would help maintain the land and solve several key issues: 1) Clearing scrubby invasive plants for more fruit and herb plantings, 2) moving materials around the property, and 3) maintaining the driveway.
The beauty of a compact utility tractor is that once I have the tractor I can buy individual attachments over time. So while I can get a tractor and loader now to work on these specific issues, this purchase will continue to expand in usefulness over time and can grow with the business.
Invasive species remediation will take several years and a lot of hard work without chemical inputs.  Having a tractor to help with initial removal of larger trunks and brush and periodic mowing will make this possible.
In the long term I will continue to acquire useful attachments like pallet forks to be able to receive bulk supplies and equipment, a rotary cutter to keep the brush down, and woodchipper/shredder to  make my own mulch.
This tractor would support both economic success and environmental stewardship at Eco-Librium Farm.  Your funds will go directly to tractor payments and necessary attachments.  If Eco-Librium Farm aligns with your values I hope you will consider helping me build up my equipment!
labels: Creative arts, Badge, Symbol, Fictional character

title: Help Chick N’ Friends Relocate and Grow
description:
In 1977, the Lloyd family packed up their car and drove across the country from California to Columbia, Maryland for a new job opportunity and a fresh start. What began as a road trip to a new home quickly grew into a legacy. By 1981, the family was working as equipment contractors for KFC, Wendy’s, and Burger King throughout the DMV. In 1987, after years of hard work in the restaurant industry, the Lloyds opened Chick N’ Friends in the Long Reach Village Center. Today, more than 24 years later, Chick N’ Friends proudly stands as the longest-running family-owned and Black-owned restaurant in Columbia, Maryland.
For decades, Chick N’ Friends has been more than just a place to eat—it has been a part of the community’s heartbeat. We’ve served comfort food that brings families together, offered first jobs and training to local youth, and provided a gathering place where memories are made.
Our family business has reached an important crossroads. With our lease ending and the property slated for redevelopment, it’s time for us to relocate. Taking to heart the feedback of our loyal customers, we’re excited to share that a new location has already been secured. Though this transition was unexpected, we’re optimistic—the new space will be safer, more visible, and better suited to welcome our community for years to come.
We’re so close to making this dream a reality! Our fundraising goal of $31772.00 will help us cover the final costs of relocating—everything from moving expenses to securing our new space and making sure the transition is smooth and successful.
But this move isn’t just about keeping things going—it’s also about growing! With your support, we’ll be able to expand our menu to include delicious breakfast options, a wider variety of desserts, a refreshing smoothie bar, and allow us to continue to offer employment to our community.
If Chick N’ Friends has touched your life, or if you believe in preserving community-rooted, family-owned businesses, we invite you to support us. Every donation—large or small—will help us keep the doors open and the tradition alive.
Your support today keeps our doors open tomorrow.
CHICK N’ FRIENDS

title: Save Rocketbelly: Help Arlington's Youngest Entrepreneur
description:
I’m Mary, Olivia’s mom.
As her mom, I’ve watched Olivia pour her heart and soul into Rocketbelly since she was 10 years old. She saved every dollar, she worked harder than most adults, and she built a restaurant that people in Arlington truly loved.
I stepped away from my own career to support her dream because I believe in it as much as she does. But the truth is, the last year has been incredibly hard. We’ve faced obstacles that no child should have to endure just to keep a small business alive. On top of that, I'm a single mom providing for her and her two other siblings while trying to support her and keep her dreams alive.
Olivia signed a lease for her new location in Downtown Arlington last October. What should have been a quick transition turned into 11 months of delays and setbacks that were completely out of her control. We have shared more details on her social media pages. But below is a timeline of what happened:
She closed her original shop in May, expecting to reopen within weeks. Instead, she has been left waiting, first for a promised wall to be built, then for permits, then for electrical corrections. Each step has been slow, uncertain, and devastating for a 13-year-old who just wants to work hard and serve her community again.
At this point, Olivia no longer has a location, her savings have been eaten away, and Rocketbelly has been stuck in limbo. She has requested her prepaid rent and deposit back, but there’s no guarantee she’ll ever see those funds. That means she has to start over completely from scratch and this time without all the money she saved over 3 years of running Rocketbelly.
Olivia is only 13, but she has carried herself with strength and determination beyond her years. Still, even the strongest kids need help sometimes. I've exhausted all my family and emergency funds to try and help Olivia. That’s why I’m here, humbly asking on her behalf: if you’ve ever eaten at Rocketbelly, if you’ve ever cheered for a young entrepreneur, or if you just believe kids deserve the chance to see their dreams come true, please consider helping Olivia.
---
Here is a message from Olivia:
Hi everyone, my friends and awesome customers!! ❤️
I miss you all so, so much. Rocketbelly was my happy place, and the best part was always YOU — my customers, who became family.
It’s been really hard watching everything I worked for disappear while I sit and wait on things I can’t control. Some days it feels like my rocketship might never take off again. But I don’t want to give up, I just need a little help to get through this.
If you’ve ever enjoyed a meal, a tea, or a laugh at Rocketbelly,
I hope you’ll believe in me one more time
. Every dollar helps me get closer to reopening and welcoming you back.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you. I promise I’ll keep working hard, keep giving back to our community, and keep dreaming big.
Love, Olivia
---
Your support doesn’t just keep a business alive. It keeps a dream alive. It tells a young girl that her hard work matters, that her community believes in her, and that she can keep pushing forward no matter how many setbacks stand in her way.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for believing in Olivia, in Rocketbelly, and in the power of community
Love,
The Rocketbelly Family
Please follow us on our pages to see updates as Olivia restarts her journey:
Rocketbelly Facebook
Rocketbelly Instagram
Rocketbelly Tiktok
---
Here are some memories:
Rocketbelly's 1 year anniversary:
Olivia's 12th Birthday @ Rocketbelly:
Astronaut and Navy Seal Chris Cassidy Visits Rocketbelly:
Serving her community:
And so many other memories:
And if you've never heard of Olivia's story, here are some videos about her:

Real Astronaut Visits Rocketbelly!

title: Help Alfredo & Nichelle Rebuild Elotes El Regio
description:
Help Alfredo & Nichelle Rebuild Elotes El Regio #2 After the Fire
On October 6th, 2025, tragedy struck when our dear friends Alfredo and Nichelle Gonzales, the hardworking owners of
Elotes El Regio #2 in Corpus Christi
, lost their beloved food truck to a devastating fire.
In just moments, they lost everything inside the truck — equipment, supplies, and even personal belongings. For a family of six, this wasn’t just a business — it was their dream, their livelihood, and the way they supported their children and served our community.
If you’ve ever stopped by Elotes El Regio #2, you know the heart behind every roasted corn, taco, and plate they served. Alfredo and Nichelle always welcomed everyone with smiles, kindness, and the best Mexican food in town. They’ve built more than a business — they’ve built a family within our Corpus Christi community.
Now, it’s our turn to give back.
We’re asking our community to come together and help Alfredo, Nichelle, and their children rebuild what was lost.
Every dollar raised will go toward getting them back on their feet — replacing essential equipment, restocking ingredients, and helping them restart their dream.
Even a small donation can make a big difference. If you can’t donate, please share this fundraiser and help spread the word. Let’s remind this family that Corpus Christi stands behind them — just like they’ve always stood behind us with hard work, love, and delicious food.
Let’s help Elotes El Regio #2 rise again — stronger than ever.
Thank you for your kindness, generosity, and support.
— Ruben Murillo
labels: Eyewear, Sleeve, Collar, Vision Care, Glasses

title: Whisking Up a New Chapter for Fannie Cakes™
description:
Whisking Up a New Chapter for Fannie Cakes™
Bringing more seats to the table with the breakfasts you crave and the baked goods you love.
Hello, my name is Stefannie Roundtree, and I am the proud owner and founder of Fannie Cakes™ Bakery Café. For the past eight years, I have had the honor of serving this community with fresh, homemade breakfasts, baked goods, and desserts that bring people together.
I am now stepping into an exciting new chapter: expanding into a new location directly next door. This space will finally allow us to provide seating for our customers, creating a warm and welcoming café environment where families and friends can gather to enjoy great food and fellowship.
To make this vision a reality, I am seeking to raise $10,000 through this fundraiser. These funds will go directly toward the essential costs of preparing the new café for operation, including:
Signage – to proudly display the Fannie Cakes™ name and attract customers
Inspections & Permits – to ensure the space meets all required health and safety standards
Rent – to secure the new location as we prepare for opening
Inventory – stocking the kitchen with the food and supplies needed to serve our customers
Cleaning & Preparation – making sure the café is spotless and inviting for our guests
Contractor Build-Out – finishing touches to the floor plan to ensure the space is customer-ready
My goal is to have the doors of our new café open by the end of October. With your support, we can make this happen even sooner.
This is not just about expanding a business—it’s about investing in our community, creating more opportunities, and continuing to serve the people who have supported Fannie Cakes™ from the beginning.
I invite you to join me in this next phase of our journey. Every contribution, big or small, will bring us closer to opening the doors of the new Fannie Cakes™ café. Together, we can make this vision a reality.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support, encouragement, and belief in this dream.
— Stefannie Roundtree, Founder of Fannie Cakes™
labels: Restaurant, Fast food restaurant

title: Help Starr Medical cross the finish line
description:
My name is Tiara Granger, and I’m building something bigger than myself — Starr Medical, LLC, a company dedicated to helping clinics run smoother by handling the heavy paperwork, scheduling, new patient onboarding and authorizations that steal time away from patient care. But this journey isn’t just about starting a business. It’s about survival, resilience, and turning struggle into purpose.
For the past 13 months, my wife has been held off her federal work duties, fighting to get back into the career she loves. Just when she finally ordered too return, the government shutdown hit — knocking us right back into uncertainty. Through it all, I’ve been holding down our family of six, keeping the vision alive, and pushing forward step by step.
And here’s the part I’m most proud of:
I haven’t sat back waiting on a handout. I’ve already poured every resource and sacrifice I could into Starr Medical. I wrote a complete business plan, registered with the State of Tennessee, designed business cards, and even set up a company phone and fax line. I Have even started marketing, getting Starr Medical name out there to the community. These weren’t luxuries — they were faith moves, proof that I’m committed to making this dream real no matter the obstacles. Now, I’m at the final hurdle: covering the official LLC filing fees and startup costs to make Starr Medical fully official and open for business. This is where I need my community. By donating, you’re not just helping with paperwork. You’re Investing in a my children's future. Helping create real solutions for clinics so providers can focus on patients- YOU, not red tape. Partnering in a vision that will let me provide for my children while building generational stability. Showing my family — and especially my kids — that when life knocks you down, faith and community can still carry you across the finish line. Every donation, big or small, is a seed into something bigger than just me. It’s an act of faith that says: “I see you, I believe in you, and I want to be part of this story.” If you can’t give financially, a share is just as powerful. God told me I had no worries - so if a share is all i can get, then a share is all I will be thankful to have. Help me spread the word and bring this vision to life. From the bottom of my heart — thank you for believing in me, my family, and Starr Medical. ✨
— Tiara Granger & Family
(Starr Medical, LLC in the making)
labels: Logo, Graphics, Symbol, Graphic design

title: The Boba Bros!
description:
We are the Boba Bros!
Hi everyone, my name is
Gavin Stella
, and alongside my partner
Nate Hilton
, we’re excited to share our new venture with you. We’re both students at
Eckerd College
, and with the school’s support, we’ve been given the opportunity to start our very own on-campus business:
selling Boba Tea to our fellow students.
We’re raising funds to cover startup costs like ingredients, supplies, and equipment to help us launch successfully and keep drinks affordable for our classmates.
Our stand is located in a
central spot on campus near the food vendors
, giving us great visibility and plenty of foot traffic. With very few drink options available on campus, we believe boba tea will quickly become a favorite choice for students looking for something refreshing and unique.
The closest competitor is a ramen shop about five minutes off campus, but since most Eckerd students live on campus without cars, we’re confident our location will make us the go-to spot for boba. On top of that, we’re running our business out of a
café-style lounge provided by the school,
which means
no residency costs
. That allows us to keep
our prices lower than competitors
while still offering the same great quality and making a
fair profit
.
Thank you for supporting us and helping bring something new and exciting to campus life.
Welcome to the Boba Bros!

title: Support Allen and LaNeatha's Food Truck Comeback
description:
Our Food Truck Accident
Hello, we’re Allen and LaNeatha. For years, we’ve poured our hearts into cooking and serving communities all over — city to city, event to event — bringing food made with love that you can taste in every bite. Allen is known for “smoking up the city,” while LaNeatha is known as the seafood lady with the best sides. Together, we’ve built something that has become more than just a business. It’s our passion, our joy, and truly our baby.
Whenever our community has asked, we’ve shown up — giving 100%, going above and beyond to share our food and love. That’s why this moment is so devastating for us.
Yesterday, we were in a terrible accident. In an instant, we lost not only our food trailer but also the truck that pulled it. Everything we worked so hard for — everything we built together — was crushed. We are grateful to be safe, but the loss is heavy.
Now we’re facing the reality of starting over. It’s not easy to ask for help — but we need our community. And we know our community needs us, too! If you can donate, share, or simply send prayers and love, it will mean the world as we work to rebuild what we’ve lost.
We are stronger together. Thank you for standing with us, believing in us, praying for us, and helping us keep our dream alive. ❤️

title: Support Samurai Sam’s & Our Community
description:
My name is Marlen, and for the past 18 years, Samurai Sam’s Teriyaki Grill in Scottsdale has been my second home and a place where I’ve built lasting relationships with my community. Every day, I welcome children, families, and elderly guests who have become like family to me. I’ve always believed in serving healthy, affordable meals in a clean, welcoming environment, and I take pride in being there for my customers—whether it’s making a nutritious meal for a young person struggling with an eating disorder or checking in on an elderly couple when I notice a change in their routine. These moments remind me how much this restaurant means to the people around me, and how much they mean to me in return.
The past few years have been incredibly challenging. Food and supply costs have doubled or even tripled, and I’ve worked long hours—sometimes 65 hours a week—just to keep things going. Despite my efforts, I’ve fallen behind on rent and other essential bills like insurance and permits. I’m also facing a difficult decision about my health, as I’ve had to postpone much-needed back surgery because I can’t afford to hire extra help. My husband and I do everything we can, but it’s become overwhelming to manage these rising costs while still supporting my small team and serving the community I love.
I’m asking for help so Samurai Sam’s can continue to be a place where people feel cared for and nourished. With your support, I hope to pay off urgent bills, keep my staff employed, and focus on my health so I can keep greeting customers for years to come. I also want to keep hiring and mentoring local young people, teaching them the value of hard work and kindness. Thank you for believing in me and in the future of Samurai Sam’s Teriyaki Grill.
labels: Visual arts, Illustration, Mural, Poster, Design

title: I just want to keep good people employed.
description:
Employees are unaware of the situation, so I did not include their photos. If you would like, I can always ask them.
Summary: A large online retailer lost over $125,000 of our inventory, we had no sales for months, I covered salaries and expenses with savings and short-term loans. I have not paid myself since February. All donations will be used to pay off the short-term debt and buy inventory to support future operations. Your donations will keep 4 good people employed. It would be great to give the employees a bonus, they deserve it. Details below.
The longer version:
Hi, I’m Josh, and this is my story.
I don’t sleep well, the thought of closing the business puts 4 good people out of work and I wouldn’t be able to support my own child. But I get out of bed at 6am, put on my happy dad face and get my little girl ready for daycare. After the daycare drop-off reality sets back in and I know I have a problem. Now I’m almost to work and I put the happy face back on before the staff arrives.
We took a large loss in the first part of the year and I did what was necessary to keep paying my employees and keep the business afloat. The hole I dug seemed reasonable at the time, but here I am, asking for help.
We were approached by a very large retailer to supply them with inventory. But here is how that works: We send them inventory, then they sell it for us as they have a very large platform. So we own the inventory and they charge us to fulfil orders.
This was a very calculated decision. We tested them out over a year ago to make sure we understood the process and nuances. The process is very slow and there are plenty of nuances and getting help to fix issues is difficult. However, the visibility is tremendous, and we did sell a lot of items quickly. So we understood the risks but were ready. In order to be successful, we would need a large volume to be sent to their warehouse. So spent 7-8 months planning inventory (mainly apparel) and had a schedule to send spring / summer items in December and January to allow for processing time etc. and have our items on the website ready to go. We also sent a mix of fall/winter items as well.
What we didn’t anticipate:
The ability for a warehouse to lose 75% of our inventory in a short amount of time. We had not ran into this issue during our ‘trial’ phase. As it turns out, to report lost inventory there is a lot of paperwork involved to prove it was lost. We used their suggested shipping service, but still had to send them a pdf that a box of our inventory was delivered. We had to re-upload 100+ different inventory lists, then we had to go into their system to check our own status as we were not given any notification.
Long story short, 3 of us spent 5+ months checking in and submitting ‘help’ tickets. Since most of our inventory was lost, we weren’t selling anything on this large platform. We do have other outlets for sales, but couldn’t just pivot since there were only so many hours in a day.
I had hope we could fix the problem and bounce back. So I used my savings and took out loans to pay the employees, pay the bank, pay for daycare. For me, I went bare minimum. Thankfully I don’t have a lot of monthly expenses for myself. My car is 12 years old and has been paid off for a long time. I do get HBO MAX since it has Sesame Street and other Kids Shows and Movies.
Turns out, hope wasn’t a solution.
We really never received an answer on how it all happened. Thousands of emails that typically said “ we are working very hard on this.”
At this point I have minimal inventory and no reserves. Sadly I chose to borrow more money. I knew better. This is a viable business, it’s been in operation over 6 years. We have the ability to reallocate sales, but require the capital to purchase inventory and need time to ramp-up.
We are in a rural area and I am very fortunate to have a great staff. I do my best to be flexible with schedules and it had paid off greatly for me. I tell them all the time, just send me a text if you can’t make it in, I don’t need a reason, life happens, no worries here. They covered for me recently when my child’s eye doctor appointment lasted 4 hours and I greatly appreciated it. (Everything is fine with her eyes, the doctors’ office was just ‘running behind’ at 9am).
I’m 43, I struggled in my early 20’s after college to get a good job. I worked in corporate America for 20 years and saved as many pennies as I could. I didn’t plan to buy a women’s clothing distributor, but an opportunity presented itself and I took on the challenge of small business owner. It’s the happiest I’ve ever been at work. I went from suit and tie to forklift driver overnight. It’s hard to explain. I know I enjoy the challenges that arise daily, I enjoy teaching the staff about excel and the process of buying and selling. I tell you this, so the next part of my story has context on why all the warehouse workers are female.
Turns out, I don’t get many applications from males. Understandable. We get in shipments of women’s clothes and repackage to ship. I don’t particularly care, t-shirts are t-shirts, jeans are jeans. To me its all ‘product’ to sell.
Warehouse worker is the title, but a better title would be “we do everything needed.” I work the office, clean the bathroom and move boxes in the warehouse. The staff helps with office tasks, inventory evaluation and purchase, updating the website, answering the phone and emails…the list goes on and on (They move boxes too.)
(Names of Employee have been changed)
Cara is a single mom and often needs to take off to take care of her child. I will say her child needs more attention and help than most. She told me she took the job due to the flexibility. She had held other jobs where essentially, she was punished for needing to leave work to take care of her son in emergencies. Cara also gives Faye a ride to and from work daily.
Faye has been with me the longest. She works hard. I’ve helped her pay for car repairs but still she is currently without a working vehicle. She knows the warehouse better than me at this point. She is my go-to.
Sara works 2 jobs, a family and really digs into problems to solve them. She uses her own personal laptop (at home) to help me out when needed. I do work late hours, but I don’t expect anyone else to worry about that. So I learned a long time ago if I send Sara an email in the evening for a request, I wake up to a response she wrote at 10pm or 6am. I apologized to her, that wasn’t my intention for her to work that late or early, its just when I had time. Her response “I don’t mind, you let me take off whenever I need to, it works great for me.” ( I wasn’t going to argue with her, I just don’t send her late emails anymore.)
Dee is our newest employee. She started right before our big ramp-up to the retailer. She was hired mainly for warehouse work/clothes sorting etc. Very quickly she transitioned into being on top of the ‘help tickets’ for our lost apparel. She now is mainly in the office and really enjoys learning. She has been a great surprise with her willingness and attitude. She is exceptionally polite. She newer to the work-force and defies all stereotypes about work ethic.
That’s my story. I have not informed the employees as they have enough to worry about in their own lives. Greatly appreciate your help. If you would like a tour or want to learn how to drive a forklift, let me know.
Gofundme said not to include my email or phone number.  Feel free to message me here with any questions.  Happy to answer them.
labels: Chin, Eyebrow, Forehead, Collar, Smile

title: The DeMarce Theatre Projector Project
description:
The projector at the DeMarce Theatre has progressively declined to the point where we can no longer show movies. It's also too old to order parts.
We've looked at used projectors, new projectors and everything in the middle. Financially ($20,000) it would make sense to buy a cheap used projector but then we feel we will be in this same predicament in a few years time.
Ideally, for the longevity of the movie theater, we would love to be able to purchase as new of a projector as possible. This cost is looking to be about $55,000 (waiting to confirm delivery and set up costs).
We will be doing fundraisers and grant writing to help us cover some of this cost but we are also hoping you can help out too. We've heard so many heartwarming stories from our community that you are so happy the DeMarce Theatre has continued its long tradition of showhouse movies and we want to be able to continue this tradition for the next generations.
Any amount you can give is appreciated! Thank you for your continued support.
We do have a plan in place to open soon with a borrowed (rented) projector and more details will be coming just as soon as they are finalized.

title: Help Adrian Expand Adriano's Pizza Napoletana
description:
The Story
Hi, I’m Adrian — a lifelong pizza lover, pizzaiolo, and passionate entrepreneur. After years of dreaming (and dough-stretching), I’m ready to expand Adriano's Pizza Napoletana, a neighborhood-focused mobile pizzeria and catering/event center serving handcrafted pies made with love, fire, and the freshest ingredients in Springfield, Missouri.
But I can’t do it alone. I need your help to bring this dream to life.
Why This Matters

We’ll be sourcing local ingredients, hiring local staff, and giving back to the community.
Where the Funds Go
We’re raising money to cover:

1.) Pizza Oven
2.) Dough mixer,
3.) prep tables,
4.) refrigerator,
5.) freezer

Every dollar you contribute brings us closer to opening day — and every backer becomes part of our pizzeria family.
Rewards You’ll Love

Join the Pizza Revolution

Thank you for being so supportive, and I can’t wait to serve you your first slice
Adrian Michael

title: Fight for The Thirsty Perch
description:
In 2017, Steve Steeber and Sherri Miller grabbed for the brass ring and made a dream come true…they opened The Thirsty Perch in beautiful downtown Iola, Wisconsin, on the shores of Lake Iola. Local residents and long-time supporters of the Iola-Scandinavia community and surrounding areas, they wanted to give the community a fun and friendly place to go with family and friends, and provide top-quality food and drinks at prices folks could afford. The rest, as they say, is history. The Thirsty Perch is a staple in the community, drawing customers from all over to enjoy the atmosphere and the excellent food. Their Friday Fish Fry is one of the most popular in the area.
In 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic, Steve and Sherri saw an opportunity to bring even more to the community and purchased the auto garage that shared the driveway with The Thirsty Perch. The plan was to provide a venue for everyone to come and enjoy live outdoor music by converting the garage into an awesome outdoor bar with plenty of seating and even bathrooms. The end result is a beautiful outdoor space that over the years has drawn many visitors to Iola for a variety of music, events, and performers.
The first live music performance was on Memorial Day weekend in 2021 when Spicy Tie Band took the stage and rocked the crowd to everyone’s delight. Since that first show, The Perch has hosted almost 200 bands, and the audience and popularity of the venue grow with each performance.
The Thirsty Perch typically employs 25 full and part-time staff members, and in the summer that number increases to 35. These are local community members, many of whom are in high school or college, and the money they earn at The Thirsty Perch, both salary and their tips, helps pay their way through school. People who need a second job are able to work at The Thirsty Perch in the evenings and on the weekends to help support their families. People who are retired and are looking for a little extra income or just want to get out of the house are also able to help fill those odd shifts. No matter how you look at it, The Thirsty Perch brings significant revenue into our village, both from customers at the establishment and those who visit other local businesses as a result of coming to The Perch.
On June 10, 2025, with no warning whatsoever, The Village Board voted to not renew the liquor license for The Thirsty Perch. Despite being a respected and popular restaurant, losing the liquor license will essentially put The Perch out of business. The foundation for this decision was an open court case Steve was working through and in no way impeded his ability to participate in or own a bar and restaurant. Since this injustice, Steve prevailed in court and the charges were either dropped or reduced, making this situation even more tragic and unfair.
Steve and Sherri vowed to fight this shocking injustice and have hired attorneys and are working through the appeal process, now at the state level. They are fighting for their dream, they are fighting for their livelihood and they are fighting to continue to be a strong supporter ofand contributor to our community.
The impact of this on both their business income and personal savings is shocking and the reason for this fundraiser.
Lost business revenues: $80,000
Personal funds spent on attorney fees: $37,000
The Thirsty Perch and Steve and Sherri need support from the community to which they have dedicated the last 7 years of their lives.
Their personal savings are depleted, and this battle is not over. We are appealing to everyone who, whether a customer of The Thirsty Perch, a friend of Steve and Sherri, a former employee, or just someone who is troubled by the wrong that has been done to these people… we need your help. Any amount that you can donate will be applied directly towards the legal costs incurred by The Thirsty Perch as they fight to regain their liquor license and become the wonderfully popular, vibrant business that we have all come to know and love. Please donate any amount that you can and know that no amount is too small and every little bit helps.
We thank you for your support!
labels: Logo, Advertising, Graphic design

title: Back the Steady Buddy: Empowering Independence and Mobility
description:
Hi, I’m Marlene and I live with Multiple Sclerosis (MS). For over 25 years, walking has been one of my biggest challenges. Every step carries the risk of falling. While most people don’t notice an uneven sidewalk, dips in the grass, or rocks on the pavement, these things quickly become a serious hazard for me.
Still, I refuse to let MS sideline me. Every day, I push forward with determination, committed to staying active because movement is key to a thriving life. Walking, even with its risks, is essential not just for mobility, but for independence, connection, and joy. I’ve spent years searching for ways to move safely and confidently, refusing to let fear hold me back. Out of that determination, the Steady Buddy was born.
What is the Steady Buddy?
The Steady Buddy is a simple, wearable walking aid that helps people walk side by side with confidence and freedom. It’s a soft neoprene armband that is tightened on the upper arm with two Velcro straps and a sturdy handle is attached. One person wears the Steady Buddy and the other holds the handle. Together, you walk with ease and steadiness. Unlike bulky canes or walkers, it’s discreet, comfortable, and designed to make walking about companionship instead of fear.
My
Journey
Developing the Steady Buddy has been a labor of love. I’ve invested years of work, personal time, and resources to bring this vision to life.
•  Patent pending
•  Trademark registered
•  Entirely developed, funded, and led by me
Your Support
Your support at this critical time will go directly toward manufacturing, distribution, and getting the Steady Buddy into the hands of those who need it most. Together, we can make walking safer, more joyful, and more connected for people living with MS and other mobility challenges.
Thank you for believing in this vision and helping bring the Steady Buddy into the world. If this mission speaks to you, please share it with your family and friends. Together, we can bring safety, confidence, and joy to more people who need it.

title: Support Cindy Riggsbee's Shoe Repair After Flood
description:
Not only did my grandmother Cinderella “Cindy” Riggsbee (82) lose her glass slipper, she lost her small business during the flooding that happened at Eastgate Crossing on July 6. Many people may know or heard of it, “The Shoe Repair.”
The Shoe Repair was one of multiple shoe repair shops to open in the Chapel Hill, NC university area. Cindy took over the shop sometime in the early-mid 90s. Not only did she have customers from all over the Chapel Hill-RDU area, but out of the state as well. She has repaired shoes for the well known. For Woody Durham, Carl Fox, Henry Gates, Phil Ford, James Sperling, Sylvia Hatchell and the list goes on.
As her kids, grandkids, and great grands grew up, our first job was at The Shoe Repair so that we could learn the skills of running a cash register and what it takes to repair shoes. Till this day we’re able to come in and help take the load off sometime. She would NEVER turn down a customer! She would always try her best with everything that was brought to her from shoes, purses, backpacks, belts, the list goes on! Cindy Riggsbee is well known in the Chapel Hill/ RDU area, not only for repairing shoes but for being the kind, loving, helpful woman that she is.
Owning the Shoe Repair and repairing shoes brings Cindy so much enjoyment. She has befriended so many. She might not remember their names but she knows they are her customers. Cindy does to shoes what our Saviour, Jesus Christ does to us. We are torn, low to the ground, and feel like we have no more use but, through prayer and faith, Jesus repairs us. He Gives us new strength and stability to carry on. Cindy knows this. She told a customer to come back in a few weeks. She will be open. Cindy has her faith in Jesus.
Unfortunately, her insurance will not be able to cover all of the repairs that are needed to rebuild the shop and get it back up and running. Her family has gathered together to make a go fund me account to help raise money, to help her with repairing the shop. We just want to thank everyone in advance with any donation that she may receive, we greatly appreciate it and it will mean so much!
If you would like to hear more about her story check her out on CBS17 and ABC 11 with the links below.
https://www.cbs17.com/news/local-news/orange-county-news/we-got-to-stick-together-a-local-chapel-hill-shoe-repair-business-faces-flood-recovery-with-hope-and-resilience/
https://abc11.com/post/shoe-repair-longtime-chapel-hill-shop-eastgate-crossing-faces-extensive-damage-chantals-flooding/17086492/
labels: Lips, Neck, Facial expression, Eyelash, Happiness

title: Help Me Launch My Dream Food Truck
description:
Hello everyone,
My name is Shawayne Robinson, me and my spouse ( Disabled Vet ) have always dreamed of sharing our love for Caribbean dishes with the community. A food truck is the perfect way to make that dream come true bringing fresh, delicious meals straight to neighborhoods, events, and local gatherings.
Why a Food Truck?
Opening a restaurant can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars, but a food truck allows me to start smaller while still serving high quality food. We want to create not just meals, but an experience that brings people together through flavor, culture, and community.
How Donations Will Help
Your support will help cover essential startup costs, including:
• Purchasing and outfitting the food truck
• Kitchen equipment and safety requirements
• Licenses, health permits, and commissary fees
• Initial inventory and supplies
•	️ Insurance and marketing
My Goal
We are aiming to raise $60,000 to help get the truck on the road and serve the community. Even the smallest donation makes a huge difference.
How You Can Help
•	Donate what you can every dollar helps!
•	Share this campaign with friends, family, and on social media.
•	Come visit the truck once it’s up and running I’d love to serve you a plate of our delicious meals
Thank you so much for supporting our dream. With your help, We can turn this vision into a reality and bring flavorful food to life on wheels!
Gratefully,
Robinson Family
labels: Font

title: Keep the Music Alive:
description:
After years of laughter, late nights, first dates, last dances, and countless memories poured into every corner of this space… we find ourselves at a crossroads.
This bar was never just a bar. It was a heartbeat. A sanctuary. A stage for the stories that music tells when words fall short. From the first chord struck on our tiny stage to the last drink poured after a midnight encore, we’ve held space for the dreamers, the drifters, the lovers, and the loners. You made this place magic.
We’ve fought hard to keep these doors open—through long hours, personal sacrifice, and unwavering love for what this place has meant to so many. We’ve tried every angle, every pivot, every prayer. But sometimes, even the most cherished places need a lifeline.
So I'm turning to you—my community, family, and fellow believers in the power of music and connection.
If this bar has ever been your refuge, your rhythm, your reason to dance… we need your help.
Your donation will go directly toward keeping the lights on, the speakers humming, and the spirit alive. Every dollar is a note in the song we’re still trying to play.
We’re not ready to say goodbye. Not yet. Not while there’s still music to be made, memories to be shared, and stories waiting to unfold beneath these dim lights and worn floorboards.
To every patron who ever walked through these doors: thank you. You brought life to these walls. You made this more than a bar—you made it a home. Your stories, your celebrations, your quiet moments at the counter… they mattered. They still do.
If we must close, we’ll do so with grace. We’ll offer up pieces of the space that might find new life elsewhere—from bar stools and glassware to vintage signage and décor. These items carry the spirit of what we built together. But if there’s a chance to keep the beat going, I'll take it.
Being part of your lives—and witnessing what music can mean to the soul—has meant more to me than you’ll ever know. In this life or the next, I hope the beat goes on.
With love, gratitude, and hope,

title: Give Itsy Bitsy Broadway a Permanent Home and a Future
description:
Hello my name is Kira Rutter- Miss Kira to all of my students at Itsy Bitsy Broadway!
23 years ago I went on stage for the first time and gained a confidence and a passion for theater that I didn't know I could have at 12 years old.  Coming out of that experience I knew what I wanted to do with my life- I wanted to do theater.  But I didn't have dreams of going to Broadway, or Hollywood- Right then, at 12 years old, I KNEW I wanted to give other children this same experience I had of fun, creativity, expression, confidence and to see themselves as more capable than they dreamed possible and to know they belonged.  I decided that when I grew up I would open a children's theater.  I pursued a degree in Theatre Education (K-12), in 2012 I volunteered with Americorp in Teach for America in Mission Texas teaching middle school drama and  flash forward to 2016 pregnant with twins in Jefferson City Missouri- I knew it was time to open my children's theater.  In the past 9 years, we have put on hundreds of productions of various scale and skill, we teach 3 year olds to be brave, 4 year olds to be creative, 5 year olds to follow directions, 6 year olds to memorize, 7 year olds to challenge themselves, 8 year olds to accomplish hard things, 9 year olds to be leaders, 10 year olds to plan, 11 year olds to create, and 12 year olds to direct- and the education and experience gained from theater just keeps building, evolving and polishing these amazing little humans to be able to see everything they actually are and can be.
We are now about to enter our 10th year of producing theater for young audiences and by young performers. We love our students, their families and all of the support we have received from our community.  In an effort to stay accessible to all children of all demographics and incomes we have kept prices very low and worked budgeting magic to accomplish all we do. We are now hoping to create sustainability in our operation, more than anything we would like to have a permanent home for itsy Bitsy Broadway.  Please consider helping Itsy Bitsy Broadway continue to offer affordable theater experiences for all children and find a permanent home by contributing to our Go Fund Me- we promise to keep giving theater to the children and we promise to never grow up <3
labels: White, Line art, Drawing, Design, Graphics

title: Raise the Bar! Women Led, Culture Fueled, Community Driven
description:
Hi friends! We’ve just been presented with an opportunity we couldn’t pass up, a turn-key Oakland establishment to nurture with care, creativity, and purpose.
The current owner approached us, believing in our experience, vision, and drive to carry this beloved space forward. Entrusted by them and the community, we’ve stepped into this moment with deep intention and gratitude.
This fundraiser will help us bring this dream to life, an offering to the city we love. While we’ve invested our own savings, we’re calling on our community to help us cross the finish line. Your contribution will support renovations, permits, a liquor license, and legal/administrative costs to lay the groundwork for a lasting, community centered venue.
We are an Oakland-based power-house team with a shared commitment to cultivating spaces that inspire connection, celebration, and self-expression. One of us brings over two decades of experience in bar leadership and community programming. The other is a celebrated DJ and curator known for music-driven experiences that unite generations and backgrounds. We bring a rare combination of experience, blending industry knowledge, cultural insight and deep community roots.
We've chosen to name the venue Golden Ratio. It's a name that reflects our philosophy and is a natural blueprint found in everything from seashells to symphonies. It's the sweet spot where music slaps, cocktails hit right and community feels real.
Together, what we're creating encompasses everything we’ve built across the Bay. This is more than a business, it’s a continuation of our work, rooted in care and shared purpose. With your help, we’ll create a space where people come as they are and leave more connected.
No matter the amount, every contribution brings us one step closer to opening our doors. Whether you’re giving $10 or $10,000, your support means the world to us — and we’re so grateful to be building this space with our community behind us.
*No raffles, sweepstakes, giveaways, or promotions are offered in exchange for any donations made to this GoFundMe.*

title: Bike Chef! A Woman-Owned Bike & Skate Shop
description:
Hi, I'm Kelly and I love bikes. After 18 years of wrenching and the abrupt closing of Chico Bike & Board,
I have an opportunity to start and run my own shop.
Maybe I've fixed your bike, built you a board, taught your kid how to fix their own flat, or just listened to your big feelings on a bad day? Bike Chef will be a full-service repair and retail shop for bicycles and skateboards. I plan on providing a free open work stand setup for those who want to work on their own projects, as well as youth tutorial sessions, sponsorships, and community events.
Chef Sam and I have worked tirelessly without pay for the past two months in a concerted effort to get this shop up and running, despite numerous hurdles and setbacks.
I've spent what I had on setting up the business. What we need now is some capital to stock inventory and continue to cover our monthly costs as things get properly going.
Aside from being a competent and skilled mechanic, I know (as do many of you) that I bring a unique perspective and energy to my profession. The skate, scooter and BMX community deserve a local outlet and I'm here for it.
Please support this woman-owned business in a typically male-dominated trade.
labels: Skateboard, Skateboarding--Equipment and supplies, Floor, Knee, Skateboarding

title: Please Donate To Keep Melrose House Open!
description:
Hi everyone, I’m Santiago Varela, owner of The Melrose House.
For the past four years, Melrose House has been a community space where DJs, artists, and collectives have been able to host events, build culture, and bring people together.
Recently, we invested in remodeling the venue to improve the space for everyone. Before starting the remodel, the landlord and I had an agreement: he would renew the lease at the same rent for two more years if we moved forward with the improvements. I have his word in writing through text messages, but he never sent the formal amendment. Now that the remodel is done, he’s trying to raise the rent and telling me “things change.”
I used my personal savings to upgrade this space, and as many of you know, small venues like ours are struggling to survive. We want to stay open and continue providing a home for events, music, and community.
We’re asking for your support—anything you can contribute truly helps us fight to keep Melrose House alive.
Thank you for standing with us and for being part of this community.

title: Support Tyler's Business After Theft & Devastating Fire
description:
At 6:30 am on Thursday, September 25th, Tyler Gilbert, owner of Rock Solid Landscape in Amarillo, TX, received a call that his shop was on fire. By the time Tyler arrived, 14 firetrucks and over 40 firefighters were working hard on putting the fire out. Nothing was left except ashes. Years of hard work and investment were gone.
When it was safe to approach, we found a hole where someone broke in. Thousands of dollars’ worth of tools, equipment, batteries, and keys were stolen—everything needed to keep the business running.
In just one night, years of hard work and investment were reduced to ashes. Rock Solid Landscape has proudly served Amarillo with honesty, hard work, and a passion for creating beautiful spaces for residential and commercial properties. Now, he is left with nothing but what is on a current job site.
We are reaching out to help support Tyler at Rock Solid Landscape in this time of great need. Every donation, big or small, will go directly toward replacing what was lost to get him and his business back on its feet.
We ask you to please consider donating and sharing this page.
labels: Advertising, Orange, Night, Banner

title: Help Herbert Sherbert Move This Month!
description:
Herbert Sherbert is moving! ✨
Hi friends! We’re Kevin and Esprit Herbert, the owners of Herbert Sherbert Ice Cream Co. in Brooksville, Florida.
For the past 7 years, we’ve been serving up our retro, colorful ice cream all across central Florida with mobile carts and events — and now we’re ready for our next big step!
Our current space is changing hands, so we’re relocating quickly — and that means BIG things ahead: a brand-new commercial kitchen (we have several businesses that will be moving with us who use our commissary) and, soon, a storefront where you can come hang out, grab your favorite scoops, and experience the Herbert Sherbert vibe in person.
We’ve worked hard and bootstrapped this business, since the very beginning (right before the pandemic)
We've weathered every storm, taken every risk imaginable and we've enjoyed every moment and scoop with YOU.
We are so thankful for the community that we have around us.
And now, we need YOU.
Whether it’s through fundraising, sharing our story, or simply cheering us on, your support makes all the difference.
Now, for the specifics:
Our build out is going to cost us: $17,000
Construction must begin on October 16th, this month.
As of now, we are $9,500.00 away from ensuring that the construction goes through smoothly in this short time frame along with the relocation of our wonderful renters.
Any and all assistance will not only make us even more grateful than we are for your continued belief in our business, but will also be used to to bless each and every business and every friend who loves our Sweet Treats.
We will make it worth your while ❤️
And we will show you how we're going to do that each and every step of the way, you will all be watching moment by moment, as we BUILD THIS DREAM TOGETHER ✊

title: Help Launch Fit Church in Hampton Roads
description:
Help Launch Fit Church Gym: A Beacon of Faith, Fitness & Community in Hampton Roads
Note: Claiming Your Donor Gift
If your donation tier includes a shirt, book, membership, or other gift, please complete the form at the bottom of this section.
For more than 20 years, God has been preparing me for this moment. From wiping down equipment at Gold’s Gym as a teen, to managing gyms, to training clients, and finally running my own Christian health coaching business—I’ve seen the good, the bad, and the broken sides of the fitness industry.
Now, I’m stepping out in faith to open Fit Church in Hampton Roads.
This won’t be just another gym. It will be a Christ-centered fitness community where the Gospel is woven into everything we do—where believers can grow stronger both physically and spiritually, and where our community finds a safe, uplifting environment to pursue health.
What is Fit Church?
Fit Church is more than a gym—it’s a Christ-centered wellness community where faith and fitness come together. Built on biblical principles, Fit Church provides open gym access, classes, and coaching in an uplifting environment filled with Christian music, scripture, and discipleship opportunities. Members experience accountability through regular check-ins, spiritual growth through weekly Bible studies, and empowerment through monthly workshops on health and wellness. With features like functional training, outdoor space, personal coaching, and The Market offering apparel, supplements, and healthy snacks, Fit Church is designed to help people grow strong in body, mind, and spirit—while equipping the Church and community to glorify God through health.
Our Message to Our Members: "Exercise Your Freedom"
Your freedom in Christ to live a God glorifying life
The freedom to move your body in any capacity
The freedom to live out your faith boldly
What Sets Fit Church Apart
Fit Church isn’t just about access to equipment. It’s about accountability, discipleship, and community care.
Here’s what makes us unique:
Member Care:
Every member receives ongoing check-ins (30, 60, 90 days) for accountability and support.
Workshops & Clinics:
Monthly public events led by Christian coaches and guest speakers on topics like food psychology, hormones, supplementation, and building muscle.
Community Engagement:
Hosting and participating in local fitness and health events to serve the wider community.
Uplifting Environment:
Music, messaging, and culture aligned with scripture—encouraging purpose-driven living and biblical health.
Weekly Bible Study:
Accessible to all members and guests.
Saturday Outreach:
Free 9 a.m. community fitness class + guest entry for members to bring friends.
Christ-Centered Atmosphere:
A gym where fitness isn’t idolized, but used to glorify God and strengthen His people.
This is more than a gym—it’s a movement to rebuild health in the Church and community.
Fit Church Features
Christian music
Free weights, cardio, functional training, outdoor training space
Monthly educational workshops
Weekly Bible study
The Market: Temple Strong apparel, supplements, healthy snacks
Open gym: 5:30 AM – 10 PM (Mon–Sat)
Personal training & classes available
Closed on Sundays (so staff can be in church)
Where Funds Will Go
Transparency matters. Here’s how your gift will be used to build Fit Church Gym:
Equipment & Flooring: $30,000–$40,000
Facility improvements (painting, signage, setup): $5,000–$10,000
Insurance & licenses: $4,000
Software & systems: $3,000–$4,000 annually
Marketing & outreach: $3,000–$5,000
Launch fund (buffer for first 3 months): $10,000
Total Goal: ~$70,000
Donor Packages
To thank you for sowing into this vision, we’ve created Founding Partner packages—for both local and online supporters.
Local Supporter Packages
$100-$499 Movement Maker
Discounted membership for life
$500+ Foundation Partner
All above + Name on our Founders Wall inside the gym
1 free month of membership
Fit Church branded T-shirt (at or after the Grand opening)
$1,000+ Community Builder
All above + 3 free personal training sessions or 1 month of unlimited classes
$2,500+ Legacy Lifter
All above + 6-month membership
Recognition on our website as a Founding Sponsor
$5,000+ Pillar Partner
All above + Lifetime membership for you OR transferable family membership
Private thank-you dinner + early preview tour of gym before opening
Online Supporter Packages
$100+ Digital Disciple
Thank-you shoutout on Instagram + your name listed on our Donor Page
$500+ Virtual Builder
All above + 3 months free access to Kingdom Fit Academy online
Copy of Fit Church
$1,000+ Global Partner
All above + Access to an exclusive live Zoom meeting with Matt and other Global Partners
Recognition as a Founding Online Partner
✝️ Join the Mission
This is bigger than me. It’s about creating a place where the Body of Christ grows strong in spirit, mind, and body.
Your gift—whether $50, $500, or $5,000—helps build a gym that will impact lives, families, and churches for generations.
Please consider giving today, sharing this campaign, and most importantly—praying with us as we launch Fit Church Gym.
Together, we can show the world what it looks like to glorify God with our health.
Claiming Your Donor Gifts
If your donation tier includes a shirt, book, or other gift, please complete this form so we can get it to you:
https://forms.gle/eLTtDQMVEcf4pxVs9.

title: Help Keep BLAZE Alive
description:
Hi, my name is JoJo and I’m the proud founder of BLAZE Cycling, Yoga & Fitness in Peoria, AZ.
BLAZE was built on the belief that fitness isn’t just about sweating, it’s about community, connection, and transformation. Since opening our doors, we’ve created a space where people come together to move, heal, grow stronger, and find joy. From high-energy cycling parties to grounding yoga flows, from beginners to seasoned athletes, BLAZE has welcomed everyone.
Unfortunately, a freak accident changed everything. A car hit and ripped off the back door of our building, which led the city to deem our space unsafe until new doors could be installed. We were only opened barely three weeks when this happened. While we’ve worked to keep the spirit of BLAZE alive with pop-up and in-home classes, this setback has taken a huge financial toll. We’ve been struggling to keep up with rent, utilities, and studio expenses while waiting for repairs, and the reality is we need help to keep BLAZE’s doors open.
This fundraiser will go directly toward:
•	Covering rent and utilities while the studio recovers
•	Repair and safety expenses from the accident
•	Keeping BLAZE alive for the members and community that call it home
BLAZE isn’t just a fitness studio, it’s a safe haven. It’s where people discover their strength, find support, and realize they are capable of more than they thought possible. I’ve watched members grow in confidence, crush goals, and even find healing in their bodies and minds. That’s why I believe so deeply that BLAZE matters, and why I’m asking for your help today.
If BLAZE has inspired you, supported you, or simply made you smile, please consider donating or sharing this campaign. Every contribution, no matter the size, makes a difference in helping us keep the fire burning.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for believing in BLAZE and being part of this journey. Together, we can keep the flame alive.
With gratitude and love,
JoJo ❤️

title: Help Save The Brass Owl
description:
Help Save The Brass Owl – A Queens Small Business
My name is Nicole, and I’m the owner of The Brass Owl in Queens, NY. After 14 years in corporate retail, I followed my family’s tradition of small business ownership and opened The Brass Owl in 2014. At the time, Astoria didn’t have many fashion boutiques that catered to our diverse community, and I wanted to create a welcoming, friendly space for everyone.
The Brass Owl has always been more than a shop to me. Over the years, it’s become a hub for local artists, families, and neighbors. We’ve hosted artist pop-ups, co-chair the Destination Ditmars Merchants Association, organized small business crawls, and supported local organizations. For me, it’s always been about more than selling products, it’s about building community.
Unfortunately, like many small businesses, the past 2 years have brought challenges we couldn’t have predicted.
Rent and expenses have increased significantly
Tariffs and shipping delays
And most recently, a big-box retailer opened just around the corner, drastically reducing our foot traffic
Despite these obstacles, we’ve worked hard to keep prices fair and to continue supporting our community. So, we are reaching out to the community we love so much for help to give us a chance to make it 2026.
This fundraiser will help us:
Cover rent and utilities to keep our doors open
Support payroll for our amazing team
Pay local makers and artists whose goods fill our shop
Invest in events and outreach to bring our community back together
Make store improvements to meet our customers’ needs
How You Can Help
1.	Donate what you can - no amount is too small*
2.	Share this page with friends, family, and neighborhood groups to help spread the word.
3.	Shop with us in person or online - every purchase keeps us going.
*And to thank you, bring your GoFundMe receipt in for a free gift (in store only).
I want to be transparent: this fundraiser is truly our hail mary. I can’t guarantee it will solve every challenge, but I do know that without trying and without asking for help from the community we love , The Brass Owl won’t have a fighting chance. Every dollar, every share, and every purchase gives us hope and brings us closer to keeping our doors open.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for standing by us during this difficult time. This neighborhood has given me so much, and I hope with your help, The Brass Owl can continue to give back for many years to come.
❤️,
Nicole & The Brass Owl Team
The Brass Owl Website
Some recent press:
NPR Interview regarding tariffs
My most recent Shopping Crawl
The Halloween Block Party we organized
One of the best things in Astoria by Time Out
Small Business Satruday Coverage

title: WilsonHaus Coffee Relaunch
description:
Hi, I’m Morgan, founder of WilsonHaus Coffee and WilsonHaus Rescue.
A year and a half ago, I started a dream: a philanthropic coffee business that not only served delicious, high-quality (fair trade and organic) coffee but also fueled life-saving animal rescue work.
From the start, WilsonHaus Coffee had a simple mission:
☕ Every bag sold helps fund our animal rescue, WilsonHaus Rescue, which focuses on saving dogs from euthanasia lists and assisting our collaborative partners to pull horses out of the slaughter pipeline.
$1 from every bag is ALSO set aside specifically for spay and neuter clinics in parts of America where stray and street dog populations overwhelm shelters. These clinics are run in partnership with “boots-on-the-ground” rescues who host pop-up events to humanely reduce overpopulation and suffering.
It was working. It was growing. It was changing lives.
⸻
Why We Paused — And Why We’re Ready to Begin Again
Last year, just as we moved into the building for our rescue, my life was turned upside down.
The very day we opened WilsonHaus Rescue’s doors, a personal trauma upended my stability.
I was suddenly navigating a major life change, a move, and the challenge of running a brick and mortar dog rescue.
The funds I had saved to grow WilsonHaus Coffee went toward keeping our rescue afloat and keeping myself going.
I poured all of myself into the rescue. I didn’t think about my own stability. Now, I am choosing to focus on THIS and how to rebuild not only my dream of having this successful business but also give back in bold and beautiful ways.
⸻
Why GoFundMe?
I didn’t want to take on interest-bearing bank loans. I believe in the power of community funding — where people come together to make something beautiful possible without the strings of debt attached.
This started as a grassroots effort on Venmo, but for security and transparency, I’m moving to GoFundMe. Here, you can watch the progress bar climb in real time and see the impact of your contribution.
⸻
How You Can Help
You don’t have to give big to make a big difference.
If 10,000 people give $10, we hit our goal.
Ways you can help:
Donate what you can — $1, $5, $10 all matter.
Share this campaign with friends, family, and social media.
labels: Dog, Carnivores, Snout, Canidae, Graphic design

title: Save Cheese Bliss: Support Dove and James
description:
DON'T CUT THE CHEESE!
Dear friends, neighbors, and community members,
Our beloved Cheese Bliss, nestled in the Whit at the Heritage Whiskey Distillery on Madison and 1st, may have to close up shop in December due to looming repairs on their structure. Dove and James Greenwood, the owners of the establishment, have been serving up hot and tasty grilled cheeses for the local community for 7 years. Offering more than just a standard American on white, their creative and delicious menu offers everything from bagel breakfast sandwiches to pretzel nachos, beer cheese soup, and sammys with blackberry jam and brie. Not only is their food AMAZING, the owners are incredible folks, who always have a kind word or uplifting message sure to put a smile on anyone's face. This establishment has become a staple for the community and we can't imagine a world without the Bliss! Please help us SAVE THE CHEESE and consider donating today! All money raised will be donated to Dove and James to use towards a new truck that will enable them to spread the Bliss to even more people. These folks have done so much for our community. Let's show them the same kindness and generosity right back!
