title: Help Save Riverbend Pizza & Steakhouse – A Community Staple
description:
Hello Keosauqua friends and beyond,
I’m reaching out on behalf of my mom, Lorrie — the heart and soul behind Riverbend Pizza & Steakhouse. Many of you know her for her kind soul, delicious food, and the love she pours into our local community through her restaurant.
Today, she needs our help.
What’s Happening
Riverbend has been a beloved part of Keosauqua for many years. My mom’s dream of owning a restaurant came true when she moved to Iowa in 2018 and she’s been working tirelessly ever since to serve this community.
Recently, she began the process of moving Riverbend to a new location — the former First Street Bar & Grill — with plans to transition slowly after renovations and upgrades were complete. Unfortunately, these needed renovations have taken longer than anticipated, and the current lease is up October 1st.
Now, she’s in a race against time — and money — to keep her dream alive.
️ Why We Need Help
The sudden timeline means everything has had to happen fast:
•	Renovating the new space
•	Purchasing and installing key equipment (like a pizza oven)
•	Covering unexpected moving and construction expenses
•	Keeping Riverbend open and running in the meantime
My mom, her staff, friends, and family have been working around the clock — doing everything they can to stay afloat. But it’s just too much to do alone, and the costs have far exceeded what was originally budgeted.
Looking Ahead
With the Fall Festival coming up — the busiest weekend of the year — there’s real hope. If Riverbend can be up and running by then, it would go a long way toward getting caught up on bills and stabilizing the business again.
How You Can Help
Anyone who knows my mom knows how hard she works and how deeply she cares. She never asks for help, so I’m asking on her behalf:
If Riverbend has ever meant something to you — a meal, a memory, a moment — please consider helping.
Every dollar will go directly toward keeping the doors of Riverbend open, finishing the transition, and ensuring it remains a place of community for years to come.
Ways to Donate
•	GoFundMe – via this page (small processing fee)
•	Direct donation – for 100% of your contribution to go to Riverbend, you can drop off donations at the restaurant or send via PayPal.
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you. We’re so grateful for this community, and I promise my mom will continue giving back in every way she can — just like she always has.
Please feel free to reach out to me personally if you have any questions.
With gratitude,
Kendie Russell (Lorrie’s Daughter)
labels: Ceiling, Restaurant, Light fixture, Varnish, Sign

title: Grow a Place of Beauty and Belonging: Berry Creek Garden
description:
Berry Creek Garden:
A Place of Beauty in an Unexpected Space
Between two industrial warehouses, an overlooked courtyard will be transformed into a place alive with greenery, water, and light. The backdrop of steel and raw wood will frame the real stars: lush plants, artfully weathered pottery, and the gentle trickle of fountains. At the center will stand a greenhouse-like structure built from salvaged wood windows, a striking focal point that ties the space together. Inside, visitors will find quality hand tools, organic soil amendments, heirloom seeds, and a curated selection of garden gifts and goods.
Storytelling will be woven into every corner. Creative signage will share not just plant names, but how they support pollinators, restore habitat, or thrive in Oregon’s climate. We want every visitor to feel they have stepped into a space that is unexpected, unforgettable, and timeless.
—-
Why We’re Ready
Danny
is a Master Gardener whose expertise is rooted in both formal training and hands-on practice. He works full-time as a gardener at the
Allison Inn & Spa Culinary Garden
, where he helps cultivate produce and plants that supply one of the region’s most celebrated hospitality destinations. He maintains a plot at the
McMinnville Community Garden
, where he also pitches in as a volunteer in various ways. His love for the natural world shines in his commitment to starting healthy plants from seed and cuttings and in his belief that gardening should be approachable for everyone.
Lee
brings a career that began in food, hospitality, and event design before expanding into brand building and destination marketing. Early on, Lee worked in the family catering company, gaining experience in fine dining, large-scale event design and small business leadership. Later, as a Marketing Team Leader at Whole Foods Market, Lee honed skills in storytelling, merchandising, and customer engagement that continue to shape his work today.
At
Durant at Red Ridge Farms
, Lee led a comprehensive rebrand that united four distinct businesses into one nationally recognized destination for wine, olive oil, specialty nursery plants, and culinary tourism. Over eight years, he expanded a small two-day olive oil celebration into the Olio Nuevo Festival, a month-long annual event that draws visitors with its focus on local food, wine, and culture. Under his leadership, Durant became a “must-stop” in Oregon wine country, recognized as an industry leader while achieving rapid growth in both visitation and sales.
As Director of Marketing and Communications at
Visit McMinnville
, Lee shapes how the town is seen and experienced by visitors from across the globe. From launching the “Kick Back in Mac” campaign to building a new website, producing hundreds of social campaigns and videos, and leading national media tours, Lee’s work transforms stories into real visitation that drives the local economy. Beyond tourism, Lee has also championed community projects such as McMinnville Art Alley, the Edible Garden Festival, Merry McMinnville, MacFresco, and the Solid Foundations Tour - initiatives that turned overlooked ideas and spaces into thriving experiences for the community.
—-
Why It Matters
Berry Creek Garden
is more than plants on shelves. It is a hub for sustainable gardening, a platform for education, and a respite in the heart of McMinnville’s growing Granary District. By growing much of our own stock in a retrofitted greenhouse at Tainable Labs, we will provide healthy, locally cultivated plants that are not shipped in from hundreds of miles away. By curating native species and teaching practical gardening skills, we will help people create yards and habitats that are as good for the planet as they are beautiful.
Every purchase supports local ecosystems.
Every class makes gardening more accessible.
Every event gathers people around beauty and sustainability.
With your support, Berry Creek Garden will take root and grow into something extraordinary.
—-
What We Need
We are raising
$40,000
to bring Berry Creek Garden to life.
Your support will help fund:
Greenhouse Retrofit at
Tainable Labs
:
Growing Tables built from durable, pressure-treated wood with breathable tops for propagation, potting, and live plant backstock
Growing Supplies, including soil, compost, trays, pots, plugs, tags, and hoses
Pest and Disease Management using beneficial insects, cultural practices, and minimal sprays
Backup Power with a generator to safeguard crops during outages
Compliance and Safety with a security system, alarms, permits, and agricultural compliance
Seeds, Starts, and Spoil that will become our future Inventory
Retail Space Upgrades at
Mac Market
:
Security Fencing and an egress gate for safety and accessibility
20+ yards of Crushed Gravel to level the retail “floor” for accessibility and proper drainage.
Site Renovation by removing old decking, astroturf, and pavers to create a clean foundation
Construction of a Retail House for point-of-sale, display, and back-of-house workspace
Signage and storytelling that share our mission and create a sense of place
Initial Inventory of pottery, tools, garden art, and a curated mix of native and ornamental plants, trees, and shrubs
—-
The Impact
Berry Creek Garden will:
Provide locally grown plants that support healthier ecosystems
Host classes and workshops that make gardening approachable
Inspire sustainable choices that ripple out into the community
Transform an overlooked alley into a destination filled with beauty and connection
This is about more than retail. It is about growing resilience, beauty, and community from the ground up.
—-
Risks and Challenges
Retrofitting a greenhouse and transforming a raw alley into a thriving nursery come with challenges such as construction costs, supply chain delays, and the unpredictability of retail. With our combined backgrounds in marketing, retail, nonprofit leadership, and event production, along with strong community partnerships, we are prepared to adapt and succeed.
—-
Other Ways You Can Help
If donating is not possible, you can still make a difference:
Share our campaign with friends, family, and fellow plant lovers
Shop at Berry Creek Garden when it opens in March 2026!
Together, we can transform a forgotten alley into a thriving community space, rooted in nature and connection.
labels: Berry, Natural foods, Label, Produce, Brambles

title: Help Shaobeny Launch her Private Therapy Practice
description:
Hi, I’m Shaobeny Johnson a Christian Masters level mental health professional (Under the supervision of Judy White Jackson, LCP-A pending) devoted to helping teens, couples, and families heal, grow, and thrive. I’m building a private practice that blends evidence-based therapy (CBT, EFT, trauma-informed care), cultural humility, and faith-affirming support. I’ve been serving my community for years—as an educator, choreographer, and now a therapist—and I’m stepping into private practice to expand access, offer evening availability, and create specialized services for trauma recovery, relationship health, and identity-affirming care.
Why I’m fundraising
Launching a practice takes start-up capital for clinical trainings, licensure/insurance, technology, and outreach marketing so families can actually find me and book. The good news? I can do the work! I just need help covering the runway. Your support accelerates the moment I can say, “Yes, I have sessions available this week.”
What your gift makes possible
(impact)
• Specialized training → higher-quality care for trauma, couples, and family systems
• Ethical, secure technology → private, HIPAA-compliant sessions and records
• Community outreach → workshops for teens, speciality organizations, churches, and local orgs
• Sliding scale slots → reserved spots for clients with financial barriers
Startup budget (transparent + practical)
Advanced clinical trainings & certifications ( I will choose 2–3 to start):
• EMDR introductory training & consults ………………… $1,400–$2,000
• EFT Externship or Gottman Level 1 (couples) ………… $500–$1,200
• Prepare/Enrich or SYMBIS certification (premarital) ………………… $225–$295
Licensure/administrative setup: state fees, background checks, NPI, etc. … $250–$600
Malpractice insurance (annual) ………………………………………… $250–$400
EHR/Telehealth platform (first year) ………………………………… $200–$600
Website, domain, booking tools (DIY + apps) …………………… $150–$400
Marketing & outreach (referral packets, directory fees, prints, QR cards) ……… $250–$600
Initial office setup (deposit/light furnishings if needed) ………… $500–$1,500
Estimated goal: $4,500–$6,500 (I’ll publish a running tracker and receipts so you can see progress in real time.)
Accountability & updates
I’ll post monthly updates: what was funded, trainings completed, community events delivered, and how many low-cost sessions were offered. If you prefer, I’ll also share a simple public dashboard that shows budget → action → impact.
Non-clinical “thank yous” (ethical perks)
-Name on my “Founding Supporters” page/wall (with your permission)
-Quarterly community workshop (free to the public) on topics like stress, burnout, boundaries, or teen mental health
-Digital mini-guide: “Grounding Skills You Can Use Today” for all donors
-Sponsor shout-out for businesses/organizations at workshops and on my site
Call to action
If you’ve ever believed in my heart, my work, or the communities I serve, please give what you can and share this with three friends. Every dollar moves this from vision to visits. Thank you for helping me open the doors.

title: Save Travelers Inn Motel
description:
Help the Bryant Family Save Travelers Inn Motel
For over 30 years, the Travelers Inn Motel has been more than just a place to stay—it’s been a home away from home, run with heart, grit, and hospitality by the Bryant family.
Nestled along a quiet stretch of highway, the Travelers Inn has welcomed road-trippers, truck drivers, families, and folks just needing a place to rest their heads. Many of our guests come back year after year—not just because of the comfy rooms, but because of the people behind the desk: the Bryants.
This past year, though, has been the hardest the family has ever faced.
Between unexpected storm damage, rising repair costs, and fewer travelers coming through town, the Bryants have been stretched thin trying to keep the doors open. They’ve used every bit of savings to patch the roof, fix plumbing issues, and keep the lights on—but it’s not enough.
Now, they’re humbly asking for help.
What We’re Raising Money For:
Critical roof repairs before the next rainy season
Room updates (beds, flooring, paint) to meet modern standards
New signage and exterior lighting to help travelers find the motel safely at night
Basic operating costs (utilities, supplies) to stay open through the winter
The goal isn’t to become a luxury resort—it’s to keep a piece of small-town America alive. Travelers Inn is one of the few remaining family-owned motels in the area. It's a place where the coffee is always on, the owners remember your name, and you leave feeling like family.
labels: Sign, Motel, Siding, Inn

title: 30 Mile Dog Walk for American Cancer Society
description:
Bruno and I are walking 30 miles to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer. In a time of unprecedented funding cuts, I want to do my part to support research & science. I also want to honor my grandparents and my great aunt who all died from cancer.
Many of you got to know my beloved Gramps who died 10 years ago from glioblastoma, a terribly aggressive form of brain cancer. He was my hero, and although his death left a hole in my heart that will never go away, he also left behind a legacy of service and commitment to community. I think he would approve of this.
Thank you for your support!

title: Building Trust in African Real Estate – Join the Journey
description:
Dear Friends and Family,
I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to take a moment to share something deeply personal and important to me: the journey of Shugaland, a dream I’ve been building that is now becoming a reality.
When we launched Shugaland, our vision was simple but powerful: to create a trusted, transparent, and data-first real estate experience for Nigeria and Africa. Buying property has long been riddled with uncertainty, fraud, and inefficiencies. We believe it shouldn’t be that way. Everyone deserves peace of mind when making one of the biggest financial decisions of their lives.
Our Journey So Far
•	From our initial launch, we’ve seen strong product adoption, connecting early users with verified agents and developers.
•	We’ve had the privilege of guiding customers through safer, more transparent real estate transactions.
•	We’ve already onboarded trusted partners and begun to see the spark of what a data-driven ecosystem can do for buyers, sellers, and diaspora investors alike.
About the Founders
For those who may not know the founders have extensive professional experience and they’ve spent over a decade working as a technology architects, product managers and executives, helping companies solve complex digital challenges. But Shugaland is more than just a business for them—it’s a mission to solve a real pain point in our society and to build something that will last for generations.
Our Roadmap Ahead
We are just getting started. In the coming months, Shugaland will:
•	Expand our CRM and KYC technology to make every transaction more secure.
•	Build analytics and insights tools to empower customers and agents with real data.
•	Strengthen our marketing reach, so more people—both at home and abroad—can find trustworthy real estate opportunities.
•	Continue building a community of verified agents and partners, ensuring quality and safety across every touchpoint.
Why This Matters to Us
We’re passionate about this because real estate isn’t just about buildings—it’s about trust, safety, and opportunity. Nigeria and Africa are entering a new era where data and transparency will define the winners. We want Shugaland to be at the forefront of that transformation.
How We’ll Use the Funds
The support we’re seeking from close friends and family will go directly into:
•	Improving our technology platform, scaling its reliability, and adding more data intelligence.
•	Expanding our marketing efforts, so we can reach more buyers, sellers, and diaspora investors who need trusted solutions.
This is a heartfelt invitation to join us on this journey—not just as supporters, but as partners in creating a new future for real estate in Africa.
With gratitude,
Mannie Ijeh & Igho Mukoro
Founders, Shugaland

title: Help Lake Superior Pottery finish their studio!
description:
Help me finish my studio!
Please share!
My name is Jonathan Walburg of Lake Superior Pottery. With over 20 years of experience in the field,
my life dream is to finish building my home studio!
Please help create a space where people can see how things are made, create future apprenticeship opportunities, provide community workshops, and become an attraction/destination in our area adding to our small town’s arts culture and economy.
I apprenticed at St. John’s Pottery (MN), studied in Japan and Korea, and would love the opportunity to share the knowledge gained from these unique experiences.
I have rented in a shared studio space for years but need my own space for these opportunities to grow.
The studio structure and foundation are complete, windows are purchased, with electric/gas meters being installed this fall.
What still needs to happen? Metal siding, doors, interior electrical, insulation, drywall, and exterior grading.
Please help my life-long dream materialize to the next stage of growth and opportunity.
One month fundraiser! Ends October 31st, 2025.

title: Help Me Go From Burn Survivor to Small-Business Owner
description:
On the eve of Thanksgiving, November 23rd, 2023, a fire started in my home. The cause of the fire was never determined. The fallout was massive - literally every possession I owned - including the clothes I was wearing at the time - were consumed. The damage was not limited to material items - I was also injured (thankfully, I was the only person to sustain physical injuries). Shortly after the firefighters arrived on the scene, I was taken by ambulance to Frye Regional Medical Center, and then flown, in short order, by helicopter to the Wake Forest Baptist Burn Center/Intensive Care Unit. I spent the next 30 days in that unit, and underwent more surgical procedures than I care to recall. I was put on a ventilator for two weeks because I could not breathe on my own due to smoke inhalation; my thumb and index finger were amputated from my dominant hand because their bones had been burned through; multiple, large skin grafts were required to treat the third degree burns that covered my left side, arm, hand, and head. Thanks to God and to the amazing medical care I received, I was able to escape with my life. It could have been so much worse.
The rehabilitation process has been long and challenging. The surgical procedures did not stop after I left the hospital. I think that I have been operated on something like two dozen times now, and there have been complications, infections, accidents, setbacks, and of course financial impossibilities. And I count myself incredibly lucky. I am not a victim but a survivor.
In the months following the accident, I gave serious consideration to starting a GoFundMe campaign to raise money to pay for my medical bills. Ultimately I decided against it. That responsibility is mine.
When my insurance company declined to pay for a prosthetic thumb (I wasn’t even going to risk asking for an index finger), I again thought about a GoFundMe campaign. Again, I decided against it. I am resilient enough and innovative enough to make my way in this world with eight fingers or with ten.
To the point (and God bless you if you are still reading): Since the fire, I have tried, and tried, and tried to find steady, rewarding employment. I attempted to return to the small landscaping business that I had started before the accident, but ultimately found it untenable. I am currently working with vocational rehab to find a position where I can use my BA in English or my MS in Addiction Studies - or both. I have high hopes, but no guarantees. And the interim between being accepted into the program and actually securing a job is at the very least a months-long process. Meanwhile, I have zero income. And the medical bills are accruing, the interest rates on my school loans compounding. The worst part is the guilt I feel for leaning on my wonderful, amazing, unbelievable family for help (especially given the limitations of their resources), and the sense of worthlessness I wrestle with without the direction, purpose, and esteem that meaningful employment can provide.
But I have an idea. I am a collector. And I have a talent for researching, finding, and procuring rare, antique, and scarce items at below market cost. I already buy and sell on eBay, but the cost of doing business via that format eliminates much of the potential profit. Since the fire, I have also taught myself to draw, paint, and create assemblage art - using my (non-dominant) right hand. In addition, I have been teaching myself the craft of matting and framing artwork. I also have a wealth of experience in collecting rare, unusual, and first-edition books (I had a library with more than 1,000 volumes before the fire - none survived).
What I am proposing, the endeavor for which I am asking for your help, is to rent a space at a suitable venue (probably an upscale antique mall) at which I would sell fine art (of which I already have some inventory), first edition and antiquarian books, antique and collectible magazines and paper ephemera, my original artwork, classic cameras and typewriters, and other vintage, midcentury modern, and antique items. Most of what I will sell will be from the Art Deco, Art Nouveau, and Midcentury Modern genres.
The money I am trying to raise will pay for startup costs (booth rental, signage, business cards, display tables and cases, picture frames and matting, etc., etc.); to purchase further inventory for resale; to produce lithographs of my original art; and to take a course in how to frame and present artwork professionally. This list is by no means exhaustive - but these are some of the major expenses that I am looking at to get started.
This idea is not something I cooked up overnight. My research shows that the items I have in my inventory already are among the most popular for sale in an antique-mall setting. The notion may strike some as silly, but to me, this project is about a lot more than a job. This is my dream. Nothing grandiose or elaborate, but something honest, and plausible, and meaningful, and humble. This arena fascinates me not for the prospect of making a buck buying and selling dead people’s stuff, but because of the journey in going from discovering an item to acquiring it. I have the chance to protect, preserve, and curate history - and that is what motivates me. I possess the intellect, the ambition, the drive, the ethic, and the determination to succeed. I simply lack the resources. I am about to turn 47, and this is probably the best, and only, shot that I will have at making my dream a reality. I just need a venue and an opportunity.
Thank you, sincerely, for taking the time to read this little proposal. I am more than happy to answer any questions, to provide any information, and to discuss any concerns you may have. And I want to be transparent. I will happily document how your contribution, should you elect to contribute, is spent. Remember that proverb about how you can give a person a fish and feed them for a day, or you can teach a person to fish and feed them for a lifetime? I'm not asking for your fish; I am asking for your help to learn how to fish. Thank you again, and God bless.

title: Nourishing Skin & Community: My Journey to Holistic Skincare
description:
In 2018, I met the esthetician who transformed not just my skin, but my entire perspective. Her skilled hands unlocked a newfound confidence and sparked a dream within me. As she worked her magic, a weight lifted off my shoulders, and I saw myself in a new light. That moment ignited a passion that only grew stronger with time. I knew I wanted to help others feel as empowered and cared for as I did in that moment.
That spark led me to pursue my esthetician training, which I completed in 2023. I immediately put my new skills into practice and was fortunate enough to continue learning alongside that same exceptional esthetician. Since then, I've dedicated myself to mastering the art of holistic skincare, harnessing the power of plants to heal and nurture my clients. Every session is a pleasure, as I strive to provide the highest standard of care and comfort. The trust my guests place in me is sacred, and it's what aligns me with my values and fuels my passion for this career.
Now, I'm ready to take the next step in my journey, building on the foundation I've established and continuing to grow as a professional. With a strong sense of purpose and a commitment to exceptional care, I'm excited to see where this path takes me.
A New Chapter Unfolds
I'm opening my own holistic skincare studio and I'm turning to this community for support! I'm seeking $15,000 to launch my practice, where I'll offer natural, personalized services that make a real difference. Your contribution will help bring my vision to life and create a space that reflects my passion for skincare, wellness, and community.
My Dream
To provide personalized skincare practices that nurture your unique skin, offer accessible solutions that cater to your needs, and foster a supportive community that encourages self-love, body positivity, and overall wellness.
Your support will help me:
- Develop tailored skincare routines and products that address your specific skin concerns
- Offer adaptable skincare solutions that fit your lifestyle and needs
- Create a safe space for individuals to connect, share, and grow
How funds will be used:
- Licensing and Continued Education
- Business Setup
- Equipment and Supplies
- Marketing and Outreach
- Operational Costs
Your Impact
I believe in the transformative power of holistic skincare, and I'm committed to sharing that magic with those who've yet to experience it. I'm passionate about creating a safe, nurturing space where everyone feels seen, heard, and cared for. By supporting my studio, you're helping me bring this vision to life and make a meaningful difference in the lives of those who need it most.
labels: Smile, Eyebrow, Lips, Happiness, Hairstyle

title: Help us rebuild Adams Jewelry after devastating Robbery
description:
On September 7th, 2025, our world was turned upside down. Our family’s jewelry business, built with years of sacrifice, love, and dedication was robbed. Thieves broke into our safe and took everything: our entire life savings, precious inventory, and the future we had worked so hard to build.
This wasn’t just a business; it was our dream and our family’s foundation. Every late night, every extra hour, every piece of jewelry we carefully crafted or sourced was a piece of us. Now, we’re left heartbroken, struggling to pick up the pieces, and unsure how to move forward.
We also want to share that our store was protected with state-of-the-art security systems — including high-tech alarms, backup batteries, multiple layers of security cameras, and motion detectors. Unfortunately, this burglary was a highly planned and sophisticated attack.
We are asking for help to recover and rebuild. Any contribution, no matter how small, will help us replace what we lost and keep our family’s dream alive. If you cannot donate, simply sharing our story means so much.
With love and gratitude,
The Adams Family

title: Help Matt Opena Rebuild His Film Production Gear
description:
Hi everyone,
My name is Matt Opena, and I'm a full-time freelance cinematographer & DP.
On Saturday, September 13th, my car was broken into in Arts District, LA…
and all of my essential film equipment was stolen.
I lost not only tens of thousands of dollars in gear, but also the tools I rely on to support myself, fulfill current projects, and continue building my career.
For those who know me personally, this isn’t easy to share. As someone who prides himself on being resourceful and self-sufficient, asking for help is and has always been incredibly difficult for me. However, through the warmth and care of my friends and family, I have come to see that asking for help in times like this is more than understandable.
What I Lost:
3x cameras (Nikon z9 fully rigged cinema camera // Nikon z6 B cam rig // Fujifilm x-t4)
1x go pro hero 12 action camera with accessories
All of my lenses (5 lenses total: 2x 24-70mm 2.8 // 70-200mm 2.8 // 23mm 1.4 // 105mm 1.4)
All of my support gear (LiDAR, grip, rig parts, and rigging equipment)
All of my audio recording equipment
All 9 of my external hard drives with work since I started (this one hurts the most)
My new laptop (I just upgraded like 2 months ago )
A pair of AirPod Max
My backpack and Pelican case
There’s more, but that’s the more important stuff. The financial hit is overwhelming, and insurance won’t come close to covering the full extent of the loss, but the biggest hit is something I can’t replace, which is all the past memories and projects I had on those drives. It’s been a really painful and disheartening couple of days, to say the least… But hopefully, with enough donations, I can get right back to making new memories once again.
I have clients counting on me, projects in progress, and a career that depends on having the right tools.
Every dollar raised will go directly toward replacing essential equipment so I can get back to doing what I love — telling visual stories that matter. For those who know me personally, you know I live and breathe this career and all it encompasses. I’ve been blessed to live and experience the many beauties life has to offer through this career and am eagerly trying reset and start again.
Whether you’re able to donate or just share this campaign, every bit helps more than you know. Thank you for taking the time to read this, support me, and lift me back up during this incredibly difficult time. If you want to donate but not through GoFundMe, you can zelle through the QR code I have in the photos. Thank you so much.
Peace, Love, n all the above-
Matto :)
https://www.instagram.com/mattopena285/?hl=en
labels: Active Shirt, Selfie, Mobile phone, Crew cut, High and tight

title: Help Support Curtain Call Performing Arts in Santa Clarita
description:
Help Support Curtain Call Performing Arts in Santa Clarita
Story:
Curtain Call Performing Arts has been a beloved part of our theatre community for seven years
, serving as a vital resource for aspiring performers of all ages. From voice, dance, and acting classes to piano lessons and studio rentals for rehearsals, David and Danielle Goro have dedicated themselves to nurturing talent and keeping the arts alive in our community.
As many of us know, the entertainment business is tough. For years, Curtain Call has kept afloat by offering these classes and renting their studio, but they've never shied away from dreaming big. Many, including myself, have encouraged them to stage their own productions—a vision that, while exciting, is also costly.
The time has come to help them realize that dream.
Through the generosity of those who can, we hope to support David and Danielle in maintaining and expanding their beautiful endeavor, ensuring Curtain Call continues to inspire, educate, and entertain for many more years to come.
Your donation, no matter the size, will help make this dream possible. Thank you for considering supporting Curtain Call Performing Arts and for helping keep the arts vibrant in our community.
[Paul Reid]
Host, Curtain Call Performing Arts Fundraiser

title: Support Pieces of Heaven in Carmel
description:
Our beloved neighbors at Pieces of Heaven have been a part of the Barnyard for over 35 years, bringing joy to our community with their ice cream, treats, and kindness. Sadly, they are now facing some very difficult times.
Just this week, they suffered a sudden and unexpected loss of over $1,000 worth of ice cream when their freezer stopped working overnight. This comes on top of heavy personal challenges. Peggy, the owner, is dealing with serious health concerns and ongoing oncology visits, while also caring for her husband, who is 85 and experiencing declining health.
Despite their resilience, the weight of these challenges has been overwhelming. They have even considered taking out a loan on their home just to keep going, which is a huge and stressful step at their age.
We are hoping to raise funds not just to cover the loss of product, but also to help Peggy and her husband hire some help. This would allow Peggy to attend her treatments without worrying about the shop, giving them some much-needed peace of mind.
If you have ever enjoyed a delicious handmade chocolate or a scoop of ice cream from Pieces of Heaven, or if you simply want to support a local family who has given so much to our community, please consider donating. Every contribution, no matter the size, will make a difference.
Thank you for taking the time to read!
XO
Jackie

title: Help Build Rebels Academy of Dance
description:
Help Us Build Our Dream Dance Studio – Rebels Academy of Dance
Hi everyone,
We’re Madison Zajicek and Sarah Brassow, two sisters with one big dream — to build a dance studio that empowers, inspires, and supports every student who walks through our doors. After over 20 years of dancing competitively and teaching the art we love, we are finally making our dream come true — Rebels Academy of Dance is under construction!
But as exciting as this journey is, it's also incredibly expensive. From flooring and mirrors to sound systems and safety equipment — every detail matters when creating a space where dancers can grow and thrive. That’s why we’re reaching out to our community, family, friends, and supporters for help.
Why We’re Doing This:
Dance has shaped who we are. It taught us discipline, confidence, creativity, and resilience. We've poured our hearts into teaching because we know how powerful dance can be — not just for physical development, but for emotional and mental growth, too.
Rebels Academy of Dance isn’t just a studio. It’s a place where young dancers will find strength in themselves, feel safe to express who they are, and build lifelong friendships. We want to create a home for our students — a place filled with energy, love, encouragement, and of course, a little sparkle.
How You Can Help:
Every dollar we raise will go directly toward building our studio:
Specialized dance flooring to protect our dancers’ bodies
Mirrors and barres for technique training
Sound and lighting equipment for performances and recitals
Costumes, props, and materials to make every season unforgettable
And so much more behind the scenes…
Whether you can donate $5 or $500, every bit makes a difference. Even just sharing
our story helps!
We’ve already come so far, and we won’t give up on this dream. With your help, we can build a place that inspires the next generation of dancers to be bold, fearless, and true to themselves — to be rebels in the best way.
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for supporting us and believing in the future of Rebels Academy of Dance.
With love and gratitude,
Madison Zajicek & Sarah Brassow
Co-Founders, Rebels Academy of Dance

title: Support Local Music Shop After Theft
description:
We are a small veteran-owned business that offers music lessons, repairs and sales to the Gig Harbor community.
We recently fell victim to a scammer and thief who purchased two expensive American-made instruments using stolen credit cards.
This sort of scam is so common that it is not covered by business insurance.
Both of these instruments belonged to local folks that put these instruments up on consignment and we are obligated to do our best to compensate them for our collective loss.
This crime could not have occurred at a worse time given the chaos of our economy and the ever-growing dominance of big business.
We are humbly asking the community for assistance and we only wish for an amount that will ensure the owners are fairly compensated.
labels: Font, Logo, Advertising, Sign, Graphics

title: HJ Experience More Than Just Dance
description:
ENGLISH VERSION
Dear friends, family, and our amazing community,
HJ Experience was born from a shared vision between two passionate creatives who believe in the power of movement, celebration, and connection. After years of hosting dance classes, wellness sessions, and vibrant events in other people’s spaces, we’re finally creating our own.
We are in the process of securing a location in Houston and officially building HJ Experience—a vibrant, inclusive hub for dance, fitness, events, coffee, natural juices, and small business vendors… all under one roof.
Whether you come to dance, sweat, sip a smoothie, launch your brand, or celebrate your birthday, this space is for YOU.
But dreams need action—and support. That’s where you come in.
We’re launching this campaign to help cover:
Studio buildout (mirrors, lighting, sound, etc)
Equipment for fitness & classes
Operational startup costs.
HJ Experience will be a bilingual space (English & Español)
We want everyone to feel welcome and represented. Classes, signage, events, and energy—fully bilingual and fully inclusive.
Whether you donate, share, or simply send your good vibes—thank you.
You’re not just funding a studio, you’re helping us build a home for joy, movement, and culture.
With love and gratitude,
Héctor & Jair
Founders of HJ Experience
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL
Queridos amigos, familia y comunidad,
HJ Experience nació de la visión compartida de dos creativos apasionados que creen en el poder del movimiento, la celebración y la conexión. Después de años impartiendo clases y organizando eventos en espacios, por fin estamos construyendo el nuestro.
Estamos en proceso de crear HJ Experience, un centro vibrante e inclusivo con clases de baile, fitness, eventos, café, jugos naturales y micro-negocios… todo bajo un mismo techo.
Ya sea que vengas a bailar, entrenar, tomarte un jugo, lanzar tu negocio o celebrar tu cumpleaños, este espacio será para TI.
Pero para hacerlo realidad, necesitamos tu apoyo.
Tu contribución nos ayudará a cubrir:
Remodelación del estudio (espejos, sonido, iluminación, etc)
Equipos para clases y entrenamiento
Gastos iniciales de operación
HJ Experience será un espacio bilingüe (Español & English)
Queremos que todos se sientan bienvenidos y representados. Clases, eventos, señalización y energía — todo en dos idiomas.
Ya sea que puedas donar, compartir o simplemente mandarnos buena vibra… gracias.
No solo estás ayudando a construir un estudio, estás apoyando un hogar para la alegría, el movimiento y la cultura.
Con cariño y gratitud,
Héctor & Jair
Fundadores de HJ Experience

title: Help Jasmin Upgrade Artisan Pizza Cafe
description:
Hello everyone. My name is Jasmin. I am the owner of Artisan Pizza Cafe. First, I want to say thank you to Dave Portnoy! He noticed my pizza was very good, even though I was only open for two months.
I also want to say a “Big” thank you to my customers. If it wasn’t for them, I wouldn’t be here right now.
The reason for this request for money is because
my lower oven deck stopped working on me two days ago.
Em Bakery Equipment
is the name of the company I bought from. It’s an Italian company. My oven is new. I don’t know why I am already having problems with it.
I am trying to buy a larger oven also, and a new freezer.
My space is cozy, “small,” so I have to find equipment that’s specific to my needs. It also must be only electric, and energy save.
My restaurant started going viral in my second week of operation, when Step Out Columbus first noticed me. They are also wonderful.
If anyone can help, even a small amount, it would be very appreciated.
Thank you

title: Support As the Page Turns' Move to a New Home
description:
Help Our Indie Bookstore Stay in Travelers Rest!
Hello friends, neighbors, and book lovers near and far, We’re reaching out with hopeful hearts and a bit of vulnerability to ask for your support as we face an unexpected and significant challenge. Our independent bookstore has been part of the Travelers Rest community for 17 wonderful years, and for the past 5, we've been lucky to call Main Street our home. We've weathered many storms over the years, and through it all, our mission has remained the same: to bring people together through the joy of books, ideas, and connection.
The Situation: Our lease is set to end at the end of the year, and is set to double in cost per month. This is not financially viable for us. We've found a new, more affordable space in town, which we’re excited about — but there's a catch: this space is available starting October 1, 2025, which means we’d need to break our lease three months early. Unfortunately, breaking our lease early is not an option, we are still fully responsible for rent, utilities, and maintenance through December 31, even if we vacate. This puts us in a difficult position: we cannot afford to pay rent on two spaces, and we don’t want to lose our chance to stay in this town that is our home.
What We’re Asking: We’re humbly asking for help from our community to raise $15,000 to assist with:
Paying off the remaining lease amount and utilities for the final 3 months of 2025
Covering the costs of moving our inventory, fixtures, and shelving
Making essential improvements to the new space so we can reopen smoothly and keep serving the community
Every dollar brings us closer to continuing the story of this little bookstore in the heart of Travelers Rest. If you’ve ever browsed our shelves, come to an event, shared a book recommendation, or just believe in the magic of independent bookstores, we’d be so grateful for your support. Whether you can give $5 or $500, or just share this with others, it all means the world to us.
With deep gratitude and bookish love,
Amy
Owner, As the Page Turns
labels: Font, Book, Handwriting, Publication

title: JOIN THE MAKING OF LETHAL DUST BY BRYSCIA DOSAL
description:
My name is Bryscia Dosal. I’m 30 years old and based in Phoenix, Arizona. Over the last two years I studied acting in Los Angeles, but along the way I discovered something deeper  a passion for creating. Through acting and YouTube, I realized I was a visionary at heart. Storytelling just made more sense to me, especially because I’ve lived through experiences that fuel my creativity and allow me to express myself authentically. That passion led me to film school, which I completed two months ago, and now I’m ready to bring my very first film to life.
I care deeply about this film because it’s a story I’ve carried in my mind and heart, and now I need to bring it out into the world. I have a strong vision for Lethal Dust, and parts of it are rooted in true experiences that shaped me. Directing gives me a place where I feel completely aligned like I’m exactly where I’m supposed to be. For much of my life I often felt misunderstood, but in this realm of storytelling I feel at home. This film is also a way to show people what’s inside my mind, to reveal the depth of my creativity, and to introduce a new side of myself.
I’m raising funds because I want the production value of Lethal Dust to be as high as possible. This story deserves more than a simple backyard film it deserves to look cinematic, polished, and elevated. To fully portray the vision I have in mind, I need the resources to bring every detail to life  from the desert landscapes and costumes to the equipment and post production that will make the film shine on screen.
Thank you for taking the time to learn about my journey and this film. By supporting this campaign, you’re not only helping bring Lethal Dust to life, but also believing in an independent filmmaker. With your help, we can create something truly cinematic, bold, and unforgettable. Thank you so much for being a part of the journey.

title: Help Maddie Jo's BBQ Recover from Flood
description:
Maddie Jo’s BBQ, our favorite local BBQ place, is in need of our help!
Last week, they got flooded out and their landlord didn’t have flood insurance, so it has put Maddie Jo’s in a tough spot!
We would love to help them get back on their feet and fix their restaurant so they can open up again.
Phillip and Kristina are the nicest people ever and we would love to show them our love!
Please help donate to their cause! Thanks so much!!!
labels: Suidae, Domestic pig, Snout, Logo, Meat

title: P Town Bar Needs Your Help to Survive
description:
Help Save P Town Bar – Hit with Excessive Fines
Dear friends, family, and supporters of P Town,
We’re reaching out with heavy hearts and hopeful spirits. On Friday May 2nd 2025, we were the target of an unannounced inspection by approximately 20 Pennsylvania State Police officers and undercover agents in the middle of a show featuring the legendary Amanda Lepore that resulted in excessive fines and fees. This has placed an overwhelming financial burden on our small, community-driven bar, threatening our ability to keep our doors open.
For over 18 years, P Town has been more than just a bar. It’s been a place where people from all walks of life could gather, celebrate, feel safe, and be seen. We’ve hosted drag shows, benefits, birthdays, pride events, karaoke nights, and countless unforgettable memories. Our mission has always been to serve the community—not just drinks, but love, laughter, and a place to belong.
Now, we need your help.
The fines levied against us are beyond what any small business could endure alone. We believe the resulting penalties were disproportionate, and we’re working to resolve these amounts. But we can’t do it without you.
Your donation will go directly toward:
Paying down the +$60K in state-imposed fines
Assisting with over +$20K in mandatory property renovations. (Some of which have already been completed)
Assisting in legal fees needed to appeal for a reduction in fines.
Keeping P Town open for the community for the foreseeable future.
Every dollar helps. Every share spreads the word. If you’ve ever danced, laughed, or felt welcomed at P Town, we ask you to stand with us now.
Let’s show them that our community is stronger than fear, stronger than injustice, and that we will not be silenced.
With love and gratitude,
The P Town Bar Team
GoFundMe.com/PTownBar
#SavePTown #StandWithPTown #CommunityStrong #QueerSafeSpaces #LGBTQIA
labels: Logo, Electronic signage, Sign

title: Cycle 300 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
What's up, everyone? I'm cycling 300 miles to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer. I recently had a cancer scare when my yearly PSA test spiked. My doctor advised a biopsy, and two of the samples were worrisome. I learned that Gleason scores are complicated as hell. Long story short. An MRI revealed there was little to worry about at the moment, so I'm doing active surveillance. Nonetheless, cancer is widespread in my family tree, and I'd like to help in any way possible. So I'll be jumping on my bike in October to get these 300 miles in. Please consider donating because every little bit helps. Thank you for your support!
VTD

title: Help Rebuild More Than Sweets Cafe After the Fire
description:
Last night, More Than Sweets Cafe suffered a fire that damaged our business. We’re beyond grateful no one was hurt, but the cleanup, repairs, and lost income will be a heavy burden for our small family business.
This cafe is more than a place to eat — it’s a home for our community, built with love and hard work. We’re asking for your support to help us rebuild and reopen our doors.
Every donation, big or small, helps us move forward and bring back the sweetness Waynesboro has come to know and love.
Thank you for your kindness, prayers, and generosity. We can’t wait to welcome you back soon!

title: Help Mobile Shine 903 Roll Again!
description:
Hi, I'm Kameron Boykins. We’re Mobile Shine 903 — your local East Texas mobile detailing crew. For years, we’ve been bringing the shine straight to your driveway: from Deluxe Details to our full Presidential Detail, plus subscriptions that keep your ride spotless week after week.
We’re proud to be a family-owned, local business serving Longview and surrounding areas — keeping cars, trucks, and even fleets looking their best. You may have seen our trailer out around town… until recently.
The Setback
This past week, our trailer — the backbone of our operation — suffered major wheel and axle damage.
The hub and brake assembly completely broke down, causing structural damage to our trailer and leaving the wheel unusable. Currently, the trailer is unsafe to move.
See the photos of the damage below — this is what we’re dealing with.
Without a working trailer, we can’t transport our tanks, supplies, or detailing equipment to customers. It puts a full stop on our ability to detail for our customers around East Texas.
Why We’re Asking for Help
We’ve already shouldered a lot of unexpected costs out of pocket these past few weeks, but
this one is too big.
The cost of replacing the trailer is around $13,000. We are also looking into every solution to get our rig back up and going.
Your support will:
Cover a new trailer purchase so we can get back to serving clients
Make sure we’re safe and reliable on the road
Keep Mobile Shine 903 alive as a local, family-owned business
Our Promise
We’ll continue doing what we love: delivering high-quality, mobile detailing with care and hustle. Your donation isn’t just helping us fix a trailer — it’s keeping a small business alive and rolling.
How You Can Help
Donate – Any amount, even $10, makes a difference.
Share – Post this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, or text it to a friend.
Book Ahead – Once we’re rolling again, we’ll offer campaign supporters early scheduling and special perks.
Closing
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for reading and supporting us. With your help, we’ll get back on the road and keep bringing the shine across East Texas.
Let’s keep Mobile Shine 903 rolling strong! ✨
The Mobile Shine 903
Longview, TX
facebook.com/mobileshine903
labels: Red, Pink, Graphic design

title: Please Help Support Mottzarellas
description:
Hello friends! I am reaching out to all of our amazing members of this beautiful community in Granite Quarry and all surrounding friends who know and LOVE this family owned small business located in Granite Quarry, NC.
The Motts family started their journey in the food business and love for Buffalo style food and the Buffalo Bills on a food truck. The food truck business was so welcomed in the area that they decided to do a brick and mortar! As a member of this community, I can’t say how much we appreciate their delicious food and dedication to the community!
Unfortunately, this small business located in Brinkley Center has had issues with the old building and has had to pay all repairs out of their own pockets. This has caused them to be closed multiple times. Not to mention the repairs they had to pocket to get this beloved restaurant started.
I am reaching out to our great community to help this sweet family get necessary repairs done on an exhaust fan in their kitchen and help with lost sales, as the weekends are their busiest days. This sweet family depends on their business for income. Please help if you can!!! Every little bit helps!!

title: Help Shana Young Launch Her Dream Food Truck
description:
Hi, my name is Shana Young. Cooking has been my passion for over 20 years. It’s more than just food to me — it’s love, creativity, and soul on a plate.
For years, I’ve been selling plates out of the trunk of my car, sharing meals with my community and watching people light up with joy after tasting my cooking. Every dish I make comes from the heart, seasoned with love and created with soul in mind.
Now, I’m ready to take the next step. My dream is to open a food truck — a place where I can finally showcase my talent, share my unique and creative dishes with more people, and continue spreading love through food. This food truck would allow me to grow, serve more customers, and finally build something sustainable after years of grinding and hustling.
I’m asking for your help to make this dream a reality. Your support will go toward:
•	Purchasing a reliable food truck
•	Equipping it with the tools and appliances needed
•	Covering licenses and startup costs
No donation is too small — every single blessing gets me closer to turning this dream into a reality. If you can’t donate, sharing this page means the world to me too.
Thank you for believing in me, my vision, and my food. With your support, I can continue cooking from the heart with Soul in Mind

title: equaliTEA startup costs support fund
description:
What's Brewing?
Hello friends, I’m so excited to finally share something that’s been steeping in my heart for a long time.
This autumn, I’m launching , a small queer-owned tea business based in Durham, NC. equaliTEA will be a locally run stand offering hot and cold tea by the cup and high-quality loose-leaf teas to take home. With time (and a little help), I hope to grow into online sales (one of my goals is a tea subscription box for Durham)  and fun, community-driven merchandise that will feature local artists.
At its core, equaliTEA is about offering delicious high quality tea for an affordable price. Durham has lacked a dedicated tea shop for a long time, and I want to change that and give Durham a place for tea lovers to gather and enjoy. I truly love tea from the bottom of my heart, and I want nothing more than to share this love with the people of Durham.
Starting a small business from the ground up is both exciting and a little daunting, but I’ve been planning carefully to keep my startup costs low and sustainable. With your support, I can bring equaliTEA to life and start serving the community I love. Don't worry, I made sure the costs weren't too steep!
Where Your Support Goes
I’m keeping initial costs under $3,000, and your contributions will help cover:
Electric kettles
Tables and display setup
Sales system (like a Square reader and tablet)
Permits and licensing fees
Branding (logo, signs, printed materials)
Initial tea inventory
Portable power supply
cups, napkins, infusers, and other supplies
Every dollar raised will go directly into building a strong foundation for equaliTEA, one cup, one customer, one connection at a time.
Let’s Make Something Special
This business means so much to me , not just as a personal dream, but as a way to give something back to the community that has always inspired me. With your help, I can turn equaliTEA from an idea into a cozy little reality, and I’d be so honored to have you along for the journey.
Thank you for reading, sharing, and supporting. I can’t wait to serve you a cup.

title: Greendoor needs a boost
description:
We could use a little help from our friends.
During COVID, many of you know we were forced to close for almost two years.
Many of you offered us some monetary help at that time. Humbly we said, thank you and we are ok for now, but if and when we need help, we will reach out. Well, here we are. Thankfully, we made it through that crazy time. Lost my parents to it though. Then last year, we were down for months dealing with water well issues caused by all the rain and flooding. At that time, Spring Creek eroded away the berm that kept all that water at bay and found a new path to travel right across this property.
This year, with all the rain and standing water, we had to close again for two and a half months. Even after all this downtime, and God willing, we are still here. And we know those bills still come every month.
I know we are all feeling the crunch of the cost of foods and supplies. Today, we are at a pivotal moment. Do we just let the Greendoor continue to go underwater like this, causing further damage, or do we save this iconic steakhouse?
It's really all up to you!!!
Please help me save her.
Or she will be gone in a few years at this pace. So,
I know that if everyone I know or who knows the Greendoor can help give just a little, we all will make the difference. Maybe it will last another 50 years or not!
Please help me save the Greendoor, because it literally saved me 13 years ago.
labels: Bank, Reflection, Lake, Channel, Reservoir

title: Fuel the Future of Pizza Finta
description:
It all started in a backyard during the aftermath of a hurricane.
When Hurricane Helene hit Asheville, Matty had everything prepped to launch his pizza business—a reliable sourdough starter, fresh veggies, a trusty oven, but with Asheville shut down, nowhere to sell his pies.
So he did what any heart-led chef would do:
He fired up the ovens anyway and started slingin’ pies for free to support his community in West Asheville. Out of that moment, the first community pizza nights were born—gatherings where a free hot meal, a little laughter and a place to gather when there was no power or water for weeks on end.
People came for a meal, and kept coming back for the the feeling of community. Most had no idea the pizza was vegan. No menu. No marketing. Just really good pizza, shared from the heart.
It was that community that helped birth Pizza Finta into existence.
Since then, what started as a backyard vibe turned into a cult-favorite food experience—powered by a tiny retrofitted Japanese truck and an even bigger mission: Build community, support local farmers, and serve up the best pizza in Asheville.
But now,
the future of Pizza Finta is at a turning point.
Our beloved truck needs repairs
Our commissary kitchen is closing in October
And we’re exploring new venues to keep the dream alive
Whether it’s $10 or $1000, we’re grateful for every penny.
Can’t donate?
No worries. Post the link or share on social media and help us get the word out. Your support matters.
labels: Brown

title: Keep Art Boutiki Open Through The End of the Year
description:
The Art Boutiki will sadly be closing at the end of 2025. After years of robbing Peter to pay Paul the economic landscape and just general level of business for us has made it necessary to shut the doors after 16 years.
I know it seems odd for a business to ask for donations to close its doors, but we are trying to get out while leaving the fewest number of people hanging. Primarily we want to be able to make our commitments to people we have told could play here. We will achieve this by paying unpaid rent and affording utilities, both of which have proven to be unattainable through sales alone.
In addition to everything else, we will need to paint and restore the venue to its original state upon departure, making it usable by someone else, except for the sound enhancements and other additions we have made. This is going to be a draconian task that might take upwards of a month.
Thanks all for your support
labels: Video Game Software, Animation, Graphics, Fictional character, Graphic design

title: Run 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
This October, I’m challenging myself to run 100 miles in support of the American Cancer Society and its mission to ensure everyone has an opportunity to prevent, detect, treat, and survive cancer.
This cause is deeply meaningful to me, and I’m committed to putting in the miles to raise awareness and support.
The ACS funds groundbreaking research, provides free rides and places to stay for patients, and offers 24/7 support to families navigating one of life’s toughest battles.
No matter the size, every contribution helps—whether it’s funding critical research, supporting patients, or providing resources for families. Together, we can make a difference.
Thank you so much for your support. It means the world to me.
❤️ Catherine

title: Support Shell Key Shuttle's Recovery
description:
Please help my husband and I save our small business called
the Shell Key Shuttle
. In 2024, we were hit hard by hurricanes Helene and Milton; we were devastated. Like all our neighbors, we couldn't imagine this had happened and weren't sure what to do next. We applied to FEMA and the Small Business Administration, but after months of supplying information about our losses, the help we needed was denied. Finally, we were allowed to return to the Merry Pier and begin normal operations on February 18, 2025, just in time for the "season." But the damage to our town was so great there wasn't anywhere for the people to stay, and this continued throughout the summer. We estimate our business is down 70% for our 6 busiest months. Going into our slow time, we usually rely on a line of credit from our bank, but we have used all the $46,000 just paying bills and the boatyard, which luckily saved our boat from the storms.
If we could just keep our heads above water for a few months, we are hoping and praying we can make it back to our busy time in 2026 and make up our losses.
We are the caretakers of the Shell Key Shuttle that has been in business for 35+ years and would be heartbroken to lose it now.
labels: Boat, Sail, Sailboat, Sailing, Watercraft

title: Help Keep Phils Family Foods Going
description:
Help Keep Phil’s Family Foods Open – Support Our Community Store
Our small town has always relied on Phil’s Family Foods — not just for groceries, but as a cornerstone of our community. Right now, the store and its owner need our help more than ever.
The owner has been carrying heavy burdens: caring for her mom as she battles cancer, grieving the heartbreaking loss of her daughter, and struggling with overwhelming financial obligations. Through it all, she has worked tirelessly to keep the shelves stocked and the doors open for all of us.
But she can’t do it alone anymore. Without support, we risk losing more than just a store — we risk losing a piece of what makes our community strong.
We’re asking our neighbors, friends, and anyone who cares about keeping small businesses alive to come together and help. Every donation goes directly toward keeping Phil’s Family Foods running — stocking shelves, paying expenses, and making sure this store continues to serve us all.
Even a small contribution makes a big difference. And if you can’t give, sharing this fundraiser helps more than you know.
Let’s rally around one of our own and show what community really means. Together, we can keep Phil’s Family Foods open and thriving.
❤️ Thank you for your support.
labels: Logo, Advertising, Awning, Brick, Restaurant

title: Help build My Little Village: Community Play space
description:
Hello! My name is Amanda Cuney Lopez. I was born and raised in New Paltz, and am now raising my two girls here! As a local business owner and the founder of Soul Tribe, a group fitness studio that has already brought so many people in our community together, I’ve seen firsthand the power of creating spaces where people can connect and support one another.
I’m now working on my next project: My Little Village—an indoor play space designed especially for preschool-aged children and their caregivers. More than just a play space, My Little Village is about community building. It’s a place where kids can play safely indoors, and where parents and caregivers can connect, share, and feel less alone in the journey of raising children.
Another exciting element of My Little Village is creating flexible jobs for stay at home parents. Short shifts that allow parents to bring their children with them, giving them the opportunity to have their child play for free and bring in some extra cash to help their families.
Think play time, workshops, birthday parties, art events, all geared toward families and community building.
I’m raising funds to help bring this vision to life—to create a welcoming, safe, and fun environment that gives families in New Paltz and beyond a place to gather, grow, and build lasting connections. Every dollar counts and brings us one step closer to making our vision a reality. Your contribution will go toward play equipment, supplies and making the space inviting and cozy for all! We truly believe this will be a wonderful addition to the community and can't wait to open our doors!
labels: Kindergarten, Child

title: Support the First America Shaped Cruise Ship
description: A thought came across my mind while I was talking to a loved one. Wouldn't it be super cool to ride on a cruise ship shaped like America. Then I designed the world's first America Shaped cruise ships,  please join me on my journey making this American dream come true for all of us.

title: Underground Movement is moving!
description:
Hello Orlando dance community!
On behalf of everyone on the Underground Movement team, we want to say thank you for sharing your talent, work, and time with us over these past 7 years. It feels timely that so close to our anniversary we would have some BIG news to share with our community.
WE ARE EXPANDING!
That’s right! We are moving locations to create the new, improved, and bigger version of our space that we know will help our space grow. We know Underground is a home to so many, and when your family grows your home must follow!
To do this, we have to cover a lot of expenses: brand new floors, mirror transport, improved equipment, and other fees that come our way with making this move. So, we turn to you, with hope that you believe in this studio as much as we do enough to help us accomplish this.
We could not be more grateful for the support we’ve had over the years, and we could not be more thankful for anything that you decide to give to this mission. Underground Movement is more than a studio, and it all started as a dream, help us keep this dream alive!
With Love,
UGM
labels: Design, Graphics, Graphic design

title: Support Yarns etc... New Beginning in Chapel Hill
description:
Yarns etc just celebrated 30yrs in business this year and we were gearing up for many more years serving the community we love...right before Tropical Storm Chantal hit. The store flooded with water reaching 4ft high within the store. We lost furniture, fixtures and most of our inventory, a loss of about $45,000.
We've thought long and hard about how to recover from this devastating event. One of the major considerations is that we need to move to a new location to avoid repeat flooding events. We are committed to staying in Chapel Hill because of the amazing community we've been a part of here. A new location will need to be fitted for the store and so there is quite a bit for us to do. We're excited and hopeful about bringing Yarns etc back, so we need your help!
Any donation amount is helpful and so appreciated. We will update this post as well as Facebook as we progress on this journey. Thank you!
labels: Smile, Community, Fun, Student, School

title: Frisco Roadwork Is Crushing My Business #SaveMain
description:
A Small Business Fighting to Survive Main Street Construction
My name is Sumego Thompson, and I’m the proud owner of
Nevaeh Studio Salon/Barbershop and Nevaeh Studios Cosmetology & Barber Institute
, located on Main Street in Frisco, Texas.
For over 10 years, I’ve poured my heart into serving this community, helping people look and feel their best while giving back through fundraisers, free back-to-school haircuts, school supplies, and much more. In December 2024, I followed my dream and opened a beauty school to empower the next generation of barbers and cosmetologists.
But now, everything I’ve built is at risk. Ongoing construction on Main Street in Frisco, Texas, has devastated my business:
No sidewalk access in front of the salon
Limited parking shared with multiple businesses
Confusing detours that have driven away foot traffic
No budget left for advertising due to lost revenue
Business has slowed to a near standstill. I’m doing everything I can to keep going, but I’ve fallen behind on rent and bills and am at serious risk of losing both the salon and the school.
I’m asking for your help to keep Nevaeh Studios alive. Your donation will go toward:
Rent and utilities
Daily operational expenses
Support for students and staff
A future marketing push once we stabilize
Every dollar truly makes a difference. If you can’t give, please share this campaign so more people can help. Frisco is growing quickly, but small businesses like mine should have the chance to grow with it- not disappear because of construction setbacks.
With heartfelt gratitude,
Sumego Thompson
Nevaeh Studios – Frisco, TX
www.nevaehstudiofrisco.com
https://
www.tiktok.com/@nevaehstudiofrisco?_t=ZP-8zys2CKt2VD&_r=1
Facebook | Instagram
#SaveMain
Gifts are also welcome!
Please send to the address below. Thank you!
6726 Main Street
#200 & #210
Frisco, TX 75034

title: Help Launch Bakersfield's First Cat Café
description:
Hi, my name is Shayna Meron, and here is my dream:
Paws & Sip.
I’ve dreamed of opening a space where community, comfort, and cats come together.
Paws and Sip is more than just a café — it’s a cozy, welcoming environment where people can unwind with fresh pastries, lovingly made drinks, and the calming presence of adoptable cats.
I'm opening
Bakersfield’s first cat café
— a place that blends delicious, made-from-scratch cinnamon rolls and lattes with a relaxing, thoughtfully designed cat lounge where cats can play, nap, and (hopefully!) find their forever homes.
Why Paws & Sip is asking for Help
Starting a brick-and-mortar business is expensive, especially one that also serves as a safe haven for animals. I’ve already filed all my paperwork, and am working through the final stages of getting a small business loan. But, sometimes even with a solid plan, you just need a little boost.
I’m raising funds to help cover:
Renovations (including a custom-built cat lounge and air filtration)
Café equipment
Cat furniture, toys, and supplies
Starting inventory and ingredients
Startup costs until we’re self-sustaining
Your support will go directly toward making this dream possible — helping me create a one-of-a-kind place in Bakersfield where cats, coffee, and community come together.
What makes Paws & Sip Special?
Paws & Sip provides a safe, loving environment where homeless cats receive daily care, comfortable housing, and medical attention — all while helping them find their forever families.
All pastries are baked fresh, in-house — no shortcuts, just real ingredients and daily love.
A separate, thoughtfully designed cat lounge lets visitors relax and bond with adoptable cats in a clean, calm space.
Affordable merchandise & artist vending machines will spotlight local creators!
Memberships and events will keep the café engaging and accessible year-round.
Community-focused projects like free pet food for low-income households, coupons for volunteers from collaborating organizations, a community garden, and much, much more!
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for supporting me and this
dream. I can’t wait to serve you a warm cinnamon roll, introduce you to an adorable cat, and watch this community grow.
– Shayna Meron
Founder of Paws and Sip

title: Save 5 Points Art Gallery: Save Where Art Lives
description:
For seven years,
5 Points Art Gallery + Studios
has been more than just a building in Milwaukee’s Harambee neighborhood. It is
a home, a platform, and a lifeline
for artists locally and globally. We’ve provided affordable housing for artists, hosted exhibitions that sparked dialogue, offered residencies that launched careers, and welcomed the community into an inclusive cultural hub.
Now, this legacy is under threat.
On
December 1, 2025
, a
$260,000 balloon payment
is due. Without it, 5 Points will face foreclosure, and Milwaukee risks losing one of its last independent spaces dedicated to accessible, community-driven art.
This isn’t just about saving a building, it’s about
preserving culture, creativity, and a sanctuary where artists and neighbors can thrive together.
Why 5 Points Matters:
Affordable Artist Housing:
Providing safe, sustainable spaces for creatives in a city where affordability is rare.
Groundbreaking Exhibitions:
Showcasing BIPOC, emerging, and international artists.
Residencies + Workshops:
Equipping artists with tools to grow, while engaging youth and community members.
Community Advocacy:
Standing as a bulwark against displacement and cultural erasure.
How Funds Will Be Used:
$260,000 Balloon Payment:
To secure ownership of the gallery and prevent foreclosure.
Sustainability Investments:
Ensuring future programming, exhibitions, and housing remain intact.
How You Can Help:
Donate today:
Any amount helps. $20, $50, $100, $1,000... every gift pushes us closer.
Share this campaign:
Spread the word on social media, email, or text.
Join us at the Save the Gallery! Art + Music Festival (Sept. 27):
Where art, music, and community will gather to rally support.
Together, we can ensure that Milwaukee doesn’t lose this vital space. Together, we can say loudly:
Art belongs here. Artists belong here. Community belongs here.

title: Help Build Amy’s Place: Champaign’s Gay Owned Dive Bar
description:
Champaign needs more queer-inclusive spaces — and we’re building one. Amy’s Place will be a queer-owned, community-led dance bar in downtown Champaign, created to fill the gap in nightlife for LGBTQ+ people and allies.
This isn’t just another bar. Amy’s Place will feature affordable drinks, a brand-new dance floor, drag shows, theme nights, and music chosen by the community — from pop anthems to dance hits that keep the floor alive. It will be one of the few bars in town both owned by and dedicated to the LGBTQ+ community, offering a safe, vibrant, and welcoming space for self-expression, connection, and joy.
To make this possible, we need your help. Funds raised will go toward construction, labor, audio and lighting equipment, standard bar needs, and creating a safe and exciting atmosphere. Every donation brings us closer to opening a space where everyone can belong, celebrate, and dance.
With your support, Amy’s Place will become more than a bar — it will be the home for queer nightlife in Champaign. Thank you for helping us bring this vision to life.
labels: Brick, Sign

title: Help Toto Tours Thrive for 30 More Years
description:
Help Preserve a Legacy of LGBTQ+ Travel: Support the Next Chapter of Toto Tours
Hi! We’re Dan Perry and Michael Serapiglia. We’re partners in life, proud gay men, and passionate world travelers. We’re raising money to
purchase Toto Tours
, a pioneering LGBTQ+ travel company that has connected our community through exploration, joy, and adventure since 1990.
With your help, we’ll carry this beloved company into its next era, preserving its legacy while reimagining its future for a new generation of queer travelers.
Why Toto Tours Matters
Toto Tours has been a trusted name in LGBTQ+ travel for over 30 years. Founded by Dan Ware in 1990, it’s the longest-running gay tour company in continuous operation under one owner (a rare and inspiring example of queer business longevity).
More than just vacations, Toto Tours creates community. It offers LGBTQ+ people the chance to safely experience the world while being fully themselves, free of judgment, full of laughter, and surrounded by chosen family. As our rights and safety vary from country to country, that kind of space is more important than ever.
As Dan Ware prepares for retirement, he’s entrusted us with the opportunity to carry this vision forward. We’re honored - and excited - to take the reins.
Why This Is Personal
I’m Dan Perry, a performer, producer, and gay man with a deep love for the arts, community, and cultural exchange. I’ve spent most of my life on stage or behind the scenes, creating meaningful experiences for others. I’ve also been lucky enough to travel the world, and those experiences have changed me, opening my heart, challenging my thinking, and strengthening my pride in who I am.
Michael Serapiglia, my partner in this journey, brings his own passion for travel, people, and purpose. Together, we believe that travel should do more than entertain. It should connect, affirm, inspire, and transform.
That’s why we’re committed to continuing what Toto Tours does best and expanding it with fresh energy, broader destinations, and new kinds of experiences that reflect today’s beautifully diverse LGBTQ+ community.
What Your Support Will Do
Your donations will help us:
Purchase Toto Tours and keep this LGBTQ+ legacy alive
Cover key transition costs like legal fees, business planning, and relaunch expenses
Modernize the brand and website
Expand tour offerings to include music, theater, wellness, and cultural themes
Build partnerships with LGBTQ+ creatives, nonprofits, and local guides
Launch a scholarship program for travelers with limited means in the future
Every dollar helps. Whether you give $5, $500, or $5,000, you’re investing in something meaningful: LGBTQ+ joy, safety, connection, and freedom to explore the world.
Let’s make sure Toto Tours continues to thrive, not just for those of us who love to travel, but for those still discovering who they are and where they belong.
Thank you for being part of this adventure.
labels: Eyewear, Glasses, Vision Care, Smile, Facial expression
