title: Support Tommy’s Thai Restaurant
description:
Tommy's Thai Restaurant has been a beloved part of the Denver community since 1988, proudly standing as one of the first Thai restaurants in the city. For decades, our family has welcomed generations of customers, sharing authentic Thai cuisine and creating a warm, inviting space for friends and families to gather. Many of our regulars have celebrated milestones with us, and we’ve always felt honored to be part of so many lives in Denver.
Recently, the BRT construction and the closure of Colfax have made it difficult for customers to reach us. This has had a significant impact on our business, affecting our ability to cover operating costs and support our dedicated staff. Despite these challenges, we remain committed to serving our community and keeping the spirit of Tommy’s Thai alive.
We’re reaching out for your support to help us keep our doors open during this tough time. Every contribution will go directly toward maintaining our staff, covering essential expenses, and ensuring that Tommy’s Thai Restaurant can continue to be a place where memories are made. Your help means everything to us, and together, we can preserve a piece of Denver’s history.
labels: Orange, Interior design, Furniture, Chair, Restaurant

title: Help Expand Braille Literacy Nationwide
description:
Ashley has dedicated her life to Braille literacy, drawing from her own experience as someone who was born visually impaired and relied on Braille throughout her education. Now a certified Braille transcriber, Ashley is passionate about giving back to the blind community by providing Braille transcription and tutoring services to those who need them most. Her business, VIP Braille Services, serves both children and adults, offering lessons virtually and in person, and she has worked with school districts and businesses such as an elevator company in New York. Testimonials from satisfied clients highlight the impact of her work and her commitment to quality and accessibility.
Currently, Ashley faces significant challenges without access to a personal Braille embosser. She must manually type out Braille materials on a Perkins Braille writer, which is time-consuming and limits her ability to produce high-quality materials quickly. This process creates delays for her students and clients, and makes it difficult to meet the needs of businesses and organizations that require professional Braille documents. With a Braille Buddy Embosser, Ashley would be able to create high-quality Braille materials, including graphics, much more efficiently. This would allow her to reduce wait times for tutoring lessons, serve more clients, and expand her reach across the country.
Ashley’s goal is to use the embosser to further Braille literacy, provide faster and more accurate services, and help more people access the resources they need. By supporting her fundraiser, donors will help Ashley continue her mission to empower the blind community and make Braille accessible to all who need it.

title: Donate to Build Wise Owl Wellness in the Woods
description:
Wise Owl Wellness in the Woods – A Community Sanctuary
Hello friends, family, and kind-hearted community,
My name is Kristy, and I am the founder of Wise Owl Wellness. For more than 19 years, I’ve been sharing the healing practices of yoga, meditation, sound therapy, and mindful living with individuals and groups across the country from Virginia to Arizona. Now, I’m ready to root those teachings into a permanent home — right in the heart of Pinetop-Lakeside, AZ.
✨ Introducing:
Wise Owl Wellness in the Woods
✨
A sanctuary for healing, connection, and growth, surrounded by the beauty of the White Mountains. This space will be more than just a yoga studio — it will be a community hub for wellness, offering:
Yoga Classes for All Levels Including: Flow, Chair, Yin, Restorative, Prenatal, and MORE!
In Person Classes and Virtual Classes for People to Join from Anywhere
Sound healing and meditation gatherings
Dance Classes
Pilates Mat and Reformer Classes
Private Yoga and Pilates Sessions
Thai Massage Sessions
Workshops for self-care, creativity, and mindfulness
Special offerings for women’s circles, retreats, and seasonal celebrations
Continuing Education workshops for Yoga Teachers
Trainings and Certifications including 200 Hour Yoga Teacher Trainings, 300 Hour Advanced Yoga Teacher Trainings, and Thai Massage Therapist Trainings
Why I Need Your Support
I have been traveling to northern Arizona over the past few years to teach yoga at a resort during the summer months, when the heat in Tucson is unbearable. When I was there in August of this year, one woman came up to me after class and informed me that their beloved yoga studio would be closing, due to the current owner retiring at the young age of 82! The studio was going up for sale, and the offer presented itself...would I be willing and able to take it over?
At first, I thought "heck no!", but the woman from class said that she would bring more students with her the next time I was teaching there. So, 2 weeks later, I found myself teaching to 18 people in the pine forests of northern Arizona. There were some current teachers at the studio and a few loyal students who came to check out my teaching style and meet with me. After class, I listened to their individual stories about how much the studio meant to them.
So, I decided to go look at the space. It's lovely. Fully built out with hard-wood floors, a bathroom, and a separate room to see private clients or teach small group classes. It's...perfect. If I could take over the rent, the current local teachers will be able to continue offering their unique and well-attended classes. I would also have a place to teach and play on my monthly visits back to the area. Maybe even some of my Tucson students would join me for a weekend getaway or mini-retreat. This would also serve as a welcoming space for visiting teachers from all over the world.
Launching a wellness studio is a dream, but it takes resources to bring it to life. Our goal is $20,000, which will go directly toward:
Rent and insurance for one year – providing stability and a home base
Props & equipment – mats, bolsters, blankets, singing bowls, and sound instruments
Utilities – keeping the space warm, welcoming, and functional
Community accessibility – ensuring everyone has access to the tools they need to feel supported on their wellness journey
Donor Rewards
To honor your generosity, I’ve created some heartfelt thank-you gifts:
$25 – Owl Feather Friend
A personalized thank-you card & your name added to our “Wall of Gratitude” in the studio.
$50 – Roots Supporter
All of the above + one complimentary yoga class, either in person or on ZOOM.
$100 – Wings of Wellness
All of the above + one sound bath session OR two yoga classes. Yoga classes can be in person or on ZOOM. Sound bath is in person in Tucson or Pinetop-Lakeside, AZ.
$250 – Tree of Life Patron
All of the above + your choice of a 1:1 private yoga session or Thai yoga massage. Private Yoga can be in person, or virtual, so you can join me from anywhere. Thai Massage is done in person, so either in Tucson or Pinetop-Lakeside, AZ.
$500 – Forest Guardian
All of the above + unlimited classes for 1 month once the studio opens. Classes can be virtual, so you can attend from the comfort of your own home if you're unable to get to Pinetop-Lakeside, AZ.
$1,000+ – Wise Owl Visionary ✨
All of the above + a special private group sound healing or yoga session for you and 6 of your loved ones + your name permanently honored as a Founding Supporter in our studio. Yoga session can be in person or virtual. Sound Healing is in person either in Tucson or Pinetop-Lakeside, AZ.
Why It Matters
In today’s fast-paced world, we all need spaces that remind us to slow down, breathe, and reconnect.
Wise Owl Wellness in the Woods
will provide that safe haven — a place to gather, heal, and grow together as a community.
Your contribution, no matter the size, is an investment in creating a ripple effect of peace, health, and connection in Pinetop-Lakeside and beyond.
Ways You Can Help
Donate
– Every dollar brings us closer to opening our doors.
Share
– Please spread the word with your friends, family, and community.
Join us
– When the doors open, come practice, celebrate, and grow with us!
Together, we can create a space where wellness takes root and radiates outward — a true sanctuary in the woods.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for believing in this vision. Your support means the world.
With gratitude,
Kristy
Founder, Wise Owl Wellness

title: Help ZZ’s Ice Cream Puffs Open 1st Store in DFW TX
description:
My name is Nikita Seal, and I’m the founder of ZZ’s Ice Cream Puffs. After five years of serving the Dallas–Fort Worth area as a mobile dessert business, my team of Puffatiers and I are ready to take the next step: opening our very first pop-up shop in Irving, Texas. This is a 3-month pop-up in a retail space, designed to test if we’re ready for something more long term. Our soft opening will be October 10th and 11th, with the official grand opening and ribbon cutting on November 1st.
Our journey began with a single trailer and a dream to create one-of-a-kind ice cream experiences. We’re known for our signature ice cream puffs—a warm, sweet Korean-style bun filled with your choice of ice cream and toppings. Over the years, we’ve become a beloved part of the community, bringing joy and creativity to every event we attend.
This pop-up shop is more than just a new location; it’s a chance to build a gathering place where families, friends, and neighbors can come together. We want to revitalize Irving with a space full of excitement, connection, and, of course, delicious desserts. The funds from this fundraiser will help us cover essential costs like cosmetic repairs, new equipment, staff, and the fresh ingredients that make our puffs so special. Every dollar will go directly toward creating a welcoming environment and ensuring we can serve our community at our very best.
Opening this shop is a dream built on resilience, hard work, and the support of people who believe in what we do. With your help, we can make this pop-up a reality and take the first step toward a permanent home for ZZ’s Ice Cream Puffs. Thank you for being part of our story and helping us bring more joy to Irving.

title: Help Relaunch Lyssie Lou’s Cookie Co! ❤️
description:
Lyssie Lou’s Cookie Co. was born from something simple: a desire to help people create meaningful memories — one truly great sugar cookie at a time. From the beginning, we’ve committed to using only fully organic ingredients, with no shortcuts, no artificial flavors — just nostalgic, thoughtfully crafted treats made with care and intention.
Our mission has always been about more than just cookies. We want every bite to feel like a warm memory: cozy, joyful, and deeply personal. The kind of sugar cookie that doesn’t just taste amazing (though it absolutely does) — it reminds you that you’re home, you’re celebrated, you’re connected.
I started baking these cookies with my mom. After she passed, those memories in the kitchen became one of the greatest gifts she left me. That’s the heart behind Lyssie Lou’s — to help others create their own lasting moments, just like I did.
Now, after pausing to refine our vision and rebuild intentionally,
we’re preparing to relaunch this December — and we’d love your help bringing it to life.
Our Goal
We’re looking for 65 donors to each contribute $100 to help fund our comeback.
In return? You’ll receive an exclusive invite to the Lyssie Lou’s Tasting Party — a cozy, community-driven event where you’ll:
Be the first to try our brand-new seasonal frosting flavors
Enjoy free coffee, savory snacks, and a beautifully curated tasting experience
Connect with other supporters who care about small-batch, organic, woman-owned businesses
If you donate $400 or more, you will be invited to all four of our tasting events, one for each season!
It’s our way of saying thank you — and bringing you into the heart of what we’re building.
Can’t give $100 or $400? We totally understand — every bit helps.
As a thank-you, any donation amount will receive 10% off all your December cookie orders. It’s our small way of saying we appreciate your support, no matter the size.
Where Your Donation Goes
Your support helps us:
Finalize new monthly flavor recipes
Source premium, organic ingredients for testing flavors
Design and launch sustainable packaging
Build a pared-down, elevated website to match our refined brand
Host our first tasting event with our new flavors
Kick off with a beautiful December drop
Find our future home where we make our cookies
You’re not just funding cookies. You’re helping us lay the foundation for a thoughtful, long-lasting, year-round business that celebrates flavor, artistry, and community.
Why It Matters
Our goal has always been to be one of the most intentional. Every cookie we make is a reflection of what we value most:
Only organic ingredients — no shortcuts, ever
Consistent, hand-crafted quality you can taste in every bite
Small-batch joy, made with care and delivered with love
A business model rooted in connection
Paying and treating the people we work with well
Whether you’ve been with us since day one or just found your way to our cookies, this relaunch is our love letter to you — to our customers, our community, and to the belief that doing things differently is always worth it.
labels: Blue

But the best person to plan your trip is a local professional—a tour guide who actually lives there. You don't have to plan alone, like a conquistador on your side of the world. Channel a local before making all of your travel decisions.

the same guide who plans your trip with you online can also be the one who Guides you in-person.

with a local tour guide that will customize based on your wants and needs.

platform that offers:
Seamless Online-to-Offline Integration
– The same guide who plans your trip online can be the one who accompanies you in person. No other platform offers this complete continuity.
Premium Guide Curation
– Over 200 personal interviews to select only licensed, experienced professionals. We're not an open marketplace where anyone can sign up.
True Personalization, Not Packages
– While others sell pre-defined tours, we create 100% customized experiences based on your profile, budget, and interests.
Authentic Local Expertise
– Our guides have lived in their destinations for years. They know the "secrets" that only locals know.
⏰
Sustainable Income for Guides
– We create revenue streams during off-seasons, revolutionizing how tourism professionals work globally.
The Result:
The only complete bridge between personalized online planning and authentic in-person execution, with the same professional from start to finish of your journey.
________________________________________
Our Story: From Chance Encounter to Global Platform
Chicago, 2001.
A young Brazilian immigrant tours Rosana around the city. Twenty-three years later, that sparked a global movement.
Rosana
, a 34-year travel industry veteran and former Director at JTB Group, led a recovery project that achieved outstanding results and also led the team that won one of the Top 10 corporate travel accounts in Brazil. She saw the missing link: travelers crave authentic human connection and truly custom experiences.
Leticia
, who came to America at 9 as an immigrant, became a licensed architect, military spouse, and traveler at heart. She joined Rosana in designing the solution, often late into the night, even while pregnant - because she believed this could change everything.
Together, they turned personal experiences into a platform ready to revolutionize how the world travels.
Enter Leticia—came to America at 9 as an immigrant, became a licensed architect, military spouse, traveler at heart who loves solving complex problems.
Rosana identified the gap. Leticia helped design the solution.
Picture this: Rosana pinpointing exactly what travelers needed. Leticia and Rosana designing the platform late into the night, pregnant growing belly and all, because they knew this could change everything.
________________________________________
Four Years of Proven Success
Built from the ground up. Completely bootstrapped by two determined mothers.
✅
Surveyed hundreds
of travelers and guides
✅
Hand-curated licensed guides
through personal interviews
✅
Validated market
demand without external funding
✅
Created sustainable income
for guides in 22 countries
✅
Positive feedback
from all consultations proving travelers love this
And after personally interviewing over 200 guides, one thing became clear: they can't wait to see Contenta360 scale and bring them more travelers.
We didn't just survive the pandemic - it was during that difficult time that we created this solution. And today, we've proven the world needs it.
________________________________________
We've Proven This Works. Now We Scale Globally.
This isn't just about building a business—it's about:
Restoring human connection
in an AI-dominated world
Valuing tour guides' knowledg
e and giving them year-round income (there's no off-season for planning)
Supporting local communities
with sustainable opportunities
✈️
Empowering travelers
with authentic experiences
‍
Proving bootstrap startups
can revolutionize industries
And we've been recognized for it: accelerated by Peachscore, finalists at BoostX, and selected for a corporate finance program that prepares us to scale sustainably.
______________________________________________________
How Your $4,500 Support Will Be Used
Since we're in the launching phase, every dollar is strategic:
• 70% Marketing
– Reaching premium and passionate travelers who value authentic, tailor-made experiences and building global awareness
• 30% Platform Improvements
– Enhancing technology for a seamless traveler & guide experience
Future stretch goals will include expanding our guide network worldwide and hiring core team members to scale operations effectively.
________________________________________
Two Accomplished Mothers. One Revolutionary Mission.
Rosana:
55+, 34 years of travel expertise, seasoned leader with a proven corporate track record.
Leticia:
Young mother, licensed architect, immigrant success story, military spouse resilience.
From chance encounter to proven platform - this is how world-changing companies begin.
We've spent four years proving this vision works. Bootstrapped through pandemic struggles, late nights, and motherhood. And we've shown that when you connect real people with real people, magic happens.
Now we need your belief in us to take this global.
________________________________________
Join Our Revolution
Support Contenta360. Support human connection. Support two mothers changing how the world travels.
ONLY 30 DAYS LEFT – $4,500 GOAL
[SUPPORT CONTENTA360 NOW]
Every contribution powers authentic online travel planning and supports local tour guides worldwide.
Ready to experience authentic travel planning?
Try Contenta360:
www.contenta360.com

title: Be the Bridge: Empower Voices, Change Lives
description:
We are Kadijatou Barry and Asantewa Bonna, two friends who met during our first year of college and dreamed of making an impact in the world through stories.
Our roots are in Guinea and Ghana, places rich in culture but where too many brilliant voices remain unheard. We have seen firsthand how literature and the arts are too often dismissed as mere hobbies, and how extraordinary talent is overlooked simply because opportunity never arrives.
Barry & Bonna Publishing
was born from our shared belief that stories are bridges—they connect people, heal communities, and open doors to worlds we have never known. We are building a publishing house that empowers underrepresented writers, celebrates diverse cultures, and makes books accessible to
anyone, anywhere, anytime
.
Your support will help us launch our very first titles by covering crucial costs such as printing, editing, design, and events that will bring these stories to life. These books are not just pages and ink; they are lenses through which we see the world more clearly, mirrors that reflect the beauty and complexity of our identities, and sparks that ignite change in hearts and minds.
When you contribute, you are not just funding a business, you are becoming part of a movement. You are saying
oui
to a young writer in Guinea who thought her story did not matter. You are saying
yes
to a poet in Ohio who never imagined his words could reach across oceans. You are saying
speak
to voices too often silenced, preserving the richness of cultures and sparking change—one story at a time.
Thank you for believing in us, in our authors, and in the power of storytelling to change lives.
labels: Smile, Happiness, Headgear, Textile, Facial expression

title: ReLimb: Beyond the Body
description:
Ever since I was little, I watched the people I love most struggle with their bodies, most importantly my mother. Seeing her endure conditions that limited her physical abilities and slowly deteriorated her body left a mark on me that I couldn’t ignore. It wasn’t just about wishing that I could heal her; I wanted to do something bigger.
From a young age, I dreamed not just of fixing the human body, but of enhancing it, pushing it beyond its limits and perfecting its potential with technology. That dream has driven every step I’ve taken in my life, guiding my studies, beliefs, and now, this project.
This Kickstarter is more than just a business venture for me. It’s the opportunity to dedicate my research, my time, and my energy to creating technologies that improve lives, technologies that could help people live stronger, healthier, and more capable lives.
With your support, I can turn these dreams into real inventions, and together, we can make the world a better place, one innovation at a time.
labels: Animation, Clip art, Graphics, Fictional character, Animated cartoon

title: Run 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
Hi Everyone,
After a few quiet years, I decided to bring back a charity event through my Instagram. This is my way of putting some good into the world during such a chaotic time. This October, I’m partnering with the American Cancer Society for their 100-Miles Challenge although I’m flipping it a bit:
every $5 donated equals 1 mile I’ll run, up to 100 miles.
(I’ll keep donations open through the first week of October since I’m starting late.)
For me, this cause is personal. My mom was diagnosed with cancer in 2019, and that moment was something that truthfully rocked my world. She’s doing much better now, but we all know someone who’s fought—or lost—someone to cancer. With running becoming my thing this past year, so I’m turning miles into support.
Please consider donating or sharing this GoFundMe to help hit our donation goal.
Thanks everyone,
Tyler Monell

title: Support Jess Erb's Inclusive Pilates Studio
description:
Hi! I’m Jess Erb. I am a fat fitness professional with over 4000 hours of wellness training. I am a yoga teacher and educator, and a Pilates instructor. And— a mom. I want to open a private/ semi-private Pilates studio in my home that focuses on bringing classic/ classic inspired sessions to ALL bodies. No mirrors, no narrow raised mats, no 22” chair seats… my dream is that anyone can use anything they see when they walk in and that I have exactly what I need to teach classes sequenced for accessibility.
Raising money to supplement the cost of Pilates equipment will help me price control my services and get started soon. First, to price control, I am going to consider the cost of my training (about $10k when all is said and done) as a loss and working from my home will eliminate rent. Second, I could do this in a couple more years, readjusting my timeline after a very difficult pregnancy and first year as a mom (IYKYK)… but I believe I have something to offer imminently. There’s a place for this work.
Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

title: Fuel Boats' BBQ Business Journey
description:

Well, the time is now and boy is it not cheap, so I'm asking my friends and family that have had the pleasure to taste my food and say it is excellent BBQ to support and help.
Thank you and shine bright!

title: Help Forge A Collaborative Theater Space in SE Michigan
description:
I'm launching Forge Theater - a collaborative community and studio space. Forge's mission is to foster original work for the stage, screen and street. Members and non-members can reserve space for auditions, classes/workshops, events, rehearsals and performances.
Your contribution will turn this blank slate at 3000 Packard in Ann Arbor into a flexible space with basic lighting and sound, a meeting area, and mobile seating for creative collaborations and theatrical productions.
There has long been a need for a community space for independent creators and producers to hone their craft, engage audiences and develop professionally. Forge Theater is a home for independent theater makers. For more information visit
www.forgetheatercollaborative.com.
Please help forge a home for creatives in Southeast Michigan. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

title: Support Brazas Market and Family After Fire Incident
description:
As most of you know or may have heard, on the morning of August 31st,
my sister-in-law's beautiful family restaurant, Brazas Market and Churrasqueira, had a devastating fire incident
. A restaurant that they put their blood, sweat, and tears into. No one was hurt, thankfully, but the restaurant took on some damage that unfortunately will cause them not to reopen for a little while.
I know this is a hard time for a lot of people financially, but I’m asking you to please just consider donating anything you can as this beautiful restaurant was the main source of income for this family.
As a community, let’s show this family the love that they deserve and get this restaurant back on its feet as soon as possible!

title: Walk 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
I'm walking 100 miles in October to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer. This is a very meaningful cause for me.  You may know this already but, my father passed away from pancreatic cancer at the young age of 42.  Also, my  close family-friends, Sharmin, Janet, and Eliane (my adopted French mom), are in remission from breast and leukemia cancer.  They are the strongest women that I know.  With every single step, I am honoring their strength, courage and willpower that it takes to fight cancer.
ACS has a platinum rating on GuideStar (the highest possible), so give with confidence!  Or, you can give to them directly here:
https://www.cancer.org/
Please consider making a donation because every little bit helps. Thank you for your support!
With heart,
Meena

title: Run 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description: I'm running 100 miles to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer. This cause is deeply personal. My father fought cancer with courage and strength, and though he’s no longer with us, his fight, and his victories along the way, continue to inspire me every day. I’m running in his memory, and for every family who has faced this battle.Thank you for your support!

title: Help Shelby Reopen a Lawrence Child Care Center
description:
My name is Shelby Huggins and I have been working in early childcare for over 20 years. Seeing the lack of centers in my city is truly breaking my heart.
Princeton Children's Center, which had been a long-running center, shut down abruptly earlier this year
, and the building remains with pretty much all the equipment (inside and outside) you would need to open a center.
My goal is to get this center back up and running.
I want to reopen this building so that the families in Lawrence, Kansas, have a safe and nurturing space for their children to thrive, grow, play, and have fun! I know I can do this, but I need your help! Any help big or small will be blessing. I will accept prayers and positive vibes sent my way too.
To reopen this center, I need funds to:
* Secure the building
* Clean, update, and renovate the inside of the building
* Landscaping and updating the outdoor playground
* Hire and train staff
* Meet updated licensing and safety requirements
* Purchase essential supplies and learning materials
* Create a new logo for branding, marketing, and social media pages
Once I get the building and start the cleaning and renovating process, I will adjust the amount to help with continuing costs until everything is complete and the center has officially opened.
The center will have a new name and while I have one in mind, I am open to other suggestions!
I will also share updates through this page as well as my social media pages, so you can see the progress once we get this going!
labels: Smile, Chin, Cheek, Happiness, Eyebrow

title: Help AJ Santavy keep his business for the kids
description:
My son is a co-owner of a soccer business.
Currently he is going through a legal dispute with his business partners who are trying to push him out of a company that he helped create while spending countless hours, labor, giving up personal time, sleep, etc to get it to the point where it is today.
His goal was to create a place were kids and young adults could come and train and share in the love of the sport of soccer. At the same time to teach them life lessons not only on the field but off the field. Along with doing things to help the local communities was going to be another goal of his that has been stopped short during this legal battle.
During the short time that his business has been open the last 2 1/2 years he has not only helped develop kids and young adults into better soccer players on the field and off the field. He has also been there for those who were struggling mentally by simply just listening and helping them and their families during some difficult times.
Currently he is struggling to help cover the bills of the business to keep the doors open and legal costs to keep up the fight.
Every contribution big or small helps give him a fighting chance to stand up for himself and to get chis business back.
If you can’t donate please share this link with others, to support fairness, integrity and small business owners who refused to give up.
Thank you for your kindness and support it truly means more than words can say.
labels: Orange, Graphics

title: Build Vegan Heat's Permanent Home with Rene
description:
Hey family, it’s Rene from Vegan Heat — and y’all already know the pressure when it comes to our food
For the past few years, I’ve been grinding in shared kitchens and pop-ups all over the DFW area, serving dishes like our Fried Chicken Sandwiches, Rasta Pasta, and Chopped BBQ Rib Sandwich — all made with love, culture, and heat.
Now, it’s time for the next step: our own home base in Dallas.
This space will let me:
•	Cook more consistently and expand the menu
•	Cut wait times for online orders
•	Offer pickup, catering, and private dining more often
•	Keep creating new vegan food that hits like comfort food should
The goal is to raise $5000+ to help with:
•	First month’s location deposit
•	Kitchen equipment and setup
•	City of Dallas permits and fees
•	Basic renovations to get the space ready
If you’ve ever pulled up for a plate, shared a post, or told somebody “you gotta try Vegan Heat,” — this next move is for us.
Every donation, big or small, helps build something permanent that represents our community, culture, and love for this food.
Let’s make Dallas the official home of Vegan Heat.
Thank you for believing, sharing, and supporting — always.
With love and heat,
– Rene

title: Run 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
This October, I’m running 100 miles for the American Cancer Society.
Cancer has left a lasting mark on my family. My mom passed away from lung cancer at just 48, even though she never smoked a day in her life. My mother-in-law fought through multiple battles with breast cancer, and my aunt is thankfully a survivor.
Every mile I run is in their honor and for everyone who has been touched by this disease. For the families who have stood beside them. For the doctors, nurses, and caregivers who are true angels on earth.
If you’d like to support my run and the mission of the American Cancer Society, please consider donating through the link below. Every contribution, big or small, helps fund research, support patients, and bring us closer to a world without cancer.

title: Transform Lives: Support Organizing With Kayla
description:
Hello! My name is Kayla, and I am the owner of Organizing With Kayla. I’m a professional organizer, cleaner, and interior designer with a passion for helping people transform their homes into supportive, peaceful, and functional spaces. Over the years, I’ve worked with many individuals and families, including those who are neurodivergent, living with chronic pain, or navigating mental health challenges. My goal is always to create spaces that ease stress, promote independence, and bring a sense of calm.
Why I’m Raising Funds
I believe that everyone deserves to live in a home that supports their well-being—no matter their financial situation. Unfortunately, many low-income individuals and families cannot afford professional organizing and design services, even though these services can make a life-changing difference.
This fundraiser will help bridge that gap. All donations will go directly toward providing free or reduced-cost organizing, cleaning, and design services for low-income clients in my community as well as out of state individuals. The funds will cover essential supplies, travel expenses, and the time and care it takes to transform each home into a safe and welcoming space.
The Impact
Your support does more than organize a home—it restores dignity, reduces daily stress, and helps people feel proud of where they live. With your help, I can make sure that financial hardship never stands in the way of someone having a home that truly supports their mental health, physical needs, and quality of life.
Thank you for helping me bring hope, comfort, and transformation to those who need it most.

title: Help The Serene Scene Spa Thrive and Expand
description:
When we first opened The Serene Scene Spa Lounge, we wanted to create more than just a spa—we wanted to build a safe space where people could pause, breathe, and pour back into themselves.
We started with a dream and our own hard-earned money, funding everything out of our pockets because we believed in the vision. No investors. No grants. No outside funding. Just faith, determination, and the willingness to work.
Along the way, we’ve faced the real challenges of being small business owners: the rising costs of keeping our doors open, the long nights after our full-time jobs, and the constant push to grow while making sure our employees have opportunities too.
But we never gave up. We’ve hired talented team members who now rely on us for income. We’ve built a community of clients who trust us with their self-care. And we know this is only the beginning of what The Serene Scene can become.
Now, we’re at a turning point. We have the passion, we have the talent, and we have the foundation—but what we’re missing is the guidance and marketing power to push us forward. That’s why
we’re raising $4,500 to invest in:
• Mentorship ($2,500 for 8 weeks + $1,500 for a 2-day in-person training) to give us the strategies and structure to make this business sustainable long-term.
• Marketing ($500 for Google Ads) to help new clients find us and keep revenue flowing.
This isn’t just about keeping a spa open—it’s about building something that lasts. A place where beauty professionals can thrive, where clients can recharge, and where the community can feel cared for.
We’re asking for your support—whether it’s $1, $10, or even just sharing this fundraiser.
Every single contribution helps us get one step closer to stability, growth, and impact.
Thank you for being part of our story. With your help,
The Serene Scene
can continue to grow into the wellness hub we know it’s meant to be.

title: Donate to Ava's Vision: Kava Queen Expansion
description:
Aloha friends, family, and community,
My name is Ava, and I’m the heart behind Kava Queen—a space where people come together to relax, connect, and experience the grounding traditions of kava. We started small, sharing a shop, learning as we went, and pouring our love into every cup. Now, it’s time for the next chapter: a standalone kava bar at the silos!
This move means:
✨ A space that’s just ours for gatherings, music, and cultural events
✨ Extended hours so you can see us in the daytime
✨ A full menu of traditional kava, creative kava drinks, and other drink options!!!
✨ A community hub that honors Pacific Island traditions while welcoming everyone
Opening this new space takes resources—furnishings, permits, supplies, and a build-out that matches the dream in my heart. As a small, independent business owner, I can’t do it alone. As fun and amazing my first year at the silos has been, it has also taken a tax on my mental & physical health. The bar never really got to a place where it was thriving. I have seven carpool tunnel in both of my hands and am just absolutely exhausted. I cannot wait to open during the day time as I feel it will life changing for my business. I love you all so much and am so grateful.
Your donation will help us create a warm, welcoming kava bar that celebrates culture, connection, and community.

title: Donate to Denisia Ealy's Relocation for News Producer Role
description:
Hello everyone,
My name is Denisia Ealy, and I’m a proud recent graduate of the University of North Texas where I earned my degree in Media Arts with a minor in Marketing. During my time at UNT, I had the honor of serving as Secretary of the Exquisite Eta Alpha Chapter of Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc. and as Director of Marketing for the Professional Women’s Council (2024–2025).
Since graduation, I’ve poured my energy into building a producer’s portfolio to launch my career in broadcast media. After many rejections and months of hard work, I’m excited to share that I’ve been offered a position at News On 6 in Tulsa, Oklahoma as a Producer!
This opportunity is a dream come true and the first step into my professional career. However, moving out of Texas on my own comes with financial challenges. I’m asking for donations to help cover moving costs, housing expenses, and everyday essentials as I relocate to Tulsa by October 10, 2025.
Any contribution, no matter the size, will help me start this next chapter with stability and confidence. I’m grateful for your support, prayers, and encouragement as I step into this new journey.
Thank you for believing in me,
Denisia Ealy

title: Support Domenico's Recovery and Caffe Paradiso
description:
On the late afternoon of June 27th, Domenico was attacked in front of his restaurant, Caffe Paradiso, in Brentwood. It resulted in a concussion and several bruises on his shoulder and ribs. Domenico now suffers from post-concussion syndrome, severe eye pain, headaches, dizziness, among other symptoms. Due to this incident, Domenico was forced to close the business for a week, leading to a significant loss of his supplies and earnings. He reopened under restricted duties, requiring his current employee to work more hours, which comes at an additional cost. Many have suggested creating a GoFundMe to help him recover his losses. He listened.
Over the years, Domenico has become an indispensable part of the community. His love of people and his desire to delight them with great food have been the foundation of Caffe Paradiso, also referred to as a second home by many of his customers. It all started during the pandemic, when he was looking for a location to open his new restaurant, that is when fell for that “paradise” view. Hence, Caffe Paradiso. He ran larger restaurants in different places around East Bay, but never something that intimate. It was perfect for him. He made it a great environment for interpersonal relationships to flourish. Many customers became his close friends. Yet, in these difficult times, he needs some support.
If you’re able, please consider donating or sharing this fundraiser with your friends and family. You can also always stop by to show your support. He’ll deeply appreciate your help.
Your generosity will help cover:
Inventory loss / food supplies
Increased staff hours to lighten Domenico’s workload.
Utility bills
labels: Eyewear, Eyebrow, Glasses, Vision Care, Jaw

title: Help donate to ChinChin-Support Sabrinas Family
description:
Hello to everyone, my name's Sabrina Gao.
I woke up to my mother running around on a phone call saying, "Are you serious? I'm on the way." As a curious girl, I took my sister with me and drove to her restaurant at 2 in the morning.
My family is devastated.
She has owned her restaurant for around 15-16 years, The place was around for 30 years. It makes me sad to think about how my mom feels. I've grown up without my dad around, so my mom would always take me and my siblings to ChinChin to watch after us since she didn't want us to be home alone.
I would really like to surprise her and try to help her rebuild everything.
She is lost right now without a clue on what to do. Lots of people lost their jobs today, but my family and I lost our homes today.
labels: Thigh, Jean shorts, Vacation, Calf, Dusk

title: Support Wolves & People's New Newberg Taproom & Venue
description:
HELP US EXPAND WOLVES & PEOPLE
Friends, if you've followed our 10-year journey from scrappy, born-in-a-barn startup, you'll know we've faced obstacles from the dreadful wind & rain variety (ice storms) to neighbors dragging us into court and perhaps worst of all, the beloved brewhouse that gave up the ghost in 2024, causing an 8-month production shutdown.
The recent closure of Benjamin Rd. has been one of the hardest. Traffic to the brewery has dropped off. Benjamin is closed forever. The alternate route will wind through condos at Crestview. Or, the 3 mile detour we are all using now.
So many good breweries are closing, but we do not intend to go down the same path.
We launched this brewery 10 years ago with heart pounding support from friends, family, and passionate beer fans before we even really started construction, and it's time for us to do it again.
IN OUR NEW DOWNTOWN NEWBERG LOCATION. Yep. A 2nd spot!
THE PLANS
It's go time. This fall we plan to open a 2nd location in downtown Newberg where we can present not only our award-winning beers but also delicious food, cocktails (eventually), wines, ciders, NA, plus (drumroll, please), really good, amplified LIVE MUSIC.
None of those things beyond beer tasting are currently allowed at the farm on a regular basis. But with the continued success of Thursday bluegrass nights and the Newgrass Festival, which is scheduled to return in mid-March 2026, the timing feels right.
It is one of the very coolest, and as-yet-unknown spaces in town, a refurbished 1940s auto shop on Meridian, just around the corner from Rosmarino, the food card pod, and other East end favorites. It's also owned by the good folks behind The 1888, vintage apartments in Newberg's oldest building (which is attached to the one I'm describing), home of the Newberg Graphic and the first bank in town (and future home of an area chef's fine dining establishment - details when can share!). As history buffs, we practically fell in love before we even saw the place. Then we walked in.... and WOW. Think weathered wood rafters, faded paint, glinting sunlight, antique green lamp shades like we have already. It's a natural extension of what we love about the barn where all this started a decade and 300+ recipes ago.
If things continue on track, we will be grand-opening this addition to Newberg
this November
. At that point, the farm's tasting area will be buttoned up this and every winter (at least until Spring when Newgrass season rolls back around), available for private rentals and occasional one-offs.
WE CAN'T WAIT! With our relationships in the music industry (including the curators of Pickathon), we can bring Newberg and the valley a venue that will reverberate with great music all year round. And yes, we'll have the full gamut of W&P beers, plus guest beers, cans, bottles, and merch to go.
THE COST & HOW THE MONEY WILL BE SPENT
It's substantial, and coming off the last two years we've faced, no small task. We have some funding but need more. Donations go directly to me on behalf of the brewery.
In addition to permitting and moving costs for a ton of gear, we'll install custom cold storage, optimal draft equipment, bar amenities, stage/sound/lighting gear, paint, artworks, furniture, myriad functional items for the spot itself, making it feel like a true extension of W&P from day one. (All beermaking stays on the farm by the way).
The initial goal is $16,000, which could help the walk in part especially, but we will need to go well beyond that investment wise to make it all work the way it should.
STRETCH GOAL
Because the Benjamin road closure is never going away, we also do need to fix that ASAP for the sake of the business now and in the future. It does not seem the city, county, or developers responsible for the closure feel like pitching in. But with your help, we can plan to work with local excavators to build 550' of gravel road from 99W to the barn on the Eastern perimeter of the property, which is fairly difficult-to-farm, sloped orchard that would better serve as a driveway. (While the city/county will open a paved route through the new "Crestview Crossing" neighborhood that comes closer, it's a bit convoluted.) Estimated costs are coming together, but it won't be a cent under $25K, maybe double that. This is heavy excavation work. But we know how to get it done. This is secondary to getting the new location going.
Per GoFundMe’s Terms of Service (
https://www.gofundme.com/terms
), GoFundMe is not responsible for any offers, promises, rewards or promotions made or offered on GoFundMe fundraisers.
To learn more, go to our website,
www.wolvesandpeople.com.
Thank you!
labels: Facial hair, Dress shirt

title: Help Build an App to Support Communication
description:
Every day, I see autistic children and their families facing barriers to communication.  As a speech-language pathologist, I’ve learned firsthand, how important it is to slow down, lean in,  and listen.  The more I listen and respond this way, the more the children - and I - grow in connection, confidence, and communication.
Too often, the responsibility for change falls unfairly on autistic people and others who communicate in ways that may not be typical.  As Damian Milton’s Double Empathy Problem reminds us, communication is a two-way street.  Therapists, parents, and society all share responsibility for adapting so that everyone can be understood.  But right now, even with our best efforts, it’s often difficult and time-consuming for families and professionals to truly understand the unique ways children communicate.
That’s why I’m developing a mobile app designed to help caregivers and speech therapists interpret children’s natural communication patterns and adapt their own styles to support growth.  This project is rooted in a neurodiversity-affirming mindset and celebrates children’s authentic voices while fostering collaboration between parents and professionals.
To bring this vision to life, I need to raise $10,000 for the research and development phase.  This is the critical first step before applying for a larger grant from the National Institutes of Health.
Please consider donating and sharing this campaign. Every dollar truly makes a difference and can support building a future where communication is shared, equitable, and inclusive, and every child’s voice is heard and celebrated.
#sowvibrantlyreapvibrantly

title: Keep Chicago's Sweet Treats Alive
description:
Hi, my name is Lametria, and I’m the proud owner of a small cupcake bakery here in Chicago called Greater Baking at 2300 E. 71st Street!
Our bakery has always been about more than just sweets—it’s about community, joy, and bringing people together through delicious cupcakes and cookies.
Recently, our brand-new Blodgett oven suddenly stopped heating, leaving us unable to bake the treats our customers know and love. Unfortunately, the cost to replace it is more than we can afford at this time, and without it, our little bakery can’t run the way it should.
We’re asking for help to raise $13,000 so we can purchase a new oven and get back to doing what we love—baking fresh, delicious goodies for our neighborhood. Any amount, big or small, would mean the world to us and help us keep our doors open and our ovens warm.
Thank you so much for supporting small businesses like ours and for helping us continue spreading sweetness in Chicago.
labels: Eyewear, Glasses, Vision Care, Happiness, Smile

title: Help Big Splash Swim School Reopen
description:
For eight years, Big Splash Swim School has been dedicated to saving lives and spreading the joy of swimming. Since 2017, we’ve taught hundreds of students — from infants to grandparents, including children with disabilities and autism — how to survive, thrive, and fall in love with the water. In 2022, we found a home at a facility in Katy, TX, where our mission of drowning prevention and water confidence continued to grow. Families from every background joined us to learn, and our students became living proof that with patience, guidance, and practice, everyone can learn to swim.
This spring, our journey took an unexpected turn. The facility we’d been using closed suddenly, leaving us without a pool almost overnight. As we worked to find a solution, life delivered even more challenges: I was rushed to the hospital for emergency surgery, Coach Rudy became seriously ill, and my wife and I faced the heartbreak of a miscarriage. Despite these hardships, we refused to stop. By God’s grace, we kept teaching this summer using our apartment pool and an outdoor community pool. Weather delays and limited space made it tough, but thanks to the families who stood by us, we built momentum that we are determined to carry forward into our own facility.
Drowning is one of the leading causes of accidental death in children, yet it is 100% preventable with the right education. We believe swimming isn’t just a sport — it’s a life skill every person deserves. Our classes serve babies, toddlers, parents, competitive swimmers, and children with disabilities through adaptive programs. With your help, we can secure a permanent indoor pool, purchase training tools and adaptive equipment, offer scholarships, and expand our special needs programs. Every donation moves us closer to building a safe, inclusive swim school where everyone is welcomed and supported. Please donate, share, and help us make a Big Splash again. Together, we can keep our community safe, strong, and swimming.
labels: Swimming pool, Recreation, Leisure, Resort, Fun

title: Donate to Pickleball for Parkinson’s
description:
Pickleball for Parkinson’s Is Becoming a Nonprofit — and the Celebration Starts with You
All proceeds support our free weekly clinics for people with Parkinson’s, our expansion to new locations, and a contribution to the Michael J. Fox Foundation.
What does it mean to keep showing up?
For people living with Parkinson’s, showing up means facing the morning stiffness, the trembling hand, the frustration of a body that doesn’t always follow instructions — and coming anyway. It means stepping onto a court not knowing if your balance will cooperate, but trusting that someone will be there to steady you if it doesn’t. That someone will
see
you.
Pickleball for Parkinson’s
started with a few people, a few paddles, and a lot of hope. It’s grown into something rare: a space where joy and difficulty coexist, where every missed shot is met with encouragement, and every small win is celebrated like a championship point.
.
All proceeds go toward:
* Weekly clinics for people living with Parkinson’s
* Equipment, court space, and volunteer support
* Expansion to more locations across NYC
* Contributions to the
Michael J. Fox Foundation
for Parkinson’s research
If you’ve ever play
ed at one of our clinics, you know what makes it different: the feeling that no one’s alone out there. That every person matters. That showing up is the win.
So come play. Come laugh.
And if the experience moves you — like it has for so many — come back.
Be a partner. Be a volunteer. Be part of something built to outlast us all.
Donate. Rally. Return.
#PickleballForParkinsons
#RallyToZero
#0-0-2LetsGo

title: Gavi’s Running 100
description:
In October of 2004, my little brother was declared Cancer Free after three years of treatment for leukemia. It’s been 21 years since that day, so it feels like a really wonderful time to celebrate that he’s now healthy, happy, and a great dad to my sweet little niece.
The three years of treatment were also a really challenging time for my family, but I’m pleased to say we all made it through and maybe we’re stronger for it, or at least better at washing our hands ;)
I'm running 100 miles throughout the month of October to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer.
ACS has a platinum rating on GuideStar (the highest possible), so give with confidence! Please consider making a donation because every little bit helps. Thank you for your support!

title: Help Smokin’ Dutchman BBQ: Donate Now
description:
Help Save Smokin’ Dutchman BBQ
We never imagined we’d be here—our savings gone, homes refinanced, and now facing shutoff notices just to keep the lights on. After seven years of serving Kalamazoo with pride, we’re at risk of losing everything. We achieved our goal of paying the utilities, now we need to chip away at our back rent of $40,000.  Smokin’ Dutchman BBQ would love to cater your events, feed your family and friends and ultimately give back to our community's non-profits.
But we believe in a God who restores, and with your help, this story doesn’t have to end here.
In 2018, we opened our doors with nothing but hope, excitement, and a whole lot of smoked meat. From day one, it’s been about giving back—donating catering for school auctions, supporting local sports teams, putting ads in school plays. If the community asked, we said “yes.” Always with a smile. Because for us, it has always been about serving people first.
But today, Smokin’ Dutchman BBQ is at a critical crossroads. Without immediate help, our future is in jeopardy.
Here’s how you can help keep Smokin’ Dutchman alive:
✅Donate to help us catch up on rent and utilities.
✅Dine with us and bring your family and friends.
✅Hire us to cater your next event—from tailgates to weddings, we’re here to serve.
✅Share this story so more people in Kalamazoo know what’s at stake.
This hardship stems from pre-petition debt tied to our former three expansion stores, which we closed in order to restructure and provide financial strength moving forward to negotiate with our creditors. These debts are not from our current restaurant but remain tied to us.  If our luck couldn't get any worse, we had a grease fire at the restaurant on May 17th, which forced us to close and remediate for almost 2 months.
The difficulties began under the Dickey’s BBQ Pit franchise. As reported in the New York Times (June 3, 2025), Dickey’s exploited owners through hidden costs, threats, and unprofitable business models. Like so many others, we poured our retirement into staying afloat, only to find ourselves buried under debt, legal threats that arrived more often than birthday cards, and stress no family should ever carry.
We filed Chapter 11 bankruptcy—only to learn it’s expensive to tell people you don’t have money. So, we exited it, choosing instead to take the hard road: working with creditors directly and negotiating to pay back what we can. It’s not the easy way, but it’s the right way. It’s how we were raised—to work hard, to respect others, and to honor God by doing the right thing.
On June 13, 2025, we became proudly independent: Smokin’ Dutchman BBQ.
And here’s what this fight is really about: people.
✅Megan, our Pit Master, who will one day share in ownership because she believes in what we’re building—alongside her daughter and niece who work with her.
✅John, who dreams of one day opening his own place, and his niece, whom he gets to work with every day.
✅The high school students who got their first jobs with us and came back to work summers after college.
✅Our own children, who worked in the restaurant knowing they were helping their parents hold onto a dream.
This has always been about community, opportunity, and creating something bigger than ourselves. We’ve called Kalamazoo home for more than 50 years, and we want to keep giving back to the city that has given us so much.
Our vision for Smokin’ Dutchman BBQ is to bless this community even more:
✅A community platform where local families can showcase their backyard BBQ recipes and share them with Kalamazoo.
✅A catering program that not only feeds events but also helps inspire and mentor new food entrepreneurs—supporting the next generation of local restaurants and food trucks.
✅Locally sourced food—from Michigan-raised meats and Jack's Blend Rubs in Hudsonville, to baked goods from Schultz Sweets.
✅A BBQ menu that honors tradition while adding new twists—featuring a local family’s backyard BBQ every month.
That’s our dream. But right now? We need help just to survive.
Every single dollar, every meal purchased, every event catered, every prayer, and every share makes a difference. Together, we can keep the pits burning at Smokin’ Dutchman BBQ, spark the next wave of Kalamazoo’s food entrepreneurs, and show the power of a God who restores.
We believe the best is still ahead.
Thank you for your love, kindness, prayers, and support through these past 7 years.
— The Smokin’ Dutchman BBQ Family
labels: Automotive Exterior, Automotive Parking Light, Automotive Tail & Brake Light, Restaurant, Luxury vehicle

title: Help Crownz Heavenly Palace Open Its First Medical Office
description:
Hello, my name is **Mikaelah Grant**, and I am the proud founder of **Crownz Heavenly Palace** — a business rooted in compassion, empowerment, and restoration. As a **Cranial Prosthesis Specialist**, I am dedicating my career to supporting individuals experiencing medical hair loss due to conditions such as alopecia, chemotherapy treatments, and other health-related challenges.
Up until now, I have been serving my clients virtually — providing consultations and education on cranial prosthesis for medical hair loss , and emotional support from a distance. While this has been effective, I am incredibly excited to share that I’ve been offered an amazing opportunity to take the next step: opening a **physical medical office space** where I can serve patients **in person** alongside a growing, supportive team.
This office space will allow us to:
* **Offer private, safe, and welcoming consultations** for clients who need one-on-one support.
* **Properly fit and style cranial prosthetics** in a hands-on setting with full privacy and care.
* **Build confidence and emotional support** through a more personal, face-to-face experience.
* **Host community support events and educational sessions** for patients and their families.
* **Accept medical insurance**, making services more accessible to those in need.
* **Serve our veterans**, who deserve the highest level of care and dignity in their healing journey.
However, to bring this vision to life, I need your help.
The opportunity is here, but the **funds are not readily available**. I am currently seeking financial support to cover the **initial down payment and first month’s rent** for this medical office. This space represents more than just a building — it is a **safe haven** where patients can feel whole again, where healing meets hope, and where every person can walk out feeling crowned in confidence.
With your donation, no matter the size, you are helping me and my team make a lasting impact in the lives of those who need it most. You’re not just funding a space — you’re **helping people reclaim their identity, dignity, and beauty**.
This is just the beginning of something truly powerful, and with your help, **Crownz Heavenly Palace** will soon open its doors to provide even greater care, compassion, and transformation.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for believing in me and the mission of Crownz Heavenly Palace. Let’s build this palace together.
With gratitude,
**Mikaelah Grant**
Founder, Cranial Prosthesis Specialist
*Crownz Heavenly Palace*

title: Don’t Let Draper Lose Pier 49 Pizza!
description:
After 30+ wonderful years in Draper, our family business has lost its lease.
This is a bittersweet moment, but we are not giving up. We love Draper, and we want to stay right here in the community that has supported us for so long. We’re working hard to move into a new building so we can continue everything that makes Pier 49 special—our fresh sourdough pizza, our bingo nights, and the many memories we’ve shared with all of you.
Brad and Antje, the heart of Pier 49,
have poured their love and dedication into this restaurant. They don’t want to lose what they’ve built—and with your help, they don’t have to.
Pier 49 has always been more than pizza.
We’ve hosted school tours where kids could make their own pizzas, celebrated birthdays and other milestones, participated in Draper Days bingo, worked with 93.3 The Bull, catered for Alta and Corner Canyon High Schools and other local businesses, and supported countless charity and fundraiser events. Serving and giving back to this community has always been at the heart of what we do.
We’ve also been blessed with the best employees
—people who care deeply about their work and the guests they serve. Our good name has grown because of them, and because of each and everyone of you.
Every donation, big or small, will help us keep Pier 49 alive in Draper.
If you aren’t able to donate, sharing this page with your friends, family, and neighbors means the world to us. Together, we can keep Pier 49 going for many more years.
Stay connected with us on Social Media for updates:
Instagram:
pier49sourdoughpizzadraper
Facebook:
Pier 49 Pizza Draper
TikTok:
pier49pizzadraperut
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for your support. We wouldn’t be here without you. ❤️

description:
I'm excited to share that I've been accepted into the 11-day Living Sport business program, where I'll get the chance to learn about the business side of sports at the Super Bowl. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to gain hands-on business training
, network with professionals in the industry, and take the next step toward my dream of a career in sports business.
The program does come with significant costs, and I would be so grateful for any support in helping me make this dream a reality. Thank you for your generosity and for helping me with this journey.

We just replaced our entire AC system for $14,000 (no help from our landlord)

title: Save Heavy Cardboard from Demolition!
description:
Hey y'all. I'm Edward Uhler and I run
Heavy Cardboard
, a YouTube channel and podcast that teaches, plays, and discusses medium and heavy board games. I've been hosting the show for 11 years total and running it as my full-time job for about 8 of those years. Over the life of the show, we have produced over 2,000 videos and podcasts for the board gaming hobby.
The studio is located just outside of Boston, Massachusetts, in the town of Wakefield. Recently, I have been informed that the building is scheduled for demolition and that we need to be out by September 1st.
This was completely unexpected, and it has put me and Heavy Cardboard in quite the difficult position.
I make my living by hosting Heavy Cardboard, but while it pays the bills, it certainly does not make enough to be able to afford an unexpected teardown and move. Simply put, I can't afford to move Heavy Cardboard. The greater Boston area is, unfortunately, an expensive part of the country to live in. Moving from here isn't an option as my whole life is here (my partner & family and our game group), so here we are.
I am trying to raise a total of $19,000 which will cover the following things:
1st month's rent, Last month's rent, and the security deposit on the space
1 year's difference in rent between the current location and the new location
Moving expenses
The cost of materials to setup the new studio
Any funds above the goal will be used to upgrade the studio (lights, camera, etc).
Hosting Heavy Cardboard has been a very surreal experience, and I feel very fortunate to be able to do this on a daily basis. So while this has been a very stressful (and honestly scary) situation, I am keeping a positive attitude and hope that, with your help, Heavy Cardboard will continue.
Thank you for whatever support that you are able to provide.
****Edit: Wow, the original funding goal was met during the Kickoff Live-stream, and thru everyone's recommendations, they suggested to keep building on for upgrades to the studio & an emergency fund, so that's why the funding goal is higher than the original. Thank you all so much!***
labels: Logo, Label

title: Babes & Bellies Ghana mission 2. Making heartbeats count
description:
“Give Hope to Mothers, Life to Babies”
Babes & Bellies is heading back to Ghana to provide free ultrasounds and donate essential maternal and baby items.
When we last traveled in 2022, we performed hundreds of scans and distributed thousands of items — diapers, wipes, car seats, clothes, and more. We also performed general diagnostic ultrasounds as well to the general public.
Some of the challenges faced: no safe tables for scans, no privacy screens, and no stand for our portable machine, however, we managed to press forward. With your support, we can purchase equipment this time to ensure mothers are seen safely and with dignity.
In Ghana, 308 women die for every 100,000 live births — deaths that are often preventable with proper prenatal care and access to ultrasound.
Your donation will help us save lives, provide comfort, and bring hope to mothers and babies in need. Every gift makes a lasting difference.

title: Help Freddie Williams Continue His Legacy
description:
For over 26 years, Freddie Williams has been more than just a barber in Middletown—he has been a mentor, coach, and a community leader. Through his shop, 6 West Barber Shop, Freddie has dedicated his life to serving the people of Middletown and especially its youth.  His work extends far beyond cutting hair: he has organized programs that provide meals, toys, clothing and essential items to families in need throughout the years.
Recently, Freddie has faced difficult hardships. He is dealing with a new medical diagnosis that has raised uncertainty about his health and his ability to continue the work he loves. In addition, a serious security incident at his shop has placed even greater strain on his business. Despite these challenges, Freddie’s heart remains with the community, and his greatest wish is to continue offering support, mentorship, and safe spaces for the Middletown Community & its youth.
The funds raised through this campaign will go directly toward helping Freddie keep his doors open to the community, continue his nonprofit community outreach, and ensure that local families and children receive the care and support they’ve come to depend on.
Freddie has given so much of himself to Middletown for decades.  Now, it’s our turn to show him that his community stands behind him.  Any contribution, big or small, will help Freddie continue his mission of service, love, and resilience.

title: Save Taco Tico Claremore
description:
Taco Tico in Claremore, OK has been serving the community and visitors from surrounding states since 1962. As the owner and franchisee, I’ve dedicated 40 years of my life to this restaurant, and I’ve seen firsthand how much it means to our customers. People travel over 100 miles just to enjoy our food, and many share stories of family traditions and memories made at Taco Tico. At one time, there were over 100 Taco Tico locations nationwide, but now only 22 remain, with Claremore being one of just two in Oklahoma. Our restaurant is a gathering place for friends, families, and longtime staff who have become like family over the years.
Recently, the property owner put our building up for sale, and there’s a buyer interested in tearing down Taco Tico. I’m determined to save our restaurant and keep this piece of local history alive. The funds raised will go directly toward the down payment needed to purchase the building and secure Taco Tico’s future in Claremore. By helping us, you’re not just saving a business—you’re preserving a beloved community landmark and the memories that come with it. Your support will ensure that Taco Tico continues to serve great food and bring people together for years to come.
labels: Logo, Plastic, Sticker, Label

title: Support Retro Vixen Boutique- Where Retro Meets Community
description:
Watch a quick video about our Gofundme!
https://m.youtube.com/shorts/bYI97jnVCxQ
Thank you so much KCTV5 for the news story!
https://www.kctv5.com/2025/09/10/retro-vixen-struggles-stay-afloat-tariffs-drive-up-costs/
Thank you KMBC9 for the news story!
https://www.kmbc.com/article/retro-vixen-boutique-financial-struggles-donations/68041821
We're creating t shirts, stickers and buttons as a gift to our supporters, plus planning some special events which we will be posting!
Help Retro Vixen Boutique Continue Spreading Love and Style!
Hi, I’m Melissa Evans, the proud owner of Retro Vixen Boutique. When we opened our doors in 2010, I could never have imagined how much this little boutique would grow and evolve. What started as a space for affordable, retro-inspired fashion has blossomed into a vibrant and inclusive community. Today, we proudly serve people of all ages, sizes, genders, and backgrounds, offering unique and stylish fashion that makes everyone feel beautiful and accepted.
Retro Vixen isn’t just a store—it’s a place where customers can express their personal style and embrace who they truly are. Whether you’re shopping for vintage-inspired pieces or simply looking for something that fits your personality, we want every person who walks through our doors to feel celebrated and empowered.
But as we all know, the past few years have been tough. Since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, we’ve faced a series of financial challenges that have left us struggling to stay afloat. Here’s a glimpse of the hurdles we’ve encountered:
COVID-19: We were forced to close our doors, but we kept paying our employees and rent to support our team during this time.
Renovations: We invested thousands into upgrading the store to attract more customers, but unfortunately, we haven’t been able to recover that investment.
2024 Struggles: A 44% drop in sales last year led me to put $50,000 of my own money into keeping the boutique running.
Now, in 2025, we face even more challenges. Inflation is rising, tariffs are driving up costs, and our suppliers in the UK are raising prices.
For example, an order that used to cost $1,000 is now $1,600 due to tariffs.
This means these items will be have to be priced significantly higher- something we simply can’t justify when so many of our customers are struggling.
This is where we need your help. We’re asking for donations to:
Cover the added costs of tariffs so we can keep prices affordable.
Replenish our inventory so we can continue offering the styles you love.
Pay off existing small business loans and operating expenses, including rent, payroll, and bills. We’ve had to cut back on staff hours, but with your support, we hope to reinstate those hours and get our team back to full strength.
Retro Vixen has always been a community-focused business, and we believe that with your help, we can continue to be a space where everyone feels welcome and stylish. Your support will make a world of difference, and we are so incredibly grateful for anything you can contribute.
Thank you for being part of this journey with us. We couldn’t do it without you.
Some reviews from our customers that make us want to show up each and every day!
I started off as a shy curious shopper from St. Joe, I've grown to be one of Retro Vixen's biggest supporters. The level of comfort and safety you feel when you walk in the store is unmatched. You're home, and you're seen. Body positivity is a big deal here, and these ladies have seen me through all my changes. They support the LGBTQIA+ and Black Lives Matter communities, and are everything we should strive to be in the female empowerment community - build each other up, don't tear each other down. Their new secondhand clothing program is also amazing. About 80% of my wardrobe & accessories are from Retro Vixen, and I'm proud to have morphed from a shy, curious shopper into a full on supportive friend that's even modeled a little for them!
My first visit to Retrovixen was in 2018, just after ending a really long and hard relationship. Jess, greeted me with a big “hello darling” and offered assistance right away. I was nervous because I had never been in a store like that and felt like maybe I didn’t belong. But Jess made me feel welcome. She helped me pick out my first dress, that I still own and wear frequently.
Now, shopping at retrovixen is like home. I have gotten to know Jess, Melissa and the other sweet women who pick up shifts from time to time. Retrovixen has been more than a store for me. Retrovixen gives back. They give back by sometimes donating proceeds to good causes. They are extremely vocal about their commitment to diversity and inclusion. They have even helped me out when my dog was nearly dying.
Their smiles and friendly hellos are genuine. Of course, I can’t forget the adorable unique pieces they have. They sell a lot of pinup and rockabilly style pieces that I adore. They have the funnest earrings!! And recently they started to buy and sell second hand pieces.
I love this shop and will always support them as best as I can!
Retro Vixen has been a hot pink sanctuary over the years. My relationship with my body has always been complicated and my weight has fluctuated due to disordered eating and diet culture. Though my body has changed, Jess and Melissa have always been supportive and helped experiment with my style. I’m so grateful that I have a healthier relationship with food and my body, and the role Retro Vixen played in my journey has been invaluable! They’ve helped me celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, job promotions, and days that end in Y. Retro Vixen isn’t just a store, it’s a community and for me it was a lifeline, and no trip to KC is complete without a stop.
labels: Facial expression, Cartoon, Poster, Illustration, Animation

title: Help Replace My Stolen Detailing Trailer
description:
My name is Jesus, and I’ve been running my own mobile auto detailing business for about four years. I started this journey because I wanted to provide for myself and offer the same level of care I give my own car to others in my community. My business has allowed me to help people who truly care about their vehicles but don’t always have the time to keep them clean. For many of my clients, having their car detailed is one less thing to worry about in their busy lives.
Unfortunately, my detailing trailer was stolen early Thursday morning. The trailer carried all the equipment and products I need to serve my clients, including power tools, cleaning supplies, and specialized detailing gear. Without these tools, I haven’t been able to work, and it’s been a major setback for my main source of income.
I’m raising funds to replace my trailer and the essential equipment so I can get back to helping my clients and supporting myself. Every contribution will go directly toward purchasing the tools and products I need to restart my business. Your support will make a real difference in helping me recover and continue providing quality service to my community.
labels: Tire, Motor vehicle, Automotive Tire, Automotive Exterior, Automotive Wheel System

title: Save Russkull's Comics: A Community Effort
description: My name is Russell Scrufari and I am the owner of Russkull's Comics and Collectibles, 45 East Avenue Lockport. In February 2023 I had a tumor removed at Roswell Park and was diagnosed with lung cancer. Thank God they caught it early; it was contained and they got it out. I have been a comic book collector for over 40 years and was devastated when my favorite comic book store Pulp 716 was closing the end of October 2023. It was always my dream to open my own comic book store so I looked into leasing the building that Pulp 716 had used. I started leasing the property January 1, 2024 and March 31, 2024 was the grand opening of Russkull's Comics and Collectibles. So many customers commented they were so glad that I reopened as a comic book store. It has been great interacting with customers who shared my passion for comic books. The store also participated in the Easter Trail down Main Street in Lockprt and the Downtown Trick or Treat where we handed out candy and free comic books. Both events were huge turnouts and it was great getting involved with the community. In November 2024 Roswell Park found a new tumor in my other lung. They removed it and it was cancerous but again contained. The store lost business when it was closed while I had surgery and when we had shorter hours while I was recovering. On April 5, 2025 the store celebrated our One Year Anniversary. On April 19, 2025 we started selling bubble tea which was very popular with Pulp 716. This brought in a whole bunch of new customers who commented that they were glad we brought back the bubble tea. Then in June 2025 our distributor, Diamond Comics, went bankrupt and could not fill July orders and stopped delivering new comics by the end of June. The store lost business during the time we did not receive our new weekly comics while we switched to a new distributor. We are finally back on track with our weekly deliveries but business has been very slow. We will not be able to to stay in business without some help. I have no other resources available and am appealing to the community and comic book lovers everywhere. I really feel that Russkull's Comics and Collectibles is a vital resource being the only comic book store in Niagara County. My goal is to raise $5,000 to get caught up with bills and rent. I would also like to purchase more product to expand our bubble tea menu along with some tables and chairs to make the customers more comfortable. The store has over 250 followers on Facebook and if each one donates $10 we will be half way to our goal. We really need everyone's help to keep our small shop alive. So many customers have commented on how much they like our store. It would break my heart to lose my dream and have to close. PLEASE DON'T LET THAT HAPPEN!! Thank you for your generosity and support.
labels: Advertising, Poster, Logo, Banner, Graphic design
