title: Run 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
I'm running 100 miles to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer. This is a very meaningful cause for me. I lost my grandmother before I was ever able to make any memories of her, and my Uncle Ken was taken before I could truly appreciate the man he was. I dream that down the line these donations may not only benefit the well being of patients with cancer, but but the many people that they influence through their strength and persistence one of the most hellish battles known to man.
I am an inexperienced runner. This may be difficult for me to complete, but I will complete it. Because when my uncle was reaching the point of death, he always managed to have a smile on his face. Not only that, but he still managed to make others laugh, even though he was facing more pain than could be imaginable. He taught me a lot in his last year of life, but most importantly he taught me that you are not a product of your circumstances. Its all about mindset.
Your donations go to an amazing cause to fight against cancer, and help those who are fighting against it. You don't have to donate much, but every penny helps.
I will be matching the first $500 worth of donations

title: Hat & Heart Farm Needs Help! 6th Generation Family Farm
description:
Will you help save a sixth generation family farm?
The Ottmer family has been feeding communities in our hill country since 1855, when Governor Sam Houston signed their 1000 acre land grant on the edge of Fredericksburg. 170 years later, 6th generation farmer Bradley Ottmer has been farming his 93 acres where he was born and raised, driving his first tractor at age 5! "OPA's farm" was its name, now called Hat & Heart Farm. Here he and his parents have provided tons of vegetables, meat goats, turkeys, and currently 1000 chickens.
Bradley sells his organic foods at local farmer's markets and supplies restaurants - including the fabulous Leaning Pear.
Last May a powerful storm tore the tin roof off of his barn which then smashed into his large greenhouse and destroyed it. Since then, he has been growing his crops in the field, but needs the greenhouse for fall and winter plantings.
Bradley found a suitable used greenhouse to purchase, however he needs $6500 plus the help of some willing folks to move it and get it set up.
Check out their beautiful website to see what they contribute to our food supply!
https://www.hatandheart.com
labels: Greenhouse, Garden, Leaf vegetable, Plantation, Agriculture

title: Building Lifestyle for our community
description:
FitForLife Ohio Fitness & Lifestyle Center
A Female-Owned Wellness & Empowerment Facility
Our Mission
At FitForLife Ohio, we are more than a gym. We are a lifestyle center; a collaborative space designed for trainers, wellness professionals and community members.
Our mission is to strengthen the physical, mental and emotional health of our east side community through fitness, entrepreneurship, and lifestyle education.
Why We Need Your Support
We are nearly ready to open our doors. However, before the City of Whitehall grants occupancy approval, a few required renovations and safety upgrades must be completed.
Project Breakdown – $30,500 Needed
Seal & Stripe Parking Lot (36 spaces) – $12,000
Exterior Signage (Black Awning) – $7,500
Commercial Garage Door Installation – $5,500
Security System (cameras & alarms) – $5,500
Total Required: $30,500
Your support directly funds these improvements so we can open safely, legally and with the visibility needed to serve our community.
Transparency & Resilience
“We lead this journey with honesty as one of the keys to connecting directly to our vital communityLike many entrepreneurs, we trusted a local contractor who came across as reputable but failed to deliver as promised. This caused delays and unexpected costs.
While setbacks can discourage others, at FitForLife Ohio, we see them as reminders of why accountability and integrity are the foundation of our work. Every dollar contributed will go directly towards approved city requirements—so this facility can effectively serve the community it was built for.
Why Partner With Us
As a Black female-owned lifestyle facility, FitForLife Ohio is a platform of empowerment. This project is more than a fitness center; it’s a community movement that uplifts people through health, opportunity, and education.
By collaborating with us, you are investing in:
Group fitness for all ages
️ Personal & group weight training
Senior fitness programs supporting independence & mobility
Youth sports conditioning that builds discipline & confidence
Mental health & stress management workshops
❤️ Adaptive programs for chronic health- prenatel programs needs and inclusive wellness
Collaboration Opportunities
We welcome:
Nonprofit partnerships to co-create wellness programs.
B2B collaborations for community outreach.
Advertisement opportunities for branding and visibility inside the Lifestyle Center.
(Examples: dedication of space, program sponsorship, branded wellness events.)
Together We Build Stronger Communities
FitForLife Ohio is founded on collaboration, not competition. With your support, we can create a facility where trainers thrive, families grow stronger, and communities are empowered.
✨ Join us in opening the doors to a healthier, stronger, and more united east side community.
FitForLife Ohio Fitness & Lifestyle Center – Whitehall, OH 43213
Thank you so much, for allowing me to share our Journey
#FitForLife #forevereverfreefitness #community #WhitehallCommunity
labels: Red, Pink, Graphics

title: Help Max Open A New Restaurant
description:
Hello everyone! My name is Meghan and the other day I was running errands when I noticed the sweetest sign at a cafe next door.. “If You Are Hungry and Don’t Have Money We Will Feed You. Just Let Us Know. -Mitra’s Cafe”
I have never felt so compelled to walk into a building and give them my business. Upon talking to the owner I found out that he has not only been serving his community, but the hungry free of charge for the last 15 years!! Not only this but he told me the next day, Sunday August 31st, 2025 was his last day before getting kicked out of his building so another business could expand.. and he couldn’t afford to move into a new one..
This didn’t sit right with me so I made a tiktok, and the rest is history. Max not only touched my heart that day but over 1 million other people who wanted to do whatever they could to help! So I went back on his last day and asked him what he wanted his future to look like. He told me making food for people is his passion and his dream would be to open another restaurant if he could afford it..
This is where we, as a community come in. Max has spent his life not only keeping people fed, but clearly changing the lives of every person he comes across. He is so selfless and it’s time for all of his good karma to come back around. Whether you can donate a few dollars, or just simply share his story, you WILL be making a huge difference in someone’s life. Someone who has spent their whole life doing just that, making a difference.❤️
labels: Text, Font, Poster, Handwriting

title: Grow My business After Overcoming Cancer
description:
In 2022, I expanded Elk Rock Yoga, a studio I acquired in 2020, further solidifying my commitment to building an inclusive and welcoming community. Over the past three years, I have poured my "blood, sweat, and tears" into growing Elk Rock Yoga with a clear mission: to support all bodies through a practice that embraces all peoples, beliefs, and abilities.
That mission took an exciting new form with the opening of Elk Rock Yoga’s sister space, Elk Rock Outpost, at 2205 E Burnside. Officially launched on Memorial Day Weekend 2025, the Outpost was created as more than a retail shop—it is a carefully curated haven designed to inspire an artful life. The space offers a diverse selection of carefully sourced products that reflect my dedication to wellness and community:
Consumables: Delicious treats and pantry staples for everyday nourishment
Wellness and Self-Care Items: Products that nurture mind, body, and spirit
Vintage Finds and Gifts: Unique treasures and meaningful gifts
Every item at the Outpost is chosen through direct collaborations with artisans, makers, farmers, and growers, ensuring that each piece promotes ease, beauty, and well-being.
Beyond retail, the Outpost serves as a vibrant community hub, featuring workshops, live music, and gatherings that promote connection and creativity.
This project is particularly meaningful to me as I've been bringing it to life while simultaneously managing health challenges following a diagnosis and treatment for advanced stage endometrial cancer. As I channel my energy into this new venture, continue the operation of my yoga studio, and navigate numerous appointments during my recovery, I am seeking your support.
Elk Rock Outpost is centrally located on a busy street in Portland's Kerns neighborhood, surrounded by fantastic food. Our customers appreciate our unique gifts, warm atmosphere, and engaging events. I have poured everything I have into creating this beautiful space, and now I am asking for your support as it continues to grow.
Please consider making a donation. Any amount you can contribute will truly help celebrate overcoming cancer and get this business firmly on its feet.
Thank you for your support.
Sincerely,
Fawn Williams

title: “Fight Bullying, Build Leaders — Donate Today”
description:
Every Punch Counts – Support Peekskill’s Youth Today
For 19 years, Be First Fighting Arts Corp. (DBA Be First Boxing) has been more than a gym. We’ve been a safe haven for at-risk youth and adults in Peekskill, NY.
Through boxing and martial arts training, we teach discipline, confidence, and strength—helping students excel in and out of the ring. Our program saves kids from the streets, builds character, and creates champions inside and outside the ring.
But after a sudden relocation and costly renovations, we urgently need your help to raise $50,000 to continue this mission.
What Your Gift Will Support
• Expand weekly gym hours so more youth can train safely after school
• Bring on full-time coaches to mentor and guide students
• Hire a front-desk/cleaning manager to improve safety and service
• Purchase a reliable 10-passenger vehicle so kids can travel safely to competitions
• Cover essential operating costs so we can focus on mentoring, not just making rent

title: From House to Warehouse — BAMF is Leveling Up!
description:
Help BAMF Build Our First Studio ️✨ (Warehouse Secured — Let’s Make It Shine!)
CAMPAIGN STORY
WE GOT THE KEYS!
After months of planning, saving, and all-out hustle — BAMF Design Studio has officially secured its first commercial space.
But this didn’t happen overnight.
Amy started BAMF in August of 2022 — squeezing it in after her day job, staying up late, grinding through weekends, and sacrificing family time to build something real from scratch. For nearly three years, she ran the business solo — designing, packing, filming, answering emails, and showing up on every livestream with that signature BAMF energy, even when she was running on fumes.
This brand was built one order at a time. One customer at a time. One late night at a time.
In August of 2024, Amy finally left her 9–5 to go full-time with BAMF. Eight months later, in April 2025, I (Kaleb) joined full-time to support the growth and free up Amy to focus on expansion.
Since then, we’ve doubled down.
Launched new livestream formats, including private subscriber shows
Added new equipment, including a laser engraver
Opened up travel vlog content to connect beyond the workspace
Expanded product lines, added more stock, and introduced BAMF Boxes
Built deeper connections with our customers through content, chaos, and consistency
The growth has been real. But it’s come with a cost. Right now, BAMF is taking over our house. Literally. Our two biggest rooms are workspaces. The kitchen is lined with product. The library is storage. The playroom is a shipping zone. The hallways are obstacle courses of boxes. We can’t relax. It doesn’t feel like a home anymore.
We’re proud of what BAMF has become — but it simply doesn’t fit inside these walls anymore. The business grew, but the house stayed the same, and something had to give. It was time to either cap the growth... or move to a bigger pot.
So we started looking. Calling. Emailing. Touring buildings. Crunching numbers. And on September 25, 2025, we got the keys to our new studio: A 1,650 sq ft commercial warehouse with dedicated office space!
We did a public walkthrough with our customers the same day. It’s real. It’s empty. And it’s ours. Now, we just need to make it BAMF.
WHAT THIS FUNDRAISER COVERS
We’re not asking because we can’t do this on our own — BAMF has always paid for itself. But so many of you have asked how to help without placing another order or adding to our workload, so we’re opening this space for those who want to contribute directly to the next chapter.
Here’s what your support will help us bring to life:
Deep Cleaning & Prep: The space has been sitting vacant. Before anything moves in, it needs a full deep clean — floors, vents, surfaces — so we can start fresh.
Lighting Upgrades & Fixture Improvements: With power active, we’ll be replacing outdated fixtures, improving visibility across the warehouse, and making sure the lighting supports livestreams, admin work, and long-haul production days.
Workspace Furniture & Storage: This studio is over 3x bigger than our current space. We need modular workbenches, storage, shelving, and clean organization to scale effectively.
Shipping Station Buildout: We’re building a real fulfillment zone — label printers, pack stations, shelving, and supply caddies — to streamline how we ship and serve.
Livestream & Content Studio Setup: We’re upgrading to a professional content studio with quality lighting, cameras, sound, and space flexibility to take livestreams and BTS content to the next level.
️ Admin Station: A designated admin zone with computers, monitors, and peripherals for design work, moderation, scheduling, and customer support.
Every dollar goes directly toward building a professional, scalable, sustainable BAMF Studio — not for extras, not for fluff — just the essentials that help us deliver better quality, faster service, and more room to grow.
Connect With Us
Join Us On Discord
️
Visit Our Website
See All Of Our Socials

title: Cambridge Natural History Museum Needs a Permanent Home
description:
Hi, my name is Anderson Taylor. I’m 10 years old and I’ve loved fossils and natural history my entire life. After visiting the Staffin Dinosaur Museum while vacationing with my family in Scotland in 2022, I knew I wanted to open a museum of my own someday. With the help of my family, my community, and a lot of generous people from around the country,
that dream became real on August 9th, 2024.
I attended many village board meetings and met with the village administrator many times about my dream of opening a museum, which resulted in the Village of Cambridge kindly letting me use an old building free of charge to get started. On opening day, I started with a single display case of fossils and artifacts. The collection has since grown to fill eleven cases and the museum has welcomed hundreds of visitors from around the world. We regularly host school and daycare field trip groups, and it’s been amazing to see how many people are excited to learn about natural history right here in our small town.
I have been overwhelmed with the generosity I have experienced this past year and want to do everything I can to fulfill my promise to those who have lovingly donated fossils, minerals, artifacts, and more to the museum and ensure these items will be displayed for years to come.
This is where I need your help!
My goal is to raise $50,000 to purchase and renovate the building the museum currently occupies.
Your donation will help:
Secure a permanent home for the museum in Cambridge, IL
Restore and preserve the building’s brick exterior
Finish the upstairs space and convert it into a short-term rental to help support the museum financially and provide much-needed temporary lodging in the area
Update and repair the museum space, and create a small gift shop for visitors
If you believe in the power of curiosity, education, and young people chasing big dreams, I hope you’ll consider donating. Every dollar brings us closer to making the museum a permanent part of Cambridge.
Thank you so much for your support!
– Anderson
PS - Please join us in celebrating our one-year anniversary on Saturday, August 10th. We'll be open from 11am to 4pm that day.
NOTE: The goal amount shown may not reflect the actual goal. Because campaigns on GoFundMe are all-or-nothing, they gradually increase the goal amount as donations come in. This ensures that if the full goal is not met, partial funding is still available.
labels: Blue, Font, Symbol

title: Support Chef Jeremy's Dream: Help Me Buy A Food Truck
description:
Life has not always been easy, but cooking has always been my passion. Inspired by my dad and grandma, I started young, and wrestling gave me the discipline to push through challenges. I became a 3x state champion at Omaha North and a national champion in college. Those lessons in hard work shaped me and built the character I rely on today.
I worked many years at Leavenworth Café, where I learned patience and gained the vision to start my own business. In May 2025, I quit my job at the county to take a leap of faith to cook full time. Since then, I have been doing everything on my own. Life has tested me, but I am determined to make this dream a reality.
This past July, I offered Omaha Police “Lt. Dan” a plate of food while he was patrolling nearby. That small act sparked a friendship and showed me how food can break down barriers and bring people together. It reminded me why I love doing this: food has the power to unite us, no matter our background.
I have put everything I have into this dream, but I need help to take the next step. A food truck costs $8,000, and I have already saved half. With your support, I can reach my goal, expand Omaha’s food options, and provide for my family while giving back to the community.
Food is not just a meal to me. It is a way to connect, to heal, and to inspire. Your support would mean the world and would help me turn years of struggle, sacrifice, and hard work into something lasting.
labels: Hat, Cap, Night, Rapper, Baseball cap

title: Restaurant's manager embezzles $300k. They still cater event
description:
**Help Verde Cocina Recover from a Devastating Betrayal**
As a proud member of the small business community in Oregon and SW Washington, I’m heartbroken to share the story of an unimaginable betrayal — one that’s shaken a family-run local favorite to its core.
The Garnica family, owners of Verde Cocina, one of Portland’s most beloved organic, locally sourced restaurants and caterers, have been an essential part of our community for over 16 years. As a wedding venue, we've worked with Verde Cocina for a decade and have seen firsthand the love, integrity, and excellence they bring to every event and every meal.
But now — they need us.
What Happened
On September 19th, the Garnicas discovered that a trusted longtime manager had been embezzling funds and committing wire fraud by siphoning off payments meant for the restaurant by linking his own bank account to Verde Cocina’s Square processing system and issuing fake invoices using their logo.
The current estimated loss is nearly $300,000 and that figure only covers what’s been uncovered over the past eight months.
This comes on the heels of another major setback: a fire in 2019 that destroyed their largest location and catering kitchen. The family never asked for help — they rolled up their sleeves and rebuilt on their own. Last year, they were close to reopening… but the money was gone, and they didn’t yet know why.
Now, we do. The PPB has made an arrest and the district attorney is building a case as this is a class B felony and has affected well over a hundred transaction.
Despite Everything, They're Still Showing Up
Even now, Verde Cocina continues to honor catering commitments, delivering food for weddings and events even though they themselves haven’t received the payments, That’s the kind of people they are.
This family is not asking for a handout. In fact, they’re not the ones who started this fundraiser, we are. Because we’ve seen what they do for their staff, customers, and community. Because they would never stop showing up for us — and now it’s our turn to show up for them.
Why This Matters
Verde Cocina employs dozens of people, including multiple generations of families. Their team is like a second home for many and turnover is almost nonexistent.
Here’s what one employee, Elana, shared:
“In 2019, I lost my father suddenly. The Garnicas were heartbroken for me — they wrote me a check to cover my rent and told me to take as much time as I needed. They’ve done the same for countless others. They drain their bank account to help employees, and that’s what makes this betrayal so devastating.”
This isn't just a financial crisis, it's an emotional one. A violation of trust by someone they treated like family.
How You Can Help
Your donation will help:
* Cover the financial loss from the fraud
* Support staff salaries and operations
* Finally reopen their flagship restaurant and catering kitchen
* Ensure they can continue to serve the community with the heart and excellence they’re known for
Every dollar helps. Every share helps. Let’s rally around this incredible family and business just like they’ve always rallied around us.
Thank you for supporting Verde Cocina and the Garnica family.
PPB Case # 25-259330
If you have any questions or information, please contact the non emergency number. [phone redacted]
labels: Food, Restaurant, Produce, Fast food, Vegetable

title: Help DLV Designs Rebuild After Massive Fire in Red Hook
description:
Help Mark and Maggie De La Vega rebuild after a devastating fire destroyed their studio in Red Hook.
De La Vega Designs is a small furniture manufacturing + design studio. The fire that erupted on September 17th in the warehouse where we make furniture burned for over 24 hours, destroying our small business. We have lost access to finished pieces and materials, and are unable to continue to work in the building because of the destruction. We are searching for a temporary studio space to continue operations. Your donation will help us move forward after this incredible loss.
Thank you for any support during this difficult time. Our hearts are with the Red Hook community and all affected by this fire, especially fellow small businesses and artisans.

title: Help Ramatu Turn Pain Into Purpose
description:
Hi, my name is Ramatu Kamara.
I’m the heart and hands behind Sweet Tuu’s Cakes & Treats. I’m a single mother of two, a self-taught cake artist, and a woman who has turned pain into purpose. In 2018, I started my business out of my kitchen as a way to heal and to bring joy to others. I love bringing important moments to life by creating custom cakes and treats and making everlasting memories with every bite.
In December 2023, I survived a major car accident that nearly took my life. The vehicle was totaled. Since the accident I have been in and out of work due to lack of reliable transportation and this year alone I have been let go from three jobs. My childcare paperwork was mishandled and that left my son without services. As a single mom, these challenges have taken a toll on my household and my children’s lives.
But through it all, one thing has stayed constant: my calling. I believe God spared me for a reason, and He’s been telling me to step fully into my gifts. After losing another job in August 2025, I made the decision to listen to that still, small voice and focus on Sweet Tuu’s Cakes & Treats full time. By growing my business, I can eliminate childcare costs, create a flexible schedule for my family, and finally build stability doing what I love.
I’m fundraising to invest in equipment, ingredients, licensing, marketing, and reliable transportation so I can take my business to the next level.
Every donation — no matter how small — helps me provide for my children, serve my community, and build a legacy that turns pain into something beautiful.
Thank you for reading my story and believing in my dream. If you can’t give financially, please consider sharing my campaign with others who may want to help.

title: Help us to launch Island Tings!
description:
Island Tings is a Jamaican-inspired beverage brand created by two sisters, rooted in our family’s authentic recipes. Our drinks—both canned cocktails and non-alcoholic options—are designed to give you a refreshing escape to the islands with every sip.
To make this dream possible, we’ve launched this GoFundMe with a goal of $20,000. These funds will go directly toward:
Marketing & Brand Awareness/Development – This includes a fully revamped website, honing our brand story, finalizing packaging designs, and growing our community through increased social media engagement.
Federal Compliance – securing the necessary permits and licenses to bring our drinks to market
First Small-Batch Production – producing our very first run of Island Tings cans so we can officially launch
With your support, we’ll be ready to officially launch by Spring 2026! Every contribution helps us take one step closer to sharing a taste of the islands—authentic, refreshing, and full of good vibes.
Thank you for believing in Island Tings and helping us bring this vision to life!

title: we got robbed- help rebuild hid.n!
description:
help hid.n rebuild
last night, our costa mesa showroom was broken into. over $45,000 worth of designer inventory was stolen. we’ll be closed this week as we regroup and recover.
if you’ve ever pulled up to one of our events, copped something from the rack, or just showed love—i’m asking for your help.
i started hid.n almost 5 years ago with the goal of building something rooted in culture and community. we’ve thrown shows, hosted creators, and built a space that feels like more than just retail. this robbery is a big hit—but we’re not stopping.
i’m hoping to raise $50,000 to:
•	replace stolen inventory
•	cover being shut down for the week
•	invest in stronger security + rebuild what we lost...
if you can donate, share, or even just repost this—it truly means everything right now.
thank you for rocking with us. always.
— tony / @findhid.n
labels: Font, Graphic design

title: Making The Blok DFW's First 24 Hour Climbing Gym
description:
Help Bring 24/7 Climbing to The Blok!
The Blok has come a long way since we first opened our doors almost 2 years ago. What started as a dream has grown into a real community, and it’s because of all of you that we’ve made it this far. We’re finally starting to round the corner financially, which means we can shift from just keeping the lights on to actually building out the experience our members,
YOU
, deserve.
One of the things people ask about most is extended hours, especially early in the morning. We’d love nothing more than to make that happen, but you all know there's only three (sometimes four) of us to staff the desk around the clock, and 13-14 hours a day already has us all stretched as thin as we can be. BUT... we've done the legwork and found a solution so you can climb whenever it works best for you, whether that’s early before work, late at night, or somewhere in between, and it also lets the Brooks Family retain some amount of "work" - life balance.
The only thing standing in the way is the upfront cost of converting the gym to 24/7. We're taking on additional monthly overhead to get these systems in place but, instead of raising membership prices for all of you that have been so loyal to us,
we’re hoping to fund the upfront cost together through this campaign
. Every contribution goes directly toward making 24/7 access a reality. Everyone that is a member before our 24/7 access goes live will be grandfathered in at their current membership rate (see below for clarification).
FOR TRANSPARENCY
All existing members will gain extended access when 24/7 access launches for no additional fee, details for the access for each membership type are below:
Individual
+ Squad
- 24/7 Access
Build Your Own
- 5AM to Midnight on selected days
Early Bird
- Check-in from 5AM to 2PM
PWYC/Health/Industry/Non-member
- 10AM to 8 PM Daily.
**Members CAN bring guests outside of general public hours, but their guest must purchase a day pass and check-in at the kiosk. No guest passes can be used outside of general public hours.**
WHERE IS THIS MONEY GOING?
Door access control hardware - $1,900
Knox box for EMS access - $500
Additional surveillance equipment - $500
Customer management door access integration - $1,200
Member music control kiosk - $400
Total investment cost -
$4,500
We don't want to raise your dues, and 24/7 access will be coming regardless of how much funding we raise from this, but we also know our community would probably like to see this happen as soon as possible, and this GoFundMe serves to get this launched ASAP for you all.
If The Blok has ever felt like your place to hang out, grow stronger, or connect with others, we’d be grateful for your support. Even a small donation helps push us closer to unlocking the doors around the clock.
Thanks for being part of this community and helping us keep building something special together.
Next up after we go 24/7...
a shower
!
Thank you!
The Brooks Family
labels: Headquarters, Corporate headquarters, Aluminium

title: Donate to Bring Stray By The Bay Cat Cafe to Life
description:
Stray By The Bay Cat Cafe: Lincoln's 1st Cat Cafe
Hi everyone! I'm Emily Cancelmo, the owner/founder of Stray By The Bay. Over the past two years, we've worked hard to help rescue cats in Lincoln and surrounding areas with the dream of opening Lincoln's first ever cat cafe. The time has come to make that dream into a reality, but not without
YOUR help!
Stray By The Bay is hoping to open the purr-fect hangout spot
that will bring together the aspects of your favorite coffeeshop alongside the irresistible company of local adoptable felines. We've partnered with several local shelters and rescues to give cats a safe, cage-free, and enriching environment while they wait for their fur-ever homes.
✨What to Expect✨
Locally roasted coffee, teas, and fresh baked good available for purchase in the cafe area
A beach theme throughout the cafe to bring shore vibes to the Midwest
Adoptable cats and kittens from your favorite local rescues and shelters
Multiple monthly events- cat yoga, painting, movie nights, and more
Community Give Back- cat supply pantry, microchip/vaccine clinics, and educational events
Where your donations will go:
Acquisition of a physical space
Permits and licensing
Cafe and cat room renovations
Equipment and supplies
The majority of donations will go towards acquiring the physical location and renovations needed for the cafe. This will include constructing walls to separate the cafe and cat room spaces, as well as making sure both areas are safe and cozy for humans and cats alike. Donations will also help to cover the equipment needed for a fully functional coffee bar and small kitchen to provide guests with fresh drinks, baked goods, and other snacks.
Every donation-big or small-brings us one step closer to opening our doors and saving the lives of countless cats. Whether you're a long time supporter, coffee fan, cat enthusiast, or someone that just loves supporting the community, we'd be so grateful for your help and support.
Thank you for being part of this dream! We can't wait to welcome you to Lincoln's first cat cafe in 2026!

title: VIP Barbell Needs Your Help!
description:
Hi everyone! My name is Shannon.
I am starting this GoFundMe to support Brian & Emily during this difficult time of financial hardships with VIP Barbell. This fundraiser is to help get VIP Barbell up and running on their new property as soon as possible due to unexpected financial obstacles.
Over the past week, Brian & Emily faced an unexpected challenge. They were informed that they won’t receive the full proceeds from the gym sale. While this is no fault of Brian & Emily they will be investing every dollar personally to get this off the ground running. This will also impact the sale of Emily’s house. I am reaching out to invite your support in helping bring this vision to life sooner then later.
VIP Barbell and Brian & Emily have had a huge impact on my life. I’ve been friends with Emily for over 12 years, and she has always been an inspiration to me. Watching her through her fitness journey, especially while dealing with medical challenges that we both understand all too well, gave me the push I needed to finally join the gym back in 2021. From the moment I walked in, Brian made me feel welcomed, supported and pushed me to my limits. I started to feel stronger—not just physically, but mentally and emotionally too. VIP quickly became my happy place. It’s where I have met amazing people and I finally felt like I belonged. That’s why I’m doing this for Brian & Emily who built this community, and for everyone who calls VIP Barbell their home.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Brian & Emily Reed are the proud owners of VIP Barbell in Newtown, PA. VIP Barbell has never just been a gym to them. It’s their dream, passion and second home. They built a community where lifters of all ages and backgrounds can come together, push their limits and support each other both inside and outside the gym. It’s a place where new lifters find their footing, where seasoned lifters smash their PRs, and where friendships are formed that last far beyond the walls of the gym. They have seen people walk in unsure of themselves and become not only stronger physically, but more confident in every part of their lives. That means everything to them. Members often tell Brian & Emily that the gym is the one place they feel truly at home.
Sadly, like many small businesses, they are facing financial challenges that are forcing them to make a heartbreaking decision of closing the gym in October. This is heartbreaking—not only for Brian & Emily, but also the VIP Barbell family. The thought of losing the community and family is crushing for them.
Let's help them with a new chapter!!!
Their dream is to reopen VIP Barbell on their newly purchased residential property. To bring that vision to life they are building a standalone structure dedicated entirely to strength, focus, and community.
A project like this takes serious commitment. Every dollar possible is being invested personally by Brian & Emily to get this off the ground. I am reaching out to invite your support in helping bring this vision to life.
If VIP Barbell has ever been a place where you felt stronger, supported or inspired—or if you just believe in small businesses that care deeply about their people—I would be forever grateful if you’d consider donating or sharing this story. Every single donation, share, or kind word makes a difference—not just for Emily & Brian, but for the entire VIP Barbell family.
Together, we can make this next chapter happen.
Why We Need Your Help:
Your support will go directly toward:
Building a standalone structure on their residential property
Moving and maintaining equipment
Covering startup costs to get the gym up and running
Every donation—no matter the size—brings them one step closer to rebuilding.
How You Can Help:
Donate to help them build out the new space
Share this story with friends, family, and anyone who believes in supporting small businesses and strong communities
Stay connected—we’ll keep everyone updated on their journey to reopening
VIP Barbell is more than four walls and some weights—it’s people, support, and a place where strength is built in every sense of the word. With your help, we can bring the gym back to life in a new home and keep VIP Barbell thriving. Thank you for your support. It is more appreciated than you will ever know.
Shannon

title: The Lift Initiative: San Diego Academy and Colegio Los Andes
description:
The Lift Initiative: One Heart, Two Schools, Double the Blessing
My name is Gabi Rivera for the past five years, I’ve been baking cookies and giving them out on a donation basis to help fund Christian education for students in Colombia. By God’s grace and the support of my Tierrasanta Seventh-Day Adventist Church family, that simple act turned into something much bigger — providing 15 full scholarships for students at Colegio Adventista Los Andes.
Now, I’m inviting you to join the next movement!
In just 30 days, we aim to raise $7,000 to bless two schools in two countries:
The first $1,000 for Colegio Adventista Los Andes (Colombia): celebrating their 40th anniversary and moving closer to their dream of a new $12,500 computer lab.
The Next $6,000 for San Diego Academy (California, U.S.): reducing sports fees to increase participation and building a student weight room so every student can become a stronger athlete.
Why “The Lift Initiative”?
Because we are not just lifting weights, we are lifting each other up.
Organized by San Diego Academy ( Principal Thomas) with me, Gabi Rivera, as Founder and leader of The Lift Initiative.
Why We’re Doing This:
At 13 years old, after hearing my grandmother share about students in Colombia who couldn’t afford school, I asked a simple question in the car: “What if I bake cookies and gather donations?”
That small act of faith became a movement. Batch after batch, God multiplied it into over 15 scholarships for students in Colombia. Now, with
The Lift Initiative,
I’m inviting you to help expand this mission — blessing two schools at once.
First goal: $7,000 in 30 days.
After we reach it, every extra dollar will be split 50/50 for both schools’ needs.
Families in Colombia: You can donate with a credit card (note that your bank may charge a small international fee).
Local San Diego donors: I will be visiting local churches with my cookies to collect donations (dates to come), and I’ll keep the GoFundMe updated so everyone can see our progress.
We’d love to hear from you!
When you donate, feel free to share who you are, where you’re from, or just say hello. We want to celebrate our donors and create a connected, global community.
I’ve seen how God can use something as small as a cookie to change lives. My dream is that this project reminds every student — in San Diego and Colombia — that
with God’s help, nothing is impossible.
I also wanted to share what I heard on K-LOVE last week:
“Sometimes we are the answer to someone’s prayer, and sometimes we are the receivers.”
Join The Lift movement, be the answer to someone’s prayer
.
Transparency Note:
All funds raised will go directly into the San Diego Academy account and will be distributed exactly as outlined above — ensuring full accountability and transparency.
Donate & Share:
Thank you for lifting with us! Together, we can bless students in Colombia and San Diego, honor 40 years of God’s faithfulness, and show what happens when one heart says "Yes!" to serving.
✨ We’re lifting up two schools at once — will you join the movement today?

description:
Hi everyone! My name is Anya and I am opening up my city’s first Black owned coffee shop that also happens to be a romance bookstore, Mis Amores. Mis Amores was created to provide a space that prioritizes marginalized voices in the romance book space and to also provide a safe space for individuals where they can be authentically themselves regardless of where they come from, what language they speak, or who they love. This is a space for community and full of love with a side of cafecito and empanadas.
I finally found the physical location for my business where I feel safe and support but I need help. Costs are adding up and it is my goal to open before the end of Latinx Heritage Month. I need some help to cover expenses like coffee equipment, hiring staff, and first month of bills.
if you’re able to help then I really appreciate it or if you could share then that would also go a long way.

description: Kilted Mermaid is under investigation by the Florida Attorney General for hosting a drag show. We have always stood up for the LGBTQ community, and we will fight this as hard as we possibly can, but we need your help. We are raising funds for legal fees. title: Rebuilding Vamp Salon
description:
Hi, my name is Alayna, and I’m creating this GoFundMe on behalf of my mom. Recently, devastating floods swept through Globe, Arizona, leaving behind heartbreaking damage. My mom’s salon a place she has poured her heart, soul, and years of hard work into was severely impacted.
Her salon isn’t just a business. It’s been a safe space where clients come not only for beauty services but also for encouragement, laughter, and community. Seeing it destroyed has been overwhelming for her, but I know with support, she can rebuild and bring back the place that means so much to so many people.
We are asking for donations to help cover the costs of repairs, replacing lost equipment, and getting the salon doors open again. Any amount, big or small, will make a huge difference in helping my mom rebuild her dream and continue serving the community she loves.
Thank you for reading, sharing, and supporting us during this difficult time.

title: Donate to the Enfield Safe Harbor Warming Center
description:
Enfield People For People
operates the
Enfield Safe Harbor Warming Center in Thompsonville, CT.
Your financial support of our mission is critical to us, as the Enfield, CT Town Council has declined to renew our $13,000 grant for 2025-2026. This decision will strain us financially as we resume overnight shelter operations on Dec. 1, 2025.
We are completely reliant on public fundraising and grants to meet our nearly $140,000 budget through 2026.
Since 2016, we have provided warm and safe overnight shelter for the unhoused/heatless in the Greater Enfield community. We also seek transitional housing and permanent accommodations through other organizations. Most importantly, we offer a respectful place for a guest to enter without judgment, persecution, or guilt.
Apart from the winter season, we operate an outreach program 3 days each week to distribute pre-packaged food, clothing, toiletries, etc., and provide referrals to government agencies and the not-for-profit sector.
Last winter, we opened the Warming Center for 121 consecutive nights, with 3,455 total overnight stays at an average of over 28 guests per night.

title: Fund TBNI's Innovative Alzheimer's Treatment Center
description:
About Tampa Bay Neurocognitive Institute (TBNI)
TBNI is committed to delivering a comprehensive diagnostic and treatment center for Alzheimer’s disease and related disorders, all under one roof - so patients can avoid traveling to multiple clinics across the region.
We employ cutting-edge modalities: an Ultra Low Magnetic Field MRI, advanced EEG, and SynOne skin biopsy (for Parkinson’s/Lewy body). These tools help us detect changes early, monitor treatment response, and tailor care.
Our ambition is to accelerate the time from consultation → diagnosis → therapy, offering evidence-based strategies and, when appropriate, anti-amyloid therapies. We also participate in research trials and plan to expand our own translational research.
Why this new building matters
We purchased a facility to centralize our operations. To fully realize this vision, we need to renovate and build out several critical areas: exam rooms, MRI suite, infusion / therapy bays (2–3 chairs), and support spaces. The goal is not only functional — we want spaces that are warm, welcoming, and dignified for patients and caregivers at every stage.
How your donation helps
Funds raised will be dedicated exclusively to capital improvements and facility build-out (e.g. construction, infrastructure, medical-equipment installations, furniture, HVAC, shielding).
No funds will be used for routine operating expenses (e.g. staff payroll, clinical supplies, or patient care).
Your contribution helps us expand access to high-caliber Alzheimer’s diagnostics and care — in a single, patient-friendly location. Thank you for helping us build a future where fewer families must suffer the fragmented journey across multiple providers.
labels: Pink, Petal, Blossom, Clip art, Graphics

title: Bringing Back Local Family-Owned Business
description:
Do you miss being able to go here to grab ice cream? My family would like to make it a local, family owned business again, but we can’t do it without your help! With this location now being zoned to sell adult recreational material it makes it out of our reach price wise to purchase it alone. Is this a BIG goal? Yes! Can it be met? Also, YES! 100,000 people donating just $8 could get us there! Taking a leap of faith here!
Our family misses having a close ice cream shop to go to. My mom grew up in this neighborhood, as well as my husband. The Minnow Bucket closed shortly after us moving here. It has been sad having it gone and the building sit empty when it has so much potential to serve the community. My husband and I have talked about opening it up again as a place for the community and those visiting the lake to go to for pizza and ice cream. Combining the experience of myself and my husband we have a history of store management and the experience in the food service industry. With extended family we also have a contractor for renovations.
I know we can do this with the help and support of our community and anyone who would like to see this happen! Any support, small or big, is so much appreciated! We need your support, and we also need you to share! Thank you so much!

It turns out there is enough demand for me to do this full time... I just need the right equipment! Unfortunately I lost my job recently, and finding a new one has been difficult. Although I am still looking for a job, I also want to save, save save and INVEST! As well as book clients, build my portfolio, and turn this side gig into a dream come true! With this money I could not only save up for a new Canon, but a new backdrop stand and lighting for an in home studio. Id be able to offer more services and learn so much more in the process. I would be investing in something amazing! If there is anyone interested in helping me grow my small business into something magical I would genuinely appreciate any kind of help.

title: Keep Our Business Rolling: Bus Repairs Needed
description:
Hi guys! We’ve simply run out of funds to keep fixing all the things that break down. Currently,

We’ve been doing this full-time, together, since 2011. We’re not spring chickens and not sure what else we would do to make a living at this point in life. We’ve been given a full bag of lemons while living under a black cloud for quite some time now.
We have amazing customers who always show up for us, and we try our hardest to make all your events memorable and yummy!
Some customers have been so kind as to ask what they could do to help, and some suggested us setting up a GoFundMe page for the repairs needed, and here we are…
So, if you feel moved or are so inclined to lend a helping hand, we would be deeply appreciative. Thanks in advance for reading this! Much love to all our wonderful customers who’ve become friends and family over these last 14 years!

title: Support Chef B's Vision: Building Legacy Through Food
description:
Sowing Into Chef B’s Vision: Building Legacy Through Food
My name is
Chef B
, and for years I’ve poured my heart, soul, and strength into building a legacy through food. This business has never just been about cooking — it has been about serving, creating memories, and showing love through every plate and every event.
I have never asked for help to this capacity before. By the grace of God, I’ve worked with my own two hands — even when I was broke, brokenhearted, grieving, or unsure of the next step — to make sure that my clients experienced joy, excellence, and unforgettable moments. I’ve sacrificed to ensure others had what they needed, even when I barely had enough myself.
Now, for the first time, I am humbly asking for support.
Why I’m Asking Now
My business has already launched and thrived, but the truth is — financially, it’s been a major struggle to keep momentum flowing. Steady income has been inconsistent, and while I’ve managed to carry this vision this far, I cannot build the next phase alone.
Your support will go directly into:
•	Hosting taste-testing events that will showcase my food and build community.
•	Launching cooking classes to teach, inspire, and empower others in the kitchen.
•	Investing in new equipment and business tools to serve with greater excellence, whether it's kitchen equipment, seasoning ingredients, bottles, or labels.
This is not a handout — it’s a seed. A seed into good ground.
Why This Matters
Food has a way of healing, connecting, and inspiring. My calling is to use this gift to serve people in ways that go beyond a plate — to touch lives, spark joy, and create lasting memories.
When you sow into
Chef B
’s vision, you’re not just supporting a business. You’re helping build a kingdom legacy. You’re helping create spaces where people are celebrated, where community is built, and where excellence shines as a testimony of God’s faithfulness.
How You Can Sow Into This Vision
To honor your generosity, I’ve created ways to thank and acknowledge everyone who joins me in this journey:
$10 – Seasoning Squad
✔️ Shoutout on social media
✔️ Your name added to the Founding Supporters Wall
✔️ An exclusive recipe from my kitchen to yours
$25 – Kitchen Partners
✔️ Everything in
$10
tier
✔️ Early invite to my first taste-testing event
✔️ Access to 2–3 exclusive recipes or cooking tips PDF
$50 – Chef’s Circle
✔️ Everything in
$25
tier
✔️ Discount code for your next seasoning order
✔️ Recognition on socials + website as a Chef’s Circle member
$100 – Vision Builders
✔️ Everything in
$50
tier
✔️ Personalized thank-you video/message from me
✔️ VIP early access to my first cooking class
$250+ – Legacy Supporters
✔️ Everything in
$100
tier
✔️ 20-minute personal cooking/meal planning consultation with me (Zoom/phone)
✔️ Your name honored on my Founder’s Board displayed at my first major event/class
Final Words From My Heart
This is not easy for me to write. For years, I have built with nothing but faith, my hands, and God’s strength. But I know even visionaries need community. I believe God places people in our paths who are meant to stand with us, sow with us, and build with us.
Your support
— whether big or small — is a confirmation that this vision is worth it, that this work matters, and that together we can do something greater than I could do alone.
If you’ve ever tasted my food, experienced my service, or simply believed in me, I ask you to prayerfully consider sowing into this vision. Every seed planted here will grow into something that will bless many.
“Now unto Him who is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us.”
— Ephesians 3:20
“But my God shall supply all your need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.”
— Philippians 4:19
From the bottom of my heart, thank you. Thank you for believing in me, standing with me, and helping me carry this vision into the future.
With love and gratitude,
Chef B
labels: Logo, Graphic design

title: Build a Community Hub: Espresso Machine for Marion
description:
My name is Marion Evans, founder and owner of the new Daily Drip Coffee Cafe in Old North St. Louis. After 25 years working as a social worker, I started this cafe in my neighborhood as a way to bring people together. This cafe is a space where everyone is welcome and where people are able to connect with friends, neighbors, and resources.
The opening has been a labor of love, with two years of navigating renovations, permits, and city licenses. We offer fresh-baked pastries that my husband Jeffery makes from scratch, and we are continuing to expand our menu as we grow with guest chefs who make breakfast burritos and sandwiches on the weekend.
While we offer fresh-brewed drip coffee and a variety of frozen frapes, we have not been able to get an espresso machine to offer lattes or other espresso drinks. We know there is a need for a full-service coffee cafe in North St. Louis, and we are asking our community to help us fulfill that need with support to purchase a new espresso machine.
We appreciate your support as we continue to build this community hub in Old North St. Louis!
labels: Logo, Advertising, Sign, Restaurant

title: Baking with purpose, a pop-up with heart.
description:
Hi, my name is Angie.
Baking has been my safe place. A few years ago, I went through one of the most painful and traumatic seasons of my life. In the middle of it all, I found myself in the kitchen — measuring, stirring, creating. Somewhere between the butter, sugar, and flour, I found a way to heal. Baking became more than recipes; it became therapy.
Today, I carry that same hope into the lives of others. I work at the Fisher House, where military families stay while their loved ones receive care. It’s an honor to serve them, and one of the ways I do that is through a little program I started called “Cookies with the Chaplain.” Every week I bring in cookies to share, sometimes paying out of my own pocket, because I’ve seen what something as small as a cookie can do — it breaks the ice, softens heavy hearts, and reminds people they’re not alone.
Now, I’m ready to take what baking has done for me and create something bigger: a pop-up bakery space. A place filled with warmth, color, and sweets that carry a story of resilience and joy.
The funds raised will go directly toward:
•	Decorating and bringing the pop-up space to life
•	Stocking it with baked goods and display items
•	Purchasing the supplies and tools needed to keep things running
This isn’t just a business dream — it’s a chance to spread hope, one dessert at a time.
If you feel led to support, know that you’re not just helping me open a pop-up; you’re helping me continue a journey of healing, and hopefully sparking healing in others too.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
With love & gratitude,
Angie
labels: Food, Ingredient, Finger food, Dessert, Retail

title: From Dream to Reality: Opening My Massage Therapy Studio

I believe that massage therapy is more than relaxation; it’s about helping the body heal, recover, and thrive. My vision is to create a peaceful, welcoming space where clients can step away from stress and step into wholeness.
To make this dream a reality,
I am raising funds for the final pieces needed to open the studio: supplies, equipment, moving expenses, and design materials.
The studio owner has generously offered me a $500 design credit, which is such a blessing, but I still need support to cover the essentials and create the warm, professional environment my clients deserve.

title: Help Small Business Owners Recover From Disaster
description:
Hi from the LiftFund Team!
As you know, disasters can strike at any time, putting small businesses at risk. LiftFund is committed to supporting them through any crisis. Small businesses support over 57 million workers in the U.S. and their families. Together, we can ensure they have the meaningful support they need in their time of greatest need.
LiftFund, a nonprofit community funder headquartered in San Antonio, TX, has supported small businesses and community recovery caused by natural disasters and business interruptions dating back to Hurricane Katrina.
This year, LiftFund supported the Hill Country’s recovery from the tragic floods and the Los Angeles community's recovery from the devastating fires. We can't help business owners like Brian, Brandi and Amanda in Hill Country without your help!
Small businesses often are the first to respond by serving as centers for communities in crisis, providing food and resources that are critical in the moment. Rapid funding is essential to ensure communities come back stronger by keeping small businesses open and retaining employees through supported financial recovery and compassionate support from the LiftFund team.
We appreciate you!
The LiftFund Team
www.liftfund.com
https://youtu.be/tPragbcBqHs?si=NliDIIoD-M3m4GBw

title: Faith, Family, and Fire: Help Red Bird Media Tell the Story
description:
Be Part of the Red Bird Media Mission
Back in 2020 I started Red Bird Media. At the time it was just me, a camera, and a conviction that God created me to be creative, to tell His stories through the lives of others. What started as a simple act of faith has grown into a calling that has carried me across the country.
Who we are
: Red Bird Media is built on faith, family, and fire. It’s about documenting the brotherhood of the fire service, the families who stand behind them, and the sacrifices that deserve to be remembered. This isn’t just about cameras, it’s about community, and it’s about making sure no firefighter or family ever has to pay to be remembered.
What we do
: Over the past few years I’ve been blessed to travel to Texas, St. Louis, Louisville, Indiana, Florida, New York, and Boston, with more stops to come. At each conference and event, I’ve been able to capture and share stories of the firehood family, not as a business transaction, but as a gift. Everything we create is given freely, because these stories matter more than money.
Why we’re asking
: The next step is purchasing a camper. This isn’t about comfort, it’s about calling. The camper will serve as both a rest station and a portable studio, keeping me self-sufficient on the road. That means conferences don’t have to use valuable resources to host me, and it allows me to keep giving content away freely. It will let me show up wherever I’m needed, stay present, and pour everything back into the firehood family.
How you can be part of this
: Supporting this mission is not just about donating, it’s about joining the community. Every prayer, every word of encouragement, and every contribution of any size makes you part of Red Bird Media. We want to carry that with us, so we’re inviting supporters to add their family names, company logos, or personal marks to the camper itself, a rolling reminder of the people who helped make this possible. We’ll also share posts and updates along the way, showing our gratitude and highlighting the community that fuels this mission.
Every single contribution matters
. Every dollar, every prayer, every word of encouragement will be fully honored and poured back into telling these stories. For those who feel led to give significantly, your name or logo will travel with us, seen across the country as a visible sign of the people who helped turn this dream into reality.
Red Bird Media is not just my story, it’s our story. Together we can continue to tell stories of faith, family, and fire with dignity, without burden, and always pointing back to the One who gave me this purpose.
With faith and honor,
Daniel Purcell
Red Bird Media

title: Eat Track: We make healthy eating easier for everyone!
description:
Hello All! I am Part of a Innovation competition for one of my MBA courses called Creative strategies of innovation, me and my team aim to develop an app called Eatrack to make choosing healthier foods easier than ever when grocery shopping!
The app will allow you scan the grocery products and grade the ingredients to show you how ultra processed it is, show you healthier alternatives and simplify any confusion you may have!
Imagine, going to the store aisle and not being lost to the long ingredient lists where you don't understand what's on it. One scan and you are given all the information necessary to make the best decision for you!
Please see our Virtual presentation here for Eattrack:

title: Donate to help us create this amazing bug-tastic game!
description:
Hi, my name is Bug, and I’m working on creating a unique and fun project: a Bug Simulator Game!
Ever since I was a kid, I’ve been fascinated by the tiny worlds of insects — how they build, survive, and interact in ways that are surprisingly similar to us. That passion has inspired me to design a simulator where players can step into the shoes (or legs!) of a bug and experience life from their perspective.
This game will let players:
Explore realistic environments from a bug’s point of view.
Survive challenges like predators, weather, and finding food.
Build and grow a colony or live as a lone survivor.
Learn fun facts about real insect behaviors along the way.
I want this project to be more than just a game — it’s a way to spark curiosity about nature and show how amazing the smallest creatures really are.
I’m asking for support to help cover the costs of development tools, art, sound design, and the time it takes to bring this vision to life. Every donation, big or small, helps me get one step closer to launching the bug world I’ve always dreamed of creating.
If you’ve ever looked at a bug and wondered what life is like for them, this game will give you the chance to find out. Thank you for supporting me and helping bring this buggy adventure to life!

title: Help Save Hit-the-Web Marketing After Housing Struggles
description:
Hello friends, family, and community,
I’m Carol, the founder of Hit-the-Web Marketing. For years, I’ve poured my heart into helping construction companies, eCommerce shops, and local small businesses grow online. I believe every hardworking business deserves to have a clear, predictable, and reliable way to attract customers — and that’s been my mission.
But right now, my own business is at risk.
I’m facing overwhelming bills and expenses that I simply can’t keep up with on my own. I’ve been doing everything possible — substitute teaching, consulting, and freelancing — but it’s not enough to cover both my personal obligations and the marketing dollars needed to keep Hit-the-Web running.
Without urgent help, I risk losing the business I’ve worked so hard to build.
What Happened
This past year, I was told I had to leave my apartment. Rent in my area skyrocketed from $1,400 to $2,250 a month — a 60% increase.
It took six difficult months to find a new place and move. That transition ate up not only my savings, but also valuable time I would have spent building my business.
On top of that, my cat Maggie became sick and needed urgent vet care. She’s family to me, and while I don’t regret making sure she was treated, it pulled more money away from my business.
Between moving, higher housing costs, and vet bills, my business had to take a back seat. Now I’m working hard to rebuild Hit-the-Web Marketing, and this GoFundMe will help cover marketing costs, overdue bills, and rent so I can get back on track.
Why This Matters
Saving Hit-the-Web isn’t just about me. It’s about the many small businesses, non-profits, and entrepreneurs who rely on my work to:
•	Grow their online presence
•	Generate consistent sales
•	Compete against bigger companies with bigger budgets
I know the difference that good marketing makes — I’ve seen small businesses go from struggling to thriving because of it. But without support, I may lose the very business that helps others grow.
How Your Support Will Be Used
Your support will go directly toward:
1.	Marketing for Hit-the-Web Marketing – building visibility, running campaigns, and attracting new clients so the business can stand strong again.
2.	Rent support – covering the 60% increase that has drained my resources.
3.	Back expenses – catching up on overdue bills (utilities, business tools, basic living costs) that piled up during the six-month housing transition.
4.	Stability cushion – creating a small safety net so I don’t fall behind again and can focus fully on helping small businesses grow.
How You Can Help
1.	Donate what you can — even $10 makes a difference.
2.	Share this campaign with your friends, family, and networks.
3.	If you own a business, consider working with me so your support goes both ways.
I’ve always believed in lifting others up, and now I’m humbly asking for help to get through this season. With your support, I can rebuild after this setback and keep Hit-the-Web Marketing alive — not just for me, but for the businesses who count on me.
From the bottom of my heart — thank you.
Carol Scalzo
Founder, Hit-the-Web Marketing

title: Support David's Mission to Transform Lives Through Fitness
description:
Hi, my name is David, and I’m a certified personal trainer, nutritionist, and Aikido practitioner. For almost 20 years, I’ve trained in the Art of Aikido and have been deeply connected to a community that has shaped me physically, mentally, and spiritually. Many of you know me from the mat, as a student, training partner, and friend.
Nine months ago, I took a leap of faith and launched my own small business: a private, in-home personal training and nutrition service designed to help people take control of their health in a sustainable, meaningful way. This work is my passion, blending discipline, care, and the principles of Aikido to support others in becoming stronger, more resilient versions of themselves.
It’s been both an exciting and challenging journey.
I’ve been building everything from the ground up, training clients, managing every detail of the business, and steadily growing through word of mouth. But as the business begins to expand, so do the growing pains. I’ve reached a point where I need support to take the next step and serve more people at a higher level.
Why I’m Asking for Help
I’ve always valued hard work, independence, and service. It’s not easy for me to ask for help, but I’ve learned that asking doesn’t mean weakness. It means believing in the vision enough to let others be part of it.
I’m raising funds to invest in professional equipment and tools that I can bring to my client’s homes, as well as for my in-home studio space.
This will allow me to:
· Provide safer, more effective training experiences for clients
· Expand my offerings to meet increasing demand
· Improve the overall quality and professionalism of my services
These upgrades will make a real, direct impact in the lives of the people I train, many of whom come to me during transitional or vulnerable times, seeking strength, healing, and confidence.
Why It Matters
This isn’t just about growing a business. It’s about continuing a mission to help people feel better in their bodies, find clarity in their lives, and experience the kind of personal transformation I’ve seen through Aikido and mindful movement.
If you’ve ever trained with me, shared space on the mat, or been part of my journey, you know how deeply I care about what I do. And if you’re just getting to know me, I hope you’ll feel the sincerity in my words.
How You Can Help
If you feel called to contribute, know that every donation, no matter the size, helps move this dream forward. Even sharing this campaign with others can make a big difference.
All funds will go directly toward:
· Essential training equipment
· Improving the in-home training space
· Supporting ongoing client care during this transitional phase
If you would like to support the growth of this business, the best way is by sharing and contributing to this campaign. Every donation makes a meaningful impact, and if you're interested in working with me or learning more about what I offer, please visit my website at functionalfitness-nj.com, where you can also sign up for updates, training programs, and more. I am truly grateful for your support, and I can't wait to continue building something powerful together.
Thank you for reading, for believing in small businesses like mine, and for being part of this community.
With deep gratitude and respect,
David

title: Jacques' 300-mile Cycle Challenge for ACS
description:
This October, I’m cycling 300 miles for the American Cancer Society. It gives me a tangible goal — a world without cancer — and a cause worth riding for.
Why 300 miles in October?
For me, biking is about connection. There’s no metal shell around me, and because I move a little slower, I actually get to see the world. I can wave to pedestrians, stop into a neighborhood shop, or just take in the city around me. Cycling grounds me in my community.
This month-long challenge is my way of expanding that connection — showing solidarity with those fighting cancer and linking my rides to an even larger community. It’s about turning my love for cycling into something that matters beyond myself.
How you can help
Every donation fuels research, patient support, and resources for people impacted by cancer. Whether you give $5, $50, or simply share this fundraiser, you’re helping turn these 300 miles into something far greater. Together, we can ride toward a world without cancer.
Give me a reason to ride
What would be immensely helpful is giving me destinations. Invite me out — to a craft fair, an art class, a dance, a cool event in Chicago. Tell me where to go, and I’ll bike there. Your suggestions won’t just make this challenge more fun — they’ll turn every mile into a story, every ride into a connection.

description:

Thanks for taking the time to view my fundraiser, and if you can donate or share it would be greatly appreciated!

title: Help Launch Bible Bound Co.
description:
Support Bible Bound Co. – Faith Tools for Every Step of Your Walk with Christ
Hi everyone,
My name is Makayla, and I’m the heart behind Bible Bound Co.— a faith-based small business focused on equipping others with beautiful, intentional tools to grow closer to God. From Bible study kits and prayer journals to Bible journaling supplies and other encouraging faith tools, every product is designed to help people deepen their relationship with Christ in a meaningful, creative way.
This vision has been on my heart for a while, and I truly believe God has called me to create this business. But recently, my family and I purchased a home, and much of our resources are currently tied up in necessary renovations. While this new chapter is a blessing, it’s also made it difficult to financially launch this dream that God has placed so strongly in my spirit.
That’s why I’m stepping out in faith and asking for your help.
Your support will go directly toward:
Producing high-quality Bible study and journaling kits
Purchasing supplies like notebooks, pens, tabs, bookmarks, and devotional materials
Creating a website and storefront
Packaging, shipping, and startup marketing
I want this company to serve as a source of encouragement and spiritual growth for women, teens, and anyone eager to dive deeper into the Word. Every item is made with care, prayer, and the hope that it draws someone closer to Jesus.
If you believe in the power of Scripture and the importance of faith-based tools, I’d be honored to have your support — through donations, prayers, or simply sharing this with others.
Thank you for being part of what God is building through Bible Bound Co.
With love and faith,
Makayla
"Faith tools for every step of your walk with Christ"

title: Help me make my dream come true!
description:
Hi everyone!!
I have some insanely exciting news… I am opening my own flower shop!!
Most of you already know that I am a florist and extremely passionate about the industry. I became a florist right out of high school and fell in love with floristry immediately. Since then, I’ve moved to Portland and continued my career here, doing so much more than I ever could have imagined when I started. From local family-owned shops to the flower market and then spending the last few years freelancing, helping other talented florists in my area with incredible weddings and events.
I am going on 10 years as a florist, and opening my own shop is a dream I didn’t realize was a possibility for me until now. This decision has been overwhelming and a bit scary, but exciting nonetheless. I’m constantly reminded just how much support and love I have from all of you, which makes this feel all the more possible.
While I do have the funds to get started,
I am preparing for months of running the place by myself and the unexpected costs of starting a new business/being a new business owner
, and wanted to give all of you the ability to help out if you would like!
I do not expect to reach the goal that has been set, so anything helps. I know times are tough, so for anyone who isn’t able to contribute financially, I would really just appreciate some advice, words of encouragement, or just more people to be as excited about this as I am :)
I cannot wait for this next chapter and feel so incredibly grateful for my support system! Thank you for being here
labels: Flower, Petal, Yellow, Pink, Floristry

title: Bellissima Family
description:
Hello, my name is Maria Ysabella Pego owner of Salon Bellissima for the past 20 years. On June I received the following message from my current landlord: "I hope you’re well. I’ve decided to make changes to the building to help me keep pace with the rising costs associated with owning it and to address the overall dated condition of it. Unfortunately, this requires that I will not be able to continue to rent the space to you. Alexandra and Bobby (owners Zuzu Petals) will be renovating the first-floor unit and run their wine bar out of it at an increased rent."
It’s not an easy decision, but one I feel is necessary at this point in time to keep up with rises in insurance costs, taxes, and interest rates. I want to give you ample time to find a new location for your business. Feel free to call or text me to go over that. I’m respectful that you probably need time and I’m willing to work with you on that. I’ve enjoyed having you as a tenant since I purchased the property, and I hope we can move forward collaboratively.
Best,
xxxx
And just like that, I lost my space that I have renovated for the past 20 years, I cried for 2 days straight. As most of you know, I have curated a space that I love and enjoy working in.
After the longest cry of my life I decided to fight back and go after my new space. The greatest news is that
we have a new home, and I need all the help and support I can get to make this space ready for all of us.  The high cost of this transition is much higher than we thought and it can cause us to lose everything.
We are asking everyone that can support us in donations.
We are really just trying to make it possible for this location to get ready as soon as possible.
We are now paying for 2 locations which is very expensive for us.
We  appreciate your support and big thanks to all.
labels: Love, Graphics, Heart, Graphic design

title: HELP US KEEP THIS DREAM ALIVE
description:
WE NEED YOUR HELP
Hola Plantiitas fam,
What started as a simple dream—to bring lush, beautiful plants into homes and hearts while supporting and giving back to our community—has grown into much more than we ever imagined. We are incredibly grateful for every person who has supported us along the way.
These past months have been very challenging for many small businesses everywhere, especially with everything happening across our country.
Despite all of these hardships, our passion for plants and community keeps us going. We truly don’t want to close our doors and keep this amazing community growing.
However, we have seen a huge drop in business and our expenses keep growing.
This changarrio is more than just another business; is our community family and friends and we want to continue growing with it with you.
As Latine/Latin@‘s, it’s hard to ask for help and especially when it’s something like this.
But, we have to put our pride aside and ASK FOR YOUR HELP!!
We want to keep our doors open at Plantiitas.
So we are here, asking for your help.
We are not asking for a handout but asking to help us keep this dream alive.
This is how you can help us:
-Come shop with us
-Share our page with fiends and family
-Come to our events and workshops
-Host and event with us
We’ve also set up a GoFund me where you can donate directly to keeping Plantiitas’ doors open if you are able to.
Thank you for believing in us, for your support, and for helping us keep this dream alive.
We hope we can get through this together!
labels: Flowerpot, Happiness, Houseplant, Herb, Floral design

title: Urban Earth Nursery Employee Fund
description:
Urban Earth Nursery, Fremont's only indoor-outdoor garden center since 1997, will be closing its doors at the end of October. Our property management company has sold our plot of land to be converted into demolition vehicle parking for a development company building condominiums in the adjoining lot.
The employees of Urban Earth are not only grieving the loss of our beloved home and community, but are also now grappling with the loss of income that this change has caused, including losing the company-sponsored health insurance that Urban Earth provided to all its year-round staff. We are hoping to raise some money to provide a cushion for our retail staff as they search for new full-time employment. This money will go directly to the shop staff, and will help cover living expenses until they can find a new stable income source.
We at Urban Earth thank our community with all our hearts for the generosity (both material and interpersonal) they have shown us over our nearly three decades in Fremont. Any small amount you can give to help our staff now will be deeply valued.
We love you, Fremont, and will miss you more than words can say!
