While transitioning in to two new rewarding jobs! As a yoga teacher and kayak guide.
Any help is so appreciated. This asking of help, for me is ceremony, prayer, in action, so Thank you for even just energetically receiving of this GoFundMe
.
This is Huge for my internal energetic masculine, the artist and accomplisher of our being, he is inflamed and exhausted as a result of our current systems. We all deserve a life of affluence and flow, creating from ways that are nourishing and stainable.
I've been in a financial deficient and debt for years, it flows in, it flows out, I know many of us know this... working month to month and never being able to save or get ahead much.
The kind of brutal irony is that the business I am aiming to relaunch is that of a channeling and spiritual embodiment mentor, that's why I've cringed at asking for help in this way before. Being caught up in the ideas that I need to appear a certain way, fully affluent, on social media for "people to trust me" again the brutal irony!
This is a demonstration of safety, of the simple, I Am, regardless of the external circumstances. And in this absolute authenticity, there is deep medicine, medicine for me and perhaps others receiving this, regardless if you feel called to donate. It is okay to ask for help.
It is so relevant to declare and set one's standards! In this exaltation, we release and receive.
We are allowed and Needed to know and declare our value and worth! As we set our individual standards from absolute authenticity, a massive ripple effect is created, empowering others that may choose to be effected by my personal declaration, and adding for aid, in action.
So, to those that have supported me through the years, purchasing my services, thank you!!!! I ask, right now, humbly for your personal help, any denomination of money is so deeply received and seen as prayer in action.
To those that have perhaps watched, enjoyed and been inspired my content on social media this is me humbly asking again, I need your help right now, to continue to keep my content sharing consistent and to continue to refine and relaunch the brand that is Gita Rose and Bella of the Mū. Any denomination of money is so deeply received and seen as prayer in action.
I've been going back and forth for years how much to charge for my services, lowering and raising prices. As I wanted to make myself approachable and affordable while honoring and expanding the knowing of my worth. So, this is perhaps a very sweet opportunity for those of you that have perhaps wanted to book sessions with me and it wasn't in your flow, to support me so I can continue to create obtainable ways to receive the offerings of my body of work.
To my friends and family, you know that my finances have long been a hurdle for me and I really do believe it all stems from the energetic layers of self, that is why I am creating this, why I feel asking for help is so powerful. I am opening.
I've always worked other jobs as well while creating and refining my personal LLC. In the restaurant industry for years, then Zipline adventure tourism. I am in a transition period and need help through this passage. I have recently started teaching yoga again, and have recently started as a local ecology steward and kayak guide in Jenner on the Russian River.
It is very important to me, especially after the passing of my blood sister that I enjoy every day, as much as possible.
Forging a life that is physically embodied, connected to nature, and rewarding. I know, I know, I could have gotten a "real job" years ago, but wouldn't be the real me.
To my friends and family, any money help would allow me to fully integrate the transitions my immediate family experienced the last four years or so, and help me be able to be in your lives again!
This is why I have been removed and distant from many of you, navigating debt and financial deficit while, creating and showing up as much I could, left me depleted in many other areas, unable to complete my grieving process so as to have present relationships with my loved ones.
To everyone reading, thank you, truly, for taking in of my honest authentic exposure!
The money will first go to paying down debt, loans and credit cards to return me to level ground, to help pull me up out a hole, before it gets any deeper.... And then to act as a bit of a pillow and buffer while I transition into the new jobs and continue to refine and expand GITA ROSE LLC. I aimed for a number $13,000 (number of transformation) that feels a little high for my current situation, my deficit is not that deep, and yet it feels important for me to play with the symbolism and to continue to step into the value of my worth!
I am also available for sessions and immersive containers if any one would like support and reflections in creating a life of deep authenticity, GitaRose.com - I also have some paintings available for sale. You can reach out to me via social media, or email is to be found on my website to inquire.
Thank you so much for receiving of my simple and profound asking for help. The money is needed and is absolutely nourishing for the parts of me that feel overextended and are begin to teeter towards crisis. I will ask for help, before it gets there. "You can go in grace or you can go in trauma" - Ke'oni Hanalei
I will go in grace.....
I am available. I receive. I am opening.
I love all of you
Thank you for being you! \
Aloha,
Gita, Marjorie, Margie, Rose Taylor
labels: Happiness, Smile, Shoulder, Beauty, Facial expression

title: Help Hey Doc Clinic Secure Our Forever Home
description:
You made Hey Doc Clinic a reality. Now, help us secure a permanent home!
Dear friends,
Hey Doc Clinic isn’t just our clinic, it’s yours.
Together, we turned a dream into a place where over 2,000 patients have been seen, respected, and cared for. We built a space that centers BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ folks while welcoming everyone. We’ve grown from one doctor and one admin to a full team because of you, your donations, your trust, your belief that we deserved and needed to exist.
Now we are taking a huge leap with the next big step: buying a building to root into permanency, and just like before, we can’t do it without you.
Why This Matters
Small, community-rooted clinics like ours get pushed out every day by rent hikes, building sales, and unsafe spaces. Owning this building means we stay put, no one can sell it out from under us, make the rent out of reach, or stop us from growing.
This is more than just buying a building. It is about shedding an area of control that dominant systems have long held through rentals and systems that have historically kept people of color out of these spaces. By owning this space, we ensure that Hey Doc Clinic, and the community it serves, will be here for generations.
More Than a Clinic
The continued growth of Hey Doc Clinic is an ongoing community effort, never just one person’s job.
With a permanent home, we will:
Provide assurance and security for our staff, providers, and patients.
Host workshop programming and support groups that bring people together.
Rent space to mission and vision aligned health and wellness practices.
Turn our walls into a gallery for local artists and donate space for community fundraisers.
Offer retail shelf space to support local makers whose products align with our mission.
This is how we root into permanency, creating a lasting space for healing, connection, and belonging.
How You Can Be Part of It
We’re raising funds for the down payment and move-in essentials:
-Carpet Replacement & Interior Paint $15,000
-ADA Ramp & Front Entry Modification $25,000
-Equipment for practitioners $7500
-AC Replacement (AC Units were stolen during vacancy) $25,000
-Moving Expenses $6500
Let’s Do This Together
Hey Doc has always been a collective effort. Every donation, big or small, is part of protecting what we’ve built together and planting it firmly in the ground for the future.
Portland is what we make it, healthcare is what we make it.
Let’s root Hey Doc Clinic into permanency, together.
Care for Everyone. Centered on Equity.
labels: Smile, Happiness, Advertising, Collage, Graphic design

title: Save The Reef!
description:
The Reef Studios has always been more than just a studio — it’s been a home for artists, musicians, and community builders. It has been a classroom, and safe space for middle school and high school youth of Oakland Unified School District.
After 5 years of operation and impact, The Reef has reached a critical point in its story. While the studio has been able to survive many challenges including a global pandemic, the financial state of the studio has been tremulous for years. Recent changes in ownership and auditing has created an immediate financial and operational strain that is now too great to face without community support.
The Reef is seeking aid from our community in order to continue pouring back into the community. Clearing the hurdles of back taxes and delinquent bills from past ownership will provide a clean slate for the studio to operate sustainably — and to continue offering a safe, creative, and collaborative space for Oakland youth, artists, and changemakers.
This GoFundMe is a call for support! Your contributions will go directly toward stabilizing the business so that The Reef can survive and thrive well into the future. By helping now, you’re not just keeping the doors open — you’re ensuring that artists of all ages have a place to create, collaborate, and grow.

title: Help Brandara Family Farm Expand Healthy Food Access
description:
About Us:
Brandara Family Farm is on a mission to make fresh, healthy food more accessible—by growing microgreens indoors using alternative farming methods in a GAP-certified facility that feeds communities and inspires the next generation of farmers. We love sharing our knowledge and teaching others that you don’t need acres of land to grow real food—just some lights, love, and a little creativity. With your help, we’re building a facility to expand access to nutrient-dense food and create community jobs.
Meet The Founders:
We are Brandon and Sara Mitchell—urban farmers, educators, and founders of Brandara Family Farm . Part of our mission is to share our love of agriculture, innovation, and community. Our farm partners with dieticians, nutritionists, and local organizations like Augusta Locally Grown which helps families access more ways to purchase fresh whole foods by doubling SNAP benefits. Brandara Family Farm microgreens have been part of programs like Food is Medicine and Nourishing Moms that help our customers access the right resources for nutrition. Selling at local farmer’s markets help us connect with our neighbors and spread the word about the delicious and nutritious world of microgreens.
Our Solution:
We’re building a GAP-certified growing, harvesting, and packing facility that uses modern, indoor growing technology to bring nutrient-dense food to underserved communities and provide fresh sustainably grown microgreens to food pantries, food hubs, and farmer’s markets local and regional grocery stores. Our mission is to reimagine vegetables and farming—making it climate-resilient, space-efficient, and accessible in the suburbs, cities, or anywhere in between. We want to make farming cool again, and show people of all ages and backgrounds that yes, you can grow your own food—and make a difference doing it.
Why We're the Right People for This:
Farming is deeply personal for us because we grew up around farms in Maryland and Pennsylvania, learning to garden from our parents and community. Getting our hands dirty and growing food and herbs has always been like a lifeline for us by empowering us to become more self sufficient. Growing up in the 80's and 90's, we saw first hand how entire generations of future farmers were discouraged from pursuing agriculture as a viable way to make a living. And now as we live and work around Augusta, GA, we see the community impact that living in a food desert and lack of agricultural education can create. That’s why we do this—to give people a fighting chance at better health through food and farming. With years of hands-on growing experience and deep ties to our community, we’re uniquely positioned to lead this work with heart and impact.
Our Goal:
We’re raising $30,000 to fund sustainable land development, equipment purchases, USDA GAP certification, and hire local help. Your donation helps us grow food, create jobs, and inspire the future of farming
$3500 helps us put a down payment on a 2100 square foot steel building
$20,000 helps us purchase a 2100 square foot steel building - paid in full
$30,000 helps us purchase a building, create interior space for GAP compliance, cover the cost of GAP certification, and purchase more supplies like soil, trays, lights, racks, and seeds
Stretch Goal - $50,000 helps us hire a local work force
Our Plans:
GAP Certification Costs – Covering USDA fees and compliance costs.
Land & Building Structures – Creating a safe, climate-controlled space for food production and hands on learning experiences by using ecologically conscious building methods.
Equipment – Investing in tools, supplies, and vehicles to streamline harvesting, packaging, and distribution.
Community Jobs – Hiring local residents to be part of this mission.
How You Can Help:
Contribute to and/or share this campaign. Help us make this a movement and inspire others to reconnect with their land and empower themselves through food sovereignty.
Thank you for believing in what we’re building—literally and figuratively. Let’s grow something amazing together.
Learn more about us at
Brandara Family Farm
and follow our story on social media -
Facebook
and
Instagram
labels: Smile, Happiness, Facial expression, Advertising, Family

title: From Passion to Purpose: TM Squash & Training
description:
Crowdfunding the next chapter of a lifelong squash journey!
Hi everyone,
As many of you know, squash has been a lifelong passion of mine. After nearly 28 years in the sport, I’ve recently launched my own coaching business, TM Squash & Training, where I provide private squash lessons for players of all levels, from complete beginners to competitive athletes. My mission is to create a welcoming environment where everyone can learn, grow, and develop a lifelong love of squash and experience all the benefits it brings.
Launching this business has been exciting, but it also comes with significant startup costs, like LLC registration, liability insurance, equipment, court rentals, and outreach to grow my client base. That’s why I’m reaching out to my friends, family, and community for support.
I’m working to raise $6,500 to cover these expenses and give TM Squash & Training the stability it needs to grow and serve the community. Every contribution, no matter the size, will directly support this dream and help me expand access to squash for players of all ages and abilities.
If you’re able to donate, share this campaign, or simply cheer me on, I’d be deeply grateful. Thank you for believing in me and supporting this next chapter!
With gratitude,
Tessa
https://www.tmsquashtraining.com

title: Francis Rides 300 Miles to Fight Cancer
description:
I've gotten back into cycling recently, and found out the ACS was asking people to ride 300 miles in October to Fight Cancer. I love riding, and this is a great opportunity to push myself, and help out a worthy cause.
I'll be riding 10-15 miles every day, with longer rides on weekends. I'll post links here to my Ride With GPS so you can see where I rode, and maybe a few pictures of Nazareth, Bethlehem, and Easton.
If all goes well, I should finish my goal by the 26th. If not, I'll do a big ride on Halloween to finish it out.
Scroll through the photos to see my lovely wife, who surprised me by joining for my first mile!
You don't have to give. But if you've got a few extra dollars, I'd love your support! Thanks for reading, and thanks for donating. 100% of funds go straight to the ACS. Literally never even hits my pocket.

description:
Little Dipper Diner is a family-owned and operated restaurant
that has been a part of the community for almost 9 years. It was the dream of Alaskan owners Samantha and Dewey Wells. Having gotten a loan from friends and family, they started up in 2015.
Since COVID-19, however, it's been a challenging endeavor keeping the restaurant open. Due to inflation and other rising costs,

title: Small Business and living expenses
description:
Hi, my name is Cynthia Downen. I’m reaching out on behalf of Macheal Price, owner of Sweet Thangz in Douglass, Ks. Macheal is a self-motivated and hardworking single mother with a true passion for food and serving her community.
She has poured her heart, time, and energy into building her small food business from the ground up. Every meal she makes is crafted with love, and her food has brought joy to so many people. Right now, she’s facing an unexpected challenge that could put everything she’s worked so hard for at risk.
Her food truck recently broke down, and without it, she can’t continue running her business or supporting herself through the craft she loves. She has tried everything to keep things going, but the cost of repairs and keeping the business afloat has become overwhelming.
Macheal is not one to ask for help easily — she’s always been the type to work harder, push through, and find a way. This time, she needs her community’s support to keep her dream alive.
Every donation, no matter how big or small, will go directly toward:
•	Repairing the food truck
•	Covering essential business costs during downtime
•	Keeping her small business open and thriving
Supporting Macheal isn’t just about fixing a truck — it’s about giving a determined entrepreneur the chance to continue serving her amazing food, following her dream, and staying on her feet during a tough time.
If you can, please donate and share this campaign to help spread the word. With your help, Macheal can get back on the road and keep doing what she does best — cooking delicious food and sharing it with the community.
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your kindness and generosity.
labels: Font, Logo, Graphics, Graphic design, Neon

title: Help Devon Reignite His Culinary Dreams
description:
Hi, my name is Devon!!! I'm an up-and-coming chef, trying to spread love and unite the community through amazing flavors and bold tastes. I've been a chef for the last 3 years in San Francisco, working for a company called "Farming Hope," where we help food-insecure families obtain fresh and nutritious fruits, vegetables, and healthy meals they otherwise may not have access to. Farming Hope also provides free weekly fine dining dinners that are open to all those same food-insecure families and offers a Paid Culinary Apprenticeship program for those having a hard time adjusting back to society and the workplace. After graduating this program, I worked at Farming Hope as one of their Chef/Trainers for 2 and a half years! But after being hit in a hit-and-run accident last year,
my dream of becoming one of the greatest chefs in San Francisco has been cut short!
And with my health issues taking a turn for the worse, my doctor doesn't see me in anyone's kitchen anytime soon, so
it's time for me to get in my own.
So, I'm gonna put my pride aside and ask for a little help to get back to chasing my dreams! This money will be used to purchase a food trailer, so that I can get back to my dream of spreading love through food again....
labels: Hat, Dishware, Cook, Serveware, Chef

title: Please help me save and enhance my business
description:
My name is Keiko Acri, and I have owned Petals Makeup and Skincare for over ten years. I am starting this GoFundMe for a few reasons. First, I would like to change my business to incorporate healing. I have lost my son and daughter this year, and it has completely changed how I view my life and my work. After losing two children so suddenly, I have realized that life is very short. I had wanted to change the mission of my business from beauty to health and well-being for a few years. Now, I realize it is time.
Second, I would like to change the name of my business in my daughter’s honor. She passed very quickly from ovarian cancer. She always wanted to start a business with a name that she had for years. I want to honor her by changing to that name.
And finally, I am struggling financially. Not only from taking time off from grief, but also from the time I took off to care for my daughter before she passed and being with my son when he passed. It all happened too quickly!
My focus has always been to help people look and feel good. To me, skincare is more than just creams and makeup. I have done a lot for my clients, and I want to keep that up. And, I want to incorporate healing as well. My daughter suffered a lot during her process. Her doctors did not want to incorporate any naturopathic therapies. They were just giving her chemotherapy and lots and lots of opioids. So, she was either in extreme pain or drugged up. She only lived a year after she was diagnosed. I believe she did not have to suffer as much as she did.
Things are just not looking good for me at the moment, and I need something good.
I specialize in taking care of people. I want to be able to take the time to really focus on people who need the care I can give them. I do not want to lose my business or my purpose. I would appreciate any help I can get to continue with my goal.
Thank you so much to everyone who has been there for me in my time of grief.
labels: Head, Arm, Hand, Happiness, Finger

title: I’m Swimming 5 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
I’m swimming 5 miles to help the American Cancer Society (ACS) fight for a world without cancer. This is a very meaningful cause for me.   In February 2024, my mother Sharon was diagnosed with Angiosarcoma, a rare and aggressive cancer that starts in the endothelial cells that line the walls of blood vessels or lymphatic vessels. In June 2024, Mom underwent an all day surgery at Jefferson hospital in Philadelphia to remove areas on her scalp and neck. It was a hard and painful road to recovery, but she is doing well and continuing her immunotherapy treatments in Washington Twp., NJ.
I hope this fundraiser encourages Mom and helps us get closer to one day living in that cancer-free world the ACS is working hard to create.
ACS holds top ratings from Charity Navigator, the Better Business Bureau Wise Giving Alliance, and Candid. So give with confidence! Please consider donating because every little bit helps.
Thank you for your support!
Sam

title: From Market Success to Freezer Stress – We Need Your Help
description:
This year we started selling our goat meat at two farmers markets, and we’ve been so encouraged by the response! But, as is often the way with small businesses and farming, we haven’t yet been able to generate enough revenue to cover a big, unexpected expense.
This spring, we purchased a used commercial freezer for our goat meat.
Unfortunately, it broke down much sooner than expected.
The good news: thanks to our wonderful customers, we sold everything quickly and didn’t lose any meat.
The hard news: without a freezer, we can’t process more goats—which means our farm is at a standstill.
Repairing the freezer will cost $3,000. A brand-new one would be around $7,000, so for now, we’re choosing the repair route.
If you’ve enjoyed our products or simply want to support local farmers, we’d be so grateful for your help. Every dollar brings us closer to getting back up and running.
Your support helps us cover this unexpected expense and keep our farm moving forward. We are so thankful to have you as part of our journey.

title: Help Us Open Vintage Ink Stationery in Orlando!
description:
Hi everyone! My name is Khloé and I’m the founder of Vintage Ink Stationery—a cozy, creative haven for journalers, writers, and lovers of all things paper. Vintage Ink was born from my dream to create a space where community, creativity, and self-expression meet. Think a little bit of nostalgia, a dash of literary charm, and a lot of encouragement for people to slow down, write, and connect with themselves and others.
This space isn’t just about stationery—it’s about belonging. Whether you’re jotting down your dreams in a journal, penning a letter to a friend, or discovering a new creative hobby, Vintage Ink Stationery is designed to be a welcoming corner for inspiration, conversation, and connection.
I’ve found the perfect location where this vision can come to life, but the costs of bringing it to reality are adding up quickly. My goal is to open our first physical shop by spring 2026—one that reflects our values of creativity, inclusion, and community—but I need your help to make it happen. Funds raised will go toward things like store build-out, display fixtures, initial inventory, marketing, and hiring local staff to help run workshops and events.
If you’re able to support, every contribution—big or small—brings this dream closer to reality. And if donating isn’t possible right now, sharing our campaign with friends, family, or fellow stationery lovers goes a long way. Together, we can build something beautiful for our community.

title: Help Us Save Spanish Marie
description:
HELP US SAVE SPANISH MARIE
To our friends, fans, neighbors, and community:
Spanish Marie started as a dream in 2013. From day one, we set out to build something different. Local laws were changed to make it possible, we built it by hand, and poured everything into it. Over the years we earned recognitions like Best Brewery in Miami and participated in events all over the country. Spanish Marie was built on grit, imagination, and heart. A place rooted in integrity, creativity, and community.
We built a space for Miami’s beer lovers, creatives, misfits, and families to come together. A home for every event imaginable from trivia nights and DND to drag shows and blood raves in the speakeasy. We can still see the neon silhouette of Vecna engulfed in flames during SOOOUR THINGS and the candle lit skies of Spanish Marie and the Brewer's Carb Stone. We saw strangers become regulars and regulars become family.
This year we were hit by the perfect storm: a struggling industry, a staggering economy, rising costs, unpaid invoices, equipment failures, county pressure, fines, staffing challenges, personal health issues and medical procedures that continue. And on top of it all, our rent nearly doubled. It pushed us past the point where the current setup could survive, even during strong months.
We’re now at a breaking point. But there’s still a small window... a tiny chance to stick around. If we can downsize and focus operations around the brewhouse and speakeasy, we have a shot at keeping Spanish Marie alive in a new form.
Your donation will help cover immediate needs like back rent, utilities, labor, equipment repairs, new equipment, and the transition ahead. Every bit helps. Whether it's five dollars, a share, or just a kind message. If you’ve ever had a beer here, attended an event, or felt part of this beautiful thing we built, please consider helping us keep it going.
I’d like to give a huge thanks to every staff member past and present. To everyone who ever came out, brought a friend, supported a release, or just believed in what we were building, you made this more than a brewery. You made it home.
Now the tough part is we need $100,000 and we know this is a big number, but even a piece of that would help us buy some time to find other resources. Every bit helps.
With love and deep gratitude,
Alby
labels: Facial expression, Black hair, Smile, Cartoon, Animated cartoon

title: Help Replace Buffalo Brewing's Vital Equipment
description:
My name is John Domres Jr. and
I am the owner and brewer at Buffalo Brewing Company
, a family-owned and operated brewery specializing in lager. We brew historic brands like Simon Pure, Manru Lager, and Bellweiser. Our production brewery is located in the historic Schreiber Brewery in the heart of Buffalo's Polonia District.
On the evening of 7/10,
our glycol chiller was vandalized for its aluminum evaporator, rendering the unit useless for our operation
. Since the vandalism, we can no longer produce product. The glycol jacketed, insulated tanks that contain the beer in process have now lost the ability to regulate temperature, essential to the brewing process.
With the chiller destroyed during the height of the summer season, the busiest part of our year and of course the warmest, we are now hoping for a miracle!
Our insurance policy covers mainly our retail operation, including both properties; however, we struggled to get coverage for our Fillmore operation as portions of the building that are intended to be renovated are in bad shape. I took a chance because I wanted to brew in a historic brewery. I knew all along that this would be an uphill battle but never thought we'd suffer a set back of this magnitude.
I want to thank you for your donation or just reading and learning about our little brewery with a tremendous heart.
labels: Barrel, Keg, Brewery, Cylinder, Machine

title: Roots Zero Waste Market - Rooted in Community Campaign
description:
Help us preserve a community cornerstone and continue to build The Grocery Model for a less wasteful world.
OUR ASK:
The financial opportunity your donation provides allows us to build on the foundation we've laid with this young concept of a more ethical, just, and community-driven connection to our producers and the Earth
Here's how we can continue to Honor the Harvest and Grow together, Rooted in Change!
Suggested Contribution Amounts:
$15.00 x 9K Followers = Clears High interest Debt for Pandemic Recovery and Keeps the Market Restocked
$35.00 x 9K Followers = Clears All Start up and Pandemic Debt - Market is Fully stocked & Fully Staffed
$50.00 x 9K Followers = All Start up and Pandemic Debt Cleared, Market is Fully stocked, & Full Staff restored + New equipment and Products and Cafe Offerings, Parking Lot Resurface, Outdoor Sign Refurbish,  Underwriting and advertisement with Local Radio and outreach organizations to expand our presence in the community and grow!
While the goal $$ is set based on our 9,000 Social Media Followers, if you find yourself here, welcome! Let's Grow Roots Together!
We are mindful of budget constraints in everyone's lives, we are hopeful this campaign can show that just like our journey to waste less; the small contributions of many, create big results!
Highlights of what Roots Provides to our community and beyond:
Since 2018, Roots Zero Waste Market has grown from a bold idea to reduce plastic pollution and food waste from the traditional grocery experience, into a vibrant working example to build upon. This kind of alternative, community-powered model is not just viable, it’s needed now more than ever.
We source from over 180 regional/local growers and makers - strengthening our regional economy and resilience, in the face of global supply chain instability.
We offer bulk organic groceries, low-tox household goods, and prepared foods at affordable prices
Eliminate Plastic Pollution and Food Waste from our local landfill for our shoppers and our Market.
Provide an Organic, scratch-made deli/cafe with options for every dietary restriction and preference - sourcing from our grocery area to close the loop on food waste.
Provide community space and fosters connection with each other
Support local artists with commission free space each month of the year and embrace our live- work- create district.
New concepts need time and resources to grow! Thank you for having faith through our commitment.
We would be grateful if you helped us get there together and continue to inspire change throughout the country.
every zero-waste purchase, every locally sourced product—adds up to meaningful change.
We hope to see you in the Market for years to come!

title: TeachDNA, an invitation to molecular biology
description:
TeachDNA
Two biologists, both with deep roots, both with a passion for sculpture and poetry.
One of them is still alive (2025).
(We never met each other, are connected transgenerationally.)
Our desire is to broadcast the wild truth about ourselves and all of Nature,
as revealed just now (over the past ~3 human generations) by molecular analysis of cells.
Starting with
The Way Life Works
(1995, Hoagland & Dodson),
a whimsical and accessible picture-book elucidating the wild fundamentals…
…and a puzzle-toy spun off the book’s cartoon DNA/RNA iconography, called “PlayDNA!”
TeachDNA has future directions:
A ~30th-anniversary refresh
of
The Way Life Works
, with new Comic Commentary, some Rude Interruptions, and an Illustrated Epilogue relating the biggest news in biology since 1995.
More puzzles and games
to invite all inquisitive minds into hidden reality.
We look at Nature with awe, and want to share the awesomeness.
We feel humility and deep connectedness, and we think everyone should.
TeachDNA.net
- a work in progress, Bio-Q&A blog coming soon.
Starting up is expensive. Your generous assistance is very much appreciated.
labels: Terrestrial animal, Art Paint, Mustelids, Clip art, Marsupial

title: Support Alicia Clayton's Therapy Practice Dream
description:
Dear Friends, Family, and Community,
My name is Alicia Clayton, and I am in the final stages of becoming a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist. This has been a long, humbling journey filled with challenges, growth, and the steady belief that healing is always possible.
My deepest passion is working with kids and supporting their families, as well as helping couples and individuals build healthier relationships, find their voice, and heal from the struggles so many of us carry. Strangely enough, I never thought I would enjoy working with couples—but over time I’ve come to love it, and I now see how rewarding that work can be.
Through a sudden chain of events, I have the chance to open a small therapy practice on short notice—possibly within the next two months. If I can step into this quickly, I’m assured a beginning caseload of clients, which is an incredible opportunity. The financial side, however, is a real challenge. Starting a practice requires covering supervision, liability insurance, an online therapy platform, billing systems, office space, and professional listings so new clients can find me.
My dream is to build a practice that offers therapy on a sliding scale so kids, families, and couples can access support without cost being a barrier. I’ve been sober for over five years, and my life experiences have taught me both humility and, to feel alone, and to rebuild—and I want to create a space where others can do the same.
I’m asking for your help in raising $5,000 to cover the essential startup costs. Your support would not only help me get my practice off the ground but would also ripple outward—supporting every child, parent, couple, and individual I’ll be able to walk alongside in their healing journey.
Thank you for taking the time to read this and for considering helping me make this dream a reality. Your encouragement, belief in me, and kindness mean more than I can say.
Warmly,
Alicia Clayton
labels: Monochrome photography, Facial expression, Smile, Monochrome, Black and white

title: Help Me Launch My Starter Poi Store
description:
Hi, I’m Shianne!
I’m working on starting a small business built around something that has changed my life — flow arts.
My dream is to make affordable flow props, starting with handmade sock poi, for anyone who wants to try this amazing art form for themselves. My goal is to spread the joy of flow arts to as many people as possible — anyone willing to pick up a pair of poi and give it a spin!
My vehicle situation is finally resolved, and now I’m focused on keeping life moving forward — literally and creatively! This time, I’m ready to build a side income doing something I love, something I’ve wanted to pursue since 2013.
I plan to open an online store where it won’t cost you an arm and a leg for shipping, and where you can get your starter sock poi quickly — all made right here in the U.S.
Flow arts opened up a whole new world for me. It gave me community, confidence, and color when life felt grey. It’s been my happy place during hard times and my favorite way to express myself when words just don’t cut it. It’s also fantastic exercise — great for cardio, endurance, coordination, and keeping the spirit young and adventurous.
If you’d like to be part of this journey, please consider supporting me as I take this leap. Your help will go toward materials, supplies, and setting up my first online shop so I can bring this dream to life.
Let’s share the flow, the movement, and the magic together.
Thank you so much for believing in this dream — now, let’s GOOOO!
labels: Animation, Graphics

title: Swim 5 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
I’m swimming 5 miles during August to help the American Cancer Society (ACS) fight for a world without cancer. This is a very meaningful cause to me. I’m posting this more as an accountability device.
As I’m swimming all those laps, I will be thinking about how much cancer sucks, how much Ben enjoyed swimming laps when he was healthy and how much he loved the waters of Interlochen's Duck Lake.
If you can give it a few dollars that would be great, but if you only cheer me on, I would thank you from the bottom of my heart.
Update, 8/6: I've swum nearing a kilometer in Duck Lake this week. More to come.

title: Help Kelly Create a Cat Lounge in New Orleans
description:
My name is Kelly Johnson-Hill. I am originally from a small town in Pennsylvania but have lived in New Orleans for the past 4 years. I have always had a passion for animals and a dream to own my own business. I have over 25 years of experience in both volunteering and fostering for animal rescue and retail.
Over the past several years, cat lounges and cafes have increased in popularity around the world, but New Orleans has been left out, until now.
I feel now is the perfect time to combine my two greatest passions and create a fun, relaxing place for both humans and cats to come together, enjoy each other's company, and help find forever homes for homeless cats.
I'm trying to raise enough funds to get this project off the ground. I'm hoping with a little bit of help from the community, I can create a safe and welcoming space for homeless cats to hang out until they find their forever home.
My plan is to find a space where I can create two separate areas. One space will be the actual cat lounge. In this space, there will be lots of things for cats and humans to do to relax and have fun. I would love to be able to create a space big enough to host private and public events like yoga, painting, and game nights.
The second part of the space will be the area for humans to buy all things cat-related. I have some really fun custom toys and merchandise in the works. There will also be mini snacks and soft drinks available for purchase to take into the lounge.
There is no contribution too small; any money raised through this campaign will go directly toward the construction and furnishing of the cat lounge. The faster I can get to my goals, the faster we are to getting homeless cats off the street.
Lastly, as a thank you to anyone who contributes, if you wish to provide your name, you will receive one free entry into the lounge and a free gift upon opening.
Thank you!
Kelly Johnson-Hill
labels: Felidae, Display device, Felinae, Whiskers, Cat

title: Save Bantha Tea Bar!
description:
In 2013, best friends Jack Ball and Brett Boye decided to turn the small plumber’s office at 5002 Penn Avenue into a tea shop. It took two years of renovations to turn that building into the cantina-like shop you walk into today; adding stucco walls, a mosaic-tile floor, and a DIY-assemblage style bar counter incorporating old trolley tracks and glass bottles. Open seven days a week, Bantha creates an inclusive environment, welcoming anyone and everyone who walks in for a cup of tea. The shop also hosts a variety of events, including live bands and DJs, comedy shows, poetry readings, and the occasional karaoke night. Over the years, Bantha Tea Bar has become a staple in the Bloomfield-Garfield community and the wider Pittsburgh region, acting as a third space for people all over the city. As Bantha approaches its ten-year anniversary, we find ourselves in a dangerous position. With the never-ending construction swallowing Penn Avenue and rising tariffs on our stock, Bantha is at risk of closing its doors for good. As the surrounding neighborhoods have seen a strong shift in demographics with many small businesses closing, Garfield is beginning to see a similar trend. With Brett and Jack being in the neighborhood for over 15 years they have been able to withstand a variety of challenges, and become a safe space for locals, immigrants, the LGBTQ community and many more.
Jack, Brett, and all the baristas at Bantha want to continue serving the community for another ten years and beyond, but we need your support to keep going.
** CALL FOR ARTISTS: If you are willing to donate one or two pieces to be auctioned at the benefit event, follow this link and fill out the form:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfPydjXjKjOQO00gG7otLIHltpdR_pNfKcRltmAxvwjBaEaRQ/viewform?usp=preview
**

title: Permits and Equipment
description:
Family, we started something extraordinary—and you’ve already seen the preview. Now it’s time to elevate it to the next level!
To keep serving you and building this movement, we’re working to secure the proper food handler’s permits, vendor/peddler licenses, and equipment required in Westchester County. These steps will allow us to safely and legally reconvene outdoors without interruptions from the city or law enforcement.
Here’s what we need to cover:
•    Food Handler’s Permit (per person): $120
•    Westchester County Vendor License: $200
•    Peddler’s License: $150
•    Equipment & Miscellaneous (tents, coolers, tables, signage, insurance, and setup needs): $1,530
➡️ Total Goal: $2,000
We can’t do this without you. Your financial support is essential to help us reach this goal and bring the vision to life for our community.

title: Help Launch Michael's Beauty Conservatory
description:
Hi, I’m Michael Caballero. For over 30 years, I’ve dedicated my life to the beauty industry as a Master Stylist and Educator. My dream has always been to open the Michael Joseph Beauty Conservatory in Staten Island—a place where aspiring beauty professionals can learn advanced skills, build confidence, and launch meaningful careers.
This dream was put on hold when I stepped away from my career to care for my mother after her husband was tragically killed by a motorist. Supporting her through her final years took everything I had—my time, energy, and resources. Now, as my 50th birthday approaches, I’m determined to finally bring this vision to life, but I’m starting from scratch and need support to make it happen.
The funds raised will help me secure a location for the Conservatory, cover essential business licenses, and provide a financial cushion so I can pay bills and stay afloat while developing the business. Every contribution, no matter the size, brings me closer to creating a space where future stylists can thrive and our community can benefit from new opportunities. If you’ve ever sat in my chair, learned from me, or believe in second chances, your support would mean the world. Let’s make my 50th birthday the start of something lasting and impactful.

title: Opening the doors of Fire and Knives BBQ Restaurant
description:
Molalla’s own Fire and Knives BBQ is opening a brick-and-mortar Restaurant in the Domino’s building next to the new St Clair gas station on Engle Ave in Molalla, Oregon.
My brother, Christopher Shook, is an Award-Winning Chef with a lifelong passion for creating incredible mouthwatering meals for people to not only enjoy but experience.
After years of delighting customers with his Fire and Knives BBQ food truck, stationed near the Molalla Brewing Company regularly, Chef is now ready to open the Doors to Fires and Knives BBQ, as a brick-and-mortar restaurant in Molalla, Oregon
Chef has poured his heart, soul, manual labor and life savings into his dream, and was ready to open his restaurant more than a year ago, but bureaucratic delays and unresponsive architects have drained his resources. He has done everything he can to prepare, and now he needs a little help to finally make his dream a reality.
In Molalla the community is very eager and excited to have the doors open -everywhere Chris goes in town, everyone he meets will ask him "When will your restaurant open?" Since they have tasted his food from his Food Truck, they know what's in store and would really love a place to sit and enjoy his food. They believe in him and so do we.
Your donation will help cover:
*A hood to get a certificate of occupancy
*Building Permits and final approvals
*Startup expenses
In Supporting this cause, every contribution, no matter the size, brings Fire and Knives BBQ Restaurant closer to opening and you are not only helping a small business or community you are helping Chef Chris make his dream come to life, to share his exceptional culinary BBQ and delicious creations with the community of Molalla, and creating a space where friends, families, and neighbors can gather and enjoy really unforgettable food.
Thank you for helping us open the doors and bring Fire and Knives BBQ to Molalla!
Your support means the world to us — we’re excited to share great food and create a place where our community can gather, connect, and feel right at home.

title: Save Colorado Springs’ First Interactive Pizza Restaurant
description:
Our Family’s Pizza Dream — and the Setback We Need Help Overcoming
Hello friends, neighbors, and pizza lovers,
We’re a small, family-owned restaurant right here in downtown Colorado Springs, and just 8 weeks ago we opened our doors with a dream: to bring families together over incredible pizza and one-of-a-kind dining tables where you can order food, play games, and connect with each other.
We’re one of the first restaurants in the USA to feature these innovative interactive tables. Our mission has always been bigger than pizza — it’s about creating a space where families, kids, and friends can make memories while enjoying great food.
But behind the scenes, our journey has been far more difficult than we ever imagined.
The Challenges We Faced
Like most restaurant owners, we knew opening would come with challenges — and we were prepared for them. But from the very beginning, things went wrong:
Construction took more than twice as long as promised.
Almost half of the brand-new kitchen equipment failed in some way, costing us thousands in unforeseen repairs and replacements.
And worst of all: the software that was supposed to power everything — online ordering, reservations, and our interactive tables — turned into a disaster.
We hired a developer a year ago who promised to deliver a fully functioning system with all the features by opening day. Instead, after paying him $155,000, we were left with something completely broken, unstable, and unusable.
When we opened our doors, the system collapsed almost immediately:
Customers couldn’t order or pay smoothly.
Staff had to scramble with pen and paper just to take orders.
Online ordering, waitlists, reservations, pay at the table, and even our website were completely down.
Within 2 weeks, the whole system crashed and became unusable.
It wasn’t just a scramble — it nearly destroyed us before we even began.
The Sacrifice We Made
To build this dream, we put literally everything we own into this restaurant. Our house, our cars, and all our possessions went into construction, equipment, and custom tables. From the dirt floors of the building to the final details, we are now in for over $1 million — money we don’t have but risked because we believed in this dream.
We planned carefully, setting aside $75–100k for software, which both we and the developer agreed was reasonable. But instead, he drained us for $155k, and now it will take another $50k with our new development team just to fix his broken system.
That unplanned $100,000 overrun wiped out our marketing and operating budget — leaving us completely exposed just weeks after opening.
Where We Are Now
We’ve since hired a new 4-person development team who has stabilized the system so it finally doesn’t crash. After 8 weeks of patching broken code, we’re only now able to roll out the basics — like our website and online ordering — things we should have had on day one.
But without the features we originally promised, we can’t deliver the full experience we dreamed of:
More family-engaging games on the tables (like trivia night).
Build-your-own menu customization.
Pay-at-the-table convenience.
Instead of focusing on food, service, and community, we’ve been fighting fires — and we’re nearly out of money.
Why We’re Asking for Help
We never imagined we’d be in this position. We hate having to ask for help, but after pouring everything we own into this dream, we have no other choice if we want to keep our doors open.
We love what we do — we’ve been making pizzas for over 5 years. We love this community — we’re Colorado Springs natives. And we still believe this restaurant can become something truly special.
The truth is, $50,000 won’t cover all of the software fixes or operating expenses we’re facing — but every bit helps, and it will make a huge dent in getting us back on track:
Helping stabilize and continue developing the software we should have had from day one.
Covering staff and basic operating expenses so we can keep our doors open.
Allowing us to finally invest in small marketing efforts to spread the word.
Every donation — big or small — gets us one step closer to surviving this storm and building the restaurant Colorado Springs deserves
How You Can Help
Come visit us and try a pizza!
Share this campaign with friends, family, and your community.
Leave us a kind review online to help spread the word.
And if you’re able, donate. Every single dollar helps.
We also promise that once we’re stable, we’ll pay it forward by donating back to community and charitable causes here in Colorado Springs.
From Our Family to Yours
❤️
We know times are tough for so many people right now, and it means the world to us that you’ve even taken the time to read our story.
This restaurant is more than just a business — it’s our family’s dream. With your help, we can turn this setback into a comeback and keep serving Colorado Springs the best pizza in the most fun way possible.
Thank you for supporting us,
Kristina, Kevyn, and Kylor Bradley
707 Pizza Co.
labels: Blue, Font, Symbol

title: Leo’s Bug Business Fund (entomoleogy)
description:
Hello! My name is Leo, and I’m 21 years old. Ever since I was a very young child, I have loved bugs. I am severely disabled with a neurological disorder called functional neurological disorder (FND), which causes me to have seizures, loud tics, drop attacks, and various other symptoms. For this reason, I am unable to work a typical job. My dream is to open a small business selling pet bugs. Proceeds from this fundraiser will go towards various things such as enclosures, bugs to begin the breeding process, and, eventually, building a website. Please, help me make my dream come true, and donate today!
(Logo designed by the talented Crimson/@bullpr1nce on Instagram!)

title: Sacred Vortex Holistic Healing Center
description:
Hello, my name is Christopher Chavez. I recently moved from Los Angeles, California to Sedona, Arizona at the beginning of this year. I felt called to come here; at first, I didn’t know why. I came here the first week of January for a seminar. Once I was here, I didn’t wanna go back to California, so I stayed, applied for jobs, and found a place to stay.
Since then, I was fortunate enough to land a job and two more after that, then rent a beautiful townhome in the village of Oak Creek. Ten months later, I met this amazing woman who is retiring from her holistic healing business and is willing to offer me the business after she retires.
I see this opportunity as a blessing because I never would have imagined something like this to be possible ten months ago.
With this holistic healing center, I feel I could help so many people, and I’ve always had a feeling that part of my mission and life goal is to help others heal themselves.
I have 3 1/2 months to come up with the down payment, which I’m confident I will be able to make happen.
The amount requested is only a portion of it. The rest I will have myself. Any kind of support would be very well received and appreciated no matter how big or small. Anyone who donates is more than welcome to stop by the healing center for any one therapeutic session free of charge.
Help Me So I Can Help So Many Others Heal Themselves ❤️
labels: Blue, Daytime, Facial hair, Jaw, Facial expression

title: Be Part of Verna's Ministry Vision and Purpose
description:
Hello, everyone. My name is Verna. I'm raising funds to start my ministry.
A place where the people of God can have a safe place to come and worship the Lord Jesus Christ so they can allow God to heal them, deliver them, and get set free, and learn to have a personal relationship with Jesus.
I am stepping out on faith, but I desperately need your help to get the building. A place for my ministry. I am not revealing the name until I have the building, but I have taken all the necessary steps. Now, I need your help.
Please, can you help me?
I am going to buy the building, not rent. So, whatever you can afford to donate, I am grateful. I am walking in purpose and destiny. Thanks for your support.

title: Help us take this financial burden off our hands
description: Since we have opened this restaurant we have put in lots of money into the building ,unfortunately we never received help from the landlord to make any repairs/upgrades to the building.it came to a point where we have had a financial burden and we have tried to negotiate with the landlord but we were unsuccessful.in order to save the business we had to hire an attorney and unfortunately we don’t have funds to cover the cost of attorney.We are grateful for all our loyal customers that visit us at the restaurant and we really appreciate all your help and support.

title: Help Preserve Frabjous: A Sanctuary for Cats and Community
description:
Dear Frabjous Family,
Two years ago, we opened Frabjous Catfé with a dream:
To create a cozy, whimsical space in Wake Forest where rescue cats could feel safe and loved—and where people could find joy, healing, and connection.
Thanks to your support, nearly 100 cats found forever homes, and hundreds of people found a sense of peace, purpose, and community here.
But today, that dream is at risk.
Why We’re Fundraising
Our lease has ended, and despite every effort, we’re unable to remain in our current location. We are closing our doors—for now—but we’re not giving up.
We're launching this fundraiser to raise $100,000 to:
Cover core operating costs during this critical transition
Provide continued care for our remaining cats
‍ Pay staff and retain our small but dedicated team
️ Secure and build out a new location
Keep the mission and magic of Frabjous alive
Where Your Donations Will Go
Core Operating Expenses (4–5 months): $45,000
Rent ($2,710/month): $13,550
Utilities ($500/month): $2,500
Staff wages ($3,700/month): $18,500
Inventory & Supplies (coffee, snacks, café items): $4,000
Insurance, Admin, POS systems: $6,450
Cat Care Needs: $12,000
Enrichment and habitat support
Relocation & Build-Out: $20,000
Securing a new space (deposit, permits, inspections)
Basic renovations, furniture, fixtures
Moving and equipment transport
Community Engagement & Recovery: $5,000
Pop-up events
Marketing & rebranding efforts
Raising awareness for future plans
Platform Fees (~5%): $5,000
Covers GoFundMe’s processing fees so we receive the full amount
Emergency & Sustainability Buffer (~13%): $13,000
Helps protect against unplanned expenses, emergencies, and supports our stability during this transition
❤️ Why This Matters
Frabjous Catfé has always been more than a café. It’s:
A safe haven for rescue cats
A launchpad for second chances
A place where laughter, healing, and adoption happened daily
A home for volunteers, artists, and local animal lovers
If Frabjous has ever made you smile, introduced you to your furry best friend, or brought magic into your day—we’re asking you to help us continue that mission.
✨ How You Can Help
Donate what you can—every dollar truly makes a difference
Share our story on social media, with friends and family
Host a mini fundraiser or collaborate with us on a community event
We believe in this mission. We believe in our cats. And most of all, we believe in you—the people who have supported us from day one.
Let’s save Frabjous Catfé, together.
With love and endless gratitude,
Dawn & The Frabjous Catfé Team

title: I Built a Bakery. Now I Need to Rebuild It for My Body.
description:
Hi. I'm Rory Kandel — founder of Rory’s Bakehouse, a frozen bake-at-home bakery built on love, nostalgia, and resilience.
I started Rory’s Bakehouse during lockdown, mostly as a way to stay busy and channel my lifelong love of baking. One thing led to another, and before I knew it, I was building my childhood dream — a bakery that ships frozen treats nationwide, designed to bring that fresh-from-the-oven magic straight to your home.
On the outside, everything looked like it was rising beautifully. But behind the scenes, my health was starting to crumble. After months of strange symptoms, I was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis in December 2023. I’m only a year and a half into this diagnosis, but already it has dramatically changed how I move through the world — literally. Walking, something I used to take for granted, has become something I have to focus on with every step.
Still, I show up every day. I love what I do too much to stop. Some people might hang up the apron — and no judgment if they do — but that’s not me. I just need a few accommodations to keep going.
The floors in my kitchen came with the space — I didn’t choose them, and they were never designed with accessibility in mind. Now, every uneven tile feels like a hurdle. I’m still figuring out the right mobility aids, but even without them, just getting from one side of the kitchen to the other can be exhausting, painful, and sometimes even dangerous. What used to be second nature — moving freely, carrying trays, baking with ease — now takes so much more from me.
Replacing the flooring with a smoother, accessible surface and adding a small ramp at the back door would change everything. It would give me the freedom to move safely through the space I’ve poured my heart into — and help ensure I can keep doing what I love for years to come.
This space isn’t just where I work. It’s where I dream, create, and connect with customers who’ve turned into a community. I’ve come this far through grit, cookies, and a whole lot of heart. I’d be so grateful for any support in making this next phase possible.
If we’re lucky enough to exceed our goal, every additional dollar will go toward something even bigger. Any money raised above and beyond what we ask for will be donated to the National Multiple Sclerosis Society — an organization that’s become deeply personal to me since my diagnosis. Your support not only helps me keep baking, but also gives back to a cause that’s working toward better treatment, awareness, and ultimately a cure.
Thank you so much for reading, for caring, and for cheering me on.
With love,
Rory
labels: Beauty, Facial expression, Smile, Tooth, Happiness

title: Help Moldova Parking Lot Owner Recover from Arson
description:
Title:
Support Parking Lot Owner in Moldova After Arson — 6 Cars Burned
Story:
Dear friends,
On Friday, September 19, 2025, around 4:30 a.m., a tragic incident took place in Moldova. An unknown person doused several cars in a parking lot with a substance and set them on fire. As a result, six cars that had been placed there for sale were completely destroyed.
The parking lot owner now faces the obligation to compensate the full value of these vehicles, with the total damages reaching approximately
$70,000
. For one person, this is an unbearable financial burden that could ruin his livelihood.
We are raising funds to help him recover from this devastating situation.
Every contribution, no matter how small, will make a difference.
All collected donations will be sent directly to Moldova to support the parking lot owner who suffered this loss.
Please consider donating and sharing this campaign. Your generosity will provide real relief in a moment of despair and show that kindness crosses all borders.
Tiktok account:
https://www.tiktok.com/
@vasioko1?_t=ZP-8zrzVby9AWU&_r=1
Thank you for standing together in solidarity!
labels: Fire, Flame, Smoke, Emergency service, Emergency

title: More Croissants! Support 222 Pastry’s Next Chapter
description:
Help 222 Pastry Grow Into Its Next Chapter
First, I want to say how deeply grateful I am. Your encouragement, love and support have carried me to this point where 222 Pastry is truly thriving. What started as a dream is now a busy, growing bakery pop-up that I pour my heart into every single day and I couldn’t have gotten here without you.
Now, I’m stepping into the next chapter. I recently moved into my own beautiful kitchen space, which I share with one other small business. This is an exciting step but it also means I’ve had to purchase all of my own equipment to keep production going.
To truly grow and to keep up with demand I need a few key pieces of equipment:
•	A croissant laminator (to roll butter layers more efficiently)
•	A proofer (to create consistent, high-quality pastries faster)
•	A stacked convection oven
• 30 qt mixer and table
With these tools, I’ll be able to produce so many more croissants and pastries (which you know sell out so quickly!) and my process will become faster and more efficient. This means more of my baked goods will make it into your hands and I’ll be able to expand my wholesale and community offerings.
I know times are tough for everyone and it means so much to me that you’ve already supported me on this journey. If you’re able to contribute or even just share this campaign, you’ll be helping me take 222 Pastry to the next level.
Thank you, truly, for believing in me and in 222 Pastry. Every message, share and donation makes a difference and I’d be honored to have you as part of this next chapter.
With endless thanks and gratitude,
Allie
No raffles, sweepstakes, giveaways, or promotions are offered in exchange for any donations made to this GoFundMe.
labels: Food, Ingredient, Pastry, Dessert, Finger food

title: Please Help Book Love Bar continue and reach Phase2!
description:
My name is Jessica Tharp and I am the proud owner of Book Love Bar, together with my husband, Stephen. We are thrilled by how far our journey has taken us and are deeply grateful for the incredible support we've received from our community. Our vision is blossoming—soon, we'll add an inviting bar and cozy coffee nook to BLB, making it an even more vibrant gathering space.
We believe in the power of community and are excited to see our business growing with new monthly events and book clubs, each bringing more friends and neighbors together. Every day, our dream of making BLB a welcoming hub filled with conversation, laughter, and connection comes closer to reality.
Our Business Plan statement reflects our heart: Our mission at Book Love Bar is to share our passion for reading and our experience in hospitality. We aim to create a space where everyone can enjoy a good book, a delicious drink, and inspiring conversation. We are so excited for what lies ahead, and grateful to have such a wonderful community behind us as we take these next steps.
We are reaching out for support as we embark on this exciting new chapter. Every contribution will go directly toward creating our envisioned bar and coffee nook, from building out the space to securing the equipment and licensing we need. Our dream is to welcome you into this expanded space by next summer.
Thank you so much for considering being part of this journey. Your generosity, in any amount, means the world to us and brings us closer to making Book Love Bar an even more vibrant community gathering place.

title: How can you support Red Pearl?
description:
Hi friends,
This is Karen G., founder of Red Pearl Yoga. Can you believe it’s been 24 years?! We’re deeply grateful to be part of this amazing community. Red Pearl has become known for its intimate, unheated classes and a team of some of the most caring, talented teachers around. Your support over the years is the reason we’ve been able to grow and thrive in an ever-changing world.
Unfortunately, this summer has been particularly slow, and I’ve personally been covering the studio’s shortfall. However, I recently experienced a serious medical emergency (a disc herniation), and this has made it difficult for me to continue supporting both my personal expenses and the studio during my recovery.
To help Red Pearl Yoga through this temporary challenge, we’ve created this GoFundMe. Your donation will help us bridge the gap until class attendance naturally increases again usually during the winter season when our snowbirds, travelers, and tourists return to Fort Lauderdale.
If you're able to contribute no matter the amount, thank you from the bottom of my heart.
You can also support us by purchasing:
Class Packages - If you already have a package, don’t worry new ones will stack behind your current one.
Gift Cards
Red Pearl Merchandise such as Yoga Mats, Blocks, T shirts.
I’m healing slowly but steadily. My years of yoga practice have helped me stay grounded and positive throughout this process. I truly believe in this practice physically, emotionally, and spiritually.
Thank you for being part of this journey. Keep doing yoga. It works.
With gratitude,
Karen G.
labels: Physical fitness, Exercise, Yoga, Yoga mat, Yoga pants

title: Help Us Launch The Unmentioned Project
description:
Help Launch The Unmentioned Project
We’re reaching out to our community to help us cover the start-up costs of getting The Unmentioned Project off the ground while we wait for our official 501(c)(3) status.
Our mission is to break the stigma around men’s mental health by normalizing open conversation, connecting men and their families to accessible resources, and working with community partners to prevent suicide and support families affected by suicide.
This mission is deeply personal to me. I, Hannah, along with our dedicated board, founded The Unmentioned Project to honor my dad, whose loss to mental health struggles has been the hardest experience of my life. Through this work, we aim to help other men and families facing similar challenges, offering strength, resources, and a safe place for open conversation.
Your gift today covers essential start up costs while our 501(c)(3) status is pending:
•	Marketing materials - ($50 could cover the cost of business
cards)
•	Software costs - ($50 could cover the cost of a months worth of
website maintenance)
•	Filing fees - ($320 could cover all filing costs)
•	Promotional products - ($90 could cover the cost of stickers with
the foundation logo)
•	Items for our first event on August 24th - ($150 could cover the
cost of a table and tablecloth with our foundation logo)
•	Other essential start-up expenses for the foundation - ($200
could cover the cost of a laser printer and supplies)
Any funds remaining after start-up costs will go straight back into the foundation, helping us provide resources and support to our community. While our nonprofit status is pending, donations may not be tax-deductible; we’ll let you know as soon as that changes.
Please donate and share this page with your friends. If you’d like to follow our journey or see updates on upcoming events, connect with us on:
Instagram: @theunmentionedproject
Facebook: The Unmentioned Project
For questions or to learn more about our mission, message us on one of the social media platforms listed above — we’d love to hear from you.Thank you for your kindness, generosity, and belief in this cause.
With gratitude,
Hannah Heim
Founder, President & CEO
The Unmentioned Project

title: Help Bring LA SOBRIA to Life – A Non-Alcoholic Cocktail Bar
description:
LA SOBRIA: Non-Alcoholic Cocktails, Puerto Rican Soul
Hello! My name is Yolanda, and after many years working in the food and beverage industry, it’s finally time to take a big step: to open my own space, something different, authentic, and filled with culture.
That dream is called
LA SOBRIA:
A non-alcoholic craft cocktail bar with delicious Puerto Rican tapas. But LA SOBRIA will be more than just a bar: it will be a cultural and artistic hub, a gathering place where both artists and non-artists can enjoy music, poetry, film, theater, and the richness of Puerto Rican culture.
Why LA SOBRIA?
Because I believe in creating an inclusive space where everyone can enjoy a great cocktail without alcohol while also feeling part of a creative and vibrant community.
Our goal
To make this dream a reality,
I need your support.
Our initial goal is $15,000 USD, which will go toward:
• Basic construction and remodeling of the space
• Permits and licenses
• Essential equipment and furniture
• Initial inventory of non-alcoholic cocktails and Puerto Rican tapas
labels: Font, Poster, Advertising, Design, Graphic design

title: Tony runs for Nonie - 100 Miles in October to fight Cancer
description:
Mom would have turned 75 on September 15th this year. Aunt Helen would be turning 74 in a couple months. Big Phil might still be meticulously chipping away at a project...
We've all got a cancer story somewhere close to us.
I smoked for 20 years. In March, I decided to try to run some - to try to get in better shape and also "give back" a little to my heart and lungs. I know I hadn't taken care of them, and I often worried they'd fail me if I pushed on them too hard.
This summer, I decided to sign up for a 5k race in November, and as I've gotten in my training runs 4 times a week, I've done things I never thought I would. For one, I often wake up at 5:30, lace up my shoes and head out for more than an hour before returning to make breakfast for us, see Rachael off to work and spend the day with Augie.
When this challenge popped up - run 100 miles in October to raise money to support the American Cancer Society, it felt like it fit this moment for me.
100 miles in a month, though... That's more than a 5k every day of the month.
That's a bit of a stretch for training for a 5k! But with a push and your support running for a good cause, I know it's within reach.
So let's do this!
When I hear that alarm in the morning, when I'm out there plodding away in the dark, mile after mile, I'll carry them & your support with me all the way. Thank you.
All donations go directly to the American Cancer Society.

description:

Our mobile Cookie and Ice Cream Cart!

The donated funds will be used to help us launch the cart and all the expenses that come with it.
We are only reaching out to our friends and family at this time as it is not something we are able to post on social media or answer any questions about until legal measures and logistics are finalized, so please keep this confidential and only share with close family and friends and not post on any social media platforms.
Anything would be a blessing, and I sincerely appreciate the support you have already given.
Love,
Cherish

title: Honor Clare Celano: Support CCH Foundation
description:
On September 9, 2025, at 6:21 PM, my mother, Clare Celano, passed away after a long and challenging medical journey. Her time in the hospital was filled with ups and down, painful moments of struggle, but also beautiful moments of resilience and accomplishments that many thought were impossible. Each day, Mom woke with strength and courage, determined to fight and endure months of challenges with incredible grace.
Clare was so much more than a patient—she was a devoted mother, an accomplished journalist, a cherished friend, a caring nurse of more than thirty years and a beautiful soul who touched every life around her. She loved deeply, laughed often, and gave endlessly. Her radiant smile will never be forgotten.
As we say goodbye, I am carrying forward her story and her spirit telling her story and demanding accountability by creating a documentary with the real life story of her medical journey and building The CCH Foundation (Clare Celano Humanitarian Foundation). The charitable foundation is dedicated to effecting change in healthcare focusing on mental health, patients with disabilities, and accountability within hospitals, subacute facilities, long-term acute care centers, and nursing homes.
No family should ever feel bullied for advocating for their loved one. Doctors must recognize that families often know their loved ones best. Patients deserve access to their own therapists and psychiatrists—especially because trust is not easily given, and for many, it is the foundation of healing.
Our Mission
The mission of the CCH Foundation is to advocate for and support patients by ensuring they have access to the resources, information, and care they need to navigate their healthcare journey.
We are committed to empowering individuals and their families, promoting patient rights, and bridging gaps in healthcare systems.
Through education, support services, and collaboration with healthcare professionals, we strive to create a more compassionate, equitable, and understandable healthcare environment for all patients.
Any contribution, no matter the size, will help us honor Clare’s memory, launch the CCH Foundation, and ensure her fight creates lasting change for others.
Your donations will give us the jump start to file for the 501(c)(3) as well as start creating the documentary of Moms medical journey. No life should end being thrown in a diaper and disrespected. The CCH FOUNDATION promises change.
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for your kindness, prayers, and support during this heartbreaking time
https://www.instagram.com/cchfoundationnj?igsh=MXZ0bG13azRzbGEw
.
labels: Text, Font, Happiness, Graphics, Graphic design

title: Help Beatnix Open Dover's First Coffeehouse and Dry Bar
description:
Dover's first dedicated coffeehouse and dry bar is in the works, and we need your support!
We’re Ash and Nico, owners of Beatnix Coffee Station in Dover, New Hampshire. We’ve spent years helping the Seacoast get its coffee fix.
Now we're looking to serve our signature drinks along with exciting new options in a unique social atmosphere: A happening place to hang out and schmooze, without the booze.
Our vision for Beatnix Coffeehaus & Dry Bar is inspired by Beat Generation coffeehouses and temperance bars of the early 20th century. Imagine not only an offbeat spot to grab a coffee, but an evening venue for social events, roundtable discussions, poetry readings, puppet shows… anything our endlessly weird and wonderful community can dream up.
What’s On Tap?
Beatnix Coffeehaus & Dry Bar will offer a diverse assortment of mocktails, non-alcoholic beer and wine, soft drinks, and - of course - Beatnix coffee. Our menu will include:
NA Beer Variety: A quality selection of local and craft non-alcoholic beer.
Creative Mocktails: Signature drinks that match the complexity and flavor of traditional cocktails without the drag on your liver or your wallet.
Coffee: You know it and love it from Beatnix Coffee Station! We’ll continue to feature a selection of hot coffee and cold brew, as well as lattes and espresso-based beverages.
Community Event and Art Space: Featuring regular themed events, live performances, and other gatherings to foster community engagement - not just for hepcats and daddy-o’s, but anyone looking to make connections and get their kicks outside of a conventional bar setting.
Why Non-Alcoholic?
The demand for alcohol-free options is on the rise. Newly-released Gallup polling shows that American alcohol consumption is at its lowest levels in close to a century! For a variety of reasons, people are seeking alternatives, and we want to serve this growing need. We’ll provide a welcoming and inclusive social environment for:
Anyone sober or sober-curious
Anyone looking for a fun night out without the hangover
Anyone looking for a hip, safe, all-ages hangout spot
Funding Goals
We are seeking $150,000 to cover the initial costs of opening, including:
Location Lease: Securing a prime location in historic downtown Dover, NH.
Renovations: Creating a cozy and eclectic atmosphere with comfortable seating, funky bar, lighting, and decor (plus tchotchkes and knick-knacks a-plenty!)
Equipment: Purchasing bar equipment, glassware, and initial inventory.
Marketing: Promoting our initial calendar of events and continuing to build our community presence.
We want to redefine social drinking in the Seacoast region. With your help, we can create an inviting and intriguing space that feels like your favorite local haunt, without the influence of alcohol. Please join us in making Beatnix Coffeehaus & Dry Bar a reality!
labels: Graphic design, Graphics

title: Save Lidia’s Cocina at Old Pueblo
description:
Lidia’s Cocina at Old Pueblo has been a cornerstone of Florence, Arizona for nearly 39 years, known to many locals as OP. Since I took over in 2018, it’s been my dream to continue the legacy of this beloved restaurant and keep its doors open for our community. The restaurant isn’t just a place to eat—it’s a gathering spot where memories are made, and where our elderly employees have found a second family.
Right now, we’re facing foreclosure, and without urgent support, we risk losing not just a business, but a vital part of Florence’s history. Lidia’s Cocina has always been about giving back. Every Thanksgiving, we serve meals to those in need, and we maintain a fund to help community members with rent, food, or other essentials. Just recently, we were able to help Shawn Anderson, a local resident facing foreclosure and the threat of losing his home, through our donation fund. At Christmas, we look forward to seeing Nick, our local Santa Claus, who brings joy to the restaurant and the children we sponsor for gifts and school supplies. No one is ever turned away hungry, and our mission has always been to lift up those around us.
I have three employees who have served this community for about 30 years, and they depend on this restaurant for their livelihood. Owning this restaurant was a childhood dream come true for me, and I believe it was a blessing to have the chance to carry on its legacy. With your help, we can protect jobs for our elderly staff, preserve a piece of Florence’s history, and keep serving our neighbors in their times of need. Your support will make a real difference in saving Lidia’s Cocina at Old Pueblo and ensuring it remains a beacon of hope and kindness in our community.
labels: Sign, Advertising
