title: Fuel PairGo: It's growth time!
description: Hi, everyone! My name is Emerie, and I’m the founder and CEO of PairGo. For the past three months, I, along with my small but mighty team, have been building something we truly believe can redefine how people connect and collaborate in more meaningful ways. PairGo isn’t just another app—it’s a breakthrough platform designed to bring new energy and innovation to human interaction. Whether it’s solving challenges, sparking creativity, or helping people uncover deeper truths about themselves, our mission is to create an experience that goes beyond the surface. We’re so excited to announce that our first demo is almost ready to launch! As we approach this huge milestone, we’re asking for your support. Developing PairGo has been an incredible journey, but building something truly great comes with costs—development, legal, and giving our team the tools and resources to keep innovating. Whether you’re able to contribute financially or simply share this campaign with someone who shares our vision, your support makes a world of difference. Thank you for being part of this incredible journey. What we’re creating doesn’t just belong to me or my team—it’s about building a foundation for something much bigger, something that brings people closer in ways that truly matter!

title: Tracy will cycle 300 Miles for the American Cancer Society!!
description:
There is not a single person I know who hasn't been personally affected by cancer's vicious grip. My heart aches for the ones I've lost, for the ones who are battling, and for the ones who will be delivered terrible news in the future. If I can do anything to help raise some funds and awareness for this cause, well damn it I'm going to TRY!!
I intend to cycle 300 miles in the month of October - I genuinely don't know if I can do it, but I hope you will consider joining me on this journey and if you are able, please donate to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world WITHOUT cancer! (ACS has a platinum rating on GuideStar (the highest possible), so you can give with confidence!)
Please consider making a donation because every little bit helps. Thank you all for your support and encouragement - oh, and FUCK CANCER!!!!!

description: Hello, my name is Tawanda Peebles, and I’m the creator and owner of How to Make It in Phoenix. I’m a Jersey girl who has called Arizona home for the past four years. How to Make It in Phoenix is dedicated to helping people navigate life in the Valley. From showcasing local events and businesses to sharing resources and hidden gems, my goal is to highlight the best ways for people to not just live here but truly thrive in Phoenix. With your support, I’ll be able to dedicate more time to research, feature more small businesses and organizations that deserve visibility, expand the series with interviews and in-depth guides, and even host community events that bring people together in real life. Your contributions will also help cover startup costs like a new camera, microphone, website, event expenses, and so much more. Thank you all for your support and generosity. title: Roll Toward Recovery with Mike Weed
description:
I’m raising funds to repair and transport adaptive bikes so stroke survivors and others can ride again. Every dollar helps keep people rolling toward recovery. ‍
Hi, my name is Mike Weed. After surviving a stroke, I found healing and purpose through adaptive cycling. Now, I want to give others facing physical or emotional challenges the same opportunity. I lead bike rides and events that help stroke survivors, people with disabilities, and anyone needing support to get moving again, on three wheels or two.
Right now, I’m raising funds for:
•   Tune-ups for the 9 bikes and trikes we use on rides
•   Hanging storage rato organize them in my garage safelyrage
•   A trailer to transport them to events and community rides
•   Gas and travel costs to bring these bikes where they’re needed most
Every dollar helps get more people rolling toward recovery, connection, and joy. Thank you for fueling this mission!
I’m raising funds to repair and transport adaptive bikes so stroke survivors and others can ride again. Every dollar helps keep people rolling toward recovery. ‍

title: Support Audicity Distributors' Coffee Dream
description:
Fundraising Goal:
$25,000
Mission Statement:
Our mission at
Audacity Distributors
is to deliver exceptional coffee through a one stop, full service fulfillment model that supports every step from soil, through farmers hands, to coffee trees, from bean to cup. We are deeply committed to advancing African American participation and leadership across the coffee industry - from farming and roasting to retail ownership. Through every cup we serve, we aim to empower communities, fuel nonprofit fundraising efforts, and promote equity, sustainability, and impact driven growth.
Michael A. Fleury and Wendell Jones
Directly from Farmers to you - No Middle Man
Farmers from the western highlands of Cameroon offer you their Cameroon Boyo coffee is organically grown on traditional African family farms.
At an average altitude of over 5,000 feet, Cameroon Boyo Coffee grows under ideal climatic conditions on nutrient-rich, dark, volcanic soil. This rich Cameroon soil, along with farmers' skills, produces a flavorful, smooth tasting full-bodies coffee with an enveloping and pleasant aroma. These complimentary characteristics contribute to the fame of Cameroon Boyo Coffee.
From the farms to world markets, Cameroon Boyo Coffee is owned by the growing farmers.
Audacity Distributors are collaborating with the African Coffee Trading Group (ACTG) of Atlanta,Georgia. 100% African American owned, along with the Cameroon Cooperative.
No Raffle, Sweepstakes, Giveaways, or Return On Investment are offered in exchange for any donations made to this GoFundMe.

title: Running 200 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
Mileage progress: 110/200 (as of 10/5/25)
I'm running 200 miles to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer! This challenge will last through September (Childhood Cancer Awareness Month) and October (Breast Cancer Awareness Month), with a goal to raise $1,000.
As a childhood cancer survivor myself, this is a very meaningful cause for me. When I was 17, I was diagnosed with Hodgkin’s Lymphoma. Thanks to the amazing doctors and nurses at Mary Bridge Children’s Hospital in Tacoma, WA, I beat cancer. I want to raise money to help other kids out there beat cancer so they can live their lives to the fullest and make an impact on their communities.
Please consider making a donation because every little bit helps. Thank you for your support! Much love. - AJ

title: Support Julie Baby's Cupcakes & Dog Treats After Storm
description:
Help Julie Baby's Cupcakes & Dog Treats Rebuild After the Storm
Hi, my name is Julie, and I’m the proud owner of
Julie Baby’s Cupcakes & Dog Treats
—a small business built from love, passion, and the belief that our furry family members deserve the absolute best.
Six years ago, we adopted our sweet rescue pup. Like many new pet parents, I wanted to spoil them with tasty treats—but what I found on store shelves shocked me. Many treats were full of additives and chemicals I couldn’t even pronounce. They didn’t smell right, and I knew deep down I couldn’t feed those to my baby.
So I got to work. After months of research, recipe testing, and inspiration from my own pup, Julie Baby’s Cupcakes & Dog Treats was born. Our treats are made with real, wholesome ingredients—no fillers, no junk, just goodness. If I wouldn’t feed it to my dog, I wouldn’t feed it to yours.
Thanks to an amazing community of dog lovers and customers (many of whom have become friends), we’ve grown slowly and steadily. Every purchase, every like, and every share has helped us continue our mission to create healthy, delicious treats with real benefits for your pets.
Unfortunately, our journey hit a tough spot recently.
Heavy rains severely damaged our supplies, ingredients, and packaging.
We are now facing unexpected costs just to restock and get back to doing what we love.
That’s why I’m reaching out with this fundraiser. We’re asking for a little help to rebuild and replenish what was lost. Your support—whether it’s a donation, a share, or just spreading the word—means the world to us.
Every little bit helps, and every dollar goes directly toward getting us back on our feet so we can continue baking with love for your pups.
From the bottom of my heart (and from my pup Rocky), thank you.
With gratitude,
Julie
Julie Baby’s Cupcakes & Dog Treats
labels: Dog, Carnivores, Vertebrate, Snout, Working animal

title: Help HMHormiguitas Rebuild After Devastating Fire
description:
On July 8th, 2025, our family business, HMHormiguitas  Beauty Supply, was tragically set on fire. This store has been our livelihood since 2011, and we are heartbroken by this loss.
For years, we’ve proudly served the community from our spot in Santee Alley, starting with toys, accessories, and clothes and eventually growing into a full beauty supply store. This business isn’t just a storefront to us it’s how we support our family, pay our bills, and continue our legacy.
The past few months have already been challenging with slower foot traffic, and now this fire has made things even harder. We’ve lost countless products, supplies, and a huge portion of our income. It’s difficult to put into words how much this has impacted us, but please believe us when we say it’s been devastating.
We’re reaching out to ask for your support during this incredibly difficult time. Whether it’s $5, $10, or anything you’re able to give, your donation will go directly toward helping us recover, replace lost inventory, and begin the long journey of rebuilding our store.
Please consider helping a small, family-owned business get back on its feet. Every dollar counts and every share helps.
From the bottom of our hearts thank you.
–The HMHormiguitas Family
labels: Red, Orange

title: Help Shape Season's Future
description:
As we get ready to celebrate our first year in business, we remain so grateful and humbled by the incredible support we’ve received from this community. Every day we’ve welcomed politicians, pastors, educators, retirees, and families of all walks of life into our dining room — and every single one of you has become more than just guests. You’ve become our friends. We cannot do this without you. You are the most important ingredient in our recipe.
Before opening Season, we wrote a mission statement:
“To be the standard in which our guests compare other dining experiences to.”
That mission has guided every plate we’ve served and every cup of coffee we’ve poured. Our goal is to raise the bar for dining here in Marietta — to create a place where hospitality, quality, and community come together in a way that makes people rethink what a restaurant can be.
We’ve bootstrapped this entire venture from the ground up for the greater good of the community. And while we could never give Marietta back as much as we’ve already received from your love and support, our mission still stands: to build something lasting, something that makes Marietta proud.
Now, as we look forward to new opportunities, we need your help once again. We’ve reached a point where we must take a massive leap forward to meet the growing demand and capitalize on what lies ahead. Every contribution — no matter the size — brings us one step closer to securing the future of Season, supporting our team, and continuing to serve the community that has given us so much.
If Season has made a difference in your life — whether through a meal shared, a coffee flight enjoyed, or just a smile on a tough day — we ask you to consider helping us through this next chapter.
From the bottom of our hearts: thank you for believing in us, for dining with us, and for making Season possible. With your help, the best is yet to come.
— Chef Nick, Theresa & the Season
***disclaimer***
No raffles, sweepstakes, giveaways, or returns on investment are offered in exchange for any donations made to this GoFundMe.
labels: Sleeve, T-shirt, Smile, Beard, Active Shirt

title: Support Melrose Golf Course Recovery
description:
In the early hours of August 16th, a devastating fire consumed the Melrose Golf Course clubhouse, destroying not only the building but also the cherished property and memories it contained. Fortunately, no one was hurt, yet the magnitude of the loss for our community and business has been profound.
For over fifty years, Melrose Golf Course has served as a welcoming haven for golfers of all skill levels, families, and friends seeking both relaxation and friendly competition. The business has stood as more than just an enterprise—it represents Tony’s true passion and a source of pride rooted in decades of service to our loyal customers.
The aftermath of the fire has left us facing tremendous challenges: the clubhouse has been entirely destroyed, inventory lost, and plenty of expenses that need to be covered. Without additional support, maintaining the condition of our course, rebuilding facilities, and restoring normal operations will be extremely difficult.
Fundraising Goals
To recover and rebuild, we are seeking financial assistance to address several urgent needs:
· Establishing a temporary clubhouse
· Replacing essential equipment and supplies
· Covering lost income while in this transitional period
Every contribution, regardless of amount, brings us closer to restoring our beloved golf course and continuing to serve the community. If you are unable to donate, sharing our fundraising efforts is equally valuable and deeply appreciated.
We are truly thankful for the outpouring of love and support we have already received. Together, we are confident that we can overcome this hardship and rebuild stronger than ever.
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts,
Melrose Golf Course
labels: Text, Advertising, Font, Logo, Banner

title: The Roguelike Tavern Needs A Saving Throw!
description:
A Message from The Roguelike Tavern
Hey friends, John here.
As many of you know, we had to close this week to deal with some major plumbing issues. And while we avoided the worst case scenario in terms of repair costs, closing and losing a week’s worth of business hit us pretty hard, and to be honest, this couldn’t have come at a worse time.
I opened the Roguelike in the middle of the pandemic, after our original opening date of March 15th, 2020 literally became the day that everything shut down. Since then we’ve weathered an extended closure, multiple strikes that have hit our Burbank friends disproportionately hard, production shutdowns, wildfires, and most recently the devastating effects that the ICE raids have had on the whole city. We’re doing our best and I honestly marvel at the wonderful things that have happened at this bar, but truthfully, we’ve never not been playing catch-up, and this past week puts us even further behind.
As such, I’m asking for your help in creating a Roguelike Tavern “recovery fund” to help us get off our back foot and into a place of strength as we head into the upcoming holiday seasons. I’m hoping to compensate our staff for lost income, pay off the expenses incurred by the repairs & subsequent closure, and accrue an emergency cushion that will allow us to keep our heads above water the next time the unexpected happens, which, honestly, I’m surprised hasn’t happened as I'm typing this.
There has been no greater joy in my life than being a part of the community of customers, collaborators and friends that has coalesced around the Roguelike, and I humbly ask you to help us find our footing again and keep that community alive.
-John & The Roguelike Team
labels: Pub, Bar, Restaurant, Customer

title: Support Chef2TheBone: Keep Our Doors Open
description:
Please Help Keep Chef2TheBone Open and Operating
Dear Friends, Family, and Supporters,
We are reaching out with humble hearts and hopeful spirits. Chef2TheBone has been a labor of love from day one—a small, family-owned brand built on big dreams, generational homemade recipes, and a deep commitment to serving our community.
For almost 4 years, we’ve proudly provided not just delicious meals, but a warm and welcoming space where people from all walks of life come together to enjoy our service. From free meals for those in need, to local events and fundraisers, our mission has always been bigger than just business—it’s about the people, culture, and connections.
But like many small businesses, we’ve been hit hard by rising costs, economic challenges, and the overall price of being in the restaurant industry. Despite our best efforts, we’re now facing the possibility of closing our doors.
We’re not ready to give up—and that’s where you come in.
We’re launching this GoFundMe to raise funds to help us stay open and operate at our highest potential, keep our staff employed, and continue serving the supporters we love and appreciate so dearly. Your support will help cover:
Rent and utilities
Payroll for our amazing, dedicated team
Daily inventory
Restaurant maintenance
General operating expenses
Every dollar counts, and every share helps. If you’ve ever shared a meal with us, felt the love in our food, or believe in supporting small businesses, we invite you to stand with us now.
Let’s keep Chef2TheBone cooking and creating—for today, tomorrow, and for generations to come.
With sincere gratitude,
Chef Reggie and Mrs. Chave Stewart
labels: Furniture, Flooring, Chair, Restaurant, Wood flooring

My name is Alex.
I am trying to start a mobile car detailing and pressure washing business

As I start to grow my business, I want to give back to those who have served and are serving in many different fields. Keeping things operational and in good shape saves so many headaches for so many people, especially in the fast-paced world we live in today.
Please help me in achieving this goal and thank you for your time! May God bless you and keep you safe!

title: Help Tee Stanley Reopen His Community Barbershop
description:
My name is Tee Stanley aka Tee hyphen and I’ve been cutting hair for years — not just as a profession, but as a passion, a way to connect with people, and a way to give back to the community.
A while ago, my barbershop was shut down due to a tragic police incident that had absolutely nothing to do with me. Unfortunately, the situation forced my doors to close abruptly. Overnight, everything I worked so hard for was gone.
Instead of giving up, I pivoted. My background in music opened unexpected doors, and I was blessed with opportunities to work as a role manager for one of the most iconic groups in the world, through my connection with Eric Sermon. I also had the honor of working with Killer Mike at the famous Swag Shop Barbershop Arena in Edgewood, Atlanta.
I humbled myself and worked everywhere I could — from Walmart barbershops to small neighborhood shops in New York, Atlanta, Chicago, and everywhere in between. Every chair I sat behind taught me more about resilience, perseverance, and community.
Now, by the grace of God, the chance to reclaim my shop has come back around. I wasn’t expecting it, I wasn’t prepared for it, but it literally fell in my lap. This is my opportunity to return to my neighborhood, rebuild what I lost, and create something lasting — a safe, positive space where people can come together.
But I can’t do this alone. Reopening requires resources, and financially, I need help to make this blessing possible. That’s why I’m reaching out to my community, friends, and supporters.
Your support — no matter how big or small — will help me reopen this shop and make it more than just a barbershop. It will be a hub for culture, mentorship, and positivity in our neighborhood.
Thank you for believing in me, for standing with me, and for helping me turn this setback into a comeback.

title: Help Nathaniel Launch Naturally Better Butters
description:
My name is Nathaniel Swain. I'm looking to start a business in the Bedford County area.
My business idea began while I was a sophomore in college.
I was looking for something to help me apply the things I was learning in my classes. After a couple of failed attempts, I tried making peanut butter and selling it to other students. During this period, another student was trying to raise funds to go overseas. I took the opportunity to help them raise funds through the sales of my peanut butter. While it didn't raise much, I saw the potential that my product had.
I did this for the entirety of the school year, using the concepts from my classes to help build a rough sales model. I took a break the following school year, but quickly realized that I had a product after several people asked about the peanut butter I was selling. So, I started to explore the possibility of turning it into a business. Now, after several years of development,
I believe I am ready to launch. But like any business start-up, I need the funding to begin.
Naturally Better Butters specializes in natural nut butters that are customized to the needs or preferences of our customers.
Our product is more affordable, healthier, and aims to support local farms and businesses. The mission of Naturally Better Butters is to create excellent natural nut butters that accurately fit the needs of our customers while helping others fulfill their God-given calling. Would you be willing to help me make Naturally Better Butters a reality?
labels: Sleeve, Smile, Eye, Facial expression, Active Shirt

title: I’m Swimming 5 Miles for American Cancer Society
description: I’m swimming 5 miles to help the American Cancer Society. This is a very meaningful cause to me. I still have my husband because of a drug named Rituximab. Clyde was diagnosed with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) 13 years ago.  He underwent 2 years of infusion treatment using the monoclonal antibody medicine.  Fortunately his body responded positively and he has been in remission for many years. We are both so grateful for Dr. Hansen, his assistant Dr. Bowjanower and to the American Cancer Society. I would swim a thousand miles to keep my sweet, loving husband Clyde!  I want to help the American Cancer Society to have the funds to continue to fight against cancer.

Thank you for your support!

title: Support Samantha &Forman Show Stables After Tragic Barn Fire
description:
Support Samantha Forman & Forman Show Stables After Tragic Barn Fire
On July 8, our hearts shattered as our barn family suffered an unimaginable loss — eight cherished horses perished in a devastating barn fire at The Mor Linn Farm. Among them were three beloved horses belonging to Samantha Forman and a client of Forman Show Stables, who has been leasing space from the Kennedy family.
While we collectively grieve, we also rally to support Samantha, whose business and heart were deeply impacted by this tragedy. Samantha has been more than just a trainer, she’s been a mentor, a role model, and a source of strength for so many of our children. She’s poured her soul into building a nurturing environment where young riders thrive, and now she needs us to help carry her through this dark chapter.
The fire took the lives of Bear and Prada, two beautiful show ponies who had just begun their promising journeys with our girls, as well as Bowie, another cherished horse. Also lost were all of Samantha’s supplies, tack, and equipment stored in the upper barn.
The road to recovery will be long. Horses are now spread across three different barns, and with no shows or lessons on the horizon, the financial strain is significant. This GoFundMe is being launched to help Samantha rebuild emotionally, logistically, and financially so she can continue the work that has touched so many lives.
We ask you to please keep Samantha and Forman Show Stables in your thoughts and prayers. And if you are able, consider making a donation. Every bit helps ease the burden and ensures that Samantha and her incredible program can rise from this tragedy.
Please share this fundraiser widely. Together, we can show Samantha that the love and support she’s so generously given to others is returned tenfold in her time of need.
With gratitude,
Sam's pony moms
Clarification- this Go Fund Me is separate from the one for the Kennedy Family, the owners of the barn. Sam also needs our support as she tries to piece things back together.
labels: Horse, English riding, Bridle, Footwear, Animal sports

title: Support Trevor's Journey to Overcome Setbacks
description:
Hi everyone,
I am starting this GoFundMe for a good friend, Trevor Northrup, because I know he wouldn't ask himself for the help. So, here we are wanting to help him out!
A couple of weeks ago, Trevor made the leap of faith to quit his job and just started his own business. Things were finally moving in the right direction, getting everything in order, and he was finally building something of his own.
Then, Friday night, everything changed. His truck was stolen right from his street in Colorado… along with every single tool he owned. His entire livelihood was in that truck, and in one night it was all gone just like that. It still hasn't been found.
After losing his truck and tools, Trevor rented a car and returned home to Iowa to regroup. He picking up what he can from his storage and what he has here, and keep working however possible while he is back. He’s determined to keep pushing forward — because, as he says, “The grind can’t stop.” But he can’t replace everything on his own.
Trevor is almost 9 months sober and has been working every day to rebuild his life and stay strong. What happened could have been the kind of setback that breaks someone, but instead, Trevor is refusing to give up. That kind of strength takes someone who is committed to seeing life in a clearer, better way.
This GoFundMe is to help him get back on my feet — to replace some of the tools he need to keep his business running, to stay moving forward, and to keep proving that no matter what life throws at him, he won’t give up.
Anything you can contribute — whether it’s a donation, sharing this, or even a job lead — would mean the world.
Let’s help Trevor out and show him he is not in this fight alone.
Thanks so much!
Tessa and Stephen
labels: Dog, Hat, Carnivores, Sunglasses, Recreation

title: 10 Years of Community Aid & Music Let’s Keep It Going
description:
For over ten years, Ritual has been more than just shows. It’s been my way of giving back—supporting local artists, helping small businesses stay afloat, raising funds for schools, and creating safe, loud, unforgettable spaces for underground music to thrive. Everything I’ve ever done with Ritual has come straight from the heart. Every dime I’ve made has gone back to the people who needed it more than me—whether that was a band on tour, a struggling venue, or a classroom trying to build a library.
This August, we’re putting together something truly special—a four-city tour across Texas featuring 18 incredible bands. This isn’t a big-money, corporate-run festival. It’s a labor of love, built entirely to celebrate the music, the community, and the artists who pour themselves into every note they play.
But right now, I can’t carry this alone. I’ve already invested thousands to make this happen, but with transportation, lodging, and band payouts still hanging in the balance, the tour is at risk. Without support, I can’t give these artists the shows—and the pay—they deserve, and we could lose one of the most meaningful underground events Texas has seen in years.
If Ritual has ever meant something to you—if you’ve come to a show, seen us fight to keep a local business alive, or just believe that music and community matter—I’m asking you to help me keep this dream alive. Even $5 makes a difference. And if you can’t donate, sharing this link is just as powerful.
This tour is about more than music. It’s about proving that when we come together, we can make something beautiful and loud and unforgettable, even when the odds are stacked against us. I’ve always fought for this community. Now, I’m asking for your help so we can keep building it together.
labels: Graphic design

title: Support Travis Foreman's Next Level Journey
description:
Every Dream Starts Off As A Whisper.....
The laughter of a child is nostalgic because you can hear how boundless their joy for life is. So imagine if you had a gift that could bring forth boundless joy that could build dreams inside the eyes of children while placing hope into the forefront of their minds? What if I told you that this gift is a simple whisper away?
Seeing is always believing. So when thinking that a whisper can change a child; doubt is usually the first response. Then suddenly reverberation from success occurs and children of famous people like DJ Khaled confirms "Another One" is successfully in the books. Then the likes of Daymond John of Shark Tank, fame is bearing witness to this "whisper" so much that he starts to follow the whisperers social media page. Jimmy Fallon and Drew Barrymore can attest too! Curiosity blooms as people will want to know just who is this whisperer? His name is: Travis Foreman aka The Bike Whisperer
Who is Travis Foreman?
Travis Foreman is a native of Long Island. Travis always had a passion for life whether expressing himself through dancing or competiting on the hardwood as a gifted basketball player. Travis was always spirited and ambitious. Travis becoming a teacher was a no brainer, as he is the kind of influencer parents should want around their children to build confidence in their actions while showing them how to be accountable in their character. Travis creates a legacy inside of the minds of children that they can carry on throughout life that will assist them in achieving whatever they put their minds to. If you want to get to that next level, Travis Foreman is a builder of success.
What Is The Next Level For Travis Foreman?
The next level for Travis Foreman in and of itself is a partnership with a company called INSIDE SUCCESS LEGACY BUILDERS to have his own episode of NEXT LEVEL CEO. Travis will have the opportunity to bring his voice and face to whisper what will allow him to reach a bigger audience. A bigger audience will equal a greater impact on a national level. This would be a ground breaking accomplishment; but much like those helpful whispers Travis Foreman has offered to the children, he now needs your support as well.

title: Bringing Yemex Café to Houston
description:
Dear friends, family, and community,
What began in our kitchen—late nights baking our halal pastries, experimenting with flavors, and sharing them with our community—has grown into something much bigger than us. Yemex Café was never just about coffee and pastries. It’s about culture, warmth, and creating a space where people feel at home.
Today, we’re proud (and a little nervous!) to share that
we’ve signed the lease for our very first location in Houston
. It feels surreal, but now comes the part where dreams turn into reality: remodeling the space, buying equipment, stocking our shelves, and preparing to welcome you through our doors.
We can’t do this without you.
Every contribution—no matter how small—helps us build this café from the ground up. And in return, we want to give back our gratitude in ways that connect us even more:
(In order to receive perks, please do not submit anonymously)
Under $50
– A digital thank you card from us.
$150+
– A handwritten thank you card + Yemex stickers mailed to you.
$300+
– Everything above, plus a private invite to our pre-launch event.
$600+
– Everything above, plus a Yemex care package prepared with love.
Your support isn’t just funding a café—it’s helping create a place where people gather, share stories, and build community. Thank you for walking this journey with us.
With love and gratitude,
Rawan & Efrain
labels: Eyewear, Smile, Glasses, Head, Sleeve

title: Penny Olson
description:
Help Support Penny Olson
On the night fierce storms tore through Bemidji, one of our community’s most cherished small businesses — Thunderbird Graphics — was devastated. Lovingly operated since May 1992 and owned since August 2018 by our friend Penny Olson, Thunderbird Graphics has been a creative force in our town for years, providing custom designs, signs, apparel, and unwavering support to schools, local events, and fellow small businesses.  Penny has always shown up for us. Now it’s our turn to show up for her.
The damage to the business was extensive and heartbreaking. As with any disaster, many pieces are still unknown, however, the bills continue to come. As Penny sifts through the wreckage and works to rebuild she is left with the continuing expenses both business and personal.
Without the assistance from those that care, Penny struggles to rebuild or reopen — something she has poured her heart, time, and talent into for years.
This GoFundMe is a way for all of us to rally around Penny — to lift her up when she needs it most. Every dollar raised will go directly toward helping bring Penny move forward after the devastation the storm has caused both personally and professionally.
If you’ve ever worked with Penny, worn a shirt she printed, or seen one of her signs around town, you know the care and pride she puts into everything she does. She’s helped shape the visual identity of our community — let’s help her rebuild her own.
Please consider donating, sharing this page, or sending a message of support. Every gesture, big or small, helps more than you know.
Let’s come together, as we always do, and help Penny rise from this storm.
labels: Font, Purple, Graphics, Graphic design

title: Help Nanda Rebuild Makeup Kit After Theft
description:
My name is Nanda, and I’ve been a professional makeup artist since I was 15, starting my journey in Venezuela before moving to Miami in 2015. Over the years, I’ve specialized in editorial, commercial, and social makeup, building a career I’m deeply passionate about. My work is not just my livelihood—it’s my creative outlet and the way I connect with my community.
Yesterday, I experienced a devastating setback. When I went to my garage, I found my car had been broken into. The glove compartment was open, the back seat was a mess, and when I checked the trunk, I realized my entire professional makeup kit and lighting setup had been stolen. Everything was gone—my makeup products, brushes, suitcases, lighting, even my hair kit and the crystal bowls I use for sound healing. Years of investment and hard work disappeared in a moment.
This loss has put my ability to work at immediate risk. I have a two-day production job coming up on Friday, and without my kit, I can’t fulfill my commitments. It’s currently low season for my business in Miami, so funds are tight, and replacing even the basics is a challenge. I’m reaching out for help to get back on my feet quickly, so I can continue doing what I love and supporting my clients. Any support will go directly toward replacing essential tools and equipment so I can return to work as soon as possible.
labels: Video camera, Cameras & optics, Camera, Film Crew, Camera Operator

title: Support Micah Attend ANCA District Conference
description:
My name is Micah Colding, and I am proud to be a Spring 2025 initiate of the Gamma Mu Chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.. As a newly initiated brother, I am honored to serve as the 2025–2026 Chapter Secretary.  This fall, I have the opportunity to represent Gamma Mu at the Alpha North Carolina Association (ANCA) District Conference, which will be held in Durham, North Carolina from November 13–15, 2025. This conference is an important gathering that provides leadership development, networking, and training to enhance my growth as both a fraternity leader and community servant.
To make this experience possible, I am seeking donations to help cover the cost of conference entry, travel, and hotel accommodations. Your contribution will directly support my ability to attend and fully engage in this developmental opportunity, ensuring that I can return to my chapter better prepared to serve, lead, and give back to both the fraternity and the broader community.

title: Keep Holy Shannoli Serving Portland: Donate Now
description:
I'm the owner of
Holy Shannoli, a woman-owned, self-funded pop-up in Portland.
Since February 2024, operating only as a pop-up, we've generated over $120,000 in net sales. Portland has spoken—you love us, and we love you right back.
But here's the truth: while I wait on SBA funding, which is now delayed, I'm running out of working capital.
Without bridge support from our community to get us through to the holiday season, I will have to end operations.
After careful consideration and encouragement from many of my peers, it's simply time to ask for help. The truth is I am not ready to throw in the towel—Holy Shannoli has been a bright spot for so many of you, and for me.
Why I'm asking for help now:
To keep showing up for you every week, I need short-term help to cover the essentials:
• Booth fees & permits (so you can keep finding us at markets)
• Ingredients & product (so every cannoli is fresh-filled, always)
• Commissary kitchen fees (to produce safely and consistently)
• Packaging & supplies (to serve and cater well)
• Expanded marketing (so more people can find us)
• Emergency expenses (because surprises happen)
I've worked tirelessly to make Holy Shannoli the success it's proven to be. With an arm up from our community, I can bridge this gap, keep our team working, show up through the holidays, and meet the demand you've created—until SBA funding lands.
How your gift helps immediately:
• Keeps us on the market calendar
• Lets us buy ingredients and packaging in bulk (lower costs, steady supply)
• Preserves momentum going into the holidays (our busiest season)
• Protects a loved local small business built with heart
I'll post updates on where we're serving, and how your support is keeping us going. If donating isn't possible, a share means the world.
From the bottom of my heart—thank you for believing in Holy Shannoli and in me. I can't wait to see what we build together next.
Thank you,
XOXO
Shannon
labels: Food, Ingredient, Finger food, Cannoli, Dessert

title: Help Us Open the Doors to Our Store Front!!
description:
Hello Everyone
My name is Maria; I am an entrepreneur in the food industry. I started my business 8 years ago. With the help of my family, we started off under a tent with very little equipment. With each event we served our food we earned the ability to buy what equipment we needed one piece at a time.
Over the years we built a name for ourselves in our community. We became well known for our Tamales and our Catering services. After our 5 years under a tent, we earned ourselves trailer that was a fish house that we converted into our food trailer. It's been 3 years now using this for all of our pop ups.
We are now in the tail end of our 8th year in business and have been Blessed with an Amazing Opportunity of opening up our own location!!! It is the perfect size for our Taco Shop aka Taqueria!
We have always worked hard to give our community the very best of our California Style Mexican Food staying true to the flavors we grew up eating from our home state and in our homes as well as staying true to our Mexican culture style of cooking.
Our community has been a God Sent Blessing to our Family and to Our Family Business!! They have blessed us time and time again over the course of our 8 years! They have given kindness, encouragement, shared our story, supported us at our events and put us to work with catering and pop ups!
We now come to that same wonderful community asking for your help and support. We need to raise the funds to complete this opportunity and make it a real true dream come true by getting our doors open so that we can continue to serve our food to all of you on a more frequent basis.
There are a couple pieces of equipment that is still needed as well as some permits and branding essentials to make this place our own.
We believe that having this location it will bring true stability to our family and to our business and we will have achieved what we have been working endlessly for, making all of the hard work and sacrifices so many have put into the success and longevity of our small family owned and family operated Mexican Food Business.
Our family thanks each and every one of you that donated to our last cause and for seeing our family thru all of our ups and downs and hardships and for keeping us alive and thriving!
We hope to give back to our community thru this location by blessing it the way you all have blessed us!
We are so excited to open up OUR DOORS to ALL OF YOU located downtown Fargo, North Dakota in the Old Smiling Moose Location!
Please Help in any form that you can. Share our story as much as possible, Donate whatever is safe for your budget, we highly respect your donation as we know how hard everyone works for their incomes, we do not take it so lightly. You can continue to support our business via attending our pop ups, hire us for your catering needs and come to our store front once the doors are open.
We look forward to serving you delicious food made from scratch and with our hearts and love served with smiles and happiness!

title: Empower Alyssa's Creative Faith-Inspired Business
description:
Little Light Bracelets was created by homeschool student, Alyssa Granillo, with a heart for creativity, learning, and sharing God’s love through handmade jewelry. What began as a small idea to make faith-inspired bracelets has grown into a meaningful opportunity to learn real-world business skills such as budgeting, marketing, and customer communication. Through this small business, Alyssa is developing confidence, discipline, and a strong work ethic while discovering how creativity, hard work, and faith can come together to make a difference
in her community.
Our mission at Little Light Bracelets is to share God’s love through handmade creations that inspire joy, kindness, and faith while teaching valuable lessons in stewardship, responsibility, and entrepreneurship.
Our vision is to see Little Light Bracelets grow as a beacon of light and
creativity—encouraging other young people to use their gifts to serve others, strengthen their faith, and make a positive impact in their community.
These funds will help Little Light Bracelets purchase the necessary materials and tools to grow the business. Funding will support the creation of new bracelet designs, improve packaging and presentation, and allow participation in local craft fairs and community events. These
resources will empower a young entrepreneur to continue learning and shining her light through creativity and faith.

title: Someone Stole From My Garden — Help Me Build a Fence!
description:
Someone Stole From My Garden — Help Me Build a Fence!
Our garden grows the herbs for Dahlia Iris Herbal Shop teas and remedies, and fresh food for my family & community. Please help us protect this healing space so it can continue to feed, nurture, and serve.
Recently, someone came and stole vegetables from my garden—the very space where I grow herbs for the teas and medicinal products we sell at Dahlia Iris Herbal Shop, as well as fresh food to feed my family and community.
This garden isn’t just about plants—it’s about healing, nourishment, and teaching others the importance of natural wellness. To keep it safe and thriving, I urgently need to build a protective fence around the garden.
Your support will help me:
✨ Secure our herbs and vegetables from theft
✨ Continue creating teas and remedies that promote holistic health
✨ Provide fresh produce for my family and community
Every contribution—big or small—will make a huge difference in protecting this space of healing and growth.
Thank you for helping me continue the mission of Dahlia Iris Herbal Shop: wellness, community, and resilience.

Moma Boone is named after him; his name is Daniel Boone.
With every product I make, it’s made with love in his memory. Moma Boone is an e-commerce business, and

title: Help Launch The Printed Homestead-A Family 3D Printing Dream
description:
Hi everyone! My name is Kimberly, and I’m a mom of four with a big dream and a small 3D printer.
Over the past (5) year(s), I’ve been learning how to design and print functional tools for homesteads, gardens, and pets — things like chicken waterer inserts, garden markers, and custom pet accessories. I recently chose the name The Printed Homestead for my future Etsy shop, where I’ll sell affordable, sustainable, and creative 3D-printed products designed for real families like ours.
Unfortunately, my current printer has reached the end of its life, and I need reliable equipment to turn this dream into a real source of income for my family. I’m hoping to raise $1500 to purchase a new printer and starter filament so I can officially open my Etsy shop and begin fulfilling orders.
Every contribution — no matter the size — helps me get one step closer to launching this business and creating something lasting for my kids to be proud of.
If you can’t donate, simply sharing this page means the world to me. Thank you for believing in small beginnings and for helping me build The Printed Homestead.
— Kimberly

title: support me in my starving artist era
description:
❤️ supporting me through my starving artist era ❤️
for 2 years i have been living out of my backpack, with 3 sets of clothes, hotel hopping and living eating mainly rice and oatmeal. its a conscious choice to live as minimal as I can to have the freedom to be a starving artists
and now I am creating this gofundme, recommended by a friend and maybe I can starve less and as I may from time to time need the extra help.
the past year and a half, starting my music career on my own, doing tik tok lives and posting on instagram on my own has been my dream but also sometimes very hard and maybe soemtiemss lonely.
so I thought to reach out to the community.
i hate having to beg. it makes me feel so out of control and not good enough on my own merit. but then I thought it’s better to reach out to ask for support than starve.
so here I am ❤️
asking for anything to help me keep going and maybe have some more rice and beans to eat later today!
❤️
Shannon

title: From Online to Home in Vegas — Let’s Open Chunkies Cookies T
description:
Help Bring Chunkies Cookies Home to Las Vegas!
Hi, my name is Dan Stephens, and I’m the founder of Chunkies Cookies — the “Almost World Famous” gourmet cookie brand. After years of perfecting oversized, decadent cookies and building a loyal following online, my family and I are ready to come home to Las Vegas, Nevada — the city where so much of our story began.
Las Vegas is more than just a great location for a cookie shop. It’s where we’ve lived, worked, and dreamed. It’s a place that feels like home, and now we want to plant the roots of Chunkies Cookies here with our very first storefront.
Our goal is to create a one-of-a-kind bakery where locals and visitors can experience:
• Massive, gourmet cookies baked fresh daily with premium ingredients and scratch-made fillings
• A warm, welcoming space that feels like a neighborhood favorite and a Vegas destination
• Community connection, hiring and training local staff and giving back through events and outreach
To make this dream a reality,
we’re raising funds to cover:
• Leasing and building out our Las Vegas storefront
• Commercial baking equipment and custom packaging
• Hiring and training staff
• Launch events to introduce Chunkies Cookies to the Vegas community
Every contribution brings us closer to opening our doors and sharing cookies with the city we’re proud to call home.
If you can’t donate, simply sharing this campaign helps spread the word.
Thank you for helping us bring Chunkies Cookies home to Las Vegas — together, we can make “Almost World Famous” a reality. ✨
With gratitude,
Dan Stephens
Founder, Chunkies Cookies
labels: Food, Ingredient, Dessert, Powdered sugar, Cooking

title: Help Launch StopSafe A Safer Way for Police Stops
description:
Hello, my name is Bryan Augustine, and I’m developing an app called StopSafe a mobile tool designed to make traffic stops safer, clearer, and less stressful for both drivers and law enforcement officers. The application will have its own designated state. I have created the app to service Louisiana at this time, due to it being my state of origin. The goal is to create the app to service all 50 states here in America.
The app already has a strong foundation with three main sections and real functionality:
✅ 3 Main Sections
1. Video Tutorials – 6 tutorial placeholders (ready for professional videos)
2. Step-by-Step Guides – Detailed walkthroughs for all app features
3. FAQ – 12 of the most common questions with clear answers
✅ Features
• Powerful search to quickly find help topics
• Expandable/collapsible sections for easy reading
• A professional, icon-driven layout
• Video player interface (ready for real content)
• A Quick Start Guide to get users set up fast
• Contact Support section for direct help
• Mobile-responsive design that works on all devices
✅ Topics Covered
• Recording during police stops (for accountability & safety)
• Setting up a personal profile to help establish trust
• Managing important documents like license & registration
• Adding emergency contacts
• Finding attorneys when legal help is needed
• Handling subscriptions & payments
• Customizing the app for personal needs
SafeStop is more than just an app — it’s a way to protect lives, reduce misunderstandings, and build trust during critical moments.
⸻
Why I Need Help
To fully launch StopSafe,
I need to raise $3,000 in the next 7 days.
This will cover:
• Incorporating the business
• Paying the Google Play & Apple App Store developer fees
• App subscriptions & hosting costs
• Catching up on some urgent personal bills so I can focus on bringing SafeStop to market
⸻
How You Can Help
Every donation — even $20, $50, or $100 — brings this life-saving idea closer to reality.
Everyone who supports will be listed as a Founding Supporter in the first version of the app.
Together, we can create a tool that makes communities safer and improves interactions between drivers and officers across the country.
Thank you for believing in SafeStop and in this mission.
— Bryan Augustine
labels: Car, Motor vehicle, Driving, Steering wheel, Rear-view mirror

title: Help SunFlare Brands Stay Open
description:
My name is Rodney, and I’m the owner of SunFlare Brands Company, a candle and craft business dedicated to creating joy and opportunity through creativity. For years, I’ve poured my energy into building a business that not only brings unique, handcrafted products to our community, but also provides valuable training and experience to those who work with me.
Recently, I no longer have my full-time job, which has made it impossible to contribute to the business as I usually do. This sudden change has put SunFlare Brands Company at risk of losing our workspace. If I can’t cover our rent and operating costs for November and December, I’ll be forced to move the business back to my apartment, which isn’t allowed under my lease. This would halt our operations and end the internship program that means so much to me and those involved.
Your support will help cover essential expenses like rent, utilities, supplies, our website plan renewal, inventory system, and training courses. It will also allow me to continue supporting our intern, who is gaining hands-on experience that connects her passion for candle science to her future career in the natural sciences, and our part-time marketing coordinator, who I hope to enroll in a marketing course. Every contribution helps us keep our doors open, continue our mission, and provide opportunities for growth and learning. Thank you for helping us weather this challenging time and keep SunFlare Brands Company moving forward.
labels: Clothing, Arm, T-shirt, Furniture, Shirt

title: Support Raylan and Grant's Design Dream
description:
Hi everyone,
Our names are Raylan Bleimeister and Grant Danello, two local teens, and we are excited to introduce our new business:
Simsbury Home Design Group
– a fresh, creative, and client-focused home design company based in Simsbury, Connecticut.
This business has been a long-time dream of ours. Our passion for design, creativity, and helping people transform their living spaces is our goal. We have finally decided to take the leap and build something of our own.
What We Do:
Simsbury Home Design Group specializes in helping homeowners reimagine their spaces through thoughtful, personalized design. Whether it's interior decorating or space planning, our mission is to create beautiful, functional spaces that truly feel like home.
Why We Need Your Help:
Starting a business comes with big dreams—and big expenses.
We are raising $2,500 to help cover essential startup costs
, including:
•    Licensing and legal fees
•    Website and branding
•    Design software and tools
•    Marketing and advertising
•    Basic materials and supplies
Every donation, no matter how small, brings us one step closer to launching Simsbury Home Design Group and helping people love the homes they live in.
How You Can Support:
•    Donate – Any amount is deeply appreciated
•    Share – Spread the word to friends, family, and your network
•    Follow our journey – We will be posting updates on Instagram and YouTube as we grow!
Thank you so much for believing in us and this vision. Your support means the world, and we can’t wait to bring this dream to life with your help.
With gratitude,
Grant Danello and Raylan Bleimeister
Founders, Simsbury Home Design Group
labels: Sleeve, Nose, T-shirt, Smile, Neck

title: Help April and David Build Their Future and Create For You
description:
Hello I’m April . I’ve tried writing this 2x within the past half a year and never posted it. Here I am now ready to ask for a helping hand. My significant other (David) and I have been extremely busy on trying to support our family and create a business that we can share with the world. Davids been working way too hard, every single day without a day off for too long bringing income in just for us to be living paycheck to check. We miss him. My children need their father home during the mornings too, plus i can have some of my own mornings to work here from home as well to try and earn income soon. His job requires him to be at work Monday-Friday 9-5, if not more if he works overtime, and he has found many people to do steady side jobs for Friday-Sunday and even after work somedays to make sure we keep moving forward. We currently are living with my mother which has been extremely helpful in figuring out how to start something from nothing but we would love to give her space and have a place of our own too so we can bloom. The reason i am asking for help is because us trying to make a business is exhausting physically, mentally and money wise to start up, we also would love to buy a place of our own for our little family soon so its hard to put something we have spent thousands of hours and dollars on trying to do for everyone off to the side longer. In order to faster progress all the hard work and money that we have put in so far and still are is asking to support my family and i during this journey so we can share with you one day soon what we have been so patiently working on! Every little bit helps and is very much appreciated! Money raised will be used to pay for start up cost like logo and trademark and more, paying off a newly purchased machine and materials, plus any other machines and materials that may be needed to get started. Possible bills that may need covered while my significant other spends some time with his children while I start up.
**( more has been bought then shown in pictures, most is put away for now, but wanted to show we have been purchasing items towards this. just asking for help with start up cost, missing last items and more as it’s expensive. trying to go through the community before doing loan.

title: Fuel Derrick D. Copeland's Fashion Vision
description:
Hello All! I am Derrick D. Copeland, a designer with over 13 years of experience in the fashion industry. My career spans multiple facets of the business, including five years as a freelance designer, two years in production, and the balance in wholesale sales. This unique blend of creative design expertise and deep wholesale knowledge has given me a 360° understanding of the industry from concept to consumer.
Now, I am channeling my experience into my own vision,
Ore Redux: a luxury athletic wear line that merges performance, style, and elevated design
. My debut collection will premiere in January in Atlanta, marking the next chapter in my journey as a designer.
Starting Ore Redux means covering essential costs like securing a business license, manufacturing the first collection, and building a strong brand presence. These steps are crucial to bringing my designs to life and making them available to those who want unique, affordable style. Every contribution will help me move closer to launching the line and reaching customers who are looking for something different and direct from a creator who understands their needs.
This journey has required sacrifice and faith. I’ve invested everything I can into bringing my vision to life, and now I’m inviting my family and friends to be part of the foundation.
Your support will help me reach the final financial goals needed to start up the brand and execute the January show with excellence and precision.
Every contribution, connection, or word of encouragement makes a difference as I build this brand from the ground up.
Thank you all in advance!
All my best,
Derrick D. Copeland

title: TriniBean Coffee - The road to success
description:
Hi! I’m Trinielis Fernandez, the founder of Trinibean Coffee.
Starting my own coffee business has been a lifelong dream, and I finally took that leap of faith and brought Trinibean Coffee to life. As a barista, I take pride in delivering more than just coffee — I strive to provide an exceptional experience with every cup. From the first sip to the last, quality and care are at the heart of everything I do.
Family. Heritage. Quality.
These values are at the heart of everything I do at Trinibean Coffee.
Family and heritage mean the most to me — they’re the foundation of who I am and why I started this business. That’s why I’m committed to investing in and offering authentic, high-quality coffee beans imported directly from Puerto Rico.
By sourcing from Puerto Rican growers, I’m not only honoring my roots, but also supporting small farms and sharing a rich coffee tradition that deserves more recognition. Every cup tells a story — of culture, care, and connection.
This is more than coffee. This is legacy in every sip.
As any small business owner knows, the journey isn’t easy — but with hard work, community support, and a little bit of caffeine, anything is possible!
I recently had my very first pop-up event, and it was an incredible experience. It showed me just how much potential Trinibean has — and how much more I want to grow.
To keep the momentum going and continue hosting pop-ups, building my brand, and eventually opening a permanent location, I need a little help. If you feel led to support this dream and be a part of the Trinibean journey, I’d be incredibly grateful for any donation or support you can give.
Here’s Where Your Support Helps:
I know many people may not realize everything that goes into starting a coffee business from the ground up, so I wanted to share some of the key things I’m working toward — both to get started and to eventually grow and enhance the Trinibean Coffee experience.
Startup Essentials
These are the basic things I need to keep Trinibean up and running at pop-ups and local events:
•	Coffee brewing equipment (espresso machine, grinders, kettles, etc.)
•	Quality coffee beans and ingredients
•	Cups, lids, napkins, and other supplies
•	A branded tent or booth setup for outdoor markets
•	Tables, signage, and display materials
•	Permits and vendor fees
•	Transportation and storage solutions
Growth Goals
With your support, I’d also love to make these upgrades to enhance the customer experience and reach more people:
•	Custom-branded merchandise (cups, shirts, stickers)
•	A mobile coffee cart or trailer for more events
•	A user-friendly website for online ordering and updates
•	Marketing and promotional materials
•	Training and hiring part-time help for events
•	Expanding my menu with new seasonal or specialty drinks
Every donation — big or small — helps bring me one step closer to making this dream a reality.
If you’d like to support Trinibean Coffee, please consider donating, sharing my page, or simply stopping by my next pop-up to say hi and grab a cup. ☕️
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for believing in me and in TriniBean Coffee
follow my journey on Instagram @trinibeancoffee
labels: Kitchen Appliance, Cooking, Cook, Apron, Barware

title: Planting Petals of Hope: Support our Nonprofit Launch
description:
Red Petal Project is a nonprofit in progress, dedicated to creating emotionally safe sanctuaries for survivors of sexual assault, domestic violence, trauma, and grief.
Tulip & Thread is its sister program, serving trauma-impacted families—especially parents navigating recovery, loss, or housing instability. It’s also our creative arm: a gentle design studio that crafts affirming resources, signage, and healing spaces that feel sacred, soft, and dignified.
This GoFundMe will help cover our startup costs, including:
• Nonprofit registration and 501(c)(3) filing fees
• Trauma-informed bylaws and onboarding materials for board members and advocates
• Outreach flyers, sanctuary signage, and foundational branding
We’re also exploring healing-centered housing models like tiny homes and ADUs to offer physical refuge alongside emotional support. But to apply for grants and partnerships, we need official nonprofit status.
Every dollar you give helps us build spaces where survivors feel seen, held, and empowered.
Whether it’s having a number to call in times of crises, advocates available to provide resources and referrals, or even something as simple as a tulip mural in a sanctuary hallway or a podcast episode on gentle rage, your support helps us say: You are not alone. You are worthy of beauty, clarity, and care.
labels: Eyebrow, Lips, Forehead, Facial expression, Dreadlocks

title: Support J & J Imaging's Health Mission
description:
Every day, countless people walk around unaware that they’re living with vascular disease — a silent condition that can lead to stroke, heart attack, or even limb loss if left undetected. At J & J Imaging, we believe early detection isn’t just healthcare — it’s hope.
Our mission is simple:
To advance health, raise awareness, and give people the chance to live longer, stronger lives.
But our commitment goes beyond imaging.
We are also opening doors for the next generation of sonographers
— training apprentices on the job so they can build meaningful careers in healthcare while making a difference in their communities.

title: Keep Scrawl, Scribble & Smirch Book Community Bookshop Alive
description:
My dear friend, Marie, has wanted to open a bookstore as far back as I can remember. She wanted to provide a sense of community to her little town of Gustine, California. Not only is she a published author, but she’s passionate about books and helping others discover the joy of reading. She went full throttle to open Scrawl, Scribble & Smirch Bookshop in less than 45 days! Any of you who’ve ever started a business can truly sense her passion for what she does. Starting a business is not easy, but adding a small town with no signage off the freeway didn’t help. Marie has been sharing, posting, and handing out flyers, letting everyone know about this amazing bookstore and space. Slowly but surely, people are driving from different parts of California to check out her cute little bookstore. She has had 4 articles and a local TV station feature her in just the first 2 months, which is a testament to her commitment and effort to make her bookstore successful.
She’s running out of funds, simply put, and without help, she won’t be able to keep her doors open for much longer.
She could really use our help to keep her dream alive and to keep this gem open in Gustine, California!
She is creating a space for the community to gather. If only she had a little bit more time to get things running. If you feel led to donate, please do. Whatever amount you can give will help her continue to keep the doors open and thrive!
labels: Shelf, Bookcase, Shelving, Furniture, Book

title: Bring the Soul of Alaska to Life
description:
We are the Soul of Alaska team, and our mission is to bring outdoor leisure and wellness to a whole new level. Inspired by Alaska’s raw beauty and the power of nature, we design mobile panoramic saunas that combine health benefits, comfort, and style.
Each sauna is built from premium natural materials, featuring panoramic windows, smart heating, and thoughtful details that create a rejuvenating and unforgettable experience. More than just a product, our saunas help people restore balance, relieve stress, strengthen immunity, and improve sleep — all while connecting with nature.
Right now, we are at a crucial stage. To launch our first production line,
we need to rent a workshop space for 2–3 months and build our first three saunas. The total required is $30,000, which will cover rent, equipment, materials, and initial marketing.
We’ve already tested prototypes, refined the design, created visuals, and gained early interest from restaurants, hotels, glamping sites, and spas. The demand is real — now we need your help to scale.
By contributing, you’ll not only help bring this project to life but also become part of our story. Early supporters will be recognized as founding backers, receive our deepest gratitude, and even get exclusive invitations to experience the sauna during the early stages.
Our vision goes beyond building saunas — we aim to create a wellness experience that inspires healthier living, helps businesses attract more guests, and connects people to the essence of nature, comfort, and design.
Every dollar brings us closer to this goal. Thank you for believing in our mission and supporting a vision that can redefine leisure spaces.
Right now, we are at a crucial stage: we need to rent a workshop space for 2–3 months, set it up, and produce our first three saunas. The total required is about $30,000. These funds will cover rent, materials, equipment, production, and the initial marketing launch.
We have already tested prototypes, refined the design, built visuals, and received early interest from hospitality partners. But to scale, we need your support. By contributing, you’ll become part of this journey: you’ll receive our sincere gratitude, be recognized as an early backer, and even get exclusive invitations to experience the sauna during the early stages.
Our goal is not just to build a business, but to create a wellness experience that inspires people to rest better, helps businesses attract more guests, and builds a strong brand that connects nature, comfort, and design.
Thank you for believing in our idea and supporting a vision that can redefine leisure spaces.

title: Help Take The Grande Tavern on the Road
description:
The vibe? Coastal cuisine, strong cocktails, and conversations that shift perspectives. ✨ Join the movement—donate today and help launch The Grande Tavern Road Tour!
For the past 4 years, I’ve poured my heart into The Grande Tavern—a space I created to unite people from all walks of life over incredible food, authentic conversation, and unforgettable experiences. What started as a one-man project has grown into an inspirational platform highlighting entrepreneurs, creatives, and changemakers who inspire us all.
Now, it’s time to take this vision further. My dream is to hit the road along the Pacific West Coast with a traveling version of The Grande Tavern—bringing EXTICULARRY people together to share meals, stories, and perspectives that can heal divides and spark connection. Imagine a caravan filled with laughter, deep conversation, coastal cuisine, and what I call “Mermaid Juice”—all captured and shared to spread a message of openness, love, and community at a time when the world needs it most.
But I can’t do this alone. Your support will directly fund:
Transportation for the tour
Food and supplies️
Merchandise
Audio & video equipment to share the journey with the world ️
Every dollar makes a difference in bringing this vision to life. If you’ve ever believed in me, my work, or the power of unity through shared experience—this is your chance to make an impact.
✨ Donate today and help transform The Grande Tavern from a table in one city to a movement across the coast. Together, we can turn meals into movements, and conversations into change.
Every single dollar fuels this vision. Here’s how you can help bring The Grande Tavern Road Tour to life:
$5 → Fuels the caravan a few extra miles
$10 → Covers drinks + “Mermaid Juice” for a night of deep conversation
$20 → Buys fresh ingredients for one unforgettable dish
$50 → Helps us capture the magic with better audio & video
$100 → Sponsors a full dinner gathering for our guests
No matter the amount, your support goes directly toward making this movement real. Every dollar = more food, more miles, more connections.
✨ Let’s get this show on the road—literally! Your support fuels every mile, every meal, and every conversation that brings people closer together. Donate today and be part of The Grande Tavern Road Tour!

title: Fund Joe's Journey to Bakery Success
description:
I have opened this GoFundMe for someone else.
Joe is a wonderful human being with an amazing talent for all things baking and other confectionary delights. His skill and experience in baking have the approval of over 60 co-workers who have taken great pleasure in eating all of his many cookies and cupcakes that he has provided for special occasions.
I would love to make his dream come true and give him not only the funds, but more importantly, the freedom to pursue his dream that coincides so well with his amazing talent.
The help you provide will allow Joe to find a location and enable him to start gathering all materials needed for a new bakery. Funds will be used both for startup purposes ex. Rent new location, pots, pans, ingredients, and any payments needed for the first few months.
labels: Blue

title: Support Tommy G's Self-Helpnosis Workbook
description:
Hey. I'm Tommy G, the Hockeytown Hypnotist.
Over the past 20 years, I've helped hundreds and hundreds of people break free from their mental limitations and experience what it means to live free from addiction, depression, anxiety, and fear.
Recently, I've helped to form the
Tom Silver Foundation 501c3 nonprofit
where our mission is to promote mind-body wellness for those overlooked and in need. As the Hypnotherapy Program Director for the organization, I am constantly in search of new ways to achieve far-reaching and highly impactful methods of creating lasting, positive change in others.
This book is designed to extend that mission even beyond those I can work with directly.
By utilizing eye-movement and reading patterns alongside some very specific Ericksonian storytelling and word puzzle techniques, I have developed a way to create hypnotically-charged changes in readers that yield dependable results for (so far) 90% of those who actively engage.
My goal is to have this
Self-Helpnosis workbook published professionally
, not through Amazon Direct, to make it more widely available to those who need the help but cannot otherwise afford hypnotherapy.
Your donation goes directly toward funding the creation and publication of this book and helps free people from their mental prisons.

title: Help Hekate's Staff Become Owners
description:
WHO: We are the staff of Hekate Café & Elixir Lounge! And we have been given the opportunity to become the bar's owners!
WHAT: NYC’s premiere sober bar, Hekate Café & Elixir Lounge, on Avenue B in the East Village, will be changing hands. After four years in business, owner Abby Ehmann is selling her “sober oasis” to the staff.
Headed by Manager Eliott Edge, the space will finally be “sober owned.” As the city’s first successful booze-free bar, Hekate has gone from an oddity to an institution, receiving glowing press from over 50 publications and TV stations, becoming the go-to space for those looking to socialize and celebrate without alcohol. “When we first opened, people didn’t really know what a ‘sober bar’ was,” Ehmann says. “We’ve gone from having to explain what alcohol free spirits are to featuring dozens of craft cocktails created by our staff that everyone truly enjoys.”
WHY: Why the decision to sell the place? Abby explains, “My original vision has been 100% realized, with one exception: my sober friends. I opened Hekate for people I know who, for whatever reason, no longer consume alcohol. Turns out they’d rather drink the 0ABV beers at Lucky.” She adds, “Hekate has attracted an entirely new world of humans, thanks in no small part to the amazingly talented staff and Eliott’s enthusiastic efforts.
SEEING INTO THE FUTURE: Changes are in the works, beginning with adding food to the menu and teaming up with a coffee partner. What won’t be changing is the staff’s dedication to serving the widest selection of alcohol free cocktails in America, with a side of mysticism. “Our staff of tarot readers is available almost every hour we’re open,” says Katherine Maley, aka Huge Witch, and the elixir lounge’s chief wrangler of all prognosticators. And, of course, providing a haven to the sober community.
Eliott tells us, “Hekate has become so well-known because of its community. We have hosted so many regulars, so many first dates, so many parties. Folks have told us, ‘I traveled across the globe to see this place. To try your drinks.’ And have left in awe. In a good way. That is not something you get to say about your job every day. This opportunity, to carry the vision of Hekate — the Goddess of the Crossroads — into the future, is an absolute honor,” Edge tells us. “Only three years ago, at the tail end of being a frightful career drunk, I could never have seen any of this. Hekate helped me stay sober. That sobriety taking the form of creativity is a blessing that I did not expect and better than I could’ve imagined.”
By donating to this GoFundMe, you'll be enabling the staff to take over ownership.
labels: Interior design, Light fixture, Lighting, Furniture, Ceiling

title: Fund a Sanctuary for Inner and Outer Beauty
description:
When I began my own healing journey through breathwork, it profoundly changed my life. It allowed me to process deep childhood trauma, loss, and pain, and it gave me a way to rebuild myself from the inside out. After more than 23 years as an advanced aesthetician, I realized that true beauty and healing cannot be separated — the skin reflects the health of the soul. This is what inspired me to create a boutique that blends customized, results-driven aesthetics with holistic practices like breathwork and Reiki.
With this grant, I would be able to bring that vision to life. The funding would allow me to create a peaceful sanctuary where clients can feel safe to heal and transform. I would invest in designing a calming space, bringing in state-of-the-art aesthetic equipment, and creating a healing environment with tools like meditation mats, aromatherapy, and sound therapy to support breathwork journeys.
Part of this grant would also go toward offering healing opportunities to those who may not have access to them — teens struggling with anxiety and depression, survivors of stroke and muscle atrophy learning to reconnect with their bodies, and individuals who may not resonate with traditional therapy but are seeking a pathway to self-healing. I want my boutique to be more than a business; I want it to be a place where people come to feel seen, nurtured, and renewed.
Ultimately, this grant would give me the chance to take all of my experience — both personal and professional — and transform it into something that can impact lives in a profound way. My mission is to help others heal from the inside out, pairing the science of advanced aesthetics with the soul work of breathwork and holistic healing.
