title: Donate to Cool Down 144 Academy
description:
Help Us Bring A/C to 144 Academy ❄️
Hey everyone,
I’m Coach Jairo, and I’m reaching out on behalf of the amazing community we’ve built at 144 Academy. Our gym is more than just a training space—it’s a second home. A place where kids, teens, adults, and families come together to grow, push limits, and support one another.
To make our training environment even better—especially during those hot months—we’re working to install a full A/C system inside the academy. The total cost is $11,000, and while that’s a big number, I know we can reach it together with the help of our community.
This is where I’m asking for your support.
Whether you’re able to donate $5, $50, or simply help spread the word—everything helps and everything is appreciated. You’re not just contributing to a gym—you’re investing in a space that continues to impact lives on and off the mats.
Everyone who trains here is part of the 144 family, and this upgrade is for all of us. If you’ve ever felt the heat after a tough session—you already know this A/C will be a game changer.
Thank you for your time, your generosity, and most of all, for being part of this journey. Let’s keep building something special—together.
With gratitude,
Coach Jairo
labels: Flooring, Floor, Gym, Room, Ceiling

title: Help Burn Money Rebuild After Devastating Fire
description:
As many of you know, Burn Money music studios suffered a catastrophic building fire on the night of wednesday the 13th. Wicker Woodworks and Humango Toys were also completely devastated.
Burn Money has been a staple of the Portland music scene since 2016. they have recorded hundreds of artists, producing countless albums, songs, and memories. There are not words sufficient to describe the impact these talented artists have had on the Portland community, or what the loss of our studio will mean in the days and weeks to come.
As of right now, insurance claims have been denied due to clerical errors, and will take months, if ever, to see a claim approved. The studio was able to salvage some of their equipment, but many works of art, supplies, and furniture were lost to the fire. The entire building is condemned and Burn Money needs to relocate asap to continue doing what they do best, making and producing music.
We are asking the community for help. With insurance funds out of the picture, we need to raise enough money to cover the cost of relocating the studio, and replacing everything that was lost. Please consider donating whatever you can to help get Burn Money and its staff back on their feet. It will be repaid tenfold in the near future with free events and concerts to thank everyone who so kindly helps out in this trying time.
Thank you,
sincerely,
Burn Money
labels: Logo, Graphic design, Graphics, Design, Clip art

title: Tattoo studio break-in
description:
Last night, my worst nightmare as a small business owner came true, my studio was broken into.
Thousands of dollars worth of my tattoo equipment, tools, and supplies were stolen. These aren't just "things" they're what l use every day to create art for my clients and keep my dream alive.
As a small business, replacing everything on my own would take me a long time and would put my work on hold.
I never want to share my vulnerabilities but here we are. I've started a GoFundMe to help me recover and get back to doing what I love most. Creating art and serving my amazing clients and friends.
If you're able to donate, no matter how small, it would mean the world to me. If you can't donate, simply sharing this post would be a huge help.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for any support it’s your love and encouragement that keeps me going.
Also if anyone can ID this person please contact me.
Love everyone that’s been supporting.

description:
Well here I go, After a full year of holding down the fort It is TIME to move forward with the Biggest and Most Personal MISSION I've ever undertaken...... Purchasing this property in order to facilitate a Martial Arts School, a Music School and maybe even More into this building and into this community .! Everyone KNOWs I don't have the Money , I’m a consumed Dreamer  ... I've sung of my dislike of the Dollar for decades now , sang and worked my back and hands broken' With Love and Care from my Heart .. Well right now I have the Opportunity of My Lifetime and I Truly need YOUR HELP .Please ..I need the Biggest TIP" you can Muster , ..Donation..Gift? Investment.. Charity ? ..However You See It ... I need Funds ...and Fast ... I'm going to be contacting You this week ..Yes Every single one of you ..Calling , Texting, FB Messaging .. With 40K Down Payment on the Building/Property and 10K in locker room plumbing , Insurances and Mats Down and I can license and Insure and OPEN to FACILITATE my first local Youth and Adult Martial Arts classes , AS WELL AS OTHERS. Dance , Yoga , TaiChi (More Ideas ??)SPACE /as well as Beginner Music Lessons , Recording Studio SPACE upstairs.. FACILITATE music instructors their private teaching space , (Theater? , PodCasting Rooms? there’s very little Money to be made in these Artistic Venues but SO MUCH ROOM HERE. .
there are already a few somewhat Under used rec areas in town.. however I hope for this place to be much different. Gouverneur , St Lawrence County, Family , Friends, Fans , Neighbors ... I can't do this without You ... Please Donate TODAY ..and Again next week and again Until I can get these doors open for the kids and community instructors to enjoy … CHEAP. LOL. ... Martial Arts School, Youth Music School, Wood Craft Shop , Indoor Simulators , Art Gallery , Indoor Commons Rooms, etc.(more suggestions ) ??... Call Me , get ahold of me with your Questions ...Advice .. Other Donations??? contact me on FB via Messager ? .. I'm here .. Going to be a Busy week dropping FB LIVE songs and building tours and updates All this Week and Month of October ... "WE DID IT" Party is already Schedule for Saturday OCTOBER 18th Here at the building ...Every Contributor is Invited ..!! I'm Jamming with Friends and Giving Martial Arts Demos and building tours all Day ...
Please Keep the Negativity away , I've had enough people Already try to talk me out of this ...I'm not giving up this opportunity to retire here close to my Family DOING /BEING What I Am .. Help Me .. ? I’m about to SHARE my STORY with you All of how I got here .. this Building. . my Music journey Home and my Martial Arts Journey since I was just a “little Larry.. my CANES. YES old “Cain” makes Canes. All this yes. . But so much More. My Why… My Mission. …
I apologize sincerely for the Odd ,,, confusing START to this GoFundMe plan … I hope I can make THAT up to
You with MORE information and CONTENT regarding My Offering. I will teach my few classes yes But I am buying this building at age 54 , taking on the Bank Payment. The taxes the utilities , the upkeep and up grades costs and even living here as caretaker and neighborhood watch and sidewalk Security ALL in order to FACILITATE ….I'm no Master , not a Rock Star. But Man I Got a "DREAM and a HALF" here that I’m going to see through. … yeah. LOTS to share with you.
…

title: Save Gladys' Lei Stand: Support Bonnie's Legacy
description:
Bonnie has been sourcing lei for us for some time now. She called me today with our order and said that we needed to pick up early because she didn’t want her stand to get locked up with our lei still inside. That prompted me to ask what? What’s going on??
This is what she shared and I am now sharing with you on her behalf to try and save her lei stand.. with all the talk about kanaka owned business, keeping Hawaiians in Hawaii and showing Aloha, now is the time for all of us to stand together to help this ‘ohana continue their legacy.. and continue to provide everyone with their beautiful lei.
Gladys’ Lei Stand –
A Hawaiian Legacy of Aloha
My name is Bonnie Kaleikini and I am the fourth-generation owner of Gladys’ Lei Stand, a kanaka owned, ‘ohana-run lei business that traces its roots back to 1941—and even further, to Rachel’s Lei Stand, started by my great-tutu lady over 100 years ago. Lei-making is not just a business for us. It is our legacy. It is our koko — our blood.
As a baby, I slept in a carnation flower box while my tutu lady sold leis at Aloha Tower. From the time I could walk, I followed her everywhere — to schools for graduations, to pageants, fairs, hula competitions — learning to string, to sell, to make change, tie ribbons, and most importantly: to share the meaning of aloha. No lei, no aloha.
This stand has always been a Native Hawaiian, female-owned, family-run business — passed down from mother to daughter, generation after generation. We are proud members of the Lei Sellers Association and Boat Sellers Association, and we remain deeply connected to our community and culture.
This lei stand is our livelihood — but also so much more. It is therapy. It is passion. Stringing lei is a sacred act for me — a way to reconnect, to breathe, to give love in tangible form.
We source our flowers from local farms all across the islands:
Tuberose and awapuhi (ginger) from Waimānalo and Wahiawā
Pakalana, pikake, and baby hibiscus from Waimānalo and Nānākuli
Plumeria (pua melia) from Wai‘anae
Puakenikeni from Pearl City
Kika (cigar flowers) from Pālolo and Kapolei
Hilo maile from Hawai‘i Island
Tongan maile from Tonga
We even source flowers internationally when local options are limited or unaffordable — like carnations from Mexicoand dendrobium orchids from Thailand.
But despite all of this, we are now being squeezed out by development — blocked in by construction, ignored by the state, and surrounded by pressure to make room for higher-end stores. We are being pushed off ceded lands that should be serving Native Hawaiians, not displacing them.
We are the last of the Hawaiian female-owned lei stands in this area. And what’s happening isn’t just a threat to my business — it’s a threat to our culture, our community, and our legacy.
This is my life. This is my family’s legacy. This is our aloha.
And I say again: No lei, no aloha.
Recently we have come under difficult times. I am a single mother, and both my parents have become ill.. I have been trying to manage the stand and care for my children and parents. To add to this, the state is demanding a back payment of fees, that unfortunately I also inherited with our lei stand. The state is refusing to allow us to continue our payment plan to pay off this debt and is threatening to shut us down permanently as of the end of this month if we are unable to come up with the balance of $8900 owed.
We have reached out to CNHA, OHA, and lei poina’ole, just for someone to help, advocate, at least get us more time to make this payment..
We humbly ask for any help you possibly can give to keep our stand open.. any amount, prayers or a share to support our cause is greatly appreciated.
mahalo nui loa ❤️
labels: People, Hair, Smile, Head, Happiness

title: Help Glow'n Beauty Bar Rebuild After Flood

title: Run 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
In the month of October, I won't just be running; I'll be dedicating every single mile to anyone who has faced the unimaginable fight against cancer. I'm taking on the challenge of running 100 miles.
​We all have names and faces that come to mind. For me, these are my loved ones who showed incredible courage, resilience, and heart. My motivation comes from them, and I'm running to honor their strength and memory.
​I'm running to raise money for the American Cancer Society (ACS). Every step I take will be a step closer to funding life-saving research, crucial support for patients, and essential prevention education.
​Please join my effort. Your donation, no matter the size, fuels the search for a cure and provides immediate support to those battling cancer right now. ACS has a platinum rating on GuideStar (the highest possible), so give with confidence! Let's turn these miles into hope for a cancer-free future.

title: Sippindippity
description:
Once upon a dream there was a café, run by Jackie Kay and Brian Dowd. They explored this idea for decades from coast to coast and throughout downtown areas in-between. As their family grew, their mom and pop status took shape, and propelled them into the right situations.  Sippindippity is the long-awaited result of taking action to get that dreamy café into reality.
Where? 9 E. Walnut street in downtown Greencastle, Indiana.
When?  During the evening hours, when there is a need for café refreshments and hot tasty snacks.
Who?  Jackie Kay - beverage artist extraordinaire, and Brian - locally renowned artist and College Dad.
Why? They have long dreamed of running a mom-and-pop shop, and now, as Mom and Pop, they've acquired the shop - after all these years.  Please join them and their family as they continue working toward opening day. Sippindippity. Sip spot. Snack shop. Carry-out café.

title: Help Shop Halo Halo Secure a New Home
description:
Help Shop Halo Halo Find a New Home
Shop Halo Halo has always been more than a bakery. Since opening our doors, we’ve created a gathering space that celebrates Filipino flavors, handmade baked goods, and the joy of community. From tea celebrations to community fundraisers to art and educational workshops, we’ve built connections that extend far beyond pastries.
Now, as we prepare to relocate, we need your help to keep this vision going!
✨ Why We’re Fundraising
We’re committed to reopening in a new space where we can continue to:
Share our unique, Filipino-inspired baked goods and drinks
Host community-centered events that bring people together
Showcase the work of local artists, makers, and organizations
Your support will help cover relocation costs, equipment, and the build-out of a space that reflects the warmth and creativity our community deserves.
✨ How You Can Help
Donate any amount you’re able—every bit truly helps.
Share this campaign with friends and family who believe in supporting small businesses, culture, and community.
With your help, Shop Halo Halo can continue being a place of connection, celebration, and joy—a home for both Filipino food traditions and the local creatives who inspire us daily.
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for helping us write the next chapter of Shop Halo Halo.
Follow us on
Instagram
to see our journey and subscribe to our
newsletter
for updates on pop-ups and events!

title: Donate to Empower Women Engineers
description:
We at the Society of Women Engineers (SWE) are earnestly requesting your support in advancing women in the engineering and technology fields. SWE is far more than a student organization, it’s a launchpad for future leaders, innovators, and changemakers.
Through initiatives like the annual WE25 Conference (taking place October 23–25 this year in New Orleans), company tours, professional development workshops, and our mentorship program, we help our members gain access to internships, full-time job offers, and the skills they need to thrive in traditionally male-dominated industries.
Your donation will directly support the following initiatives:
SWE Mentoring Program
: This program provides stipends to peer mentors who empower SWE members to reach their full potential in academics and launch their careers in STEM.
Joni McCauley, EE Class of 2025, shared
: “The SWE mentoring program has opened many doors for me. I’ve had the opportunity to gain valuable advice from upperclassmen STEM majors and to learn about scholarship programs and undergraduate research because of the guidance I received from my mentors.”
WE25 Annual Conference Travel
: Donations help reimburse members for conference expenses, ensuring they can take full advantage of this empowering opportunity. Last year, more than 20 SWE members attended WE24, and over half of them secured internships, co-ops, or full-time positions!
Olivia Renner, MFGE Class of 2024
, said: “Going to the career fair was the best thing I’ve ever done. The internship I obtained makes me excited for my future as an engineer.”
Unfortunately, due to the rollback of
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI)
initiatives, our chapter has experienced significant funding cuts. These changes threaten the vital programs and opportunities we provide for our members, many of whom are first-generation college students, self-supporting, disabled, or navigating their paths in STEM without a built-in network.
That’s why we are launching this GoFundMe with the following goals:
Total Goal
: $10,000
SWE Mentoring Stipends
: $2,500 (10 Mentors × $250 Stipend)
WE25 Annual Conference Travel Expenses
: $7,500 (25 Members × $300 Travel Allowance)
Your contribution will directly impact the lives of aspiring women engineers, helping us close the gender gap in STEM one student at a time. Together, we can ensure that our members don’t just survive in engineering, they lead in it.
If you would like to donate or learn more about our mission and impact, we would be delighted to connect with you. If you’re unable to give right now, sharing this fundraiser is also an incredible help.
Thank you so much for your kindness and generosity, it truly means the world to us.
labels: Facial expression, Cartoon, Animated cartoon, Happiness, Animation

title: Help Launch Alicia's Mom-Centric Product
description:

I’ve developed a beautifully designed, patent-pending product that helps breastfeeding moms feed their babies with ease, comfort, and confidence, wherever they are. Donate or share if you believe in supporting moms & innovation!

title: Help Me Start Over and Keep My Dream Alive
description:
Hello, my name is Kayla, and I’ve been a barista in Washington state for nearly a decade. My greatest passions in life are delicious drinks and everything kitsch and camp.
My dream life that I have been planning and working towards for several years, is to open my own drive-through coffee shop built into a vintage Airstream trailer called Camp Ground Coffee, located in the woods of Washington state.
In summer of 2024, I signed a contract with a locally known and recommended camper remodeler and $29,000 was taken as a down payment from me to remodel a 1975 Airstream trailer into my coffee camper dream. In June of this year, the business owner suddenly passed away before starting any work on my camper, leaving me (and many others) high and dry, and deep in the hole.
I’ve reached out again and again and have heard nothing back from anyone directly associated with the business or the owner’s estate. However, there is reliable evidence that the estate may be insolvent and the business bank accounts were empty when the owner passed.
I’ve spoken to attorneys, and unfortunately a lawsuit would certainly cost more than the amount I need returned. It has been three months since the owner’s passing, and to the best of my knowledge no probate has been opened for me to file a claim, although that would not by any means guarantee my refund and the process is also costly. I have even taken the step of opening a Consumer Protections complaint with the Attorney General’s office of Washington state. Considering everything, I may likely never see my money returned to me.
The purpose of the fundraiser is to replace the funds that have been taken from me to help start the business I plan to run for the rest of my life, and to help support any legal costs I will incur while fighting in court to get my money back. My goal is to raise enough for another deposit, find a new contractor and start building my dream life after this terrible setback.
Thank you, I really, really hope to see you all at my coffee camper in the woods some day.
Kayla Mathiasen
Camp Ground Coffee
labels: Handwriting

title: Help Todd's Business Recover and Thrive
description:
Hi. My name is Todd Norris, owner of Truck Norris food truck in St. Louis, MO.
Truck Norris was my dream 8 years ago. We have created one of the best food trucks in St. Louis. We are a homegrown, locally owned, and operated business. We even just opened our very first restaurant with hopes of really building on our dream.
However, we have been hit, no pun intended, with some rough times. Our restaurant is very new and does not have the business we were hoping for yet. Then, yesterday at 9:30 AM, coming off Highway 70 and exiting at Natural Bridge, we were involved in a pretty serious truck wreck. Another vehicle went through a red light, and unfortunately, food trucks can't stop on a dime or maneuver safely in a fast method.
The food truck was horribly damaged.
The truck is what is keeping my small business afloat as we build for the future with the restaurant. Now we have lost that, and I am worried. I hate that I'm having to create this account, but we truly need help.
We have filed our info with insurance, but we have no clue how long this will take to receive anything. From lost wages for our business, our staff, and some medical bills, to hopefully a truck replacement.
I'm afraid with how long insurance can take on a matter this large that it will be forever before I can rebuild.
The time and effort it goes into building a food truck is crazy.
I'm hoping that we can get help. I know times are tough for everyone. But honestly, I don't know if we will make it through this without some help. St. Louis is a city that battles for their own. I hope some can battle for us at this moment.
That truck was my life and dream, and in a matter of a few seconds, it could be gone. Any questions, please feel free to reach out or email us.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart,
Todd Norris - Owner
labels: Land vehicle, Vehicle, Mode of transport, Tire, Motor vehicle

title: Help Me Build a Home for My Dream Busines
description:
Hi everyone,
Wildlife has always been a source of joy and inspiration in my life. One of my earliest memories is visiting a butterfly exhibit on a kindergarten field trip to the Pacific Science Center. That experience lit a spark in me and just a few years later, after a fourth-grade lesson on Monarch butterflies, I begged my mom to plant milkweed in our yard immediately!
As I grew older, that curiosity only deepened. One day while walking my dog, I noticed a group of striking black-and-white butterflies with long wings. After some research, I learned they were Zebra Longwings. To attract them, I needed to know their host plant and finding it opened up a whole new world for me.
I discovered that the most successful way to bring butterflies into my garden was to plant both host plants (where they lay eggs) and nectar plants (where they feed). The results were magical. The sensitive pea I planted for Sulphur butterflies also brought in bumblebees. Firebush provided nectar for butterflies while its berries fed mockingbirds. My yard transformed into a small sanctuary alive with color, sound, and movement.
That transformation showed me something important: when we plant with intention, we restore connections. What starts in our own backyards can ripple outward, healing ecosystems and bringing people closer to the natural world.
Since then, I’ve been dedicated to sharing my love for wildlife and making native plants more accessible. My dream is to own land where I can:
•	Grow native plants and food forest plants so more people can bring these benefits into their own yards
•	Create jobs for butterfly wranglers, nursery staff, and support roles
•	Free up time to make educational content that teaches people how to restore their own spaces with confidence
•	Build a community resource that supports pollinators, food security, and biodiversity
Right now, I’m running my business out of my parents’ house, and at my current pace it would take me three more years to move forward. Waiting that long feels like forever and turning to investors would mean giving up the values that make this work meaningful.
I already have the knowledge, experience, and community connections for this business to succeed. What I’m missing are the resources to secure land and hire help. That’s where you come in.
Your support would not just help me achieve a dream it would give more people access to the plants, knowledge, and inspiration they need to reconnect with the natural world.
Thank you for believing in me and being part of this journey to restore the land.
labels: Cheek, Eyebrow, Smile, Forehead, Skin

title: TARDIS Cabinets Relaunch
description:
️✨ I’m Gary—a lifelong Whovian, master craftsman, and the heart behind TARDIS Cabinets. Since 1983, I’ve been handcrafting solid wood boxes and cabinets inspired by the Doctor’s time machine. Not mere replicas, but functional works of art—each one a portal to wonder.
Over the years, I’ve created everything from ring boxes and dice tumblers to wall clocks and cremation urns. Every piece is made with care, patience, and imagination. For me, it’s never just been about woodworking—it’s about crafting something real and lasting that brings joy, nostalgia, and a spark of magic into people’s lives.
After years of building in the hills of South Wales, I’ve returned to the U.S. Starting over has been tough. I’m rebuilding from scratch—tools, materials, workspace, everything. That’s why I’ve launched this fundraiser: to revive www.TARDISCabinets.com as a creative hub and breathe life back into the workshop.
With your support, I can keep making pieces that carry the spirit of the TARDIS forward—objects that remind us that time, memory, and imagination are worth preserving. If you’re able to donate, I’d be deeply grateful. And if not, even sharing this page helps more than you know.
Thank you for reading, for believing, and for helping me keep the magic alive.
Allons-y.

title: Donate to Build MindHeart AI's Healing Tech
description:
We are
MindHeart AI
, a liberatory technology company founded by Dr. Sará King, a neuroscientist and medical anthropologist, and Kierstin Gray, a designer, artist and product/marketing specialist.
We design technology that cares for people by strengthening our humanity, not replacing it.
The Problem
Current AI extracts data, spreads disconnection, and makes inequities worse. Meanwhile, mental health struggles are rising worldwide.
Our Solution
We are creating technology in community, weaving evidence-based science, innovation, and ancestral wisdom so the AI model grows from a place of humanity, care and relationship.
The Mirror of Loving Awareness (MoLA)
is an AI guide that helps people see connections between their thoughts, emotions, and the world around them.
The Library of Loving Awareness (LoLA)
trains the MoLA by sharing practices, stories and tools based on neuroscience, art, and traditions of wisdom from around the world.
Together, they power a unique experience where users can receive personalized support for emotional health and collective healing.
Our Source Proofs
Our work is built on the
Systems Based Awareness Map (SBAM)
, the world’s first map of human awareness developed by Dr. King, which has already reached 750k+ people worldwide. It shows how inner healing strengthens outer healing, which is key to helping people and communities thrive.
What You Can Do
We’re raising $1 Million to build the first public prototype. If one million people give $2, we can make the MoLA real - and move one step closer to a world where collective healing is possible.
We are asking you to Donate, and share with 10-20 friends
When you donate to MindHeart AI, you join a movement of humans who have an important voice advocating for technology built for us, by us.
Our Values
We build technology that centers human and planetary healing
We protect your data
We are transparent about what trains our AI
We give credit and value to the creators who support our platform
Join us in building AI that heals. Together we can shape a future rooted in compassion, equity and belonging.
To learn more about MindHeart AI, our team, and our technology, check out our website
here
.

title: Support Vessel Coffee House & Art Cafe After Break-In ☕️
description:
Vessel Coffee House & Art Cafe — located at 506 N. Mangum Street Suite 102 Durham, NC — just celebrated its grand opening on June 29th as a beautiful new space for art, coffee, and community in the heart of downtown Durham.
Sadly, in the early morning hours of Tuesday, July 15th, the shop was broken into. The front door was damaged, and money was stolen from the register. Thankfully, no one was present or hurt — for that, we are deeply grateful.
After speaking with insurance, the estimated out of pocket costs related to this burglary comes to $1,000. As you can imagine, that’s a tough hit for any small business — especially one that just opened its doors a few weeks ago.
This GoFundMe was created on behalf of Alivia Moe, the incredible owner behind Vessel Coffee House & Art Cafe, to offer support. Alivia built Vessel Coffee House & Art Cafe to be a safe, creative, and welcoming space for all — and now we have a chance to show up for her and this special place.
If you feel moved to help, here are a few ways to support:
Donate what you can — every bit helps!
Share this campaign with your community.
Stop by the shop to grab a coffee or bring a friend — your presence means the world.
We are better together. Thank you for supporting this local gem and reminding Alivia and the Vessel Coffee House & Art Cafe team that Durham and beyond always has their back. ✨
#SupportLocal #VesselCoffeeHouse&ArtCafe
#DurhamNC #CommunityStrong #BetterTogether
labels: Glass, Door, Metal, Transparency, Iron

title: Save Sheyegirl Coffee Co.: A New Beginning
description:
Hello!
My name is Sheyenne and I am the owner/operator of a retro coffee shop located just outside of Nashville named Sheyegirl Coffee Co. The shop was created out of my intense love for high-quality coffee, all things vintage, and wanting to make a space where all are welcome to step back in time to forget the crazy world for a spell. We sell vintage clothes, merchandise, coffee, tea, treats, sandwiches, mocktails and adaptogens! We have retro sitting rooms where people can sit back and relax in such as our recreated 1950's kitchen and our 1940's living room. We use our own blends of all organic/all natural coffee roasts. Our lattes are handcrafted and made when ordered using all natural ingredients only... NO PUMP SYRUPS. We basically are baking your latte and you can taste the difference. It also makes things very customizable when you don't want something so sweet. So when you ask for a White Mocha here you get real white chocolate! We have been told that we are the coolest coffee shop and some of the best coffee around.
Our doors opened in the small downtown strip in Ashland City, TN in April 2016. Ever since, we have housed hundreds of intimate concerts, writer's nights, vintage movie nights, live jazz music, paint and sips, game nights, and more! My customers have become family, and this is truly a safe place for all to enjoy, create, work, read, or just grab a cup of high-quality coffee. Through the years, we have gotten through many challenges, including Covid, inflation, and construction/parking challenges. Unfortunately, on June 30th, I received a notice that would rock the community and my world.
My employee got a letter that stated our lease would not be renewed and that we would have to vacate the premises in 60 days.
There was no reason given other than they are going in a different direction. We have to be out by August 31st, and I have looked far and wide for a location that might be more affordable for me to be able to set up without asking for help, but alas, there really isn't anything.
I have been looking for a place since I received the notice, and I am still left with things up in the air. I have decided to put all of the shop's things in a couple of large storage units for the next 2 months and hope to raise some funds to be able to help with a new location.
The location that would be a best fit for us would be in areas that are with a higher monthly rent, but know that with the extra financial help we could make this new location flourish even more than at the location we are having to move from as there were always SO many challenges.
I am hoping that this is the push we needed to bring us to a better situation, and with your help, we CAN do it!
We have created such a community within the shop and have helped to give a stage to so many creators, original music artists, and the like! I would love to continue to be a space for the arts, creators, and the open-minded, open-hearted thinkers to continue to grace. It is so important for spots like this to exist for the community, and I would love to continue to work to make it happen!
labels: Eyewear, Glasses, Eyebrow, Vision Care, Lips

title: Help Trippy Save his Business
description:
I have dreaded posting this but I realize without the help and support from all my people’s I won’t be able to recover from this financial burden otherwise. Saturday I was headed to a photo shoot and planned to ride a scooter but on the way I was cut off by a car full of people wearing masks. One guy got out and at gunpoint told me to give him my bag as he searched my pockets.  he took my phone and about $200 in cash and my bag which contained two of my Sony cameras , three lenses and my Apple MacBook pro and  several smaller items I’m still trying to inventory then they drove off.  Im NGL it was one of the scariest situations I’ve ever been in,  But thank god nothing crazier happened. I’m thankful to be alive.
I posted online about what happened and got a lot of love and support from my community and thru all that a lot of people said I should create a gofundme so I figured it could only help, This equipment represents years of saving, countless jobs, and every lesson I've learned in my career, So Now I am posting this in hopes that you can all help me as I try to recoup and rebuild my business.
Why I Need Your Help
Im exploring all the avenues I can but the truth is, replacing $20,000 of specialized equipment is an impossible mountain to climb alone.
I am asking for your support to replace the essential core of my kit so I can get back to doing what I love and providing for myself. Every dollar raised will go directly toward replacing the cameras, lenses, and laptop necessary to book my next jobs.
If you can't donate, I completely understand. Sharing this campaign with your network, your photography groups, or on social media would be an equally monumental help.
Thank you, from the deepest part of my heart, for reading my story and for considering a donation. You all know This equipment represents a Dream I’ve been building for the last 6-7 years. This is how I create my art and support my family and pay my bills. So anything you send is greatly appreciated I couldn’t do this without you all so thank you from the bottom of my heart.  You all know how important my art is to me and I want to be able to continue providing customers and potential customers with the very best. I look forward to the day I can use this new equipment to thank you all by creating beautiful work again.
Thank you all so much,
Trippy Sanders
labels: Camera, Cameras & optics, Electronic device, Digital camera, Reflex camera

title: Cycle 300 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
During the month of October, I will be cycling 300 miles to raise money for the American Cancer Society in honor of Tom Johnson. Tom passed away just over a month ago from mucosal melanoma, a rare, aggressive, and understudied cancer. He was my best friend's dad and a dear friend of my own.
Tom was diagnosed with cancer a few days after I was accepted to medical school. As I began my studies, I watched him endure countless radiation and immunotherapy treatments with grace and humor. Inspired by Tom's courage and frustrated by the lack of information about his rare disease, I began doing my own research. For the past several months, I have been analyzing national cancer data to better understand mucosal melanoma and the patients it affects.
I am cycling this October to support cancer research -- so that people like me can keep asking questions and so that patients like Tom have greater options, better outcomes, and more time. If you are able, please consider supporting my ride and the work of the American Cancer Society.

title: ✨ Help Us Complete the Awakening Life Center ✨
description:
Dear Friends, Family, and Community,
I am so grateful to share this vision with you. I’ve started a GoFundMe campaign to help complete the opening of the Awakening Life Center, a healing and wellness space created to serve our community and beyond.
The Awakening Life Center will be home to yoga instructors, healers, and holistic practitioners who offer classes, workshops, and supportive practices for mind, body, and spirit. Our mission is to create a sacred space where individuals can heal, grow, and find balance.
We are located just one block away from Wake Forest University, and we see a great opportunity to extend healing support to students, faculty, and the wider community who need a place to recharge, restore, and reconnect.
At this time, we are raising funds to complete the repairs and renovations necessary to open our doors fully. Every contribution, no matter the size, brings us one step closer to creating a space of light, love, and transformation.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for your generosity, encouragement, and belief in this vision. Together, we can open the doors of the Awakening Life Center and welcome all who seek healing and community.
Tiffany

title: Help Myrrh Cosmetics Reach Everyone
description:
Hi, our names are Ana Clara & Alcione Gouvea and
we are distributors of Myrrh Cosmetics
. Since we were little girls, we’ve always loved how a special fragrance could change everything—lifting the spirit, calming the heart, or bringing back the memory of someone we love.
That’s why, when we discovered
Myrrh Cosmetics
, we realized it wasn’t just a brand, but a dream we wanted to share with others. It originated in Brazil in the state of Minas Gerais where the brand was highly valued. The name Myrrh touched me deeply, as it comes from the Bible, being a precious perfume offered to baby Jesus and used in sacred anointing. Myrrh carries a unique symbolism: the more it is crushed, the stronger its aroma spreads, reminding us that beauty is born out of pressure.
For us, being distributors of Myrrh means carrying this message of transformation and care to every customer. Each product—whether a cream, a perfume, or a facial wash—is crafted to deliver affection and well-being.
Our greatest hope is that when people use Myrrh, they feel the love and passion that are present in every detail of the brand. Every little donation is appreciated
labels: Personal care, Design, Label

title: Help Dave expand a stable new business in Israel
description:
Help Dave expand a stable wartime business in Israel
Dave and Kathy arrived to Israel 30 years ago, believing it was a God appointment. Dave began a contracting and remodeling business and Kathy got her real estate license in Hebrew. Our businesses have prospered and supported us, through our businesses we helped establish many others who came to Israel. October 7th 2023 the war began with missiles falling meters away from our balcony, what was supposed to last weeks has lasted two years. Israel closed access to Arab workers, working life came to a standstill. Dave couldn’t get his usual men and when work came in sporadically in 2024 the permitted workers and costs tripled in price.
Hoping for an alternative in business that could survive local difficulties, Dave took a course in selling on Amazon. He was in the top 1% of the course and was offered a beta course the next level. We had savings that we invested in an online store on Amazon featuring knitting products. It’s called Clararti. We were thrilled the products he researched and purchased sold well and we made 20% over our initial investment. He reinvested into more inventory, profits also had to go to living. Knitting is seasonal and he’d like to expand to household products which are purchased year-round.
With your support, we can strengthen our business with additional inventory so it can carry us through these uncertain times and provide a future not dependent on the Israeli economy. These past four years—two under COVID and two in an ongoing war—we experienced how important it is to have a reliable, adaptable source of livelihood when everything shuts down partially or fully. Dave will keep remodeling when work is available.
Only once in 30 years in Israel did we ask for help, with God’s help we have made it thus far, we ask for your help now. It is crucial this month as we need to purchase the inventory in a lump sum for the Christmas season which was very successful last year.
Psalm 66:12 “we went through fire and water, but you brought us to a place of abundance.”
Every contribution, will make a meaningful difference in helping us get back into prosperity. Thank you for being part of this next chapter in our journey of Aliyah. Blessing us will help us continue to establish and help others; “Gen.12:3 I will bless those who bless you…”

title: I'm making a career change. Its Time...
description:
I've come to a point in my life where I've made positive changes because I had to for the sake of my family and for myself.
I have worked in the television and movie industry for almost the last 10 years. Before that, I was a union carpenter. The volatility of the industry has made it so I need to search out other avenues of work. In the past, I had thought that driving a truck was out of reach until recently when I was in the gym and I spoke with a truck driver who was from out of state and using the gym in his travels. He explained to me that the hardest part is knowing the mechanics of the truck, which I am very well versed in, being that I have been a tool man in the movie business throughout my career. Fixing equipment and knowing what tools are used to do what is right up my alley. I've always been a good driver and I'm able to pretty much back a trailer through the eye of a needle, so I am going to take the plunge.
I'm able to take an intensified course in my area to help get me certified and then I'm going to need to lease a truck.
That's why I need to do this GoFundMe.
I want a second chance at things and my family has been struggling because of the touch and go of the movie industry in our area.
I'm asking for any and all help. It will be greatly appreciated and it will not be forgotten. I know I can do great if I'm just given the opportunity.

title: Support Our Locally-Owned Hyde & Pacific Liquor and Grocery
description:
For nearly four decades, Hyde & Pacific Liquor and Grocery Mart has been the heart of our neighborhood. What started as a Korean immigrant family's dream in 1987 became much more than a convenience store – it's been our gathering place and community cornerstone.
The store was passed down to Christina (or Chris, as regulars call her) from her father, Han, and she continued the family tradition of treating every customer like family. After over 30 years as owner, Chris now faces having to rebuild her and her family's lives from scratch. Han originally purchased Hyde & Pacific Liquor and Grocery Mart and worked at the store until his health began failing, and ever since then, it's been a mother-daughter duo with Chris and her mother, Uni. Han passed away this year. Hyde & Pacific is where generations have shopped, where kids buy candy with allowance money, where neighbors stop in for ingredients to cook at home, for a quick heat-up meal, a pint of ice cream, and a bottle of wine to drink with dinner, and where everyone knows your name.
Now, after 38 years of service, our neighborhood institution is in crisis, and will close at the end of September.
The new property owner gave Chris only 60 days' notice to vacate with no future option for the business. To make matters worse, the new landlord is requiring Chris to continue paying rent even though she's had to resort to severely discounting prices, giving things away for free, and taking significant financial losses — all to meet the deadline. During this devastating time, Chris also lost her father Han, who had devoted decades of his life to building this neighborhood institution alongside his family. With Han gone, Chris and Uni must handle both the practicalities—closing the store and settling his estate—and the deeper challenge of preserving his memory and legacy.
Chris faces mounting costs from liquidating inventory under pressure, funeral expenses, and the emotional weight of losing both her father and her life's work simultaneously. The family that has given so much to our neighborhood needs our help during this incredibly difficult time.
Every donation dollar will go toward:
Rent and utility fees from being asked to leave under duress
Loss of wages and incoming revenue
Inventory liquidation losses
Professional business closure and junk removal costs
Funeral expenses for Chris's father
Helping the family through this transition. Three generations have grown and evolved in this store since 1987, including Chris's 9-year-old daughter.
Chris and her family have been there for us for 37 years. Now it's our turn to be there for them.
"Small mom and pop businesses are the heart of what makes a neighborhood feel like home. We've celebrated with families during good times, and been here during the tough ones. Your support of local businesses doesn't just keep us going - it keeps the community spirit alive. We're going to miss you all so much." - Chris
Together, we can help Chris and her family through this difficult time. No amount is too small, and every dollar counts.
labels: Shelf, Shelving, Retail, Shopkeeper, Customer

title: Raising Awareness for Neurofibromatosis
description:
My name is Kenny, and I’m the founder of Ken of the Rocky Mountains LLC. I’m launching a business selling T-shirts, skateboards, and sweatshirts to raise awareness for Neurofibromatosis type one—a rare genetic disease that has shaped every part of my life. Living with this condition means facing daily pain, nerve damage, and mental disabilities. I spend countless hours in doctors’ offices, sometimes as many as 25 visits a year, just to manage my symptoms. The reality is, most people have never heard of Neurofibromatosis type one, and there are very few doctors who know how to treat it. That’s not just difficult—it’s heartbreaking.
I am passionate about changing this. We urgently need more awareness, more research, and ultimately, a cure. Through Ken of the Rocky Mountains LLC, I want to spark conversations and help others understand the impact of this disease. Every product I sell is a chance to educate someone new and to build a community of support for those affected. The lack of knowledge and resources for Neurofibromatosis type one is a crisis, and I am determined to do my part to change that.
Funds raised will help me purchase equipment and pay for subcontracting to produce T-shirts and sweatshirts, so I can start spreading the word and raising awareness. Your support will help me launch my business and fight for a future where no one has to feel alone with this disease. Thank you for standing with me and for helping make a difference.
labels: Cat, Felidae, Carnivores, Felinae, Vertebrate

title: Support Miftahou's Dream: Uongozi English School
description:
Hello everyone! I'm Anton, a Returned Peace Corps Volunteer who served in Comoros from 2018-2020. I started this GoFundMe on behalf of my friend,
Miftahou Mohammed
. Miftah is a Comorian English teacher who worked as a Language and Culture Facilitator for the Peace Corps. As part of his job, he taught Peace Corps Volunteers about the local culture and language.
Miftah hopes to start his own English language school, Uongozi, in the capital Moroni, and needs our help to secure the startup capital.
To ensure the project's sustainability, Miftah needs $2,232 to cover the initial costs and operating expenses for the first year.
Miftah describes Uongozi's mission this way:
"Uongozi will equip people in Comoros with simple, practical English skills that help them succeed in tourism, work, education, and global communication—so they will be able to serve visitors better, access more opportunities, and build stronger futures. This mission keeps the focus clear: it’s about making English useful, not complicated—and using it as a tool to grow both personally and nationally."
Please see the full text of Uongozi's mission statement and budget breakdown below:
Uongozi Mission Statement
Uongozi Operating Budget

title: Offsetting Tariffs & Customs Fees for KibblesTasty's KCLL
description:
Hey Folks-
I've heavily documented the process of getting the books into the US
on the Kickstarter updates
, and the unfortunate impact the tariffs and shifting enforcement standards have caused on the process. Ultimately, I said I would cover all the tariff related charges and I have - you will get your book without any additional charge.
Some people have asked for a spot to contribute to covering the cost though, so I've opened this, with a target of 50% of the total bill I've paid for the tariff & extra fees.
This is an entire voluntary donation. You will get your books just the same either way.
This is for people that either don't think US businesses should be on the hook for last minute tariff expenses, want to pay their own tariffs, or otherwise want to give me money related to the situation.
I'm going to break down what the costs come from, and then what the cost per unit was (roughly) for people that want more information or want to try to exactly pay their tariff fee.
Tariffs/Duties:
$13,123
US Customs Fees:
$4,224
Additional Processing & Logistics Costs:*
~$8,100
Total Additional Costs for the US Books:
$25,447
*this is almost certainly a low estimate on the line
To clarify, this is on top of all the normal shipping and fulfillment costs. The normal shipping and fulfillment of the books from the printer to your door (for the US and Canada books) will cost ~$67,000 in total (from factory to your door - that includes postage and boxes and all that, but is a lower end estimate since it doesn't account for lost products and other fees). But that was priced into the Kickstarter and you've already paid your share when you paid for shipping. The $25,447 was not priced in, and is effectively going to be what I'm paying out of my 'take home' share of the Kickstarter.
So how does this break down? I've imported to the US...
5685
hard cover books (KCLL + KCCC)
2885
softcover books (Spell Reference Manual, Battle Reference Manual, Crafting Reference Manual, etc)
2084
decks cards (Spell Cards, Battle Cards, etc)
If I adjust for what they cost (with some averaging), that means that per item tariff & fee cost is...
~$4
per hardcover book
~$1.25
per softcover book or deck of cards
So, for example, if you got 2 hardcover books, a softcover book, and a deck cards, you could pay $4 + $4 + $1.25 + $1.25 = $11 to cover 'your' share of the tariff. Of course, this is an extremely optional guideline, since I don't
expect
people to pay anything.
Obviously digital orders have no share of the tariff & fees. The per unit numbers are rounded estimates, since not all products cost the exact same price or manufacturing cost, but you can round the direction you feel comfortable with (if you would like to contribute at all).
I'm not dependent on this GoFundMe to stay in business or run the next Kickstarter, but ultimately I've made a lot less money off this Kickstarter than the amount of work I've put in, in a solid chunk of that is due factors pretty much out of my hands, so I've decided to put this up for folks that want to put their finger on scales to return is slightly more toward sanity.
Thank you,
-KibblesTasty
labels: Fictional character, Animation, Animated cartoon, Toy

title: Help Ravenna Varsity Close with Dignity
description:
Help us send the Seattle staple Ravenna Varsity Restaurant off with Dignity
Dear friends, neighbors, and longtime patrons,
Its with a heavy and broken heart that Sandy and I, her son Bryan, must announce that after 60+ wonderful years flipping pancakes and filling coffee cups on the corner of NE 65th St the Ravenna Varsity Restaurant must close its doors Sunday, August 3rd 2025. New lease negotiations fell through, the landlord rejected any potential buyers we put in front of them in hopes to keep the business you know and love running, so now we’re facing the hard costs of closing down this longstanding family business.
Unfortunately shutting down isn't as easy as turning off the griddle, due to closing costs that range from:
Outstanding debt from pandemic losses, rising food prices, city surcharges.
Supplier contracts & service agreements that carry steep early‑termination fees
Employee severance & final payroll for the staff who kept the coffee hot and the smiles warm
We’re asking for $50,000 to cover the bare‑minimum bills that stand between our family and bankruptcy.
Why This Matters
For six decades our family and staff at Ravenna Varsity has been serving as Seattle’s neighborhood breakfast table — the spot for family meals, first jobs, study‑cram hash browns , and endless coffee cup fillings. You made us more than a diner; you made us a community landmark, and for that we will be forever truly grateful. To us running The Varsity has never been about making big profit or perfecting the ultimate dish, its been about the customers and the connections we've made to you and your families while serving a quality home-style meal. Every person who walks through our doors whether you be a monthly drop in or a daily regular you've all become truly like family and it devastates us to see these connections fall prey to these unforeseen circumstances. We will miss each and everyone of you dearly.
How You Can Help
Donate whatever you can — even $5 helps immensely.
Share this campaign with your friends and family, especially former Seattle locals who miss our famous cinnamon buns.
Tell a Varsity memory here or on any of our socials. We appreciate any and all well wishes and classic stories.
Come in for final hug or hot cup of coffee.
Closing is incredibly bittersweet, but with your help we can finish with tears in our eyes but our heads held high, pay our people, and settle our debts without losing everything our family and crew built.
With gratitude (and syrup on our sleeves),
Sandy, Bryan, the entire Pelkey Family & the Ravenna Varsity Team
"The doors may shut, but the connections and community we built will last a lifetime"
labels: Poster, Handwriting, Food group, Fast food, Graphic design

title: Coastal Coffee Co: your loving third space in Kent, WA
description:
Hello everyone,
My name is Kelsy, and I’m reaching out as the founder of Coastal Coffee Co here in Kent, WA. After spending nearly my entire adult life working in the espresso industry and managing a local cafe for 7 years, I finally took the leap this past year to start my own espresso business. If you’ve seen me at the Kent Farmers Market or one of my pop-ups this summer, you know how much love and passion I put into every cup.
But Coastal Coffee Co is about so much more than coffee. Living and working in Kent, I’ve seen firsthand how divided our community can be—especially when it comes to our homeless neighbors, who are often treated with cruelty and indifference. I dream of creating a true third space in our city: a welcoming, safe, and cozy spot for ALL people to come together, relax, and feel seen—no matter their background or circumstances. I want to use my cafe to support local small businesses, host community events like live music and paint & sips, and help those who are hungry or underprivileged.
Starting this business has already meant investing everything I have—my espresso machine, cart, and almost everything else I found secondhand. I’m currently struggling to keep up with bills, but my real goal now is to GROW Coastal Coffee Co into the warm, inclusive community space that Kent needs so badly.
If you believe in the power of kindness, connection, and great coffee, I would be incredibly grateful for any support you can offer. Your contribution will help me bring this vision to life—helping Kent become a place where everyone feels welcome and cared for.
Thank you so much for reading, sharing, and supporting this dream.
With abundant love,
Kelsy
labels: Tableware, Drinkware, Coffee, Cup, Flat white

title: A FOURTH WALL FILM: FEVER DREAM
description:
HEY!
We’re Dillon Graham and Ahamson Duniani — two student filmmakers from Atlanta, GA, and the Bronx, NY, chasing a dream and pouring our hearts into a new film,
Fever Dream
. We’re really excited about this project, and we’d love to have you along for the ride.
What’s Fever Dream about?
It’s the story of Jackson, who spends what feels like a perfect day with Valentina — a muse who’s the embodiment of love: joy, freedom, and pure magic all wrapped up in one person. But just as the day reaches its climax, a phone call pulls Valentina away, leaving Jackson standing there, stunned and heartbroken.
From that moment on, Jackson’s world starts to unravel. He encounters five women who each embody the stages of grief — denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and finally acceptance. The catch? These women aren’t real people. They’re fragments of Jackson’s mind trying to make sense of his pain.
It’s a story about love, loss, and the complicated, messy journey toward healing.
Why we need your help
As students, we’re working with a super tight budget.
Your support would help us pay our incredible cast and crew fairly, cover essentials like food, housing, and transportation, and handle costs for equipment, locations, and eventually sharing the film with the world.
Why this story matters to us
We want to capture those fleeting moments of happiness, the ache of losing someone, and what it truly takes to move forward. It’s a story about reflection that we hope will evoke an emotion in our audience and ultimately spark a conversation.
How you can help
If you’re able to chip in, even a little means the world. If not, simply sharing our story with friends or on social media is just as powerful. We’re deeply grateful for any support you can offer.
Thanks so much for taking the time to hear us out and believe in this project. We can’t wait to share Fever Dream with you.

title: Join the Myth. Pour the Memory: Help Launch Herbal Alchemy
description:
WHAT IS HERBAL ALCHEMY?
Herbal Alchemy is more than a syrup, it’s a memory you can taste.
Like true alchemy, we transform what you already have into something richer, deeper, and more alive. Our small-batch syrups are crafted to alchemize your everyday routine: layering flavors that carry memory, spark the senses, and shift your mood, turning the mundane into a moment that feels transportive.
Years in the making, Herbal Alchemy was born from an artist’s creative practice of blending memory, flavor, and transformation. Each bottle is a blend of art, nature, and craft that has the power to change not only your drink, but your moment—and maybe even your day.
We’re now seeking the support of generous donors and early patrons to bring our first full collection to life. With your help, we’ll share these alchemical creations with the world, one sip at a time.
Born in Chicago and infused with years of artistic and culinary devotion, each small-batch flavor tells a story. Grief and joy, longing and wonder, all steeped into syrups that invite you to slow down and savor.
We are raising $15,000 to bring Herbal Alchemy to full launch — covering testing, packaging, and our first shelf-stable run — and $30,000 to secure permits, re-test our Classic line, expand production, and capture the soul of this story on film for marketing, bringing this our muse, aisling and this dream to life
MEET THE MAKER
Raised in a Charleston, Illinois home steeped in community, our founder learned early that food was ceremony.
He didn’t follow recipes. He followed rhythms:
Garlic blooming in a pan
The comfort of voices weaving together at the table
The way a meal carries flavor and memory from one generation to the next.
Years later, trained in fine art and storytelling, he began weaving myth and memory together. Herbal Alchemy is where it all converges — flavor as feeling, myth as muse, alchemy as everyday routine.
WHO IS AISLING?
Aisling is a dreamwalker from the Celestial Grove. An intuitive presence who whispers memory back to life, guiding the creation of each flavor. Through her story, we remember our own.
WHY NOW?
A vision this intentional can’t be rushed—but it can be nourished.
Herbal Alchemy has been years in the making, carefully crafted to be unlike anything else in a syrup industry dominated by mass-produced sameness. In a landscape where a handful of brands monopolize coffee shops, bars, and store shelves, we’re creating something rare: small-batch syrups infused with artistry, memory, and transformation.
Your gift today will help us:
Complete compliance & safety testing so every bottle meets the highest standards.
Produce our first full collection of alchemical syrups.
Launch a thoughtful, beautifully designed online store to share them with the world.
Capture the soul of Herbal Alchemy on film—sharing the story and the magic through marketing that inspires.
With your support, this dream doesn’t just launch—it lives, breathes, and begins transforming everyday drinks into moments worth remembering.
Every gift makes a difference — whether it’s one time, or as a monthly offering that helps keep these flavors and stories flowing.
JOIN THE MYTH. POUR THE MEMORY.
We craft artisanal syrups rooted in the human experiences and memories that connect us all. Honoring the beauty of memory and the stories evoked through taste, each bottle transforms an everyday drink into a moment rich with feeling, meaning, and connection.
If you’ve ever paused at the taste of something beautifully crafted…
If you believe story belongs at the table…
If you want to help an artist bring a bit of wonder into the everyday…
Join us. Aisling and the Grove await.
labels: Eyebrow, Sleeve, Face, Jaw, Smile

title: Support Sterling's Journey to a Food Trailer
description:
Hi everyone! My name is Sterling I’m the Chef/owner of Heartfelt Cooking. I’m fundraising to make a lifelong dream come true—
owning my very own food trailer
. Ever since I was a teenager, I’ve dreamed of sharing my love for cooking with the world through a mobile kitchen I could call my own. Now, I’m finally taking steps to make that vision a reality, but I need a little help to cross the finish line.

title: Help Rebuild Saxapahaw Campground
description:
Saxapahaw Campground has just experienced catastrophic flooding and damage and is closed until further notice.
While we have seen the Haw River come out of its banks a few times before, we have never seen anything like this. A look back in history shows the last time a flood similar to this was almost 30 years ago.
This damage done to our beautiful campground is truly heartbreaking and while we never want to ask for folks to donate, this is a time where we truly need help. Volunteering to help with the clean-up is one way to assist in getting the campground open again; the other is by donating money to help with the tremendous cost to rebuild and reopen.
Thank you so much for your consideration and support, Mike

title: Help IBSA Foster Business Student Success
description: Hello everyone! My name is Brandon Hancock, and I am the president of IBSA (Inspiring Business Students Association). We are a student-led organization at SUNY Albany dedicated to fostering leadership, professional growth, and community among business students. IBSA is open to anyone who needs guidance, support, or resources to succeed. We host meetings throughout the week based on what students need help with, whether it’s academics, networking, or figuring out how to get started in the business world. Our mission is to provide a clear path, mentorship, and opportunities for students who may be struggling to find direction. Although we are not yet formally recognized by the university, we are passionate about growing this group and supporting as many students as possible. Your donation will directly help us build resources, host events, and create meaningful opportunities for inspiring business majors. Any contribution, big or small, will make a real difference. Thank you for supporting the future of business leaders!

title: My Dream: Service To Others
description:
My name is John, and I have dedicated my life to funeral service since I was 19 years old. The loss of my cousin at a young age changed my path from teaching to serving families during their most difficult moments. Over the years, I have worked in funeral homes across Norfolk, Middlesex, Suffolk, Plymouth, and Barnstable counties in Massachusetts, caring for families and helping them honor their loved ones. Funeral service is more than a profession to me—it is a calling and a ministry. I believe in leading, educating, and making a difference in people’s lives, and I am proud to serve my community in this way.
I am now ready to take the next step by purchasing a family-owned, community-centered funeral home in Massachusetts. I want to continue the legacy that the funeral home family has established by providing the same level of compassionate care. The funds raised will be used for the downpayment, legal fees, and essential startup costs needed to secure a loan and begin negotiations. With your support, I will be able to continue a funeral home legacy and serve the community's evolving needs.
My vision is to offer more than just traditional funerals. I will provide a wide range of personalized services, helping families celebrate the lives of their loved ones in ways that are meaningful and comfortable for them. Whether it’s a traditional service at the funeral home or a unique celebration at a venue of their choice, I will guide, advocate, and execute every detail. I also plan to create a teaching funeral home, offering apprenticeships to young professionals who want to enter the field but lack connections. My goal is to build a dynamic team dedicated to serving our community with compassion and innovation. Your support will help me make this vision a reality and continue to care for families for generations to come.
labels: Smile, Sleeve, Facial expression, Happiness, Active Shirt

title: 30 Mile Dog Walk for American Cancer Society
description:
Cancer has ravaged the lives of so many people I deeply love affecting both paternal & maternal sides of my family, in fact I had my own cancer scare in 2016 thankfully I received a clean bill of health following a biopsy. November 2013 cancer stole my best friend Mary, and in October of last year it took my Aunt Bet.
I first felt the impact of cancer in middle school when a classmate Allison died of leukemia at only 14 years old. I don't think I understood then that kids died of cancer too. I can still remember sitting at the funeral in my purple turtleneck (Allisons favorite color), I'd never seen a casket that small, it just didn't seem right. Little did I know cancer would just keep making appearances throughout my life, stealing loves & time with those loves. My heart chooses to hope for a cure in my lifetime.
I'm walking 30 miles with Axle to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer. ACS has a platinum rating on GuideStar (the highest possible), so give with confidence! Thank you for your support!

title: A New Home for Houston Cats: Purradise. Your support helps
description:
Purradise is a new cat-specific boarding and grooming facility created by John and Nichol to serve Houston. Fat Cat Flats, the business where we currently work, is soon to close, and we realized there are no other quality options for cats in town. Many cat owners rely on our grooming, specialized care and safe boarding for their cats, and we want to continue providing these essential services under a new name and vision.
Our goal is to create a welcoming, stress-free environment for cats and peace of mind for their owners. With Purradise, we hope to offer professional grooming, comfortable boarding, and attentive care tailored to each cat’s needs. The support from our community will help us purchase a property and set up the facility so we can keep serving local cats and their families without interruption.
We’re asking for help as soon as possible to secure a location and begin operations. Every contribution will go directly toward purchasing the property and making Purradise a reality for the many cats and cat owners who depend on these services. Thank you for helping us keep this vital resource available in Houston.
labels: Cat, Felidae, Carnivores, Felinae, Whiskers

title: Support Squirm!
description:
Squirm Gallery is a DIY project space independently operated by a small team of artists who are deeply entrenched in the Denver scene. For the past two years, we have organized community art and music events, platforming both emerging underground artists and more established creatives. These events have been funded completely with money from our own pockets and love from our hearts. This labor of love ultimately costs a lot. We do not make a profit from these events, as is the nature of DIY. We often struggle to make rent, partly due to our belief that anyone who wants to engage with our community should be able to, regardless of financial contribution.
We need your help to keep our space accessible. Being located in an increasingly gentrified neighborhood that works against our community has contributed to our precarious situation. We aim to safely continue the legacy of 3553 Brighton Blvd while expanding on our renewed creative mission. Big expenses include maintaining our sound system which is vital to providing a quality experience for both performers and attendees, and general costs necessary to meeting citywide standards of operation.
With your support we can continue our mission and commitment to you–providing accessible opportunities for all to explore and experiment with art and music. Under the threat of the current administration’s attack on the arts, strengthening community bonds in an independent, minority-run space is essential. Let’s keep it rocking OK!
labels: Font

title: Changing the Service Industry, One Cookie at a Time
description:
I've always been honest with y'all and even though it's hard to ask for help, I decided that I shouldn't be ashamed for needing it. Okay now here's some facts, costs increased, project took longer than projected, we can't really control the city, and we can't really qualify for a standard loan because we're built on sustainability, not profitability. The last thing we need is assistance with inventory, accessibility fixtures, and permits/fees.
WE'RE SO CLOSE TO OPENING,
we have our main inspections in the next several days, we just need a little help crossing the finish line!
Will update this as much as I can to give y'all the official soft opening date, baby!
Midwest Sad: Changing the Service Industry, One Cookie at a Time
The service industry has been broken for a long time—burnout, underpaying staff, toxic kitchens, and a constant cycle of instability for small businesses and workers alike. I’ve spent over a decade in this industry, and I know firsthand how unsustainable it can be. But instead of accepting it, I decided to build something different.
Midwest Sad isn’t just about baking. It’s about proving that queer, women-owned businesses don’t have to fit inside anyone else’s expectations. That we don’t have to shrink ourselves, soften our edges, or play along with a system that wasn’t built for us.
For most of my career, I’ve been harassed, assaulted, and made fun of—told I wasn’t strong enough, smart enough, or capable enough to succeed in this industry. I’m sick of it. Things need to change. And if no one else is going to change them, I will.
Midwest Sad is built on three things:
Sustainability
– No more burnout culture. We focus on long-term success, not just surviving shift to shift.
Ethics
– No toxic kitchen environments. No underpaid, overworked employees. Just people who are valued.
Fun
– Because I refuse to let this industry steal my joy anymore.
Right now, Midwest Sad is growing, but we’re dreaming big. We want to build a community kitchen that provides free rent to food entrepreneurs for six months, helping them launch their own businesses without crushing financial barriers. We want to offer free meals, accept food stamps, and ensure that good food is accessible to everyone—not just those who can afford it.
I’m not here to be what others expect of me. I’m here to be myself, to fight for the next generation of food workers, and to build something that actually matters.
Food should be for everyone. Safe kitchens should be the norm. Queer, women-owned businesses should thrive without compromise.
This is just the beginning.
This video was made for kickstarter BUT we still wanna use this as our main video cause we love it so much, we hope you do too!
"No raffles, sweepstakes, giveaways, or returns on investment are offered in exchange for any donations made to this GoFundMe."
labels: Sketch, Line art, Handwriting, Fast food

title: Support Crown Electric Tattoo's Recovery
description:
Hello everyone, my name is Javier, I’m a tattoo artist from Crown Electric Tattoo in Las Vegas.
Recently, a devastating fire tore through our shop — our second home, our livelihood, and the heart of our artistic community. In just moments, everything we had built was lost. Crown Electric wasn’t just a place of work; it was where we connected with our loyal clients, shared stories, and created lasting art together.
This tragedy has left our entire team without income, equipment, or a place to continue our craft. We’re doing everything we can to rebuild and reopen, but in the meantime, we’re struggling to stay afloat.
We’re reaching out with humble hearts to ask for any support you can give. Your donations will help our crew cover essential expenses — like rent, food, and bills — while we work to find a new space and start again from scratch.
Every contribution, no matter the size, makes a difference. And from the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for standing with us during this incredibly difficult time.
Much love and gratitude,
The Crown Electric Tattoo Family
labels: Night, Midnight

title: Support Our Community Woodworking School
description:
A teacher mentor of mine once said this about an ACT score that came back from a school:
“You can’t measure the success of a group by the growth of the top of the class; you have to support the growth of the bottom class as well.”
This shop will always have the mission to make learning this trade accessible to ALL groups of people, the ones who can afford opportunities and the ones who can’t.
I did a GoFundMe to get this school open and now I need a little help to keep it open.
All the funds raised will be used to pay rent, staff, utilities, and class fees for those who need it.
We have grants and sponsorships lined up for the future to let this place grow and shine long term but could use a little help from our friends in the short term.
Thank you all for continuing to support our local community woodworking school.
Love,
Megan
