title: Support Farina Pasta Bar After Break-In
description:
On Tuesday, September 2nd, 2025, Farina Pasta Bar was broken into (updates will come as soon as we receive them), right after the Labor Day weekend. This beloved Philly mom-and-pop shop, owned by Chef Dan Lee - a veteran and Drexel graduate, and his wife Taylor - has always been more than just a restaurant. Dan and Taylor, who are new parents to a baby girl, have poured their hearts into building a space that brings people together and supports the local community.
Farina Pasta Bar is a true neighborhood staple. Over the years, Dan has partnered with local schools, supported other Black-owned and small-owned businesses, and created a welcoming spot for everyone. The break-in has left the business facing a significant loss of income, especially during the slow summer months when every sale counts. With fall typically being the busiest time of year, this setback comes at a critical moment for the family and the business.
The impact goes beyond the owners—Farina Pasta Bar is also home to a dedicated team of employees, many of whom rely on their jobs as their only source of income. These staff members are an essential part of the Farina family, working hard every day to make it possible to serve the community. Funds raised will help Dan, his family, and the entire team recover from several months of lost sales, allowing them to keep their doors open, pay their employees, and continue serving the neighborhood they love. Your support will make a real difference for a business that has always given back to others.
As the head of marketing for Farina Pasta Bar, being a part of this team has been nothing but an honor to work with Dan & Taylor, alongside watching them become new parents to their baby. I've seen them bend over backwards for the community, and right now they need the same help.
Philly, it's time to come together and support our own!
labels: Sleeve, Smile, Happiness, Facial expression, Active Shirt

title: Save Superchief Gallery: Keep LA’s Home for Underground Art
description:
Help Save Superchief Gallery.
Over the past few months we have made strides in building a sustainable future for the space, but we are a month away from needing to close our doors permanently. In order to avoid immediate closure, we have launched this fundraiser, and will be having several fundraising events during September. If you're able to help, it's greatly appreciated. If you can't help financially, then there are no hard feelings. Please spread the word and help us build a sustainable future for this community.
Superchief Gallery has been a vital home for underground art, emerging artists, and street culture in Los Angeles for over a decade.
The gallery has hosted hundreds of exhibitions, uplifted thousands of artists, particularly those from underrepresented communities, and built a space that is has become a vital part of LA's emerging art landscape. Counterculture, inclusivity, and community are at the heart of everything we do.
In a city where independent galleries are rapidly disappearing, Superchief has remained a sanctuary for creativity that doesn’t fit the mainstream mold.
But now,
we are facing closure.
Rising expenses, rent, and the cost of paying our staff have pushed us into debt, and without immediate support, we will not be able to stay open beyond October. Through Patreon, we’ve made it halfway toward monthly sustainability, but we need your help to bridge the gap. Every contribution goes directly toward keeping the lights on, paying staff fairly, and continuing to provide
accessible exhibitions and events, mutual aid relief for our community, educational programming, film screenings, and more.
By donating, you’re not just saving a gallery. You’re protecting a community space where art, resistance, and culture collide. Please join us in keeping Superchief alive for the artists and audiences who need it most.
labels: Wall, Visual arts, Art, Graffiti, Paint

title: Support a Devoted Mama & Herbalist Keep Her Shop Alive
description:
Support a Devoted Mama & Herbalist Keep Her Shop Alive
Dear Herbal Root Organics Family,
We’re calling on the spirit of community, reciprocity, and collective care to support someone who has poured so much of herself into healing others. Our dear friend, the founder of Herbal Root Organics, is navigating a difficult season and is in need of the same love and support she’s shared so generously over the years.
Not only is she a gifted herbalist and visionary entrepreneur, but she is also a devoted single mother who has taken incredible pride in homeschooling her children while running a business rooted in earth medicine and ancestral wisdom. Through her work with HRO, she’s touched the lives of so many—offering teas, tinctures, classes and remedies that have supported families, wombs, and whole communities with care and intention.
In addition to herbal offerings, classes, and retreats, Herbal Root Organics also serves as a beautiful, nourishing event space for the community — hosting birthday parties, bridal and baby showers, micro weddings, corporate wellness events, and more. Supporting this space means keeping a sacred container alive for celebration, connection, and healing in all its forms.
Right now, she’s in need of support to:
Sustain the shop and keep HRO’s offerings available to the community
Cover urgent living and wellness expenses as she regains her footing
Continue homeschooling and caring for her children with stability and peace
Restore, rebuild, and reignite the vision for Herbal Root Organics to not just survive but truly thrive!
This GoFundMe is not just about keeping a small business afloat—it’s about honoring a woman who has held so much with grace, and creating the conditions for her to rest, receive, and rise again.
How You Can Help:
• Donate any amount — every dollar makes a difference
• Share this campaign far and wide
• Stop by the shop to purchase herbal remedies, teas, and more — every sale helps
• Book the space for your next birthday party, shower, micro wedding, corporate event, or workshop
• Know of any grant opportunities for small businesses, women-owned businesses, single moms, or holistic healing spaces? Please reach out — we’re actively seeking sustainable funding to keep this sacred work going
Let’s uplift a mother, a healer, and a pillar of our holistic wellness community. Let’s remind her she is not alone and that the village she’s helped nurture is here to hold her too.
With love, reciprocity, and deep gratitude,
The HRO Family + Community Support Circle

title: From Garage to Dream Studio
description:
From Garage to Dream Studio ✨
Right now, I’m running powerful women’s fitness boot camps out of my tiny garage on the border of Federal Way & NE Tacoma  but my dream is so much bigger.
Hi, I’m Tamira — a mom of three, trainer, and dreamer on a mission. Years ago, I struggled with my own fitness and confidence, but transforming myself inspired me to help others feel unstoppable too. My goal is to create a modern, family-friendly fitness studio right here on the Federal Way & Tacoma border.
Right now, I run my boot camps from my garage, where I can only fit four people at a time. Some of my amazing clients bring their kids, and they play in the backyard while we train. It works for now, but when Washington’s cold and rainy season hits, I know I’ll lose families if we don’t have a safe, warm place for their kids to play while parents work out.
My dream is to build a clean, modern studio where:
• Music is pumping and the energy is electric
* There’s beautiful equipment that delivers real results
•	‍ A kids’ play area keeps families together and happy
• Everyone — moms, dads, kids, and families — walks out feeling confident, strong, and unstoppable
Your donation will help me:
• Secure a bigger, modern studio space
•	️‍♀️ Get professional-grade equipment
• Create a safe kids’ play area
• Complete my Pilates certification
•	‍‍ Build a sustainable, inclusive fitness community
Even $5 or $10 helps so much. And if you can’t donate, sharing this link means the world to me. ❤️
From garage to dream studio… here we go!

title: My Violin & iPad Broke, Please Help Me Keep Creating
description:
Hi friends and family,
For those that know me well, you may know that this year has been a huge uphill battle for me. Now, I am humbly reaching out because two of the things I rely on most for teaching and creating have both broken recently — my iPad and my favorite violin.
My iPad was water damaged and no longer works, along with my Apple Pencil. I used it every day for teaching violin lessons, drawing (which many of you know I love), making flyers, and editing music. Around a few months ago, my violin, one that I’ve loved and played for years — also broke and now needs repairs before I can use it again.
These tools aren’t just objects to me. They’re how I teach, how I share music/art, and how I stay connected to creativity. Losing them both at once has been really hard.
I know I can’t do this alone. If you’re able to contribute, it will go directly toward replacing my iPad and repairing my violin so I can keep teaching, keep drawing, and keep making music.
Thank you for reading, supporting, and caring about me and my art.
--Lys

title: Help A’Lyece’ Keep Her Bridal Studio Open
description:
Help Keep My Bridal Studio Open in Arkansas
Hello, my name is A’Lyece’, and I’m a master tailor and seamstress based in Little Rock, Arkansas. Sewing has been my passion since I was a little girl—starting at just seven years old. I spent my childhood sewing for dolls, friends, and anyone who would let me practice. I always knew this was the career I was meant for.
In high school, I dreamed of going to college for fashion design and was accepted into a program. Sadly, I couldn’t attend due to a family divorce and financial hardship. Though heartbroken, I didn’t give up. I worked part-time and enrolled in fashion classes at a community college in Minneapolis. I took every course I could afford until finances once again forced me to pause my dreams.
At 17, I moved to Arkansas alone and began honing my craft with the skills I had. A few years later, a fashion school opened nearby, and with the help of family and friends, I was able to take more classes and deepen my knowledge. Over the years, I worked in bridal shops, tailoring boutiques, and even held a management position with a major bridal corporation.
In 2017, I achieved a lifelong goal—I opened my first sewing studio. It was one of the proudest moments of my life. Unfortunately, the pandemic forced me to close, and shortly after, I was diagnosed with health issues. I moved to Philadelphia to heal and regroup. During that time, I rebranded, refined my business model, and focused on bridal tailoring—my true passion.
Despite COVID, brides still needed alterations, and I was honored to be the one they called. My time in Philadelphia taught me how to value my time, price my work appropriately, and create the luxury experience brides truly deserve.
In 2023, my children and I returned to Arkansas. I started promoting myself again, and to my surprise, my client base grew rapidly. In May, I found a beautiful space to sublease in the Argenta area, and word-of-mouth brought in at least two new clients every week.
There’s nothing more rewarding than hearing a bride say, “You saved the day,” and knowing I played a part in her happiest memories. However, bridal tailoring is a seasonal business. Without a financial cushion, the slow seasons can be extremely challenging—and that’s where I find myself now.
Despite having built a five-star reputation in the Little Rock area, and being the only highly rated bridal seamstress locally, I’m at risk of losing my space and closing my doors. This is more than just a job—it’s my purpose, my passion, and my way of serving others.
Your donation will help me:
•	Secure a new lease and stable studio space
•	Sustain operations through the slower bridal season
•	Continue offering exceptional service to brides in Arkansas
Whether it’s $10, $100, or simply sharing this campaign, your support means the world to me. Thank you for believing in my craft, my journey, and the future of my small business.
With gratitude,
A’Lyece’
labels: Chin, Head, Sleeve, Face, Forehead

title: Help Build an Affordable Living Community
description:
Hi, my name is Caleb, and I’m a U.S. Navy veteran chasing a dream I’ve held for years — opening a RV park where families, travelers, and fellow veterans can come together, relax, and feel at home on the road.
This RV park will be more than just a stop for travelers. My vision includes offering affordable living options for people who need a safe, long-term place to call home without the high cost of traditional housing.
Your support will help create:
A welcoming, family-friendly RV park
Affordable living spaces for veterans, retirees, and working families
Clean, safe sites with essential utilities and amenities
A community atmosphere that feels like home
As you can imagine, starting a project like this takes a lot of work (and funding). Every dollar raised here will go directly toward:
Securing property and preparing the land
Installing hookups, utilities, and road access
Covering permits, licensing, and startup costs
Building the foundation for a long-term, sustainable business
By contributing, you’re not just supporting a small business — you’re helping build a place that will create jobs, bring travelers into the community, and provide affordable living options for those who need them most.
Whether you donate $5, $50, or simply share this campaign, your support makes a huge difference.
Thank you for believing in me, supporting veteran-owned businesses, and helping turn this vision into reality. One day, I hope to welcome you personally to the park.
— Caleb
#VeteranOwned #SupportSmallBusiness #AffordableLiving #RVParkDream
labels: Parking, Recreational vehicle, Van, Caravan, Truck

title: Hidden Chapter
description:
Hello friends, neighbors, and fellow book lovers,
Our names are Baylie and Taylor, and we share the same dream: to create a space where stories come alive, mysteries unfold, and our community has a cozy place to gather. As two moms of two, we know the value of safe, welcoming spaces — and we want to bring one to Ogden in the form of a bookstore unlike any other.
The Vision
Hidden Chapter Bookstore will be more than a place to buy books. It will be a warm, welcoming space filled with couches, free WiFi, and shelves lined with both used and new books — with a special love for thrillers and mysteries. Beyond books, it will be a community hub:
• Weekly book clubs & poetry nights
• A safe and cozy space for college students and casual readers alike
• Events that bring people together to celebrate stories, imagination, and connection
Why It Matters
Ogden doesn’t have many bookstores that offer this kind of cozy, community vibe. We want to change that — to give our city a place where anyone can walk in, sit down, and feel at home with a story in their hands.
✨ How You Can Help
Starting a bookstore is a big adventure, and as two moms without savings, we can’t do it alone. Your donation will go directly toward:
• Leasing a location in Ogden
• Stocking shelves with both used & new books
• Creating a welcoming, cozy atmosphere with couches, plants, and warm lighting
• Hosting our very first community events
Even a small donation makes a difference — and if you can’t donate, simply sharing this campaign means the world.
A Special Thank You
Everyone who contributes will forever be part of Hidden Chapter’s story. Donors will have their names added to a special “Founders’ Wall” in the store — so each time you visit, you’ll see your name among the first people who believed in this dream.
Let’s turn the page together and create a new chapter for Ogden — one filled with books, mystery, and community.
With gratitude and excitement,
Baylie & Taylor
labels: Eyebrow, Lips, Forehead, Hairstyle, Beauty

title: Support Jessica's Vehicle Repair to Save Her Business
description:
My name is Jessica and I run an AirBnB cleaning company in Northern VT. I homeschool my 3 children as well, who travel with me to work every single day and rely on me for everything.
Yesterday, the transmission in my only vehicle blew up while we were driving down the road. We bought it less than 2 years ago at the local Ford Dealership. We had it towed to the Ford Dealership for a full diagnosis. We just got the call that they need
$15,000 to fully fix the car.
We don't have that amount of cash on hand and now
I have until Monday to lose my entire company and everything my kids rely on, or try to raise money.
We service over 30 properties and 10 different businesses in Northern VT, and our cleaning services alone bring more than $300,000 quarterly to this area of the country.
Not only that, but we use the vehicle to help others in need with food and other donations to our local food banks, as well as homeschooling 3 children in all different grades.
We are working on getting a working capital loan through small business associations, which proves difficult.
We make enough to survive, but not enough to apply for loans of this nature or amount.
Looking through the other GoFundMe stories and seeing how much people are in need is humbling. We don't expect much and we know our story isn't the most important, but it will benefit the greater Vermont area and help us continue to generate money for the people in the small communities we service.
Every dollar counts!
labels: Land vehicle, Car, Vehicle, Motor vehicle, Automotive Exterior

title: Start Mèt Tèt Designs with me!

Every bit of support makes a difference, and I deeply appreciate you being part of this journey with me.
Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
Thank you so much for believing in me and in Mèt Tèt Designs!
With gratitude and excitement, Tanayiz

title: Support Ammani Overcome this Hurdle
description:
Hey friends and family,
If you’ve received this link, it means we’re already close :). As many of you know, I’ve been on a journey of building a media business. Recently, I’ve been creating films on YouTube and growing a small but meaningful community. Even more exciting, I’m now working on scoring the soundtrack for a feature-length film! A real one with a production team, actors, director, the whole deal. Honestly, it feels surreal, but also like exactly where I’m supposed to be.
When you’re carving out a path that doesn’t have a set blueprint, you just keep showing up with what you have, trusting that today you’re a little further than yesterday.
That said, I find myself having to deal with extremely large files on a daily basis. I'm talking hundreds of gigabytes of video footage. Simply put, my current laptop (which I am super grateful for and has served me greatly) is no longer able to assist me in this line of work. Thus, my workflow is taking a hit, and in turn, so is my business. That's why I am need of a new laptop.
I am currently working while running my business which has been great to have a predictable source of income, however, living in the most expensive city in the US and having to pay a lot for immigration related expenses doesn't leave me with much. Hopefully that will change in the years to come due to my business -- good things take time! That is why I made this page. That whoever believes in my business and the fun things I get to do, is able to spur me on in this journey.
All in all, I'm grateful to even be fortunate enough to have a problem of this nature, as it definitely is a testament to how much GOD can do when you are faithful with the little.
Anyway, if you do come across this link but are not able to donate, please pray. Not just for the laptop, but also that I don't get lost in the sauce while doing something I truly love, and that I be reminded that it's the LORD who gives and He that takes away.
Thank & love you all,
Ammani :)
P.S.
The YouTube video I linked is for anyone who is curious about what I've been up to on yt. Super fun stuff! Hope you enjoy.

title: Run 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
I met my best friend, Ann, in early 2020 when we were both studying abroad in Spain. We were instantly great friends; going out to eat together, studying together, traveling and going to events. In March, the global pandemic started and both of us flew together back to the US. I lived on the east coast, while Ann lived on the west, and we couldn't visit each other during this time, but our friendship still grew strong.
Ann is one of the kindest people I know, and maintaining a long distance friendship has been so wonderful.
In August of 2022, I received a devastating text from Ann that she was in the hospital and that the doctors had found a large tumor on her liver. She ended up staying in the hospital for several weeks before they discharged her. She was diagnosed with Stage 4 Neuroendocrine Carcinoma at 22 years old.
It was heart wrenching to find out. I thought back on the times we were running up the hills in Granada, or when we were sitting in classes together. It was possible that the whole time I knew her, this evil disease was growing inside her.
Today, Ann has undergone numerous surgeries, multiple rounds of radiation, countless rounds of chemotherapy, and now immunotherapy too. I look at her with an unthinkable level of admiration, she is so strong.  Through all the pain, depression, and complicated questions, she has never changed how kind and friendly she is.
I will never know how I got so lucky had been placed in the same class as Ann back in 2020, but I will forever be grateful that it happened.
In October, I've vowed to run 100 miles, and fundraise for cancer research with ACS. We will not stop fighting until we are without cancer in this world.
Please consider making a donation, every small bit counts in our fight!

title: Help Us Build Ozone Indoor Playground !!!!
description:
Help Us Build Ozone Indoor Playground & Party Station in Orlando!
✨ A safe, fun, and affordable play space for families in our community
Hello, my name is Shameka Wyatt, a preschool director/VPK teacher and mom and together with my husband Eugene, we are bringing my lifelong dream to life: Ozone Indoor Playground & Party Station in Orlando, Florida!
Our mission is simple but powerful: to create a welcoming, safe, and fun environment where children can play safely, learn through exploration, and celebrate milestones, while parents connect and breathe.
Why We Need Your Help
We’ve already taken huge steps:
•	Filed our LLC and secured our business name.
•	Identified a great location right here in Orlando.
•	Invested our own funds and gathered support from family and friends.
•	Designed a space that will include open play areas, party rooms, and a small snack station.
But to open our doors, we need help covering startup costs like:
•	Facility rent and deposit
•	Light renovations & build-out
•	Furniture (tables, couches, seating)
•	Play equipment & toys
•	Marketing & signage
Our goal is to raise $10,000 through this GoFundMe campaign. This will help us cover those essential startup costs so we can open the doors to Ozone and welcome our community in!
________________________________________
The Impact of Ozone
Ozone will be more than just a playground:
•	It will be a safe, indoor environment for kids to play and parents to relax.
•	A party station for birthdays and celebrations that families can afford.
•	A community hub where children develop social, emotional, and physical skills — through the power of play.
As a preschool director and VPK teacher, I’ve seen firsthand how important play is for young children’s growth. I want to give Orlando families a place where play, joy, and community connection come first.
________________________________________
How You Can Help
•	Donate what you can — every dollar brings us closer to opening day.
•	Share this campaign with friends, family, and neighbors — spreading the word is just as valuable as donating.
•	Every gift matters. If you can’t donate, please share this page with your friends, church, and parent groups.
Donors of $100+ will be recognized on our Founding Families Wall inside Ozone—forever part of our story.
________________________________________
Thank You
Starting a business is never easy, but with your help, we can bring Ozone Indoor Playground & Party Station to life and create a space full of laughter, love, and community spirit.
Thank you for believing in our dream and for helping us build something Orlando families will treasure.
With gratitude,
Shameka & Eugene
Founders, Ozone Indoor Playground & Party Station
***Disclaimer- The pictures listed in the profile are only to show an example of the type of structure we are aiming for-That is not our facility****
labels: Graphic design, Graphics

title: Save Kids Can Be Kids in Fernandina Beach
description:
Help Us Keep Kids Moving and Having Fun!
Hi everyone,
We are two personal trainers who share a passion for helping kids stay active, healthy, and confident. Earlier this year, we poured our hearts (and savings) into opening
Kids Can Be Kids
, an indoor playground in Fernandina Beach for children ages 1-7. It’s a safe, fun, and monitored space where little ones can run, climb, and play while building coordination and confidence.
We dreamed of creating a place where young children could move their bodies, and just be kids. Since opening, the smiles and excitement we see every day remind us why this place matters so much. We’re honored that
Kids Can Be Kids
was voted one of the Best New Businesses in Fernandina Beach, and this is truly a passion project for us.
But as many small businesses know, the early days are tough. Between start-up costs, rent, equipment and insurance, we’ve hit a financial roadblock that threatens our ability to keep the doors open. We are working tirelessly to grow, spread the word, and serve more families—but right now, we need a little help from our community to keep going.
Your donation will help us keep our doors open to families in Fernandina Beach and continue to create new activities and events for the kids to enjoy.
Every dollar makes a difference. If you can’t give financially, sharing our campaign helps more than you know.
We sincerely thank you for believing in us and supporting a space where kids can truly be kids.
With gratitude,
Dana and Donato

title: Save Our Amazon Business: $75K Inventory Illegally Dumped!
description:
Need temporary support until settled. The property manager had
no legal right
to withhold & dispose of our $75,000* worth of inventory (see pics), plus personal items that were in a warehouse of a friend who got locked out/evicted.
Texas Property Code Sec. 54.021. LIEN. A person who leases or rents all or part of a building for nonresidential use has a preference
lien on the property of the tenant or subtenant
in the building for rent. (We were neither).
Texas law is 100% on our side, it is only a matter of time and we need help financially to bridge us until then.
Despite telling us that they would let us get our things even if he got locked out. When I would inquire about when can we get our inventory I would be told they will let me know when a good time is but the PM would never get back to me. They held it for months, knowing we needed it & watched as we fell farther behind. Eventually claiming they were "disposing" it all without notice, nearly destroying our small business.
I am open to all types of creative ideas/offers of help you may have to get us through this until things are settled.
Current goal is,
$3,000 Place to Live.
$1,000 to get storage units and move out the inventory we have left in our office-warehouse.
$1,,000.Legal assistance.
This situation is fixable.
If you can not donate, please share with Houston news sites
like KPRC, Houston Chronicle, or Texas Tribune, and groups like
Texas Tenants Union or Texas Small Business Association
to expose this injustice. Your support fights property manager abuses in Texas!
"
You shouldn't have stored it in another space where the tenant defaulted because we own the items now"
Property Manager.
- Texas law clearly states that landlords only have the right to tenant's property.
Texas Property Code §54.021 creates a statutory landlord's lien on a
tenant's personal property
in a nonresidential building to secure payment of rent.
Our property is consider
third party personal property
aka
non-tenant property
. The only exceptions are abandonment or if the third party signs over the property. We did neither.
-
By withholding such a large percentage of our inventory serious damage was done to the business. It is only a matter of time before we're right back on track. We just need some temporary help.
The 2 pics with trailers full of boxes is the inventory they "disposed" of at waste management according to the workers. There was also a "dump" trailer that was filled with what most would think of as traditional garbage. Plus some personal items, unopened mail, business records, etc. were taken during clean out. Our cost was approximately $20,000 - $75,000 plus retail. A significant amount was collectible. (Are you wondering why the product wasn't auctioned off? So are we).
We need to raise funding to
bridge us until
we can
recover damages for lost inventory & interfering with our business.
It will be used to hire an attorney, get storage/U-Haul/help to get the rest of our
inventory out of the unit we rent before that is also lost
&
to prevent eviction from home. We fear more will be lost if we don't remove it quickly. We can still save our business.
Since my girlfriend had a stroke 9 years ago,
this business has been how I paid all the bills.
It was my full time job, my career, my retirement. It’s been my only source of income all these years. With sales of over 2.5 million dollars.
Everything with this business is fixable.
It isn't failing because of mismanagement, the economy or trends. We still have a significant amount of inventory if we can save it.
We had inventory in our friend's office warehouse space across from our own office warehouse space. He was struggling to pay his rent. When I spoke with the property manager, we discussed the possibility of him being locked out of his space. I mentioned that I knew he was hoping to find a way to catch up. We both hoped he would. The property manager was aware I had inventory in the space & we sold it online. My friend was a semi-retired mechanic, our items were clearly distinct. I asked the property manager if I needed to remove my inventory before a potential lockout or if I could retrieve it afterward, as we needed it for sales. Adding we needed access to it we couldn't afford on wait 30 or 60 days.
The PM assured me that if he gets locked out, we could make arrangements for me to retrieve it.
My concern was NEVER about permanently losing the inventory. However, I was worried about having to wait an extended period of time to eventually access inventory. -
She knew the inventory was ours.
That we needed to sell.
Wanted it.
She also knew we were prepared to remove it ASAP beforehand if needed.
- A few weeks later he was locked out, I asked the property manager to set up a time, as we needed our inventory, and the property manager would say, "I will let you know." (
In Texas, a commercial landlord has no legal right to permanently keep or seize property belonging to a third party, non tenant property.
) The property manager did say that someone had to be present the entire time to ensure we didn't take anything that didn't belong to us. We discussed how long it would take me, and it would likely be a Saturday. I even suggested that I could set all our inventory right in front of the building and move it from there, instead of loading it up, taking it somewhere, and coming back for more. That way, whoever was supervising wouldn't be "stuck" there longer. The property manager never got back to us.
The property manager watched as we fell behind on our rent
. The PM then used it as an excuse to continue to withhold our inventory. After another request to retrieve our inventory the PM would allow us to retrieve our inventory
if we caught up on rent.
The PM also went on to say they could change the locks on the door anytime because we were behind. (Lockout)
As you can see this new condition & the threat of all our inventory being withheld put us in a tough & stressful position. I never agreed to the condition of paying back rent to get inventory but at that point feared argument could lead to immediate lockout.
We came close a couple of times on catching up on the rent but never recovered.
The "NEW" condition of catch up on the rent to get our inventory is even legal.
-
However, without providing any notice,
they disposed of over $75,000 worth of our inventory,
(this is a conservative estimate of the value) the withholding of the inventory & now this has caused our small business to collapse. I had been pursuing investors & the huge inventory we had was one of the biggest assets to attract them.
We only knew that they were taking away our inventory because several neighbors let us know.
Most of the property was business related. Some of the property was personal, including collectibles. It also included over
200 pieces of unopened mail -packages
(USPS, Amazon & UPS) as well as old business records and bank statements we had stored.
When I contacted the property manager as they were removing my things, I was told,
We had a deal, catch up on the rent and you could have your things & you shouldn’t have left your stuff in a unit where the tenant defaulted. It’s our property now.
We never made a deal.
See above.
We never would have gotten so far behind if PM didn't withhold our inventory. Both of the reasons she gave for withholding our property are not legal by Texas law. Plus she said before the lockout she would let us retrieve our things if it did happen.
I called the police but they said it was a civil matter. I tried to explained why it was not a civil matter anymore. I explained that I did not have a tenant/landlord relationship with the unit that defaulted. The landlord never had any right to keep non-tenant property, etc. Concluding they (the contractor & worker) are claiming they are taking it to the dump. Something isn't right here. They should at least be trying to sell it to recover back rent? The officer tried to explain to me again that this was a civil case. I told the police officer these people are taking my property and I don't even know who they are. He never even attempted to ask the contractors any questions or request to speak to the property manager.
A significant amount of the property was collectibles, so the total value will be higher than $75,000. Most of the boxes you see on the trailers cost $70 to $250 per box just to give you an idea of how much we paid, how big the loss is. The retail value/lost is considerably more.
The attorney I’ve spoken with is confident we will be compensated — but that will likely take a few months. We urgently need help to bridge the business, etc, until I can get back on track.
My house landlord also owns some commercial properties and is familiar with third-party property laws. She tried speaking to the property manager on the phone but was unsuccessful, as she couldn’t get a word in after the initial few seconds. She did help with getting some things out of our current warehouse, securing storage units, renting a U-Haul, and providing some assistance to move about half of what was left in our warehouse.
We have video of everything provided by neighbors, we have witnesses to our things being stored in there, we have video of the company employees saying it was all going to trash. Even though they were clearly separating it.
I have found many people mix-up laws regarding "storage units" with other rental property laws. There is a section of law dedicated to storage units in Texas. Even then the landlord doesn't have the right to keep third party property.
I’ll post more details soon, please share. Today I need to meet with people about selling my washer/dryer and dining room set. God Bless All of Those who read this far.

title: Support Micah Simpson's Vision for JUIICED and her Community
description:
Help JUIICED Build Generational Health in Detroit!
Hello, my name is Micah Simpson, and I am the founder of JUIICED, a home-based juice and wellness business in Detroit, MI.
JUIICED was unexpectedly born from a passion for holistic health, wellness, and community empowerment that people saw in me before I saw it in myself. Our mission is simple but powerful: to build generational health through
educating
the elders,
inspiring
adults, and
introducing
youth to preventive care through natural, plant-based solutions. Basically,
bridging the gap between generations to create a legacy of health and wellness.
Right now, JUIICED offers cold-pressed juices, detox packages, herbal teas, and sea moss gel. We also have some digital wellness products that will be available soon! But this is just the beginning. With your support, I can take the next important steps to scale and position JUIICED for long-term success.
Why I’m Raising $3,500
The funds from this campaign will directly support essential business scaling needs, including:
- Registering JUIICED as an LLC (to establish credibility and protect the business)
- Securing food and beverage liability insurance (to safely serve my community)
- Hiring a legal team (to handle contracts, compliance, and future growth)
- Investing in branding and online presence:
• Professional logo, labels, and social media templates
• Updating and upgrading my Square website
• Professional photos and videos to showcase our products and mission
Why This Matters
This first phase of growth will help JUIICED become more than just a home-based business. It will position us to expand into community partnerships, health workshops, and—eventually—a mobile juice truck serving Detroit with affordable, natural wellness.
Your contribution will help lay the foundation for JUIICED to:
Provide healthier options in underserved communities
Create local jobs in Detroit
Educate families about preventive health across generations
How You Can Help
•
Donate
to this campaign—every dollar brings us closer to our $3,500 goal
•
Share
this story with friends, family, or anyone passionate about health and community wellness
•
Follow
our journey on Instagram
(@JUIICEDGREENS)
to watch us grow
Thank You
By supporting JUIICED, you’re not just funding a business—you’re helping build a legacy of generational health in Detroit and beyond.
Together, we can make wellness accessible, fun, and sustainable for every family.
With much gratitude,
Micah Simpson
Founder of JUIICED
“Building Generational Health, One Sip at a Time.”

title: Support John Bertucci's Dream at Baton Rouge Book Fair
description:
Help a New Orleans Author Shine at the Baton Rouge Book Fair!
Goal : $2,500
Story : Hi, I’m John Bertucci, a 66-year-old New Orleans native and aspiring writer. For 25 years, I worked in TV, crafting over 1,000 commercials and shows as a producer and AVID editor, starting as a radio announcer at 21 in Port Sulphur. After Hurricane Katrina upended my life, I pivoted to IT, managing networks for three Louisiana casinos for 13 years. Last August, I lost my job, and now, on Social Security.
Living modestly in a Baton Rouge apartment with my wife, Maria, whom I recently married, I’m chasing a dream inspired by reading over 280 books-every Sherlock Holmes mystery by Conan Doyle and 22 thrillers by Michael Crichton.
Over the past decade, I’ve written 12 novels, including , a thriller with 25 stories of Hercules the cat and Squealer the parrot solving crimes in New Orleans’ French Quarter and beyond, hitting Amazon this month with Palmetto Publishing. I’m also looking to promote my latest novel, The Bootlegger’s Cousin, a 116,000 word Sicilian saga of whiskey runners from 1905 to 1992 based on my grandmother’s life and her passionate stories. I’ve poured my heart into these stories, drawing from my New Orleans Sicilian American roots and my love for suspense and big ideas.
Now, I’m headed to the Louisiana Book Festival on November 1, 2025, to share them with 20,000 visitors. I’ve reserved a minibooth and need $1,400 for 100 copies of The Bootlegger’s Cousin to sell, plus $700 for signs, bookmarks, and travel. That’s $2,500-my whole monthly SSI budget.
I've always gone it alone, but now I need your help to make this dream real, reaching out to my family, friends, and fans to make this happen. Your support will bring Hercules, Squealer, and my Sicilian heroes to mystery lovers and locals.
If we raise more than $2,500, I’ll publish The Bootlegger’s Cousin professionally to share its gritty tale worldwide. Every dollar helps me live my dream-thank you!
AVAILABLE SOON ON
www.jdbcreation.com
My Novels :
My Life With Amazing Animals
The French Quarter Connection
The French Quarter Connection: The EMP Heist
The Travellers
Night Hawks
Night Hawks: Exodus
The Prince and the Dreamer
Vatican on the Bayou
The Dream Maker
The Last Hope
Where Evil Lurks: The Man in Plaid
The Bootlegger’s Cousin
The Enforcer
About the Author
John Bertucci, a former television engineer, sports and show producer for 25 years in the city of New Orleans, worked for TV stations and a worldwide ministry. He crafted over 1000 commercials, promotions and programs. He also served as an A VID editor for many of those years
in TV production. He started his career at age 21 as a radio announcer at KAGY in Port Sulphur, La, graduated from the university of New Orleans in 1984 was married twice and has four children. After his television career, he married a third time and worked in the IT world as a network administrator for three Louisiana casinos for thirteen years. John has two grown sons living in Baton Rouge and a son in North Carolina. His daughter Jessica, is a Television Show Producer in New York City, and he has one grandchild named Rowen. John resides in Baton Rouge with his wife.
The Enforcer, my new book is nearly finished and will be available on my website in September.  It’s a gritty action back gangster thriller with cinematic scenes from the 1930s-1950s.
Note: No promotions or giveaways are offered in exchange for any donation made here in this GoFundMe.

title: Building Cafe 29:11: Serving Purpose on Wheels
description:
Cafe 29:11 is more than just a mobile cafe, it's a mission on wheels and true calling of mine. Inspired by Jeremiah 29:11, my vision is to create a welcoming space that serves purpose as much as it serves coffee. I want to reach underserved communities, offering a place where people feel seen, loved, and supported. By operating from a custom-designed mobile unit, I can bring exceptional hospitality, signature specialty beverages, and grab-and-go breakfast items directly to neighborhoods and local events that need it most. Every menu item is thoughtfully crafted, with delicious and healthy choices, and each drink or treat is named after a Biblical figure, adding a unique and meaningful touch to every order.
The funds raised will help me purchase and build out the mobile unit and equip it with everything needed to serve the community. But this fundraiser is about more than just startup costs. My goal is to use Cafe 29:11 as a platform for mission work, traveling to different areas, building authentic relationships, and supporting efforts to save human trafficked children. I want to create real change, one cup at a time, and help build stronger, more connected communities wherever I go.
With your support, Cafe 29:11 can become a beacon of hope and connection, serving both body and soul. Every contribution brings us closer to making this vision a reality and reaching those who need it most.

title: Help Kelly Rebuild Her Makeup Kit
description:
Hi everyone,
I’m heartbroken to share that my car was recently broken into and everything I use for work as a makeup artist was stolen. Thousands of dollars’ worth of makeup, tools, brushes, and hair equipment — all gone in a matter of minutes.
This wasn’t just makeup. It was my entire professional kit that I’ve built up over the years through hard work, long hours, and personal sacrifice. Every product and tool in that kit helped me serve my clients, create beautiful looks, and support myself doing what I love. I am a single mother of 2 kids ,  this loss is devastating. Insurance won’t cover the full cost and without my tools I can’t work. I’m doing my best to stay strong and hopeful but I really need help to rebuild.
I’ve created this GoFundMe in hopes of raising enough to replace what was taken so I can get back to doing what I love, making people feel confident and beautiful.
If you’re able to donate I can’t thank you enough. And even if you can’t give, sharing this link would mean so much to me.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your kindness and support.
With love,
kelly Glaze
kg beauty!

title: Bridging Cultures, Building Futures Kameoka Japans Youth Hub
description:
Hello, we are the Sharpe family! My name is Matthew, and I will be sharing our vision with you!
For several years, my wife, Brittany, and I have cultivated a deep love for Japanese culture. What began as a typical appreciation for Japanese anime blossomed into a lifelong cultural learning experience, encompassing its rich history, diverse traditions, and incredible food. Over the years, our daughter too has come to enjoy most things Japanese with a desire to learn more. We've consistently been a community-focused family, whether volunteering for our local Homeowner's Association and PTA, coaching youth in Odyssey of the Mind, participating in 4-H and youth clubs, or hosting foreign exchange students, my philosophy has always been that "it takes a village.” I've found immense reward in watching young people's curiosity, creativity, and intelligence develop, and it was with this deep-seated belief that the idea for a youth hub first took root.
During a recent trip to Kameoka, we met with several locals to learn more about the community. We were able to confirm a clear need for additional youth resources, from English teachers to dedicated youth spaces. This trip to Kameoka solidified our resolve to open a business and move there, and it was there that we found what could only be described as the door to the perfect opportunity awaiting us to enter, which brings us to this exciting endeavor: to establish a meaningful commercial space that not only serves a business purpose but also deeply enriches the community we've come to admire so much.
Part 1: The Kameoka Youth Hub & English School – An Affordable Community Haven
We are deeply committed to providing a vital community space within Kameoka. We've observed a significant need for a consistent, safe, and fun environment where young people can gather, learn, and grow outside of school or home, alongside a strong desire for English language education. This hub will be an accessible option for Kameoka's youth, designed to be more than just a place to pass time. You will find a dedicated space for youths to socialize over board games, challenge each other with video games, simply chat with friends, get lost in a book with dedicated reading corners, or utilize quiet, focused study spaces for homework and tutoring. Complementing these recreational and study areas, we will establish an “Eikawa” - English Conversation School. This school will offer affordable, engaging English classes for all ages, from children to adults, taught by native English speakers (Matthew and Brittany, with other qualified instructors potentially in the future). We believe providing an accessible and fun environment for English learning will significantly benefit the community, empowering individuals with crucial language skills for global communication and future opportunities. Our goal is to focus on a lifelong passion for English communication and community, not just passing or cramming for the next exam.
Most homes in Japan are built small and compact with limited spaces for focused studying. Libraries are limited by hours and capacity, further limiting options for students. This hub and English school will foster a strong sense of community by offering much-needed recreational options, dedicated study areas, and essential English language education by providing a crucial alternative. We are thrilled to contribute positively to Kameoka by offering this much-needed, safe, and supportive space.
Part 2: Our Vision for a Storefront.
In order to help support this space, our secondary business will be a storefront. Currently, we are exploring several different opportunities to sell prepackaged snacks and beverages.
The Property
Location was a critical factor in our search. We prioritized a venue easily accessible to students, close to schools and residential areas. The former bakery we found is an exceptional fit, located just a three-minute walk from the Junior High and Elementary Schools on the same street, and only one street away from the High School. Additionally, the main library is a quick six-minute stroll from the site.
This location was previously a bakery that operated for several years before going into bankruptcy in 2022. The owner, well-respected in the community, actively participated in efforts to revitalize this area of Kameoka during the city's H Street Initiative, offering baking classes and other events from the bakery. Unfortunately, the H Street Initiative declined as quickly as it began due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and decreased demand for bakery goods led to the store's closure.
A story and idea alone is not proof that this will work, and while proximity to educational institutions is a significant advantage, assessing pedestrian traffic was also important. Our recent observations confirmed nearly every elementary and junior high school student passes directly by this building!
This property also provides flexibility. With a diverse layout, there are several options to expand and diversify in order to meet the growing needs of the surrounding community. With an attached warehouse, we could include additional resources such as cooking, crafting, or other culturally significant activities and events such as indigo dyeing and bamboo craftsmanship from local business owners.
All the pieces were lining up except the one that brings us to this GoFundMe initiative: cost.
Goal
Our goal is to raise at least $100,000. The property itself is listed at $300,000. This amount does not include any renovations, start-up costs, not to mention the personal expense of our families relocation to Japan. This large price tag for the property is our biggest obstacle to realizing our dream and why we are reaching out to you for help.
This, though, is not us expecting money to appear from all corners of the world. With the old saying of “no risk, no reward”, we are also preparing to take the necessary risks to make this dream come true. We will be uprooting ourselves from our friends and family, life-long careers, and cashing in our chips, to include our house of 10 years and a substantial amount of our personal property, in order to help fund this.
My Promise to You
My grandfather was a great man that instilled the value of being a gentleman and being true to one’s word. He would often tell me, “Matthew, a man is only as good as his word”, and that is something that I built my reputation and my life on. My promise to you is that funds donated to this GoFundMe campaign will only be used for the purpose of purchasing or renting and renovating a property for this business venture. If for whatever reason a property is unobtainable and the business is unable to move forward, funds left in the account will be donated to a reputable charity or charities that will be determined at the time of dissolving.
Additionally, as we go through this adventure, we will provide updates and pictures on progress from purchase to renovation and ultimately grand opening! These will be through the GoFundMe campaign or links provided to the social media accounts created as we progress!
Thank you
If you have managed to read this far, firstly, I am truly grateful you have taken the time to listen to our story and understand our vision. The smallest contribution to this endeavor is never too small, and while $100,000 may seem like a large sum, small contributions build fast! If you have contributed, THANK YOU!

title: DONATE TO TRAIL'S EDGE CAFÉ'S NEW JOURNEY
description:

title: Help Kona Ice Riverside rebuild after a tragic fire.
description:
On behalf of our Kona Ice Riverside family, we’re reaching out to our Kona community during an incredibly difficult time. A tragic fire recently destroyed their commissary, taking with it nearly everything they've built over the last 13+ years. They lost 4 of their 5 Kona Ice trucks, their brand-new Travelin’ Tom’s Coffee truck, and all of their essential supplies—jugs, cups, flavors, and equipment for both businesses.
As a result, they've had no choice but to lay off their entire team of 7 dedicated employees, many of whom have been with them for years. It's devastating to say goodbye to them, even temporarily.
The Wood family have proudly served over 8 communities, partnered with schools, cities, hospitals, churches, and nonprofits—and have given back thousands of dollars to local schools and causes. Now, we humbly ask for your help as they work to rebuild.
Your donation will help the Wood Family cover:
Final paychecks for their amazing staff
Emergency commissary and storage costs
Royalties and franchise fees
Replacement supplies and equipment
Unexpected expenses caused by the fire
Every dollar brings our fellow Z closer to getting back on the road, supporting their team, and continuing the mission we all love—bringing joy to our community one Kona at a time.
Thank you for your kindness, generosity, and support during this time.
With gratitude,
Team Wood!
labels: Scrap, Rust, Traffic collision

title: Help us build Tawney Coffee's first home
description:
Hi, my name is Darla, and I’m the proud founder of Tawney Coffee, a small family-run coffee business born right here in Brighton Park, Chicago.
Back in 2024, my younger brother (just 14 years old!) and I started this journey selling coffee going door to door with just two thermos of coffee and a big dream. With hard work, love for our community, and support from neighbors like you, we transformed a mobile coffee setup in our car into something truly meaningful.
Now, we’re ready to take the next big step—and we need your help to make it happen!
We’re opening our very first physical coffee shop at 3055 W. Pope John Paul II Dr., right here in our neighborhood.
But like many local entrepreneurs, we’re facing financial challenges to bring this dream to life.
Your support will help us:
-Remodel the space (bathroom, sink, refrigeration)
-Create a cozy, welcoming space for the community
Tawney Coffee is more than just coffee. It’s family, youth, culture, and connection.We want to create a space where everyone—students, workers, neighbors and friends—can gather and feel at home.
Every donation—big or small—brings us one step closer to opening our doors.
Donate what you can
Share this campaign with friends and on social media
Follow us on Instagram [@
TawneyCoffee
] to see our progress
This isn't just another coffee shop, it is a project dedicated to serve our community.
Thank you for helping us create something special in Brighton Park!
With love and gratitude,
Darla , Christian & the Tawney Coffee Family ☕

title: Support LR$ in Restoring her DJ Equipment
description:
Hiiiii everyone! I am a firm believer in working hard to get what you want out of life, and that is exactly how I live. I am writing this from my purple heart. I never thought I’d be here, asking for help, but unfortunately,
someone stole my speaker, stand, and DJ controller from my storage room in my apartment building.
As we all know,
this is my livelihood.
Words can’t even describe how I feel right now. It’s honestly indescribable, but I have to write something.
I am deeply hurt, enraged, shocked, and feel sick to my stomach. I am reaching out to my supporters for this one. It’s hard because I don’t ask for anything, but today I absolutely am.
Please, if you can, share this!
I’m a woman who works hard for everything I have. I will not let this experience stop me from doing what I love the most. I cannot give up!
To all my supporters, your love never goes unnoticed. Anything helps. I love you!
Love,
Jas AKA lilratchetsoul
labels: Entertainment, Performing Arts, Performance, Event, Audio equipment

title: From the Ashes to a New Beginning: Crispy Healthy Snacks
description:
Gracias por tantos años de apoyo.
Nuestro food truck se incendió y lo perdimos todo, pero no nuestras ganas de emprender.
Ya había comenzado a trabajar en un nuevo proyecto llamado Crispy Healthy, donde creamos snacks de frutas y vegetales deshidratados: una opción rica, nutritiva y diferente. Incluso ya tenemos una página en Instagram @crispyhealthy y algunos equipos básicos para empezar.
Con tu ayuda quiero dar el siguiente paso y transformar esta pérdida en una oportunidad de crecimiento.
¿Para qué es tu ayuda?
Completar los equipos necesarios (deshidratador, selladora, empaques).
Comprar frutas, vegetales e insumos para la primera producción.
Diseñar empaques y fotos de producto para ventas online.
Licencias, registros y material de marca.
Meta: $10,000 para arrancar con fuerza y cubrir lo esencial.
Prometo transparencia: compartiré avances semanales, fotos del proceso y pruebas de producto. Cada aporte, grande o pequeño, será clave para levantarme y sacar adelante Crispy Healthy.
Gracias de corazón por tanto cariño y por apoyarme en este nuevo comienzo.
Tony Rivera
Thank you for so many years of support.
Our food truck burned down, but not our will to keep building.
I had already started a new project called Crispy Healthy, creating dehydrated fruit & veggie snacks—a tasty, healthy, and different option. We even launched our Instagram @crispyhealthy and already have some basic equipment to get started.
With your help, I want to take the next step and turn this loss into an opportunity to grow.
How funds will be used:
Complete necessary equipment (dehydrator, sealer, packaging).
Purchase fruits, veggies, and supplies for the first production run.
Design packaging and product photos for online sales.
Licenses, registrations, and branding materials.
Goal: $10,000 to launch strongly and cover essentials.
I promise transparency: I’ll share weekly updates, photos of the process, and first product trials. Every contribution, big or small, will be key to helping Crispy Healthy come to life.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for standing by me in this new beginning.
Tony Rivera
labels: Facial hair, Chin, Beard, Cheek, Eyebrow

title: Help Christie Helene Rebuild After Fire
description:
For over 35 years, Christie Helene has been a cherished part of the community, creating custom baptism and communion dresses, one-of-a-kind gowns, and beautiful headpieces for families marking life’s most meaningful moments. The factory, led by Mary Jane Tomasino and her staff, has always focused on making each piece special, working closely with families to design unique garments that become treasured keepsakes.
Recently, a devastating fire destroyed the entire building, along with all inventory and pre-made clothing. The loss has been overwhelming, not just for the owner, but for the workers and the families who rely on Christie Helene for their special occasions. Every dress and headpiece represented hours of careful craftsmanship and love, and seeing it all lost in an instant has been heartbreaking.
This fundraiser is to help try and continue the 2025-2026 season, replace lost inventory, and support the team as they work to recover. Community support will help Christie Helene continue its tradition of creating meaningful garments for families and ensure that the business can keep serving the community for many more years. Every contribution brings them one step closer to reopening their doors and bringing joy back to the families they serve.

title: Save Stella’s
description:
Help Keep Stella’s Alive
Stella’s Restaurant & Bar has been part of the heartbeat of Battle Lake and Fergus Falls for years — a place for great food, live music, laughter, and community. We’ve been through a lot: a fire in 2019, the pandemic, and missed relief funding that others received. Each setback left a mark, and we’ve worked hard to adapt, keep people employed, and continue serving our towns.
We are raising funds to cover legitimate, disclosed business needs, including:
Operating expenses (payroll, supplies, utilities)
Debt reduction from the fire and pandemic years
Compliance requirements necessary to operate fully — including resolving the issues that currently prevent us from serving alcohol
Improvements to sustain both locations for the future
Every dollar will go toward keeping Stella’s open, compliant, and ready to serve our community for years to come. This is not about bypassing the law — it’s about meeting it head-on and doing what’s needed to get there.
Your support means we can keep our staff employed, keep our doors open, and preserve a place that has brought so many people together. Whether you give $5 or $500, you’re part of Stella’s story.
Thank you for believing in us.
labels: Smile, Hair, Eyebrow, Lips, Skin

title: Help the Historic Vernon Plaza Theater Upgrade their Seats
description:
The show must go on! From 3-D innovation to community cornerstone, help us write the next chapter of the Vernon Plaza Theater. Since opening in 1953, the Vernon Plaza Theater has been a landmark of Texas cinema, built on the historic site of the Vernon Opera House. It made history as the state's first theater built to show 3-D movies. Though it fell into disrepair, it was rescued and revived by committed owners over the years.
Now, after nearly 20 years of dedicated family operation. Elezabeth, the owner’s niece, and her family need your help to continue this tradition, but help is needed to keep the legacy alive.
We need to raise $10,000 to purchase new theater chairs
and provide a more comfortable experience for our community. Join us in this new chapter and ensure this historic gem continues to shine brightly in Vernon, TX.
Your generosity is deeply appreciated. Your donations will be directly allocated to the two companies we are collaborating with for the purchase and shipping of the chairs from North Carolina to Texas. Any additional money raised beyond the initial $10,000 will be dedicated to the installation of the new chairs.
No raffles, sweepstakes, giveaways, or returns on investment are offered in exchange for any donations made to this GoFundMe.
labels: Eyewear, Glasses, Vision Care, Eyebrow, Lips

title: Fire to Fight: Help Henry Heal and Rebuild
description:
Hi Everyone,
My brother Henry was recently in a serious car accident, and while it's hard to even put into words, we are so incredibly lucky and grateful that he is still with us today. The difference between life and death came down to one minute and the absolute will to live.
Over the weekend Henry’s truck crashed and caught fire. Henry’s leg was was pinned in the crash and by the grace of god the window smashed out in the crash and he was able to free his leg and pull himself from his rapidly burning truck. Henry has a long road ahead of him physically, emotionally, and financially.
Henry sustained most of his injuries to his right leg. He suffered a dislocated hip and an acetabular fracture (a break in the socket portion of the hip joint), along with deep cuts and heavy bruising. The pain and recovery ahead are significant, and he’ll need time, support, and physical therapy to heal and regain his mobility.
Most people who know him know how hard he’s worked to build something of his own. He recently started his own small business, HM Home Improvement, and was gaining real momentum doing what he loves.
But as a contractor, his tools are everything — and nearly all of them were in the back of his truck when it burned. Watching that go up in flames wasn’t just devastating emotionally; it also wiped out his ability to work and earn an income.
We're asking for help to get Henry back on his feet. To help replace the tools he lost, cover some of the medical and recovery expenses, and give him a fighting chance to keep building the business and life he’s worked so hard for.
Thank you so much for reading, sharing, and supporting. Every donation, share, and kind message truly makes a difference.
Sincerely,
The Milder Kids
labels: Patient, Medical, Medical equipment, Hospital bed, Health Care

title: Cycle 300 Miles for American Cancer Society
description: I'm cycling 300 miles to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer. This is a very meaningful cause for me. ACS has a platinum rating on GuideStar (the highest possible), so give with confidence! Please consider making a donation because every little bit helps. Thank you for your support!

title: The marathon continues
description:
✨ Big Announcement ✨
It’s never too late. Your journey ends at death. So as long as you have breath, will, and mobility, you can do whatever you want and need to do for your happiness (as long as it doesn’t hurt you or anybody else in the process).
So this journey is beginning.
I have officially graduated from cosmetology school
‍♀️ and I’m getting ready to start this next chapter in the salon. It’s such an exciting step, but also a little overwhelming because starting out means I need to invest in the right professional tools. The school tools are for mannequins and practice.
I’ve been doing my research and one of the most important things I need is a quality hairdryer that can handle all hair types—especially coarse, curly, and textured hair—without causing damage. Since I’m not working just yet,
I’m reaching out for a little support
. There are about 4 most talked about hairdryers and the one that makes more sense to me is the Dyson Supersonic Hairdryer.
If you’d like to support me on this journey, I’d appreciate it. Every bit of help means so much as I step into my new career. Thank you all for supporting me through school and now into this exciting new beginning! ✂️✨
labels: Happiness, Facial expression, News, Laughter, Photo caption

title: Equip Coach India to Transform Lives Through Fitness
description:
Hi everyone!
I'm sure some might never imagine me, a 5'1" woman once stuck at 100 pounds, stepping into the role of personal trainer.
But after being laid off from a stable WFH job in 2024, I'm no stranger to life revealing new paths I didn’t know I’d love.
My fitness story:
I started going to the gym with my mom at 13, but it wasn’t until after my teen years that fitness truly clicked for me. But year after year, finding an affordable gym, or a gym that wasn't always packed and equipment always in use, felt impossible for me to continue being consistent.
Then at the end of 2024, the gym that was
finally
working for me, closed permanently, and my search for a new gym began anew. This search lead me to a gym in Culver City. It was smaller and a little pricey, but I was determined to continue with my health and wellness goals, and then, my goal to become a personal trainer.
My path to personal trainer isn't how most find their way into the field. A week into being a new member at the gym, I was “recruited.” Yes, recruited; from being a member to becoming a coach.
Well, first, becoming a sales rep while I studied and learned, then finally, becoming a coach. But something completely unexpected that has turned into one of the most rewarding chapters of my life.
Coaching has helped me find my voice, discover my leadership skills, and witness firsthand how empowering fitness can be.
Since becoming a coach, I’ve had the privilege of guiding clients to healthier, stronger lives. I’ve seen shy beginners grow in confidence and claim their belonging in the gym. I've seen people who once dreaded P.E. class light up with excitement to try new lifts, discover their own strength, and transform their daily habits.
Working at a gym in Los Angeles has been an incredible experience, and it’s inspired me to expand my reach even further.
Now, I’m ready to bring fitness out of the gym and into my community.
My vision is to host outdoor classes at local parks. I will provide fun, inclusive sessions that give people a welcoming space to move their bodies and build strength, no matter their starting point. No gym needed.
To make that possible, I’m raising funds for the basic equipment I’ll need to launch these classes.
Every contribution — no matter the size — will go directly toward equipment like Ybells, resistance bands, medicine balls, exercise mats, and other essentials that make these workouts accessible, effective, and affordable for everyone.
Your support means so much to me. Whether you’re able to donate or simply share this campaign, you’re helping me create something that’s bigger than myself: a space for people to feel empowered, healthy, and strong.
Thank you for believing in me and for helping me take this next step!
Coach India
P.S. To my LA donors: do let me know if you want to come take a class. As a thank you, come take one on me. Coach India is stern and we don't skip core, so don't say I didn't warn you ;).
labels: Font

title: Support Corazon Latino: Keep Our Dance Studio Alive
description:
Fundraiser for Corazon Latino: Help Us Keep Our Dance Community Alive!
Dear Corazon Latino Family,
We want to share some heartfelt updates from our studio. For 17 incredible years, Corazon Latino has been a vibrant part of the Austin community, providing a space where culture, dance, and fitness come together. Founded and led by Fanny Gonzalez from Venezuela, our studio has weathered many storms, but the current economic climate is challenging us like never before.
Over the past few months, we’ve faced significant rent increases and building issues that are affecting our ability to serve you. As a small business, we are not alone in facing these hurdles, but the impact has been particularly harsh on women-owned, Latino, and people of color businesses across the USA. It’s time for us to reach out and ask for your support.
To continue our mission of inspiring and empowering individuals through the transformative power of dance, we need to raise $25,000. This funding will help us cover our rent and address urgent issues in our building, ensuring that Corazon Latino remains a safe and welcoming space for everyone.
Corazon Latino plays a vital role in spreading and preserving Latin dance, celebrating the rich heritage and traditions that make our community so unique. Our dedicated team reflects our diversity, with 95% of our staff being Latinas and women. Their hard work and passion are crucial in making Corazon Latino a nurturing environment for all.
Why We Need Your Help:
Every dollar counts. Your contributions directly impact our ability to keep our doors open and provide a nurturing environment for our community. We believe in the power of dance to enhance physical health, mental well-being, and overall happiness. By supporting us, you’re helping others discover the joy of movement and achieve their health and wellness goals.
Our Mission:
At Corazon Latino, we strive to provide an inclusive space where people from all backgrounds can come together to embrace their heritage and passion for dance. We are dedicated to fostering a positive relationship with movement, and we are committed to uplifting our community.
Please consider donating to our fundraiser. Every share of our message helps us reach more people who may want to support our cause. Let's come together to ensure Corazon Latino continues to thrive for many more years to come!
Thank you for being a part of our journey. Your support means the world to us.
With gratitude,
The Corazon Latino Team
Español.
Recaudación de Fondos para Corazón Latino:
Querida Familia de Corazón Latino,
Queremos compartir algunas actualizaciones importantes desde nuestro estudio. Durante 17 años increíbles, Corazón Latino ha sido una parte vibrante de la comunidad de Austin, proporcionando un espacio donde la cultura, el baile y la fitness se unen. Fundado y dirigido por Fanny González, originaria de Venezuela, nuestro estudio ha enfrentado muchas dificultades, pero el clima económico actual nos está presentando desafíos como nunca antes.
En los últimos meses, hemos enfrentado aumentos significativos en el alquiler y problemas en nuestro edificio que están afectando nuestra capacidad para servirles. Como pequeño negocio, no estamos solos en enfrentar estos obstáculos, pero el impacto ha sido particularmente severo para los negocios de mujeres, latinos y personas de color en los Estados Unidos. Es momento de que nos dirijamos a ustedes y pidamos su apoyo.
Para continuar nuestra misión de inspirar y empoderar a las personas a través del poder transformador del baile, necesitamos recaudar $25,000. Estos fondos nos ayudarán a cubrir nuestro alquiler y abordar reparaciones urgentes en nuestro edificio, asegurando que Corazón Latino siga siendo un espacio seguro y acogedor para todos.
Corazón Latino desempeña un papel vital en la difusión y preservación del baile latino, celebrando la rica herencia y tradiciones que hacen que nuestra comunidad sea única. Nuestro equipo dedicado refleja nuestra diversidad, con un 95% de nuestro personal siendo latinas y mujeres. Su arduo trabajo y pasión son cruciales para que Corazón Latino sea un entorno nutritivo para todos.
¿Por qué necesitamos su ayuda?
Cada dólar cuenta. Sus contribuciones impactan directamente nuestra capacidad para mantener nuestras puertas abiertas y proporcionar un ambiente enriquecedor para nuestra comunidad. Creemos en el poder del baile para mejorar la salud física, el bienestar mental y la felicidad en general. Al apoyarnos, están ayudando a otros a descubrir la alegría del movimiento y alcanzar sus metas de salud y bienestar.
Nuestra Misión:
En Corazón Latino, nos esforzamos por ofrecer un espacio inclusivo donde personas de todos los orígenes puedan unirse para abrazar su herencia y su pasión por el baile. Estamos comprometidos a fomentar una relación positiva con el movimiento y a elevar a nuestra comunidad.
Por favor, consideren donar a nuestra recaudación de fondos. Cada compartido de nuestro mensaje nos ayuda a alcanzar a más personas que puedan querer apoyar nuestra causa. ¡Unámonos para asegurar que Corazón Latino continúe prosperando durante muchos años más!
Gracias por ser parte de nuestra jornada. Su apoyo significa el mundo para nosotros.
Con gratitud,
El Equipo de Corazón Latino
labels: Smile, Happiness, Advertising

title: Help Kitchens Reborn Launch to the NEXT LEVEL
description:
We need your help to launch our business to the next level!
We were recently accepted into the Pierce County Business Accelerator program, which provided us with business courses, coaching, networking, and more.
As part of this amazing program comes the opportunity to
receive a matching grant! For every dollar donated, the program matches dollar for dollar up to $10k!

We cannot thank you enough for your AMAZING support, and we pray God blesses you abundantly!

Kitchens Reborn

title: Support My Art Business Through Tough Times
description:
For the past four years, I’ve poured my energy into running a small art business as a sole proprietor that serves gaming communities like Vampire the Masquerade and Dungeons and Dragons. I create custom character art, t-shirts, game cards, painted miniatures, and 3D prints, all designed to bring players’ stories to life. My work is a labor of love, and I’ve always strived to offer unique, high-quality pieces that help people connect and enjoy their games even more.
Recently, the cost of essential supplies—resin, filament, paint, and equipment maintenance—has risen sharply. To keep my business going, I’ve relied on credit cards, but now the debt is overwhelming. I’ve had to take pay cuts for myself, and I’m no longer earning an income from my artwork. Instead, every dollar goes toward paying back what I owe, making it harder to invest in new materials or keep up with customer demand.
Support from this fundraiser would relieve the financial pressure and allow me to focus on creating without constant stress. With help, I can continue producing quality artwork, support the gaming communities I care about, and rebuild my business for the future. Every contribution will help me get back on track and keep doing what I love.
labels: Cup, Coffee, Serveware, Coffee cup, Teacup

title: Beto’s Tacos Food Trailer
description: Hello everyone! Our good friend Beto from Beto’s tacos in hastings experienced an accident this morning. His taco truck exploded this morning due to a propane leak. As a business food truck owner myself i know this situation could of happened to anyone else. Its not easy when this is literally your only souce of income. Anyone who knows Beto personally knows how much pride he takes into his work. Always having a smile on his face. I made this page to him help out from Business owner to Business owner! Anything helps! God bless!
