title: Help Nat Replace Her Stolen Camera Gear
description:
Help Nat Rebuild Her Photography Business After a Devastating Theft
Our dear friend Nat, the heart and soul behind Bay Area's Nat Dolan Photography, recently experienced every photographer’s worst nightmare.
While returning from a trip abroad, Nat and her boyfriend had all of their personal and business belongings stolen from their car outside the airport—just hours before their flight home. Among the stolen items were Nat’s entire camera gear, laptop, hard drives, and other essential tools she needs to run her business.
To make matters worse, insurance isn’t able to cover the loss.
This comes at an especially difficult time—Nat just recently took the leap to pursue photography full time, pouring everything she had into building a business that reflects her passion. If you’ve met Nat or ever worked with her before, you know the light and joy she brings into every room she enters and every session she photographs.
We’re rallying together to help Nat get back on her feet so she can continue doing what she loves most. Any donation, big or small, would go directly toward replacing her stolen equipment and helping her rebuild what was lost.
Thank you for supporting someone who gives so much of herself to others through her art and her kindness.
With deep gratitude,
Friends of Nat
labels: White, Font, Graphics, Screenshot

title: Help keep a beloved creative space alive in Oakland
description:
Hi, I’m Emmanuel Singh — founder of couchdate, a Community Space and HiFi bar that’s been a hub for Brown & Black arts and culture in Oakland for the past six years.
This year we've hosted over 200 artists, welcomed more than 5,000 guests, and in just the past month, our social media content reached over 200,000 views.
We've achieved an incredible amount of success bootstrapping this project, but that's not sustainable. That's not how you create a future.
We've been offered a beautiful new space in Temescal - a safer, more supportive location with room to grow. I want to do this sustainably this time.
Our Goal: Raise $30k in 1 month
Here’s what that gets us:
• ✅ First and last month’s rent + deposit
• ✅ Moving costs + essential utilities
• ✅ A small cushion for the transition period
Our stretch goal is $50k.
The people of Oakland deserve safe, beautiful third spaces - and every dollar goes to building that together.
If we can't raise the money (or get close to that number), we're going to take the next year off.
Why are we moving?
couchdate’s current location is owned by the City of Oakland. On May 6th, while I was unloading groceries into the space,
a shooting
happened right in front of our doors. A bullet ricocheted off my car. Thankfully, none of our team was hurt — but two others were injured.
We reached out for help. The City did nothing. Instead, that same month,
they raised our rent
and fined us for hosting an artist showcase.
We love Oakland. We want to stay in Oakland. We’ve had offers from other cities — Richmond, Sacramento, even San Francisco —
but this Temescal location is our chance to continue serving our home - Oakland.
Our mission has always been to provide Oakland with safe, beautiful, culturally affirming third spaces. Intimate spaces where artists can shine and people can connect.
If you’ve ever met a friend at couchdate, performed here, laughed here, or just felt seen here —
we’re asking you to invest in the future of this community.
Thank you for believing in us, showing up, and keeping couchdate alive all these years. We're looking forward to this next chapter together.
Love,
Emmanuel Singh
Instagram
KRON4 Article
Newsletter
Website
Youtube
⸻
Interested in Long-Term Investment?
If you’re someone looking to support couchdate beyond a donation — via an investment, partnership, or shared ownership conversation — please reach out to me directly. We’re very open to sustainable, values-aligned growth.
⸻
labels: Carnivores, Snout, Terrestrial animal, Happiness, Photo caption

title: Together for Maguilar Deli Café
description:
Dear Friends, Family, and Community,
We’re reaching out on behalf of Genser Marroquin, a hardworking and passionate young entrepreneur who poured his heart and soul into opening Maguilar Deli Café in early 2024. Located in our beloved neighborhood, this small deli quickly became a favorite spot for many — not just because of its delicious food, but because of Genser’s warm smile and unwavering dedication to his dream.
Unfortunately, tragedy struck on August 10th, when a devastating car crash severely damaged the deli. The impact caused significant structural damage, and the building was declared unsafe and unusable. In an instant, Genser lost his main source of income — his livelihood — and the dream he worked so hard to build is left hanging in uncertainty.
Genser didn’t come from much, but he’s always given his all. He spent years saving up to open Maguilar Deli Café, often working long hours and sacrificing personal comfort to create a better future for himself and serve his community. He created more than just a deli — he built a space where people felt at home
Every dollar counts, and any support — whether it’s a donation or simply sharing this page — will help Genser get back on his feet. Let’s come together and show him that the same community he served is here for him in his time of need.
1 Thessalonians 5:16-18
16 Rejoice always, 17 pray continually, 18 give thanks in all circumstances; for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.
Thank you for your kindness, generosity, and support.
*****
Queridos amigos, familiares y comunidad:
Nos dirigimos a ustedes en nombre de Genser Marroquín, un joven emprendedor trabajador y apasionado que puso todo su corazón y alma en la apertura de Maguilar Deli Café a principios del 2024. Ubicado en nuestro querido vecindario, este pequeño deli se convirtió rápidamente en un lugar favorito para muchos — no solo por su deliciosa comida, sino también por la cálida sonrisa de Genser y su inquebrantable dedicación a su sueño.
Lamentablemente, la tragedia golpeó el 10 de agosto, cuando un devastador accidente automovilístico dañó gravemente el deli. El impacto causó  daños estructurales, y el edificio fue declarado inseguro e inutilizable. En un instante, Genser perdió su principal fuente de ingresos — su sustento — y el sueño por el que tanto luchó quedó en la incertidumbre.
Genser no viene de una vida fácil, pero siempre ha dado todo de sí. Pasó años ahorrando para poder abrir Maguilar Deli Café, trabajando largas jornadas y sacrificando su comodidad personal para construir un mejor futuro y servir a su comunidad. Él creó más que un simple deli — construyó un espacio donde las personas se sentían como en casa.
Cada dólar cuenta, y cualquier tipo de apoyo — ya sea una donación o simplemente compartir esta página — ayudará a que Genser pueda levantarse nuevamente. Unámonos y demostremos que esta comunidad a la que él ha servido está ahora para apoyarlo en su momento de necesidad.
1 Tesalonicenses 5:16-18
16 Alégrense siempre,
17 oren sin cesar,
18 den gracias a Dios en toda situación, porque esta es su voluntad para ustedes en Cristo Jesús.
Gracias por su bondad, generosidad y apoyo

title: Help me open my own sushi business!
description:
Hi guys! My name is Ben. I’m a sushi chef living in Los Angeles.
I’ve decided to start my own sushi catering company, specializing in omakase dinner parties.
I’ve been making sushi for 7 years now and have always wanted to start my own company. I recently started investing in the equipment I need to get started, but I still need some help.
I'm hoping this will take off and one day lead to owning my own sushi bar.
I’ve always worked for someone else, living paycheck to paycheck, wishing I could be self-employed to better support my daughter and fiancé. Today, I’m starting the journey of turning that dream into a reality.
No donation is too small, thank you so much

title: Support EN Basketball Training
description:
Hi, my name is Edmond Ntango, founder of EN Basketball Training. I’ve been training athletes since 2018, and in 2023 I launched my own program to help players grow not only as athletes, but as people.
My mission is simple: use basketball to teach discipline, confidence, and resilience. I work with kids as young as 7 all the way to college and pro players.
The challenge? In New York City, gym rentals cost over $100/hour, and I don’t yet have consistent space. To fully serve my athletes, I’m raising $50,000 by January 2026.
This funding will:
•	Secure gym space for 6–9 months
•	Complete my I’m Possible Training certification
•	Cover a modest salary so I can focus on training full-time
•	Provide 3 months of free training to 5 students who can’t afford it
This is bigger than basketball—it’s about building character and changing lives.
To learn more about me or my training program, you can follow me on Instagram @enbballtraining.
Important Note: EN Basketball Training is a for-profit business and not a nonprofit organization. All contributions are considered gifts and are not tax-deductible. Contributions cannot be claimed as charitable tax deductions. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to me directly
Thank you for believing in me and the next
generation.
— Edmond Ntango
Founder, EN Basketball Training

title: Empower Girls with Anissa Banks' Mission
description:
Hi, my name is Anissa Banks, and I am the Executive Director of Love Yourself Ambassador, Inc., a nonprofit organization on a mission to empower girls, teens, and women with faith-based and values-driven self-love, self-esteem, and personal growth.
Our vision is to break cycles of low self-worth by creating safe spaces where youth can learn who they are, love who they are, and lead with purpose.
We're raising $50,000 to fund:
Development and printing of our Self-Esteem Textbook & Workbook
Equipment for content creation (camera, iPhone, tripod)
Expansion into local schools with student ambassadors in each grade
Program supplies, affirmations, and workshop materials
Mental health support and group coaching scholarships
A professional website and online course academy
✝️ Faith-based mentorship camps and events
Every dollar helps. Whether it’s $5 or $500, you are planting a seed that will change a generation.

title: Keep the Heart beating
description:
Help Us Save This Friday’s Event
We’ve spent the past year pouring everything we have into fixing up our building and creating a home for music, art, and community in Idaho Falls. Just as it was finally coming together, our landlord told us we have to leave.
We found out the very same day as my mother’s memorial service — and only two days before one of our biggest shows of the year.
Here’s the good news: we can still make the show happen if we raise $5,000 by Friday. That money will cover the emergency costs of keeping the space open long enough for this event and help us transition into the next chapter.
This isn’t just about one night — it’s about proving that our community wants and needs this kind of space. Every dollar helps, and every share gets us closer.
If you’ve ever come to one of our shows, if you believe in local music and art, or if you just want to help us hold on through this devastating week — please donate what you can.
Together, we can keep the music alive.
labels: Red, Night, Darkness, Design, Graphic design

title: Support Bruno's Place After Devastating Crash
description:
Hi! I live in Kessler Park near
Bruno's Place DIY Dog Wash
, and their business was badly damaged on Saturday, July 19, by a reckless driver who plowed through the building. For those of us who live in Oak Cliff, Bruno's is an important part of our community. Not only do they offer well-priced DIY dog grooming services and supplies, but they are also helpful in other ways, such as:
Whenever a neighbor finds a stray, the first thing people will say is, "Take them to Bruno's to scan for a chip."
They host low-cost vaccination clinics.
They amplify other "GoFundMe"s for families who are facing cost-prohibitive animal care expenses.
They share posts about adoptable shelter pets looking for a new home.
They've occasionally hosted little kid entrepreneurs' sidewalk fundraisers.
Please support this fundraiser so that we can sustain them while they are closed for business during the insurance and rebuilding process.

title: Transport Visionary Art Exhibit to the AATA Conference
description:
We need your help we are transporting Art Work of visionaries across the country from Tampa Fl. To Portland OR. to exhibit at the AATA National Conference. The concept of a "visionary" in art is someone who creates meaning, goes beyond mere aesthetics, and produces bodies of work that act as a "living archive" of resistance, love, memory, and transformation. This aligns with art therapy's core principles, where clients use the creative process to express their inner world and experiences in ways that can transcend verbal communication.
We will be transporting Visionary art work that include, Mildred Lachman Chapin, Don Jones, Harriet Wadeson, Bobbi Stoll, Arthur Robbins,

title: Support Sergio Hayes' Reentry Initiative
description:
My name is Sergio Emanuel Hayes, and I am a Peer Recovery Specialist, reentry advocate, and mentor. After serving nearly 25 years incarcerated, I’ve dedicated my life to helping others rebuild theirs.
I founded The Segue Initiative, a movement that bridges the gap for individuals returning to society. Through mentorship, emotional healing, employment readiness, and community support, The Segue Initiative reduces recidivism and helps people step fully into freedom and purpose.
I’m raising funds to officially launch The Segue Initiative and expand its outreach and services
, so we can reach more people in need of guidance, stability, and hope. Every contribution builds pathways of healing and opportunity for those walking the hard road of reentry.

title: Help Keep Recharge Oxford's Doors Open
description:
Recharge Oxford Wellness Center was created with love and a mission to help our community heal, recharge, and restore balance. Our space offers healing therapies such as infrared sauna, PEMF, red and blue light therapy, compression massage, hydrogen drip, vibroacoustic therapy, and more — all designed to support recovery, reduce stress, and promote overall wellness.
We officially opened our doors just one month ago, and the response from those who have visited has been incredible. Clients share stories of feeling renewed, finding relief, and experiencing peace they haven’t felt in years. But as with many new small businesses, the first few months are critical — and we are experiencing very low numbers. Without extra support, we are at risk of closing before we can truly serve the community in the way we dreamed.
This is why we are humbly asking for your help. Your donation will help us:
Cover operating costs during these first crucial months
Continue offering affordable wellness services to the community
Build awareness and reach more people who would benefit from holistic healing
Every contribution, no matter how big or small, makes a huge difference. Even if you can’t give financially, sharing our story with your network helps us more than you know.
The funds will be used to pay rent, payroll and equipment loans.
Recharge Oxford is more than just a business — it’s a safe place for healing, recovery, and hope. With your support, we can keep our doors open and continue to serve the people who need us most.
Thank you for believing in this mission and for standing with us.
With gratitude,
The Recharge Oxford Wellness Center Team

title: Fairway Leathers Growth
description:
Fairway Leathers specializes in custom leather golf accessories and embroidery.
We were started in 2014 by my brother Chuck. He loved golf. He played all his life. In 2009, he became very ill and in 2014, he wanted to start a business to keep himself in the game. He was playing one day with Paul Tesori, Tom Kim’s tour caddie. Chuck met him through a friend. Chuck saw Paul’s yardage book cover was in bad shape and asked Paul if he could try to make a new one for him. He took Paul’s cover, pulled it apart, and started to design what we do today.
It is now time to take Fairway Leathers to the next level. We have recently opened a retail location in downtown Lincolnton, NC.
We are ready to start an aggressive marketing campaign to push the Fairway Leathers name out to a broader market.
These funds will be used to build the marketing both on a local and national level.
We will also use the funds to add some new equipment to expand our product offerings.
We have an opportunity to showcase our shop on the local television market. We will also be working with a golf radio network to expand our nationwide reach.
For the equipment, we will be adding some digital printing machines which will allow us to work into another sector of business.

title: Knead some dough for dough!
description:
Baking the world a sweeter place one cupcake at a time!
Help! We knead dough - literally and figuratively - to get Sugar Mouth Sweets, LLC up and running! Like dough in the oven, our dreams need the right ingredients to rise. Your donation isn't just helping us buy sugar and spice and fondant dice, but also helps with equipment, POS system, other startup costs, and all the essentials so we can fill the air (and bellies) with an unforgettable sweetness!
I’m Dawn, with over 14 years of baking experience, making cakes and treats for family and friends. I’ve been an official pastry chef and have been working for a local storefront bakery for about a year. Now’s the time to take my experiences and talents to the next level! Along with my daughter, Kiara, we’re opening a cottage bakery serving the NOVA area. We’re offering custom orders, as well as setting up booths at local farmer markets, fairs, and other events to sell even more goodies.
Every donation - big or small - helps turn our dream into custom cakes, cupcakes, cookies, and so much more for you and our community. If donating isn't possible, sharing this campaign is just as sweet!
Thank you for helping us whip up our dream into reality!

title: Help Victory Urban Gardens Build Local Gardens
description:
Victory Urban Gardens has found a home.
Anything you can do will help us Keep Growing.
Victory Urban Gardens is dedicated to building local urban gardens where everything is free to pick—One for Me, One for the Neighbor, and One for Sale.
We start by selling organic, heritage, and heirloom veggie and herb starter plants by donation (you've probably seen my posts). This helps to pay the bills and finance the garden. All proceeds go to supporting our mission to fill local gardens and make nutritious food accessible to those who need it most while expanding the future abilities of the organization to continue growing to reach a national level. Currently we have funded a solar project and are in the process of installing a large enough system to maintain off grid capabilities. Next we will be developing a bio bag providing gas and fertilizer out of food scraps.
We’re also working to develop an online school and tutoring program to train more professional growers and encourage others to bring this vision to their neighborhoods. This will be geared towards helping keep generational homes in low income areas in the hands of the families that will be part in the tudoring program. The aim will be to keep large corporations from buying out family homes which is changing the landscape of American cities.
Very long term goal is a reverse mortgage program to help the elderly remain in their homes while pairing them up with family members that will grow and maintain a garden around them while they are still able to remain at home.
Keeping American families together.
If you believe in family, access to great food and building stronger communities, please consider supporting Victory Urban Gardens. Every donation helps us plant more gardens and move closer to making healthy food truly free and available for all.
Thank you for helping us Make America Farm Again! Front and Backyard gardens will Make America Strong Again.
In loving memory of Aunt Barb..
victoryurbangardens.com

title: Support Tonilynn in Restoring a Piece of History
description: Hello my name is Tonilynn Kleena, I’m 69 years old and been in this business for 36 years this Oct. The building was built in 1886 as the first hotel in Eagle River Wisconsin for the railroad. It had a colorful few years as a hotel for the ladies of the night and bootleggers in the 20’s or there about. It was turned into a boarding house and cafe and bus stop going to upper Michigan in the 50’s. My dad bought the building in 1979 for a Chinese Restaurant, I took it over in 1989, and turned it into an Antique and neat Stuff Shop. I’ve been working hard to up keep this old building, but it’s getting away from me. I did the roof in 1999, but it’s in need of a new one again. It’s leaking and needs to be replaced. The funds raised will be used to preserve this building as one of the oldest in town.

title: Support Holly's Dream: From Part-Time to Full-Time Art
description:
Hi everyone, I'm Holly and I am a queer artist and writer located in Wilmington, NC!
I was recently able to convert my art into a part time business and my goal is to propel it even further into a full time career!
I am raising money for greatly needed equipment and supplies that will help me in reaching my career goals. I currently have several artist markets on the books (which I am extremely grateful for) and need additional items to display my work effectively. I am also in DESPERATE need of a new laptop - No offense to my current laptop that I am typing this on, but she's on her last leg. I've had this laptop for almost a decade and in technology years that means she's basically archaic and should be on display in a museum.
This is the list of items that factored into my Gofundme goal!
Macbook Pro
Nikon Z50II + lens kit and camera bag
Flourish Mesh Panels for indoor and outdoor artwork display at pop-up markets
Adobe Subscription for photography and illustration/design
Microsoft Subscription
Studio Space (aka help with rent since my studio is in my apartment)
Art Print displays
Retail table displays for custom postcards and stickers
A wagon for towing all of my market necessities without having to make multiple trips back and forth
General needed art supplies like paint, brushes, canvas, paper, markers, etc.
Bulk orders of art prints and stickers
Thank you so much for helping me achieve my goals and I cannot wait to update you all on my journey!
labels: Blue

title: Build a small recycling center to give trash a new life!
description:
(Spanish)
Hola, mi nombre es Nemuel David Suárez Gierbolini, soy un joven estudiante universitario de Puerto Rico con la meta de hacer un cambio positivo en el mundo. He iniciado esta recaudación para comenzar un pequeño negocio local enfocado en reciclar plásticos y transformarlos en productos útiles y creativos. Con tus donaciones quiero adquirir maquinaria que me permita crear más productos hechos a mano, reducir la basura en vertederos y playas, y dar una nueva vida al plástico.
Si compartes mi pasión por ayudar al planeta, tu aporte será un gran impulso para hacer realidad este sueño.
(English)
Hi, my name is Nemuel David Suárez Gierbolini. I'm a young college student from Puerto Rico looking to make a change in the world. I've started this fundraising process to start a small local business about recycled plastic materials. I have grown a passion for recycling plastic and giving them a new life, turning then into practical products. I've noticed the amount of plastic waste that's not being recycled in Puerto Rico and I feel the need to do something about it. I've made various things out of recycled plastic, all handmade, like rings, coasters, and some domino's. My mission is to raise funds to afford some machinery to Kickstart my small business and be able to maintain a more reliable working environment, eventually making more products to sell and lowering the amount of plastics that are ending up in the landfills and beaches. I have tons of ideas for practical products that can be made with recycled plastic but I need some help, if you're as passionate as me to make a small change in the world, it will mean everything to me if you'd help me fulfill this dream.Thank you for your time!
labels: Hand, Finger, Nail, Wrist, Thumb

title: KEEP REBEL SOUL RUNNING
description:
Thanks for being here! My name is Marcia Lopez and I’m the founder + sole operator of Rebel Soul.
I am asking for help I desperately need to keep the brand running. I started this brand in 2015 and it’s been my heart & soul since. I work hard and there is no task I am above. While I love what I do, this year has been brutal. Savings are drained. I’m trying my best to push through but it’s getting near the end.
Yesterday, I cut part of my finger off while cropping a batch of tanks for open orders. A friend in the building rushed me to the ER but the remainder of my finger was unable to be reattached. I’m trying to give myself the time to heal while getting help with fulfillment.
This amount will cover me for the upcoming weeks with warehouse fees, so I can focus on my medical bills and keeping the brand going.
I truly appreciate you. If you don’t have anything to give, good energy helps too! Thank you.
ps. I’m also selling sticker packs on the site!
sticker packs

title: Vergennes Laundry
description:
I'm a long term customer of Vergennes Laundry a wood-fired bakery, cafe and épicerie. The menu reflects two French backgrounds (Montreal & France) and is influenced by Nadia's travel abroad, having immersed herself in different communities' cultures and their love for food.
Our much beloved cafe is having to move down the street from their present location. The landlords decided to not renew Nadia's lease so she is renovating the former Jackman's Fuels location on Main Street in Vergennes.
I have created this fundraiser to help with the cost of renovation and moving.
This move to a new location is bitter sweet for Nadia but also an opportunity to make the new space all their own.
As Nadia said on her Instagram feed:
"Turning heartache into celebration. Today I have fired the Woodfire oven for the last time. Although not our last weekend ( August 17th is our last day in this location) it will be the last time we bake bread allowing for the Woodfire oven to cool down before we removed it. I wish I could say we are moving it to install it in the new shop but an oven like this does not work that way and can only be used for parts that remain. I want to tell you the last few months there has been so many tears, fears , body aches, lawyers and doubt of my ability to make it through it. I don’t know why people do what they do. Someone told me I don’t understand it because I would I never do it to another and somehow it calmed me.
But today, is an end of an era for this beautiful woodstove that I bought with all my savings and a loan from the previous owner. Today this beautiful woodfire will make our bread, I remember how long it took me to understand her, I called her my master, she made me cry she ate all my butter and chocolate and burnt my bread but slowly I learned her, slowly she became a friend who took what I offered and gave beautiful loaves and pastries in return .
Today I want to turn this sadness into celebration! I want to honor her by doing what we have done all along make good food for good people. As I fed her with wood all night, I slowly thanked her, I am sad but I want this sadness to rise to something more a celebration of her, of what we have done here together. To Ryan who learned the oven in the early days with me, Jesse who baked anything she can think up out of there and my dear husband Kevin, that somehow agreed to help out one day and ended up mastering it- thank you for putting up with heat and making magic.
I WANT TO THANK YOU ALL FOR THE INCREDIBLE LOVE AND KINDNESS. THE COMMENTS, EMAILS, DM AND NOTES HAVE TOUCHED MY HEART, MY STAFF AND FAMILY - SO GRATEFUL."
Please help out Nadia. Vergennes Laundry is a beacon of light and comfort in our troubled times.
labels: Glass, Molding, Aluminium

title: Save Upstage Comedy Lounge: Donate Now
description:
For the past 4 years, Upstage Comedy Lounge has been a home for comedy, community, and culture in San Antonio. From veteran appreciation nights and open mics to national headliners and local showcases, this stage has been a place where laughter brings people together.
Recently, we announced that we would be closing our doors. But the overwhelming support from the community reminded us how much this club means to San Antonio — and that we have to fight to keep it alive.
Right now, we need your help to cover urgent costs and keep the doors open:
$4,000 – IRS payment to settle immediate obligations
$4,000 – Rent payment to keep our space secure
Total Goal: $6,000
Every dollar will go directly toward these critical expenses. Once these are covered, we’ll be able to stabilize operations and continue bringing shows, festivals, and opportunities to the community.
How you can help:
Donate – Every contribution, no matter the size, brings us closer to saving the club.
Share – Spread the word on Facebook, Instagram, and with friends.
Support – Come out to shows, tag us, and keep Upstage Comedy Lounge part of the San Antonio story.
We believe laughter heals, unites, and empowers. With your help, the show will go on.
Thank you for standing with us.
— Bobby Smith & the Upstage Team
labels: Advertising

title: Donate to Help Launch Lone Cow Coffee
description:
Hi, we’re Megan and Bridget — two friends who have been sharing laughter, adventures, and countless cups of coffee together for nearly 10 years. From the very beginning, coffee has been at the heart of our friendship. It’s where we’ve connected, dreamed, and talked about “someday” owning a cozy coffee shop of our own.
That “someday” starts here — with Lone Cow Coffee, our first step toward turning this passion into our life’s work.
We’ve poured evenings, weekends, and every bit of free time into building this little cart while balancing full-time jobs. Every board, every detail has been a labor of love to bring this dream to life.
See the dream come to life — watch us build our cart! [
Video
]
For us, this isn’t just about serving lattes and cappuccinos. Lone Cow Coffee is about creating a space for connection — whether that’s at a wedding, a farmer’s market, or a local gathering. And one day, we hope to grow this cart into a full-time brick-and-mortar shop where everyone feels welcome.
Starting a business is exciting, but it also comes with a lot of costs — from equipment to permits to supplies that will help us craft the perfect cup. With your support, you’re not just helping us build a cart; you’re helping us bring a dream to life. Every donation, big or small, brings us closer to sharing our love of coffee and community with more people.
Thank you for believing in us, cheering us on, and being part of this journey. We can’t wait to serve you a cup of Lone Cow Coffee soon.
labels: Smile, Happiness, Facial expression, Tooth, Blond

title: Support the Final Steps of Jesse’s Yoga Certification
description:
I am 98% finished with my 200 hour Yoga Teacher Training, through YogaRenew based in Hoboken. I am not able to attend the final parts of training while I work my 9-5:30 retail job.
I am raising money to get me by so I can complete my in-person training hours in Hoboken, get my certificate, and begin teaching yoga full-time.
This has been a long-time dream of mine. I have struggled with poor alignment for quite literally all my life - I did not walk until I was 3, I struggled terribly with picking up on choreography when I was in theatre, and I felt dissociated from everything below my neck until I deepened my yoga practice a few years ago.
I would like to take my passion for the art and athleticism of yoga, and use it to transform people’s lives by reframing how they experience their bodies.

title: Daisy Sky's Private Practice and Grad Fund
description:
I’m thrilled to share that I’ve officially completed my Master of Arts in Couples and Family Therapy at Seattle University!
As I approach my 30th birthday next month, I’m taking a huge leap toward my dream: opening a private therapy practice where I can serve individuals, couples, and families with deep care, creativity, and compassion.
I’m fortunate to have stable housing and food security, but starting a business comes with a host of upfront costs — from licensing and insurance to website design, marketing, and technology costs. I’m also beginning to face my $55,000 in student loans , which makes this new chapter feel exciting
and
daunting.
Choosing to open my own practice instead of working under someone else is riskier and will require patience and hard work, but I know in my bones that I will show up as my fullest, most grounded self as my own boss. I believe I can offer the most healing and empowerment to others by following my heart’s deepest calling.
If you feel moved to contribute, your support will help me build something truly meaningful. I can’t wait to give back to my community through this work I love so much.
Thank you, from the bottom of my heart

title: Support Armadillo: Accessible Security for Safer Communities
description:
My name is Steven Jones, and I'm the founder of
Armadillo Security.
I am inivting you to join us in our mission to simplify security and empower communities. For too long, security has been seen as a complex and expensive field, reserved for technical experts and large corporations. At Armadillo Security, we're changing that.
We believe everyone deserves to feel secure, and the first step is to put people in control  through education.
We are seeking to raise resources to continue producing documents, conferences, videos, and other educational materials to help communities strengthen their security from a non-technical perspective. We'll cover vital topics like
cyberbullying, radicalization, threat awareness, disaster preparedness and recovery, household security, violence prevention,
and many others.
Your support is the key to making this mission a reality. Every contribution, no matter the size, helps us empower individuals and build safer communities. As a first step, we invite you to explore our existing free resources in the following link:
ARMADILLO Security FREE Insights
Together, we can make more secure communities. Thank you for your support!
Steven

description:
My name is Jeffrey D. Lewis II, and I am the owner of

description:

title: Freshness For Our Community: A Vet's New Mission
description:
Help a Marine Vet Launch a Local Farm!
My Story & My New Mission
My name is Mike Compton, and I'm a Marine Corps veteran. In the Marines, I learned about discipline, commitment, and the importance of a mission. After serving, I knew I wanted my next mission to be one that served my local community here in Central Illinois. That's why I'm launching Vet Grown Greens.
Our mission is simple:
to provide local chefs and restaurants with the freshest, highest-quality herbs and greens possible, grown right here in our community. The national food supply chain is fragile, and by the time produce gets to our local restaurants, it's often days old and has lost much of its flavor and nutritional value. Vet Grown Greens will solve that problem by delivering produce that is harvested less than 24 hours before it reaches the chef's kitchen.
The Plan:
A Lean, Bootstrapped Launch
I've spent hundreds of hours developing a lean, efficient, and financially sound business plan. Instead of taking on massive loans, I'm starting this farm by bootstrapping it from the ground up, right in my own garage. The plan is to convert my garage into a productive, controlled environment aquaponics farm, built with a
DIY
approach to be as efficient and resourceful as possible.
Aquaponics is a sustainable system where fish provide natural, organic fertilizer for the plants. It's a closed-loop system that uses 90% less water than traditional agriculture and allows us to grow year-round, regardless of the Illinois weather.
The Ask:
Help Us Build the Farm
I'm putting my own savings into this launch, but to get across the finish line, I need your help. We need to raise funds for both the core farm equipment and the essential professional services to get the garage ready for a safe and successful launch.
Our goal is to raise $2,900 to fund all the essential startup costs. Every dollar gets us closer to our first harvest.
Join the Mission & Become a Founder
As a thank you for your support, we've put together a few rewards. By contributing, you're not just a donor; you're a founding member of the Vet Grown Greens community.
Tier 1:
The Seed Starter ($25)
A personal thank-you email from me.
Your name listed on the "Founding Supporters" page of our future website.
Tier 2:
The First Sprout ($50)
All of the above, plus...
An official "Vet Grown Greens Founder" sticker.
Tier 3:
The First Harvest ($100)
(Limited to
50
Backers)
All of the above, plus...
A voucher for one of the very first clamshells of fresh herbs to come out of the farm once we are operational.
​(Reward available for local pickup or delivery within a 30-mile radius of Paxton, IL only. We will contact you via email after the campaign to arrange fulfillment)
Tier 4:
The Founder's Box ($250+)
(Limited to
20
Backers)
All of the above, plus...
You'll receive a special Founder's Tasting Box from our first harvest. This will include a curated collection of all the different herbs we're growing, allowing you to be one of the very first to sample the entire Vet Grown Greens product line.
​(Reward available for local pickup or delivery within a 30-mile radius of Paxton, IL only. We will contact you via email after the campaign to arrange fulfillment)
Here's Exactly Where Your Contribution Goes:
1.
Grow Beds ($253)
Justification: These two large trays are the foundation of the farm, providing a food-safe, reliable, and flood-proof surface for our crops to grow on.
2.
Plumbing System ($525)
Justification: These raw materials are the circulatory system of the farm. They will be hand-fabricated into eight vertical aeroponic towers and the gravity-fed drain lines, creating a sustainable, closed-loop system.
3.
Life Support System (Aquaponics Core)
Barracuda RO/DI Water Filter ($200):
Our local water is too harsh for delicate fish and plants. This filter purifies it completely, creating the perfect, clean water foundation for our ecosystem.
150-Gallon Stock Tank ($90):
This tank is the heart of the farm. It will be the home for our fish, whose natural waste becomes the organic fertilizer that feeds all of our plants.
Submersible Pump ($90):
The "engine" of the farm. This reliable pump circulates the nutrient-rich water from the fish to the plants, 24/7.
In-Line & Bio-Filters ($90):
These filters keep the water clean and provide a home for beneficial bacteria, which are the microscopic engines that convert fish waste into plant food.
4.
Grow Environment & Lighting
T5 Style LED Grow Lights ($172):
This high-efficiency LED fixture provides the full-spectrum light our plants need for healthy, rapid growth, ensuring a consistent, year-round harvest.
Dehumidifier ($125):
An aquaponics farm creates a very humid environment. This dehumidifier is essential for preventing mold and protecting the health of our crops.
5.
Processing & Food Safety
Stainless Steel Prep Table ($100):
A professional, food-safe surface is non-negotiable for harvesting and packaging our greens for restaurants.
5-Gallon Salad Spinner ($150):
This commercial-grade spinner is critical for drying our herbs after washing, dramatically extending their shelf life.
Utility Sink ($60):
A dedicated sink is required for all washing and sanitation, forming the cornerstone of our food safety protocols.
Miter Saw ($100):
This essential tool will be used to make the precise cuts on the PVC pipes needed to build our vertical aeroponic towers.
6.
Professional Services
Electrician ($800):
Safety is paramount. A licensed electrician is needed to install new, dedicated GFCI outlets and ensure our breaker panel can safely handle the load of the lights, pumps, and other equipment.
Every contribution, no matter the size, brings us one step closer to launching and anything extra goes into building the business and increasing our reach to the community.
Thank you for your support.
Semper Fi,
Mike Compton
Owner, Vet Grown Greens
labels: Graphics

title: Help Us Defend Cakechella Against Coachella’s Bullying
description:
Help Us Defend Cakechella Against Coachella’s Bullying
We need your support.
Cakechella was created to celebrate what makes our community so special—local bakers, small businesses, and neighbors who come together over a shared love of sweets. What began as a joyful idea to connect people through cake and creativity is now under attack.
Coachella, the massive California music festival, is trying to shut us down with claims of cybersquatting. Their accusations have no merit. Cakechella isn’t their brand—it’s ours. It belongs to our community, built with heart, hard work, and the support of people right here in the DMV.
The reality is simple: they think a billion-dollar corporation can bully a grassroots event into backing down. They expect us to stay quiet, to fold under pressure. But we refuse. Cakechella will happen. And we won’t let them erase the voices, dreams, and businesses that this festival uplifts.
But here’s the truth—fighting back is costly. That’s where you come in.
For just $5, you can help protect a festival that supports YOUR neighbors—local bakers, treat makers, and small businesses who pour their hearts into what they do. Your $5 sends a message louder than any lawsuit: community creativity matters, and we won’t be silenced.
Every dollar counts. Every share spreads the word. Every contribution—no matter how small—helps defend Cakechella and the people behind it.
Thank you for standing with us, believing in Cakechella, and helping us prove that when a community comes together, even the biggest corporations can’t take away what we’ve built.
labels: Logo, Night

title: Help Lollipop Shoppe Thrive: Support Independent Music
description:
This is a tough one, but it would be worse if we didn't do this. Lollipop Shoppe needs yr support + it's urgent. Lollipop Shoppe opened in 2022 + is a live music venue + dance club + community space in SE Portland, Oregon. We've hosted thousands of artists, DJs + music lovers over these past three years, all while navigating the increased costs of small business ownership, a post-pandemic music industry + some big learning curves that come along with new business ownership.
The roots of Lollipop Shoppe began nearly 10 years ago as a series of house shows. As those grew more popular, we began renting warehouses + started an annual music festival / promotions company called Lose Yr Mind. We bootstrapped our way here using our food service tips + community support. In 2021 we reached the point of being able to purchase our own venue space (previously called Dig A Pony). After a decade of hard work, our dream came true.
We've hosted a wide away of artists over the years + frequently lend our space to causes + communities that aren't always offered the stage. We pay artists well, have a devoted team + love being part of our neighborhood. We're 100% woman owned, which is something that is rare in this industry + something we're super proud of. It wasn't easy getting to this point. Lollipop has hosted some of the best shows we've ever seen, raised funds for those in need + looks out for the Portland music community / our neighbors in general. Bands from rural Thailand to West Africa have graced our stage
Thailand to West Africa have graced our stage.
On the weekends you can dance to a range of DJs spinning Cumbia, House, Amapiano, Hip Hop, Disco + more. One of the best things about Lollipop Shoppe is the diversity of our programming. There's something for everyone + it's a place for everyone.
We've hosted nights that feature trans femme artists, are the home of the monthly hip hop showcase The Thesis + produce an array of special events on the weekend from kids music recitals to drag brunches. One of our roles in the community is to help artists grow + give them a place to cut their teeth. We are and incubator room that offers excellent sound, a beautiful space + good pay. Artists that have an audience much larger than our capacity have opted to play here for multiple nights because of the magic of this space. IYKYK.
It's been a marathon keeping our doors open these past three years. Last year our insurance increased to over $5k a month without incident or claims. We've been broken into several times + have debt that's incurred to keep going. We need relief. Being financially creative is draining + detracts from us being able to work on business development + grow. Summer is the slowest time for an indoor venue + we're at the end of a tough one. A number of larger, unexpected expenses (equipment repairs, a flood, some ownership changeover etc) have incurred + it's been tough. Lollipop Shoppe needs support to remain open.
Funds raised from this campaign will be used to pay bills, staff, artists + grow our programming. In order to increase revenue we're adding more events during the day on the weekends + adding more shows Mondays + Tuesdays. This stabilize us + allow us to succeed. We've already seen the results of some of that. But we need a stop gap. Event growth doesn't happen over night. We also need funds to increase marketing so event are better attended. We are often busy, but being a little busier is what is needed.
So here we are, asking y'all for help. We've put everything + then some into this. It's our life + it's been difficult, but we're here for the long haul. The Portland venue music community wouldn't be the same without a space like Lollipop + we're constantly hearing from artists + guests that this place is special + meaningful.
If you can, please contribute to us succeeding. To us being less hand to mouth + being less being less stressed. To finally having a buffer so we can absorb life's curveballs. We don't have any more funds to contribute, so we need you. This is not a drill. We will not be able to continue without folks showing up. It's hard to be this vulnerable + ask for this type of help, but we believe everyone benefits from us being funded + continuing. We promise the returns will be there.
Portland + artists + guests, we love you more than you know. Thank you for all your hard work + for showing up. We do this for you.
Thank you for reading + please come through sometime soon.
labels: Font, Advertising, Graphic design

title: Sweet Relief: Support this Doll's Ice Cream Dream
description:
Hi everyone,
After eight years of working in professional kitchens, starting as a donut finisher and steadily progressing to pastry chef, I’m taking the leap to starting my own endeavor. I’m raising to cover the essential startup costs that will allow me to begin production, rent kitchen space, and start selling at local markets and events. This project really blends my background in fine art and chemistry with my deep love for sweet treats, providing a whole new avenue for my culinary creativity.
My ice cream isn't just dessert—it's a canvas for playful, unexpected, and comforting flavors. I’ve spent years recipe testing, developing unique spins on classics, and dreaming of ways to make people smile through small, sweet moments. With your support, I’ll be able to purchase a larger-scale ice cream maker, secure a commissary kitchen, and stock the ingredients, packaging, and supplies I need to get started. I’ve created a detailed cost breakdown to keep everything transparent, from business licensing to custom stamps and kitchen equipment.
Those of you who know me will know that, over the course of working in bakeries for my entire career, I have developed a skin allergy to wheat products. I am constantly in a cycle of using steroid creams on my hands and arms to reduce the symptoms of redness, rash, and skin that cracks until bleeding. I use gloves religiously in the pastry kitchen, but my body is in desperate need of a step back from working with my allergens. So, the move to ice cream is also a balm for my suffering immune response.
Your contribution will directly help cover:
– $2,100 for kitchen space rental (first, last, and deposit)
– $825 for an ice cream machine
– ~$1,000 for supplies like pots, pans, packaging, and ingredients
– Licenses, insurance, and LLC fees totaling around $1,000
– Monthly costs like storage, car rentals for supply runs, and insurance
Any extra funds raised will go towards a soft serve machine and other maintaining costs.
Every dollar truly helps, and even a share or kind word means the world.
As a trans woman working to build something of my own, this business isn’t just about ice cream—it’s about self-sufficiency, visibility, and the power of creating and sharing moments of joy in a world that isn’t always built to support people like me. Your support goes beyond helping launch a dream—it helps me carve out a future where I can sustain myself doing what I love, in my own way. If you believe in me, queer-owned small businesses, in the magic of dessert, or in the importance of giving someone a real shot—this could be your chance to be part of something beautiful.
labels: Eyewear, Smile, Chin, Glasses, Vision Care

title: Please help Mr. Marc Keep The Glazery Alive
description:
The Glazery has been a part of this community for over 20 years. It started with a personal injury trial lawyer who had children and decided that creating a space for people to have fun was more important than making a lot of money, being someone who wasn't really him (me). Our customers have become very special to us. Mr. Marc is watching a fourth generation grow up since the store opened. I don't know when the store became more than a business, but it has. I say this because so many people have expressed this to me. The problem has always been that I don't like to think of The Glazery as a business, and I've done a terrible job as a business owner. The Glazery has come to a crossroads. I have two choices: try and sell as much as I can between now and the end of the year, hoping I can pay off all the debt I've accumulated, and then close the store. The other is to swallow my pride and admit that I need help and try to keep The Glazery going. As I've mentioned to many of you, I'm aware of things I could do to increase revenue, but implementing those changes would alter The Glazery. As I've always said, The Glazery will remain as The Glazery, or I will close it.
So, I am taking the second choice. I am asking for your support in coming to the store to paint and possibly contributing to this GoFundMe so I can pay off my debts before they force the store to close. I understand that some people will lose respect for me and the store for going this route. I am not entirely comfortable doing it, but it seems like my only option at this point.
Regardless of whether this works or not, it has truly been an honor to meet and watch so many of you grow up. I don't have the words to express how much you have all meant to me, Mickayla, and Daynah, though she is no longer with us. Saying thank you hardly seems enough, but thank you.
-- Mr. Marc
labels: Art, Visual arts, Furniture, Painting, Modern art

title: Help Chris Rebuild After Devastating Loss
description:
Hey all! This is Chris from Deluxe Auto NW. I am devastated to say
we lost everything
. On the early morning of August 24 around 4:15, someone broke into my work van, stealing everything I’ve built up for the past four years. Every tool, item, and unique thing I’ve accumulated. Just gone! I am absolutely devastated.
I normally do not ask for help from anyone and am usually offering the help, but unfortunately, this time
I am in desperate need of help
. My ask is if you can or are willing to help me get back on my feet so that I may continue to be able to serve our community with their needs as well. It’s a very big ask and I would love to repay or provide something for each individual out of the kindness of my heart. I am so thankful for those who can and cannot help! Even just a share of this could potentially help! I appreciate each and every one of you. I love you all and may you all be blessed! Thank you.

title: Support Dodo Bakery's Expansion Dream
description:
Hi everyone,
We’re the family behind Dodo Bakery, a small Hong Kong-style bakery that’s been serving up fresh, nostalgic pastries and breads for the past three years. Our original 800 sq. ft. shop has been loved by the community since day one—and don’t worry, we’re not closing it! We’re just growing.
Thanks to all of your support, we’ve outgrown our space and are ready to open a second location in the heart of Philadelphia, at 510 Walnut Street. It’s a busy area full of tourists, locals, and history, and we can’t wait to bring our Hong Kong flavors to an even bigger crowd.
We’ve already signed the lease and were ready to start renovations—until we were hit with an unexpected requirement. After everything was finalized, we were told we have to use a union contractor for all the build-out work. This was never mentioned during the year-long negotiations, and the cost is way beyond what we had planned for.
As a small, family-run bakery, this sudden increase has put us in a tough spot. That’s why we’re reaching out to you—our community—for help.
Any support you can give will help us move forward and bring our second location to life. We’re so excited about this next chapter, and with your help, we can make it happen.
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts. We promise to keep baking with love and sharing the best of Hong Kong-style treats with all of you—both in our current shop and soon, in our brand new space.
labels: Label

title: Help Save Our Brewery & Restaurant & Support Our Staff
description:
Dear friends, family, and our Worcester community,
Earlier this week, a fire broke out in our building due to a lightning strike causing significant water damage due to the sprinkler system and emergency efforts to extinguish the flames. As a result, both our brewery and restaurant lost power. We’ve suffered the total loss of all our beer and food inventory, and we are still assessing the full extent of the damage to our brewing and kitchen equipment — the very heart of our operations.
This is an incredibly difficult time for us, and we are reaching out to our community and home for support.
Our immediate priority is to take care of our incredible staff and our food vendors who help make our business what it is. While we are temporarily closed, your support will help us continue to pay our team and begin the process of repairing and rebuilding, with the hope of reopening our doors as soon as possible.
If you're able to contribute, please know that every dollar and gesture of support means the world to us. We are endlessly grateful to be part of such a strong, compassionate community.
Thank you for standing by us during this time. We love you, Worcester.
labels: Smile, Soil, Blue-collar worker, Garden tool, Tradesman

title: Help Angel Rebuild After Fire Devastation
description:
Devastating Fire Destroys Mechanic Shop Resulting in Total Loss – Help Us Rebuild from the Ashes
Dear Friends, Family, and Community Supporters,
I’m reaching out with a heavy heart to share some unfortunate news. On August 23, 2025, at 1:20 am, a catastrophic fire completely ravaged my father’s self-made mechanic shop, Angel’s Trucks Repair Inc., located in Long Beach Wilmington. What started as a small fire quickly escalated into an inferno that left nothing but complete destruction. The entire building, inventory, equipment, customer trucks, and years of hard work were completely lost overnight.
Angel’s Trucks Repair Inc. was founded 10 years ago, and through those years, we have given service to semi-trucks either through general mechanic work, AC, overhauls, tune-ups, etc. For my father, Angel, this was a dream built from scratch, fueled by passion, perseverance, and lots of sacrifice. Now, unfortunately, it’s all gone, and we’re left picking up the pieces.
The fire not only destroyed our physical space but also our livelihoods. Ten employees are left without work, facing uncertainty. Eight customers are left without their semi-trucks. We’ve lost original truck parts (radiators, oil pumps, starters, batteries, oil/fuel filters, O-rings, etc.), our forklift, and two company trucks. Unfortunately, insurance may not cover everything that was lost.
We want to rise back up and rebuild, which is why we’re launching this GoFundMe to raise money to:
• Cover immediate needs like temporary relocation and support for our employees.
• Purchase essential equipment and inventory to get back on our feet.
• Pay customers for their total loss trucks.
• Handle any uncovered costs from cleanup and legal fees.
Every donation, no matter how small, will make a real difference in helping us rebuild. If you can’t donate, please share this campaign with your network—your support in spreading the word is just as valuable.
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for standing with us during this incredibly difficult time. Your generosity gives us hope and reminds us that we’re not alone.
With deepest gratitude,
Angel G Perez(jr) and Angel Perez, owner of Angel’s Trucks Repair Inc.
https://www.tiktok.com/t/ZT6VWgM4D/

title: Support Studio West's Big Move!
description:
Hi everyone, I'm Buzzy, a licensed social worker and owner of Studio West, an immersive performing arts studio.
Studio West is moving to a new location this summer and while you might think this is a huge undertaking while I’m going through treatment for triple negative breast cancer, I know this is the right time.
My incredible medical team (oncologist, surgeon, nurses and others) are encouraging me to plan for a future beyond cancer. So, that’s exactly what I’m doing.
This move is not just about a new location; it’s about reclaiming our space and forging a brighter future for our current and future students.
The new studio will offer easy walking access to Black Sheep and other food and activities in the Short North, making it a perfect spot for families. Our new spot will also allow us to expand our programming to include guest instructors along with specialty programming like art and music therapy.
And I could use a little help. I have been very fortunate to have health insurance and the support from my parents and Misty Linn - so I don't have the same financial hardships as others battling this same disease. I am very grateful and don’t take it for granted.
But my life has still been deeply impacted because I haven’t been able to perform as often which has impacted my income - these are funds that I always channel directly into Studio West.
That’s why we’re reaching out to you. We could use some help to cover the costs of our move and to make necessary improvements to our new space.
We don’t yet have our non-profit designation so your donations will not be tax deductible, but please know that every dollar will go directly to our Studio West program, helping children and their families navigate life’s challenges through performing arts.
Thank you for your consideration. At Studio West, you never have to hide. You were born to shine just exactly as you are, and we are committed to celebrating and supporting you every step of the way.
About Studio West:
Studio West 614 is an immersive dance company designed to foster growth, development, and emotional healing in a judgement free environment and where all students are welcome. Owner Buzzy Biddinger holds degrees in human health and kinetics and dance from Ohio Wesleyan University and a master’s degree in social work from THE Ohio State University work with a focus on mental health and substance abuse. Through dance and performing arts, Studio West helps children and families navigate life challenges, gain confidence and develop healthy coping skills. Buzzy cheered and danced in college and then went on to dance for five professional sports teams. Learn more at:
Studio West Intro Video
labels: Entertainment, Performing Arts, Physical fitness, Choreography, Dance

title: Help Butter Love Rebuild After Devastating Loss
description:
Hey Butter Love Fam,
On August 18th, 2025, something heartbreaking happened at our shop. After returning from a pop-up, I walked in to find that two of our shelving units had collapsed. All of our body oils spilled onto the floor, our glass measuring cups shattered, and nearly every container was broken. We had just invested $1,500 into supplies to fulfill wholesale orders, and everything was already mixed and ready to be bottled. In an instant, it was all gone.
This loss has put us in a very vulnerable position as a small business. Not only did we lose product and supplies, but we also lost the income that those wholesale orders would have brought in. As a small, community-rooted business, every dollar counts, and this setback is one that we cannot recover from alone.
I’m humbly asking for your help. If you are able to donate, your support will go directly toward reordering supplies, replacing broken equipment, and helping us get back on our feet so we can continue creating products that bring joy and care to your daily routines. No amount is too small—every single donation makes a difference.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for reading, sharing, and supporting us through this difficult time. Your generosity means the world and will help us rebuild stronger.

description:

Hello, my name is Ireion Smith, and I am raising funds on behalf of my best friend,
Angel, the proud owner of HeavenLy Eatz
.
For over 5 years, she has poured her heart and soul into serving her community through her food truck. From feeding local schools to showing up at community events, she has always gone above and beyond to give back. Anyone who knows her knows she’s not just serving meals — she’s serving love, encouragement, and a place for people to feel seen and supported.
Unfortunately, tragedy struck when her food truck recently caught fire and was severely damaged.

title: PancakeBros: Support Our Family Journey
description:
I’m 14 years old and my brother is 8 years old. We decided to start a small business called (PancakeBros ) this summer instead of staying home playing games. We wanted to do something big and to help my mom out with things for us like school supplies, sports activities, essentials, clothes, everything.
She do so much for us without hesitation and I know it hasn’t always been easy for her, but she will never let us know, but I know her pain. I listen to her crying and praying to God for us in her bathroom one night and I want to make her proud of me, I know I haven’t been my best lately, in I want her to know that i understand her and love her very much and all her cry’s and prayer God has hear her, and I see her, this business means the world to me and I can use all the help I can to go as far as god allows me and to help my mom. I promise will stay focus and discipline on my goals and this business, so I’m asking for our community to help me reach my goal and become the young man, My mother know I can be.
thank you all so much in advance for everything your donations and encouraging words and support means the whole world to me.
thank you all so much in advance for everything

title: Fuel Deena Marie's Mission for Meaningful Music
description:
Hi, I’m
Deena Marie
—a singer-songwriter, independent artist, and storyteller who believes that music isn’t just entertainment. It’s a lifeline, a mirror, and sometimes even a call to action.
I write folk for the soul—songs that carry truth, courage, and connection. Some of my music is deeply personal, rooted in love, healing, and sobriety. Other songs carry a political charge, echoing the timeless tradition of protest folk. What ties it all together is one core belief: music with meaning matters.
I’ve already released a handful of songs into the world—including “Karoline,” “Relax Take It Easy,”  "West Coast (California Dreaming)," “Tear the Fascists Down (Again)”—and the response has shown me how hungry people are for real, authentic songs that speak to both the heart and the times we’re living in.
Now, I’m ready to take the next step: recording a full album that captures the spectrum of what I stand for—politics, love, courage, and transformation.
Why I’m Asking for Your Help
Making an album independently is beautiful but expensive. Studio time, mixing, mastering, musicians, production, and distribution all add up quickly. As an artist without a label behind me, every note I record and every lyric I release depends on community support.
Your contribution will go directly toward:
Studio sessions to capture the songs with the highest quality.
Collaborating with musicians and producers who bring the music to life.
Mixing & mastering so the songs sound just as powerful in your headphones as they do live.
Distribution & promotion, so these songs can reach the ears—and hearts—of people around the world.
Why It Matters
We live in a world where so much music feels disposable. But I believe folk music—the kind that speaks to the soul, confronts injustice, and reminds us of our humanity—still has a vital place. This album isn’t just songs; it’s a message, a movement, and a way to keep truth-telling alive in melody.
Every dollar raised is fuel for that mission. And every supporter is part of this album’s story.
How You Can Help
Donate whatever you can—big or small, it all makes a real difference.
Share this fundraiser with your friends, family, and networks.
Follow along on Spotify, AppleMusic,  Instagram, and TikTok to be part of my journey as an artist.
A Note From Me
Thank you for helping me bring this album into the world. Together, we can keep folk alive—for the heart, for the soul, and for the times.
With gratitude and love,
Deena Marie
labels: Photograph, Chordophone, Guitar, String instrument, Guitarist

title: Berryfine Goods Needs a Work Van for Sustainability Business
description:
Berryfine Goods was built on the mission of keeping usable items out of landfills while helping families through the overwhelming process of downsizing, cleanouts, and consignment. Every day, we see firsthand how much value and life remains in furniture, art, clothing, and household goods. Our goal is to honor these items, divert waste, and find them new homes where they can continue to be loved and used.
To take this work to the next level, we are launching a crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for a work van—specifically a used Ford Transit.
Having a dedicated vehicle would be transformational for our business.
Right now, transportation is one of our biggest barriers. With a van, we could pick up and deliver larger items, assist more clients in need, and increase the volume of goods we can save from landfills. It’s a practical, powerful step forward that will make our operations smoother, faster, and more impactful.
Our fundraising goal is to cover the cost of the van, but if we are fortunate enough to raise beyond that, the additional funds will go toward leasing a larger warehouse space to store, organize, and showcase items before they find their next home. Extra support will also help us launch Berryfine Goods Gives (BGG), our future nonprofit branch. Through BGG, we aim to extend our reach into the community by redistributing essentials—such as furniture, clothing, and household goods—directly to individuals and families who need them most.
By supporting this campaign,
you are not just funding a van—you are fueling a vision of sustainability, compassion, and circular reuse.
Every contribution, large or small, helps us grow our capacity to serve clients, reduce waste, and give back to our community. Together, we can make a meaningful impact and create a system where nothing of value goes to waste.

title: Help Keep Spokane's Music And Art Hub Alive
description:
Hello! My name is Kyle Bender with Skeemn Entertainment
Over the last year, we’ve had the honor of transforming space in the historic Luminaria Building in downtown Spokane into something truly special for the local arts and music scene. From First Friday art galleries to multiple recording studios, community events, and creative collaborations, this space has quickly grown into a cultural hub and a home for artists of all kinds.
Unfortunately, due to a series of abrupt circumstances, we’ve hit a financial corner that puts our progress at risk. While our long-term plans and 3-year lease position us for a sustainable future, we need help bridging this immediate moment.
We’re seeking to raise $3,000–$5,000 to cover the next month’s rent and high power bills—giving us the time we need to stabilize, bring in more rentals, and build on what we’ve started.
Every dollar donated directly supports keeping this creative hub alive for Spokane’s community of musicians, artists, and dreamers. Together, we can make sure this space continues to inspire, create, and grow for years to come.
If you believe in Spokane’s music and arts culture, please consider donating or sharing this campaign. Your support makes all the difference.
labels: T-shirt, Hat, Shirt, Fashion, Event

title: Help Got Smoked BBQ Get Back on the Road
description:
Got Smoked BBQ began with a simple idea: sharing pit-smoked brisket with friends who couldn’t stop raving about its flavor. For four years, I operated out of a building, serving up barbecue to loyal customers and building a reputation for quality and community. When rising costs made it impossible to keep the doors open, I decided to take Got Smoked BBQ on the road with a food trailer, determined to keep the tradition alive and continue serving the people who love our food.
The trailer needs essential upgrades to get back in business—fire suppression system, electrical work, plumbing for sinks, propane setup, and a generator cage. These improvements are required not only for safety and compliance, but also to meet Health Department standards and secure the permits needed to operate. With these repairs, I’ll be able to park in the spot customers expect, serve daily meals, and bring Got Smoked BBQ to local events, weddings, and gatherings. The demand is already there, with invitations to fall events and weddings in the coming months, and a steady stream of travelers visiting our lake community.
Refurbishing the trailer means more than just reopening—it’s about continuing to share great barbecue, supporting our local community, and being present for the celebrations and everyday moments that bring people together. Every contribution helps bring Got Smoked BBQ back to life, so I can keep serving the food and experiences that matter most to our friends, neighbors, and visitors.

title: Run 100 Miles for American Cancer Society
description:
I’m running 100 miles to support the American Cancer Society and their fight for a world without cancer.
The ACS has a Platinum rating on GuideStar (the highest possible), so you can feel good knowing your donation goes to a great cause.
Running has always been a big part of my life, and when I saw the chance to push myself further and raise money for something so important, it was a no-brainer.
Anything you can give—big or small—really does make a difference. Thanks so much for your support!

title: Running 100 Miles in October for American Cancer Society
description:
Cancer: is there anything worse? It seems like a specter stalking us all. Everyone I know has their own unique, scary relationship with cancer. Personally, cancer took my grandmother before I was able to know her. And it threatened to take my mom as well, when she was diagnosed with single cell myeloma some years ago. I was blessed to watch my mom go through the amazing care system provided by the University of Wisconsin Hospitals, and make a full recovery through the embrace of cutting-edge medical science. I only wish this kind of care was available to everyone that needs it.
I too worry more and more about getting cancer as the years go by, trying to govern my behaviors to minimize the chances of getting it, but also feeling helpless to control the inevitability of colliding with cancer in some shape or form.
This is why I want to raise money for the American Cancer Society by running 100 miles in the month of October. It is empowering to use my love of running to make even a small difference in funding cancer research.
So donate some money, or share this fundraiser with someone who has money to donate, and I will forever be grateful that you imbued something I love with so much extra purpose.
I'm running 100 miles to help the American Cancer Society fight for a world without cancer. This is a very meaningful cause for me. ACS has a platinum rating on GuideStar (the highest possible), so give with confidence! Please consider making a donation because every little bit helps. Thank you for your support!

title: Support Rochelle's Vision: Pres Play Game Nights
description:
Hello, my name is Rochelle, and I’m the founder of Pres Play, a start-up dedicated to bringing back the joy of childhood games with a fun, nostalgic twist for adults. Think of recess—musical chairs, hopscotch, Connect 4, hula hoop contests—but designed to help grown-ups laugh, connect, and build community again.
For the past two years, I have faced unemployment and countless “no’s” in my job search. Instead of giving up, I decided to create my own opportunity. That’s how Pres Play was born—a vision to provide fun, safe, and affordable game nights that bring people together in a unique way.
But as any start-up founder knows, getting a dream off the ground takes resources. I am asking for your support to help cover the costs of:
Securing venues for the first game nights
Purchasing equipment and supplies for the games
Marketing and promotion to spread the word
Building the foundation for a sustainable community-based business
Your contribution—no matter how big or small—will directly help me turn this dream into reality. If you’re not able to donate, you can still support by sharing this campaign with your friends and networks.
After two years of doors being closed, I am determined to open my own. With your help, Pres Play can launch and become a space where laughter, fun, and human connection come alive again.
Thank you so much for believing in me and this vision.
— Rochelle
labels: Logo, Advertising, Screenshot

title: I’m Swimming 5 Miles for American Cancer Society
description: I’m swimming 5 miles to help the American Cancer Society (ACS) fight for a world without cancer. This is a very meaningful cause to me. ACS holds top ratings from Charity Navigator, the Better Business Bureau Wise Giving Alliance, and Candid. So give with confidence! Please consider donating because every little bit helps. Thank you for your support!

title: A Storm Crushed My Truck — Help Me Get Back to Work
description:
On July 30, during a storm, a tree fell and crushed my work truck. That truck was my lifeline—I use it to get to jobs, haul tools and materials, and run my handyman and renovation business. Without it, I can’t work. I’ve launched this GoFundMe to help get a reliable replacement and get back to doing what I do best: building, fixing, and earning an honest living.
My name is Patrick. I’m a queer tradesman and home renovation specialist with 20+ years of experience. I take pride in working with my hands, solving problems, and making spaces better for the people who live in them.
The truck that was destroyed was a 2006 Dodge Dakota. It wasn’t fancy, but it got the job done—and I relied on it every single day. It hauled lumber, tools, tile, paint, equipment, and most importantly—it hauled me to work.
Now that it’s gone, I’m stuck. Without a vehicle, I can’t take on jobs. I can’t earn. I can’t stay afloat.
I’m not asking for a brand-new truck—just enough help to get a used, reliable work vehicle and cover registration, insurance, and the basic costs that come with starting over after a total loss.
The goal is $16,000, which will go toward:
•	Purchasing a used truck that can haul materials
•	Insurance and registration fees
•	Any emergency repairs, taxes, or setup costs
•	Replace some tools/equipment, etc that were also damaged
I know times are hard for a lot of people. I wouldn’t ask if it wasn’t urgent. Even $10 makes a difference. And a share helps more than you know.
Thank you for reading, donating, or sharing. Your support is not just helping me get a truck—it helps me stay working, stay independent, and keep rebuilding.

title: Support the Launch of RETRACT-a-BAND !!!!
description:
Hello,
I am the inventor of
Retract-a-Band
; a one-of-a-kind exercise resistance band device with comfortable grips for both hands!
Each handle can automatically retract the band to make it shorter or extend the band to make it longer. This means,
YOU CAN CHANGE THE LENGTH OF THE EXERCISE BAND AND ALWAYS HAVE THE COMFY GRIPS TO HOLD ONTO WITH BOTH HANDS!
There isn't any other device in the world like Retract-a-Band;
a PATENT PENDING
device that is an exercise workout all in the palm of your hands, literally!
No more letting go of the handle of your exercise band to have to grab it directly (which always slips out of your hand).
No need to buy multiple bands for different resistances or strengths.
Just adjust Retract-a-Band to the length or strength that you need and exercise always with a comfortable grip for your hands.
At the end of your resistive exercise band workout, just flip open both locking mechanisms, line the band up with the openings,
allow the Retract-a-Band to wrap itself inside each handle
, and snap shut the locking mechanisms.
It even has connector magnets
on the back of each handle that clicks them together for easy storage until your next Retract-a-Band exercise session.
Retract-a-Band is a "Game Changer" and a NEW WAVE in resistance band exercise workouts! AND . . .
It costs money to get it started!!!
So . . . . . . . . . . . . . We Need to Raise Some Funds!
In December of 2025, the actual price will be $44.72 plus tax, S&H and just crazy other fees making
your donation of $50.00 a perfect amount!
Thank you for reading all the way through and considering a donation to Retract-a-Band. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you if you go to our website at Retract-a-Band .com. Finally, Thank you a Thousand Times if you donate more.
You are going to make Retract-a-Band famous!
Sincerely,
John
John Martinez
P.S. No raffles, sweepstakes, giveaways, or promotions are offered in exchange for any donations made to this GoFundMe.
